analyzed: vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati
translated: or a daughter of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, and promote it,

original: na tasya māro vā mārakāyikā vā devatā avatāraprekṣiṇyo 'vatāragaveṣiṇyo 'vatāraṃ lapsyante /
analyzed: na tasya māraḥ vā māra kāyikāḥ vā devatāḥ avatāra prekṣiṇyaḥ vatāra gaveṣiṇyaḥ vatāram lapsyante
translated: Māra or the gods of his retinue who seek an opportunity and look for an opportunity will not find an opportunity in him.

original: nāpi tasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā manuṣyā vā amanuṣyā vā avatāraprekṣiṇo 'vatāragaveṣiṇo 'vatāraṃ lapsyante /
analyzed: na api tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā manuṣyāḥ vā amanuṣyāḥ vā avatāra prekṣiṇaḥ vatāra gaveṣiṇaḥ vatāram lapsyante
translated: And neither humans nor non-humans who seek an opportunity and look for an opportunity will find an opportunity in that son or daughter of good family.

original: nāpi sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā viṣamāparihāreṇa kālaṃ kariṣyati //
analyzed: na api sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā viṣama a parihāreṇa kālam kariṣyati
translated: And that son or daughter of good family will not die an untimely death without avoiding misfortune.

original: punaraparaṃ devaputrāḥ ye devaputrā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam deva putrāḥ ye deva putrāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: Moreover, gods, those gods who have set out for supreme perfect enlightenment,

original: yaiś ca devaputrairiyaṃ prajñāpāramitā nodgṛhītā na dhāritā na vācitā na paryavāptā na pravartitā /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca deva putraiḥ iyam prajñāpāramitā na udgṛhītā na dhāritā na vācitā na paryavāptā na pravartitā
translated: and those gods who have not taken up, borne in mind, recited, studied, or promoted this perfection of wisdom,

original: te devaputrāstaṃ kulaputra vā kuladuhitaraṃ vā upasaṃkramitavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: te deva putrāḥ tam kula putra vā kula duhitaram vā upasaṃkramitavyam maṃsyante
translated: Those gods will think of approaching that son of a good family or daughter of a good family.

original: tasya ca kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgṛhṇato dhārayato vācayataḥ paryavāpnuvataḥ pravartayamānasyāntikācchroṣyanti /
analyzed: tasya ca kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇataḥ dhārayataḥ vācayataḥ paryavāpnuvataḥ pravartayamānasya antikāt śroṣyanti
translated: And those gods will listen to this perfection of wisdom from the presence of that son of a good family or daughter of a good family who is taking it up, bearing it in mind, reading it aloud, mastering it, and teaching it.

original: śrutvā codgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti /
analyzed: śrutvā ca udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti
translated: Having listened, they will take it up, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, and teach it.

original: na ca khalu punardevaputrāstasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgṛhṇato
analyzed: na ca khalu punar deva putrāḥ tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇataḥ
translated: Moreover, gods, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who are taking up this perfection of wisdom,

original: dhārayato vācayataḥ paryavāpnuvataḥ pravartayamānasya araṇyagatasya vā vṛkṣamūlagatasya
analyzed: dhārayataḥ vācayataḥ paryavāpnuvataḥ pravartayamānasya araṇya gatasya vā vṛkṣa mūla gatasya
translated: bearing it in mind, reading it aloud, mastering it, and teaching it, whether in the forest, at the foot of a tree,

original: vā śūnyāgāragatasya vā abhyavakāśagatasya vā pathi gatasya vā utpathagatasya vā aṭavīgatasya
analyzed: vā śūnya āgāra gatasya vā abhyavakāśa gatasya vā pathi gatasya vā utpatha gatasya vā aṭavī gatasya
translated: in an empty place, in the open air, on the road, off the road, in the wilderness,

original: vā mahāsamudragatasya vā tatra tatropasaṃkrāmato vā caṃkramyamāṇasya vā sthitasya
analyzed: vā mahā samudra gatasya vā tatra tatra upasaṃkrāmataḥ vā caṃkramyamāṇasya vā sthitasya
translated: in the great ocean, here and there approaching, walking, standing,

original: vā niṣaṇṇasya vā vipannasya vā bhayaṃ vā bhaviṣyati /🔽stambhitatvaṃ vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: vā niṣaṇṇasya vā vipannasya vā bhayam vā bhaviṣyati  stambhita tvam vā bhaviṣyati
translated: or when standing, or when sitting, or when lying down, there will be fear,🔽or there will be terror,

analyzed: utpatsyate vā
translated: or there will be a disturbance.

original: atha khalu catvāro mahārājāno bhagavantametadavocan āścaryaṃ bhagavan yadimāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgṛhṇan
analyzed: atha khalu catvāraḥ mahā rājānaḥ bhagavantam etat avocan āścaryam bhagavan yat imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇan
translated: Then the Four Great Kings said this to the Blessed One: It is wonderful, Blessed One, that the son or daughter of good family who takes up,

original: dhārayan vācayan paryavāpnuvan pravartayan sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā yānatraye sattvān vinayati /
analyzed: dhārayan vācayan paryavāpnuvan pravartayan sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā yāna traye sattvān vinayati
translated: bears in mind, reads aloud, masters, and teaches this perfection of wisdom, trains beings in the three vehicles,

analyzed: na ca sattva saṃjñām utpādayati
translated: but does not give rise to the notion of a being.

original: vayaṃ bhagavaṃstasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ saṃvidhāsyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam bhagavan tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim saṃvidhāsyāmaḥ
translated: We, Blessed One, will provide protection, guard, and defense for that son or daughter of good family,

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati //
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati
translated: who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, and teach it.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat aham api bhagavaṃstasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ saṃvidhāsyāmi /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat aham api bhagavan tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim saṃvidhāsyāmi
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One: I too, Blessed One, will provide protection, guard, and defense for that son or daughter of good family,

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati //
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati
translated: Whoever will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, and promote it,

original: brahmāpi sahāpatiḥ sārdhaṃ brahmakāyikairdevaputrairbhagavantametadavocat aham api bhagavaṃstasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ
analyzed: brahmā api sahā patiḥ sārdham brahmakāyikaiḥ deva putraiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat aham api bhagavan tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim
translated: Brahmā, the Lord of the Sahā World, together with the gods of the Brahma group, said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, I too will provide protection, defense, and security

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati //
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati
translated: for that son or daughter of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, and promote it.

original: Vaidya atha khalu śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat āścaryaṃ bhagavan🔽yadimāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgṛhṇan dhārayan vācayan paryavāpnuvan pravartayan sa kulaputro
analyzed: vaidya atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat āścaryam bhagavan  yat imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇan dhārayan vācayan paryavāpnuvan pravartayan sa kula putraḥ
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One: It is amazing, Blessed One!🔽If that son or daughter of good family

original: vā kuladuhitā vā imān yato dṛṣṭadhārmikān guṇān pratilabhate parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: vā kula duhitā vā imān yatas dṛṣṭa dhārmikān guṇān pratilabhate parigṛhṇāti
translated: who takes up this perfection of wisdom, bears it in mind, recites it, studies it, and promotes it, obtains and possesses these visible qualities,

original: kiṃ punarbhagavan prajñāpāramitāyāmudgṛhītāyāṃ sarvāḥ ṣaṭ pāramitā udgṛhītā bhavanti /
analyzed: kim punar bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyām udgṛhītāyām sarvāḥ ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ udgṛhītāḥ bhavanti
translated: Blessed One, when the perfection of wisdom is taken up, are all six perfections taken up?

original: evamukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat evametatkauśika / evam etat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: It is so, Kauśika, it is so.

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ kauśika udgṛhītāyāṃ sarvāḥ ṣaṭ pāramitā udgṛhītā bhavanti /🔽punaraparaṃ kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāmudgṛhītāyāṃ dhāritāyāṃ vācitāyāṃ paryavāptāyāṃ pravartitāyāṃ sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikān
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām kauśika udgṛhītāyām sarvāḥ ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ udgṛhītāḥ bhavanti  punar aparam kauśika prajñāpāramitāyām udgṛhītāyām dhāritāyām vācitāyām paryavāptāyām pravartitāyām sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikān
translated: Kauśika, when the perfection of wisdom is taken up, all six perfections are taken up.

analyzed: guṇān parigṛhṇāti
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, when the perfection of wisdom is taken up, recited, mastered, and practiced, that son of good family or daughter of good family acquires the qualities of this very life.

original: tān kauśik sarvān śṛṇu /🔽sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuru /
analyzed: tān kauśik sarvān śṛṇu  sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuru
translated: Listen to all of them, Kauśika.

analyzed: bhāṣiṣye ham te
translated: Pay careful attention and I will tell you.

original: sādhu bhagavanniti śakro devānāmindro bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣīt /
analyzed: sādhu bhagavan iti śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣīt
translated: Very well, Blessed One, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, replied to the Blessed One.

original: bhagavānetadavocat tatra kauśika ye mama dharmaṃ vigrahītavyaṃ maṃsyante /🔽vivaditavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: bhagavān etat avocat tatra kauśika ye mama dharmam vigrahītavyam maṃsyante  vivaditavyam maṃsyante
translated: The Blessed One said this: There, Kauśika, those who will think to dispute my Dharma,🔽who will think to argue,

analyzed: virodhayitavyam maṃsyante
translated: who will think to contradict,

original: teṣāṃ vigrahītukāmānāṃ vivaditukāmānāṃ virodhayitukāmānāmutpannotpannā vigrahā vivādā virodhāḥ /
analyzed: teṣām vigrahītu kāmānām vivaditu kāmānām virodhayitu kāmānām utpanna utpannāḥ vigrahāḥ vivādāḥ virodhāḥ
translated: for those who wish to dispute, wish to argue, wish to contradict, the disputes, arguments, and contradictions that arise,

analyzed: punar eva antardhāsyanti
translated: will disappear again.

analyzed: na sthāsyanti
translated: They will not remain.

original: teṣāṃ vigrahītukāmānāṃ vivaditukāmānāṃ virodhayitukāmānāṃ na te 'bhiprāyāḥ paripūriṃ gamiṣyanti /
analyzed: teṣām vigrahītu kāmānām vivaditu kāmānām virodhayitu kāmānām na te bhiprāyāḥ paripūrim gamiṣyanti
translated: The wishes of those who want to quarrel, who want to dispute, who want to be in conflict will not be fulfilled.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: evaṃ hyetatkauśika bhavati ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā udgrahīṣyati
analyzed: evam hi etat kauśika bhavati yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā udgrahīṣyati
translated: Because, Kauśika, it is like this: the son of a good family or the daughter of a good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom,

original: dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati /
analyzed: dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: who will bear it in mind, recite it, study it, go forth into it, teach it, instruct in it, expound it, and repeat it,

analyzed: tasya evam tāni utpanna utpannāni adhikaraṇāni punar eva antardhāsyanti
translated: for them those arisen and arisen legal questions will disappear again.

analyzed: na sthāsyanti
translated: They will not remain.

original: teṣāṃ vigrahītukāmānāṃ vivaditukāmānāṃ virodhayitukāmānāṃ na te 'bhiprāyāḥ paripūriṃ gamiṣyanti /
analyzed: teṣām vigrahītu kāmānām vivaditu kāmānām virodhayitu kāmānām na te bhiprāyāḥ paripūrim gamiṣyanti
translated: The wishes of those who want to quarrel, who want to dispute, who want to be in conflict will not be fulfilled.

original: imam api sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikaṃ guṇaṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: imam api sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikam guṇam parigṛhṇāti
translated: Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family obtains this visible good quality.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgṛhṇāti dhārayati vācayati paryavāpnoti pravartayati deśayati upadiśati uddiśati svādhyāyati /
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇāti dhārayati vācayati paryavāpnoti pravartayati deśayati upadiśati uddiśati su ādhyāyati
translated: Whoever takes up this perfection of wisdom, bears it in mind, recites it, masters it, teaches it, explains it, expounds it, recites it, and studies it,

original: tadyathāpi nāma kauśika maghī nāmauṣadhī sarvaviṣapraśamanī /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika maghī nāma oṣadhī sarva viṣa praśamanī
translated: Just as there is a herb named Maghi that pacifies all poisons,

original: tatra āśīviṣeṇa jantunā bubhukṣitena āhārārthinā āhāragaveṣiṇā kaścideva prāṇakajāto janturdṛṣṭo bhavet /🔽sa āśīviṣastaṃ prāṇakajātaṃ gandhenānubadhnīyādanugacchedāhārahetorbhakṣayitukāmaḥ /
analyzed: tatra āśīviṣeṇa jantunā bubhukṣitena āhāra arthinā āhāra gaveṣiṇā kaścid eva prāṇaka jātaḥ jantuḥ dṛṣṭaḥ bhavet  saḥ āśīviṣaḥ tam prāṇaka jātam gandhena anubadhnīyāt anugacchet āhāra hetoḥ bhakṣayitu kāmaḥ
translated: there a hungry and seeking-food snake, seeing some living being,🔽that snake would follow its smell, wishing to eat it for food.

original: atha sa prāṇakajāto yena sā madhī nāmauṣadhī tenopasaṃkramet /
analyzed: atha sa prāṇaka jātaḥ yena sā madhī nāma oṣadhī tena upasaṃkramet
translated: Then that living being would approach that herb named Maghi,

analyzed: tena upasaṃkramya tiṣṭhet
translated: and having approached it, would stand there.

original: atha sa āśīviṣastasyā oṣadhyā gandhenaiva pratyudāvarteta /
analyzed: atha saḥ āśīviṣaḥ tasyāḥ oṣadhyāḥ gandhena eva pratyudāvarteta
translated: Then that snake would turn back just by the smell of that herb.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi tasyā oṣadhyā bhaiṣajyaguṇaḥ sa tādṛśo yastasyāśīviṣasya tadviṣamabhibhavati /
analyzed: tathā hi tasyāḥ oṣadhyāḥ bhaiṣajya guṇaḥ sa tādṛśaḥ yaḥ tasya āśīviṣasya tat viṣam abhibhavati
translated: Because the medicinal quality of that herb is such that it overpowers the poison of that snake.

analyzed: evam balavatī hi sā oṣadhī
translated: Thus powerful is that herb.

original: evameva kauśika yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā va imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati
analyzed: evam eva kauśika yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the son or daughter of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind,

original: vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati /
analyzed: vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: recite it, master it, teach it, explain it, chant it, and repeat it,

original: tasya kauśika yāni tānyutpannotpannānyadhikaraṇāni vigrahā vivādā virodhā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tasya kauśika yāni tāni utpanna utpannāni adhikaraṇāni vigrahāḥ vivādāḥ virodhāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: for him, Kauśika, whatever disputes, quarrels, arguments, and disagreements arise,

original: te prajñāpāramitāyāstejasā balena sthāmataḥ prajñāpāramitābalādhānena kṣipraṃ tata evoparaṃsyanti upaśamiṣyanti antardhāsyanti na vivardhiṣyante
analyzed: te prajñāpāramitāyāḥ tejasā balena sthāmataḥ prajñāpāramitā bala ādhānena kṣipram tatas eva uparaṃsyanti upaśamiṣyanti antardhāsyanti na vivardhiṣyante
translated: by the brilliance, strength, and power of the perfection of wisdom, by the support of the power of the perfection of wisdom, they will quickly cease right there, be pacified, disappear, and not increase.

analyzed: yatas yatas eva utpatsyante
translated: Wherever they arise,

analyzed: tatra tatra eva nirotsyante antardhāsyanti
translated: right there they will cease, disappear.

analyzed: na vivardhiṣyante na sthāsyanti
translated: They will not increase, they will not remain.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā hi rāga ādīnām yāvat nirvāṇa grāhasya upaśamayitrī
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom pacifies attachment and so on up to the grasping of nirvana.

analyzed: na vivardhikā iti
translated: It does not increase.

analyzed: catvāraḥ ca tasya mahā rājānaḥ vaidya
translated: And the four great kings, the physicians,

original: śakraś ca devānāmindro brahmā ca sahāpatiḥ sarve ca buddhā bhagavanto bodhisattvāś ca rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ saṃvidhāsyanti /
analyzed: śakraḥ ca devānām indraḥ brahmā ca sahā patiḥ sarve ca buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bodhisattvāḥ ca rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim saṃvidhāsyanti
translated: And Shakra, lord of the gods, and Brahma, lord of the Sahā world, and all the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, and Bodhisattvas will provide protection, defense, and security.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyatiḥ uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyatiḥ uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: Whoever will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, spread it, teach it, explain it, chant it, and repeat it,

original: ayaṃ tena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmiko guṇaḥ parigṛhīto bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: ayam tena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikaḥ guṇaḥ parigṛhītaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: that son of good family or daughter of good family will acquire this visible quality.

original: punaraparaṃ kauśika yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, that son of good family or daughter of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom,

original: dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati /
analyzed: dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: bear it in mind, recite it, study it, spread it, teach it, explain it, chant it, and repeat it,

original: sa ādeyavacanaś ca bhaviṣyati /🔽mṛduvacanaś ca bhaviṣyati /🔽mitavacanaś ca bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: saḥ ādeya vacanaḥ ca bhaviṣyati  mṛdu vacanaḥ ca bhaviṣyati  mita vacanaḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: will have words that are accepted.🔽He will have soft words.🔽He will have measured words.

analyzed: a prakīrṇa vacanaḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: He will have unscattered words.

analyzed: na ca krodha abhibhūtaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And he will not be overcome by anger.

analyzed: na ca māna abhibhūtaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And he will not be overcome by pride.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi taṃ prajñāpāramitā paridamayati /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi tam prajñāpāramitā paridamayati
translated: Why is that?🔽Because the perfection of wisdom tames him.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā pariṇamayati  na krodham vardhayati
translated: The perfection of wisdom transforms him.🔽He does not increase anger.

analyzed: na mānam vardhayati  sa na upanāham parigṛhṇāti
translated: He does not increase pride.🔽He does not take up resentment.

analyzed: na vyāpādam parigṛhṇāti
translated: He does not take up malice.

analyzed: na anuśayam dhārayati
translated: He does not hold on to grudges.

original: evaṃ carato 'sya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā smṛtirmaitrī cotpadyate /
analyzed: evam carataḥ sya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā smṛtiḥ maitrī ca utpadyate
translated: When that son of a good family or daughter of a good family practices like this, mindfulness and friendliness arise.

analyzed: tasya evam bhavati saced aham vyāpādam utpādayiṣyāmi
translated: He thinks like this: “If I were to give rise to malice,

analyzed: tena indriyāṇi me pari bhetsyante
translated: then my faculties would be impaired.

analyzed: mukha varṇaḥ ca me dhakṣyate
translated: And the color of my face would be destroyed.

analyzed: ayuktam ca etat mama yat aham anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: And it would not be right for me, who has set out for supreme perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: tatra śikṣitu kāmaḥ
translated: who wants to train in that,

analyzed: krodhasya vaśam gaccheyam
translated: to go under the sway of anger.”

analyzed: iti evam sa kṣipram eva smṛtim pratilabhate
translated: In this way, he quickly regains mindfulness.

original: imam api sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikaṃ guṇaṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: imam api sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikam guṇam parigṛhṇāti
translated: Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family obtains this visible good quality.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati /
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: Whoever will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, spread it, teach it, explain it, expound it, repeat it,

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat āścaryaṃ bhagavan yatheyaṃ prajñāpāramitā paridamanāya pratyupasthitā anunāmāya bodhisattvānāṃ
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat āścaryam bhagavan yathā iyam prajñāpāramitā paridamanāya pratyupasthitā anunāmāya bodhisattvānām
translated: When this had been said, Śakra, lord of the gods, said to the Blessed One: It is wonderful, Blessed One, how this perfection of wisdom is present for the taming, the quieting, of the bodhisattva

analyzed: mahāsattvānām
translated: great beings.

original: bhagavānāha punaraparaṃ kauśika ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā
analyzed: bhagavān āha punar aparam kauśika yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā
translated: The Blessed One said: Moreover, Kauśika, the son or daughter of good family

original: vā udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati
analyzed: vā udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati
translated: who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, spread it, teach it,

analyzed: upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: explain it, expound it, repeat it, and recite it.

original: sacetkulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmevamudgṛhṇan dhārayan vācayan
analyzed: saced kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām evam udgṛhṇan dhārayan vācayan
translated: If the son or daughter of good family, thus taking up, bearing in mind, reciting,

original: paryavāpnuvan pravartayan deśayan upadiśayan uddiśan svādhyāyan saṃgrāme vartamāne
analyzed: paryavāpnuvan pravartayan deśayan upadiśayan uddiśan su ādhyāyan saṃgrāme vartamāne
translated: studying, spreading, teaching, explaining, expounding, repeating, and reciting this perfection of wisdom, were to enter a battle,

analyzed: saṃgrāma śirasi samārūḍhaḥ syāt
translated: having mounted to the head of the battle,

original: tasya saṃgrāmamavatarato vā avatīrṇasya vā atikrāmato vā saṃgrāmamadhyagatasya vā
analyzed: tasya saṃgrāmam avatarataḥ vā avatīrṇasya vā atikrāmataḥ vā saṃgrāma madhya gatasya vā
translated: whether he is entering into battle, or has entered, or is passing by, or is in the midst of battle,

original: tiṣṭhato vā niṣaṇṇasya vā asthānametatkauśika anavakāśo yattasya kulaputrasya vā
analyzed: tiṣṭhataḥ vā niṣaṇṇasya vā asthānam etat kauśika anavakāśaḥ yat tasya kula putrasya vā
translated: whether he is standing or sitting, it is not possible, Kauśika, it cannot happen, that for that son of a good family

original: kuladuhiturvā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ manasi kurvato vā udgṛhṇato vā dhārayato vā vācayato🔽vā paryavāpnuvato vā pravartayato vā deśayato vā upadiśato vā uddiśato vā svādhyāyato
analyzed: kula duhituḥ vā imām prajñāpāramitām manasi kurvataḥ vā udgṛhṇataḥ vā dhārayataḥ vā vācayataḥ  vā paryavāpnuvataḥ vā pravartayataḥ vā deśayataḥ vā upadiśataḥ vā uddiśataḥ vā svādhyāyataḥ
translated: or daughter of a good family who is mentally attending to this perfection of wisdom, or taking it up, or keeping it, or reading it aloud,

analyzed: vā jīvita antarāyaḥ vā bhavet
translated: or mastering it, or expounding it, or teaching it, or reciting it, or privately reciting it, there will be an interruption of life.

analyzed: para upakrameṇa jīvita antarāyam saḥ nuprāpnuyāt
translated: He would not obtain an interruption of life through the harm of others.

analyzed: na etat sthānam vidyate
translated: There is no such occasion.

original: sacetpunastasya kaścitkauśika tatra śastraṃ vā daṇḍaṃ vā loṣṭaṃ vā anyadvā kṣipet /
analyzed: saced punar tasya kaścid kauśika tatra śastram vā daṇḍam vā loṣṭam vā anyat vā kṣipet
translated: If, on the other hand, someone were to throw a weapon or a stick or a clod or anything else at him there,

analyzed: na etat tasya śarīre nipatet
translated: it would not strike his body.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  mahā vidyā iyam kauśika yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: What is the reason for that?🔽This, Kauśika, is a great knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: apramāṇā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This, Kauśika, is an immeasurable knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: aparimāṇā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom, is immeasurable, Kauśika.

original: anuttareyaṃ kauśika vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽asameyaṃ kauśika vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: anuttarā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā  asamā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom, is unsurpassed, Kauśika.🔽This knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom, is unequaled, Kauśika.

analyzed: asamasamā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom, is unequaled and unsurpassed, Kauśika.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: atra hi kauśika vaidya
translated: For here, Kauśika,

original: vidyāyāṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā nātmavyābādhāya cetayate /🔽na paravyābādhāya cetayate /
analyzed: vidyāyām śikṣamāṇaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā na ātma vyābādhāya cetayate  na para vyābādhāya cetayate
translated: a son of good family or daughter of good family who trains in this knowledge does not think to harm themselves,🔽does not think to harm others,

analyzed: na ubhaya vyābādhāya cetayate
translated: does not think to harm either of the two.

original: atra hi kauśika vidyāyāṃ śikṣamāṇo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: atra hi kauśika vidyāyām śikṣamāṇaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: For here, Kauśika, a bodhisattva great being who trains in this knowledge will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

analyzed: sarvajña jñānam ca pratilapsyate
translated: and will attain the knowledge of an omniscient one.

original: tena so 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhya sarvasattvānāṃ cittāni vyavalokayiṣyati /
analyzed: tena saḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya sarva sattvānām cittāni vyavalokayiṣyati
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, he will look into the minds of all beings.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: atra hi kauśika vidyāyāṃ śikṣamāṇasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na tatkiṃcidasti /
analyzed: atra hi kauśika vidyāyām śikṣamāṇasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na tat kiṃcid asti
translated: For here, Kauśika, there is nothing that does not exist for a bodhisattva great being who trains in this knowledge.

original: yanna prāptaṃ vā na jñātaṃ vā na sākṣātkṛtaṃ vā syāt /
analyzed: yat na prāptam vā na jñātam vā na sākṣātkṛtam vā syāt
translated: What has not been attained or known or realized.

analyzed: tasmāt sarvajña jñānam iti ucyate
translated: Therefore, it is called the knowledge of the Omniscient One.

original: ayam api kauśika tena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā dṛṣṭadhārmiko guṇaḥ parigṛhīto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ayam api kauśika tena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikaḥ guṇaḥ parigṛhītaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Kauśika, this son or daughter of good family will also have attained the visible qualities,

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, teach it, explain it, chant it, and study it.

original: punaraparaṃ kauśika yatreyaṃ prajñāpāramitā antaśo likhitvā pustakagatāṃ kṛtvā pūjāpūrvaṃgamaṃ sthāpayitvā na satkariṣyate /🔽nodgrahīṣyate /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika yatra iyam prajñāpāramitā antaśas likhitvā pustaka gatām kṛtvā pūjā pūrvaṃgamam sthāpayitvā na satkariṣyate  na udgrahīṣyate
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, wherever this perfection of wisdom is written down, made into a book, and placed, having been worshipped,🔽it will not be honored.

analyzed: na dhārayiṣyate
translated: It will not be taken up.🔽It will not be borne in mind.

analyzed: na vācayiṣyate  na paryavāpsyate
translated: It will not be recited.🔽It will not be mastered.

analyzed: na pravartayiṣyate  na deśayiṣyate  na upadekṣyate
translated: It will not be taught.🔽It will not be explained.

analyzed: na uddekṣyate
translated: It will not be chanted.

analyzed: na su ādhyāsyate
translated: It will not be studied.

original: na tatra kauśika sattvānāṃ manuṣyo vā amanuṣyo vā avatārārthiko 'vatāragaveṣī avatāraṃ lapsyate sthāpayitvā pūrvakarmavipākam /
analyzed: na tatra kauśika sattvānām manuṣyaḥ vā amanuṣyaḥ vā avatāra arthikaḥ vatāra gaveṣī avatāram lapsyate sthāpayitvā pūrva karma vipākam
translated: There, Kauśika, no human or non-human being seeking an opportunity, seeking to harm, will find an opportunity, except as a result of previous karma.

original: imam api sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikaṃ guṇaṃ parigṛhṇāti //
analyzed: imam api sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikam guṇam parigṛhṇāti
translated: Kauśika, that son of good family or daughter of good family obtains this visible good quality.

original: punaraparaṃ kauśika tadyathāpi nāma ye bodhimaṇḍagatā vā bodhimaṇḍaparisāmantagatā vā bodhimaṇḍābhyantaragatā vā bodhivṛkṣamūlagatā vā manuṣyā
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika tat yathā api nāma ye bodhimaṇḍa gatāḥ vā bodhimaṇḍa parisāmanta gatāḥ vā bodhimaṇḍa abhyantara gatāḥ vā bodhivṛkṣa mūla gatāḥ vā manuṣyāḥ
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, just as those who are at the seat of enlightenment, or around the seat of enlightenment, or inside the seat of enlightenment, or at the foot of the Bodhi tree, whether human

analyzed: vā amanuṣyā vā
translated: or non-human,

analyzed: tiryagyoni gatān api upādāya
translated: including those born as animals,

original: yāvanna te śakyā manuṣyairvā amanuṣyairvā viheṭhayituṃ vā vyāpādayituṃ vā āveśayituṃ vā sthāpayitvā pūrvakarmavipākam /
analyzed: yāvat na te śakyāḥ manuṣyaiḥ vā amanuṣyaiḥ vā viheṭhayitum vā vyāpādayitum vā āveśayitum vā sthāpayitvā pūrva karma vipākam
translated: are not able to be harmed, killed, or possessed by humans or non-humans, except as a result of previous karma.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tatra hi atītānāgatapratyutpannāstathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā abhisaṃbuddhā abhisaṃbhotsyante abhisaṃbudhyante ca /
analyzed: tatra hi atīta anāgata pratyutpannāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ abhisaṃbuddhāḥ abhisaṃbhotsyante abhisaṃbudhyante ca
translated: Because the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones of the past, future, and present have attained perfect enlightenment, will attain perfect enlightenment, and are attaining perfect enlightenment there.

analyzed: ye sarva sattvānām abhayam avairam anutrāsam prabhāvayanti prakāśayanti
translated: They cause all beings to experience and manifest fearlessness, non-enmity, and non-terror.

original: evameva kauśika yatra kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati
analyzed: evam eva kauśika yatra kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, wherever a son or daughter of good family will take up this perfection of wisdom,

original: dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati svādhyāsyati /
analyzed: dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: will bear it in mind, recite it, study it, spread it, teach it, explain it, chant it, and repeat it,

original: tatra hi kauśika sattvā na śakyā manuṣyairvā amanuṣyairvā viheṭhayituṃ vā vyāpādayituṃ vā āveśayituṃ vā /
analyzed: tatra hi kauśika sattvāḥ na śakyāḥ manuṣyaiḥ vā amanuṣyaiḥ vā viheṭhayitum vā vyāpādayitum vā āveśayitum vā
translated: there, Kauśika, beings cannot be harmed, killed, or possessed by humans or non-humans,

analyzed: sthāpayitvā pūrva karma vipākam
translated: except as a result of previous karma.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: anayaiva hi kauśika prajñāpāramitayā pṛthivīpradeśaḥ sattvānāṃ caityabhūtaḥ kṛto vandanīyo mānanīyaḥ pūjanīyo 'rcanīyo 'pacāyanīyaḥ satkaraṇīyo
analyzed: anayā eva hi kauśika prajñāpāramitayā pṛthivī pradeśaḥ sattvānām caitya bhūtaḥ kṛtaḥ vandanīyaḥ mānanīyaḥ pūjanīyaḥ rcanīyaḥ pacāyanīyaḥ satkaraṇīyaḥ
translated: Kauśika, it is because by this very perfection of wisdom that region has become a caitya for beings, worthy of homage, worthy of respect, worthy of offerings, worthy of being worshipped, worthy of being attended upon,

original: trāṇaṃ śaraṇaṃ layanaṃ parāyaṇaṃ kṛto bhaviṣyati tatropagatānāṃ sattvānām /
analyzed: trāṇam śaraṇam layanam parāyaṇam kṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati tatra upagatānām sattvānām
translated: and has become a refuge, a protection, a place of rest, and a support for beings who have approached there.

original: imam api sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikaṃ guṇaṃ parigṛhṇāti //
analyzed: imam api sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikam guṇam parigṛhṇāti
translated: Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family obtains this visible good quality.

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat yo bhagavan kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhitvā pustakagatāṃ kṛtvā🔽enāṃ ca divyābhiḥ puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajaghaṇṭāpatākābhiḥ samantācca dīpamālābhiḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat yaḥ bhagavan kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām likhitvā pustaka gatām kṛtvā  enām ca divyābhiḥ puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja ghaṇṭā patākābhiḥ samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family who, having written out this perfection of wisdom, made it into a book,🔽and having made it into a book, would honor, revere, respect, and worship it with divine flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, bells, and banners, and all around with garlands of lamps,

original: bahuvidhābhiś ca pūjābhiḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet /🔽yaś ca Vaidya
analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet  yaḥ ca vaidya
translated: and with many kinds of worship,

original: tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya parinirvṛtasya śarīrāṇi stūpeṣu pratiṣṭhāpayet parigṛhṇīyāt dhārayeddhā /
analyzed: tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya parinirvṛtasya śarīrāṇi stūpeṣu pratiṣṭhāpayet parigṛhṇīyāt dhārayet hā
translated: and that one who, after the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One has passed into Nirvāṇa, would enshrine the relics in stūpas, would take them up, would bear them,

analyzed: tān ca tathā eva divyābhiḥ puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja ghaṇṭā patākābhiḥ
translated: and would honor, revere, respect, and worship them with just those divine flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, bells, and banners,

analyzed: samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: and all around with garlands of lamps,

original: bahuvidhābhiś ca pūjābhiḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet /
analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet
translated: and with many kinds of worship, he should honor, revere, respect, venerate, and praise them.

original: katarastayoḥ kulaputrayoḥ kuladuhitrorvā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: kataraḥ tayoḥ kula putrayoḥ kula duhitroḥ vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: Which of those two sons or daughters of good family would produce more merit?

original: evamukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat tena hi kauśika tvāmevātra pratiprakṣyāmi /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat tena hi kauśika tvām eva atra pratiprakṣyāmi
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: Well then, Kauśika, I will ask you about this.

analyzed: yathā te kṣamate
translated: As you are able,

analyzed: tathā vyākuryāḥ
translated: so you should explain.

original: tatkiṃ manyase kauśika yo 'yaṃ tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sarvajñatātmabhāvo 'bhinirvartitaḥ /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kauśika yaḥ yam tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sarvajña tā ātmabhāvaḥ bhinirvartitaḥ
translated: What do you think, Kauśika? This body of the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, which is the attainment of omniscience,

original: sa katamasyāṃ pratipadi śikṣamāṇena tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ sarvajñatā pratilabdhā abhisaṃbuddhā /
analyzed: sa katamasyām pratipadi śikṣamāṇena tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ sarvajña tā pratilabdhā abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: in which practice, training, and learning did the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, by training in it, attain omniscience, supreme perfect enlightenment?

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat ihaiva bhagavan bhagavatā prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat iha eva bhagavan bhagavatā prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, right here in the Blessed One's perfection of wisdom,🔽training in it, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One attained omniscience,

original: śikṣamāṇena tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ sarvajñatā
analyzed: śikṣamāṇena tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ sarvajña tā
translated: supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: pratilabdhā abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: attained, and fully awakened to.

original: bhagavānāha tasmāttarhi kauśika nānenātmabhāvaśarīrapratilambhena tathāgatastathāgata iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tasmāt tarhi kauśika na anena ātma bhāva śarīra pratilambhena tathāgataḥ tathāgataḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: The Blessed One said, Therefore, Kauśika, the Tathāgata is not considered a Tathāgata because of attaining this physical body,

original: sarvajñatāyāṃ tu pratilabdhāyāṃ tathāgatastathāgata iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: sarvajña tāyām tu pratilabdhāyām tathāgataḥ tathāgataḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: but because of attaining omniscience is the Tathāgata considered a Tathāgata.

analyzed: yā iyam kauśika sarvajña tā tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya
translated: Kauśika, this omniscience of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One,

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā nirjātā eṣā
translated: is born from the perfection of wisdom.

original: eṣa ca kauśika tathāgatasyātmabhāvaśarīrapratilambhaḥ prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyanirjātaḥ san sarvajñajñānāśrayabhūto bhavati /
analyzed: eṣa ca kauśika tathāgatasya ātma bhāva śarīra pratilambhaḥ prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya nirjātaḥ san sarvajña jñāna āśraya bhūtaḥ bhavati
translated: And this physical body attained by the Tathāgata, Kauśika, born from the skillful means of the perfection of wisdom, becomes the basis for the knowledge of omniscience.

original: enaṃ hyāśrayaṃ niśritya sarvajñajñānasya prabhāvanā bhavati /
analyzed: enam hi āśrayam niśritya sarvajña jñānasya prabhāvanā bhavati
translated: Relying on this basis, the manifestation of the knowledge of omniscience occurs.

analyzed: buddha śarīra prabhāvanā bhavati
translated: The manifestation of the Buddha's body occurs.

analyzed: dharma śarīra prabhāvanā bhavati
translated: The manifestation of the Dharma body occurs.

analyzed: saṃgha śarīra prabhāvanā bhavati
translated: The manifestation of the Saṅgha body occurs.

analyzed: iti evam sarvajña jñāna hetukaḥ yam ātma bhāva śarīra pratilambhaḥ sarvajña jñāna āśraya bhūta tvāt sarva sattvānām
translated: Thus, this attainment of a physical body is the cause of the knowledge of omniscience, because it becomes the basis for the knowledge of omniscience of all beings.

original: caityabhūto vandanīyaḥ satkaraṇīyo gurukaraṇīyo mānanīyaḥ pūjanīyo 'rcanīyo 'pacāyanīyaḥ saṃvṛtto bhavati /
analyzed: caitya bhūtaḥ vandanīyaḥ satkaraṇīyaḥ gurukaraṇīyaḥ mānanīyaḥ pūjanīyaḥ acanīyaḥ pacāyanīyaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes a caitya, worthy of offerings, worthy of respect, worthy of veneration, worthy of being worshipped, worthy of being saluted with joined palms, and worthy of being circumambulated.

original: evaṃ ca mama parinirvṛtasyāpi sataḥ eṣāṃ śarīrāṇāṃ pūjā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam ca mama parinirvṛtasya api sataḥ eṣām śarīrāṇām pūjā bhaviṣyati
translated: Thus, even after my parinirvāṇa, there will be worship of my relics.

original: tasmāttarhi kauśika yaḥ kaścitkulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhitvā pustakagatāṃ vā kṛtvā sthāpayet /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kauśika yaḥ kaścid kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām likhitvā pustaka gatām vā kṛtvā sthāpayet
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, if any son or daughter of good family were to write out this perfection of wisdom, make it into a book, and keep it,

original: enāṃ ca divyābhiḥ puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajaghaṇṭāpatākābhiḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet /
analyzed: enām ca divyābhiḥ puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja ghaṇṭā patākābhiḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet
translated: and were to honor it with divine flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags, bells, and banners,

original: ayameva kauśika tayoḥ kulaputrayoḥ kuladuhitrorvā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: ayam eva kauśika tayoḥ kula putrayoḥ kula duhitroḥ vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: Kauśika, that son or daughter of good family would generate even more merit than that.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: sarvajñajñānasya hi kauśika tena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sarvajña jñānasya hi kauśika tena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati
translated: Kauśika, that son or daughter of good family would have made an offering to the knowledge of omniscience.

original: yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā iha prajñāpāramitāyāṃ likhyamānāyāṃ pustakagatāyāṃ vā satkāraṃ gurukāraṃ mānanāṃ pūjanāmarcanāmapacāyanāṃ pūjāṃ 🔽ca vividhāṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā iha prajñāpāramitāyām likhyamānāyām pustaka gatāyām vā satkāram gurukāram mānanām pūjanām arcanām apacāyanām pūjām  ca vividhām kuryāt
translated: If a son of good family or a daughter of good family, when this perfection of wisdom is being written, were to make various kinds of offerings to the book, to honor it, revere it, worship it, adore it, make offerings to it,

analyzed: ayam eva tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: this one would produce merit that is much greater than that.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: sarvajñajñānasya hi kauśika tena pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sarvajña jñānasya hi kauśika tena pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati
translated: Kausika, by him an offering will have been made to the knowledge of all modes.

analyzed: yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyai pūjām kariṣyati
translated: He who will make an offering to the perfection of wisdom.

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat ya ime bhagavan jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ na likhiṣyanti /🔽nodgrahīṣyanti na dhārayiṣyanti /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat ye ime bhagavan jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ imām prajñāpāramitām na likhiṣyanti  na udgrahīṣyanti na dhārayiṣyanti
translated: When this had been said, Sakra, Chief of Gods, said to the Lord: Those men of Jambudvipa, O Lord, who will not copy this perfection of wisdom, nor take it up, nor bear it in mind, nor recite and study it, nor explain and construe it, nor will they be intent on the utmost, complete enlightenment.

original: na vācayiṣyanti na paryavāpsyanti na pravartayiṣyanti na deśayiṣyanti nopadekṣyanti noddekṣyanti na svādhyāsyanti /
analyzed: na vācayiṣyanti na paryavāpsyanti na pravartayiṣyanti na deśayiṣyanti na upadekṣyanti na uddekṣyanti na su ādhyāsyanti
translated: They will not demonstrate it to others, will not recommend it, will not expound it, will not teach it, will not announce it, will not proclaim it, will not expound it in detail, will not exhibit it, will not make it clear.

analyzed: tām ca enām prajñāpāramitām puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja ghaṇṭā patākābhiḥ
translated: And they will not honor this perfection of wisdom with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, aromatic powders, cloths, parasols, flags, and banners.

analyzed: samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: And with garlands of lamps all around.

original: bahuvidhābhiś ca pūjābhirna satkariṣyanti /🔽na gurukariṣyanti / na Vaidya
analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ na satkariṣyanti  na gurukariṣyanti na vaidya
translated: And with many kinds of worship, they will not honor them.

analyzed: mānayiṣyanti
translated: They will not revere them. They will not respect them.

analyzed: na pūjayiṣyanti  na arcayiṣyanti
translated: They will not worship them.🔽They will not adore them.

analyzed: na apacāyiṣyanti
translated: They will not venerate them.

original: kiṃ nu te bhagavan na jñāsyanti evaṃ mahārthikā bhagavatoktā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: kim nu te bhagavat na jñāsyanti evam mahārthikā bhagavatā uktā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati iti
translated: What do you think, Blessed One, will they not know that the worship of the perfection of wisdom taught by the Blessed One will be of such great benefit?

original: kiṃ nu te bhagavan na vetsyanti evaṃ mahānuśaṃsā evaṃ mahāphalā evaṃ mahāvipākā bhagavatoktā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: kim nu te bhagavat na vetsyanti evam mahā anuśaṃsāḥ evam mahā phalāḥ evam mahā vipākāḥ bhagavatā uktā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati iti
translated: What do you think, Blessed One, will they not know that the worship of the perfection of wisdom taught by the Blessed One will be of such great benefit, of such great fruit, of such great outcome?

analyzed: na ca te vedayiṣyanti
translated: And they will not experience it.

analyzed: uta jñāsyanti vetsyanti
translated: But they will know, they will understand,

analyzed: vedayiṣyanti
translated: they will experience.

analyzed: na ca punar śraddhāsyanti
translated: But they will not have faith.

original: evamukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat tatkiṃ manyase kauśika kiyantaste jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā te buddhe 'vetya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat tat kim manyase kauśika kiyantaḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyā te buddhe prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: What do you think, Kauśika? How many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa have faith in the Buddha,

analyzed: ye dharme vetya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: how many have faith in the Dharma,

analyzed: ye saṃghe vetya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: Those who have perfect confidence in the Saṅgha.

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat alpakāste bhagavan jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye buddhe 'vetya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat alpakāḥ te bhagavan jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye buddhe prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One: Blessed One, few are those people in Jambudvīpa who have perfect confidence in the Buddha,

analyzed: ye dharme vetya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: who have perfect confidence in the Dharma,

analyzed: ye saṃghe vetya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: and who have perfect confidence in the Saṅgha.

original: evamukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat evametatkauśika / evam etat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: It is so, Kauśika, it is so.

original: alpakāste jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye buddhe 'vetya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ /
analyzed: alpakāḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye buddhe prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: Few are those people in Jambudvīpa who have perfect confidence in the Buddha,

analyzed: ye dharme vetya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: who have perfect confidence in the Dharma,

analyzed: ye saṃghe vetya prasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: and who have perfect confidence in the Saṅgha.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ kauśika alpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ te
translated: Among them, Kauśika, even fewer are those

analyzed: ye srotaāpatti phalam prāpnuvanti
translated: who attain the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: tatas sakṛdāgāmi phalam anāgāmi phalam
translated: Then, even fewer attain the fruit of once-returning and the fruit of non-returning.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ pi alpebhyaḥ lpataraka āsteye rhat tva prāpnuvanti
translated: Among them, even fewer are those who attain arhatship.

original: tebhyo 'pyalpebhyo 'lpatarakāste ye pratyekabodhiṃ sākṣātkurvanti /🔽tebhyo 'pyalpebhyo 'lpatarakāste ye 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittānyutpādayanti /🔽tebhyo 'pyalpebhyo 'lpatarakāste ye 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittānyutpādya taṃ cittotpādaṃ bṛṃhayanti /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ pi alpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ te ye pratyeka bodhim sākṣātkurvanti  tebhyaḥ pi alpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ te ye nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayanti  tebhyaḥ pi alpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ te ye nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādya tam citta utpādam bṛṃhayanti
translated: Fewer than those are those who realize individual enlightenment.🔽Fewer than those are those who arouse the mind of awakening for unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.🔽Fewer than those are those who, having aroused the mind of awakening for unsurpassed, complete enlightenment, increase that mind of awakening.

original: tebhyo 'pyalpebhyo 'lpatarakāste ye 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittānyutpādya upabṛṃhayitvā ca ārabdhavīryā viharanti /🔽tebhyo 'pyalpebhyo 'lpatarakāste ye prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogamāpadyante /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ pi alpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ te ye nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādya upabṛṃhayitvā ca ārabdha vīryāḥ viharanti  tebhyaḥ pi alpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ te ye prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyante
translated: Fewer than those are those who, having aroused the mind of awakening for unsurpassed, complete enlightenment and increased it, dwell with their vigor aroused.🔽Fewer than those are those who apply themselves to the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ pi alpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ te ye prajñāpāramitāyām caranti
translated: Fewer than those are those who practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: tebhyo 'pyalpebhyo 'lpatarakāste ye prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranto ghaṭamānā avinivartanīyāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmāvavatiṣṭhante /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ pi alpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ te ye prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ ghaṭamānāḥ a vinivartanīyāyām bodhisattva bhūmau avatiṣṭhante
translated: Fewer than those are those who, practicing and striving in the perfection of wisdom, abide in the irreversible stage of a bodhisattva.

original: tebhyo 'pyalpebhyo 'lpatarakāste ye prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranto ghaṭamānā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyante /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ pi alpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ te ye prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ ghaṭamānāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: Fewer than those are those who, practicing and striving in the perfection of wisdom, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: tebhyo 'pyalpebhyo 'lpatarakāste ye prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranto ghaṭamānā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyante /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ pi alpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ te ye prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ ghaṭamānāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyante
translated: Fewer than those are those who, practicing and striving in the perfection of wisdom, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: te te kauśika bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ye avinivartanīyāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitvā
analyzed: te te kauśika bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ye a vinivartanīyāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitvā
translated: Those, Kauśika, are the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who, having stood on the irreversible bodhisattva stage,

analyzed: anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya anyeṣām adhyāśaya saṃpannānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām
translated: having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, teach the perfection of wisdom to other sons of noble family and daughters of noble family who have a superior intention,

original: ca prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇānāṃ ghaṭamānānāṃ prajñāpāramitāmupadiśanti ca uddiśanti /
analyzed: ca prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇānām ghaṭamānānām prajñāpāramitām upadiśanti ca uddiśanti
translated: who are training and striving in the perfection of wisdom, and who are expounding the perfection of wisdom.

original: te codgṛhṇanti dhārayanti vācayanti paryavāpnuvanti pravartayanti upadeśayanti upadiśanti uddiśanti svādhyāyanti /
analyzed: te ca udgṛhṇanti dhārayanti vācayanti paryavāpnuvanti pravartayanti upadeśayanti upadiśanti uddiśanti su ādhyāyanti
translated: And they take it up, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, teach it, explain it, recite it, and study it.

original: tāṃ caināṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ puṣpairdhūpairgandhairmālyairvilepanaiścūrṇairvastraiśchatrairdhvajairghaṇṭābhiḥ patākābhiḥ samantācca dīpamālābhiḥ /
