analyzed: tiṣṭhantu khalu punar bhagavan anena paryāyeṇa tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau sarva sattvāḥ
translated: Let alone, Blessed One, all the beings in the great trichiliocosm according to this method,

original: ye 'pi te bhagavan gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvasattvāḥ /
analyzed: ye pi te bhagavan gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sarva sattvāḥ
translated: and also, Blessed One, all the beings in the trichiliocosm worlds equal to the sands of the Ganges River.

original: tatra ekaikaḥ sattvaḥ ekaikaṃ saptaratnamayaṃ tathāgatadhātugarbhaṃ stūpaṃ kārayet /
analyzed: tatra ekaikaḥ sattvaḥ ekaikam sapta ratna mayam tathāgata dhātu garbham stūpam kārayet
translated: There, may each being make a stūpa of the seven precious substances containing the relics of the Tathāgata, each.

original: ekaikaś ca sattvastān sarvān stūpān kārayet /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca sattvaḥ tān sarvān stūpān kārayet
translated: And may each being make all those stūpas,

original: kārayitvā ca tān pratiṣṭhāpya kalpaṃ vā kalpāvaśeṣaṃ vā sarvavādyaiḥ sarvagītaiḥ
analyzed: kārayitvā ca tān pratiṣṭhāpya kalpam vā kalpa avaśeṣam vā sarva vādyaiḥ sarva gītaiḥ
translated: and having established them, for an eon or the remainder of an eon, with all musical instruments, all songs,

analyzed: sarva nṛtyaiḥ sarva tūrya tālāvacaraiḥ divyaiḥ sarva puṣpaiḥ sarva dhūpaiḥ sarva gandhaiḥ
translated: all dances, all divine percussion ensembles, with all flowers, all incense, all perfumes,

analyzed: sarva mālyaiḥ sarva vilepanaiḥ sarva cūrṇaiḥ sarva vastraiḥ divyābhiḥ sarva chatra dhvaja ghaṇṭā patākābhiḥ
translated: all garlands, all ointments, all powders, all garments, divine parasols, banners, bells, and flags,

analyzed: samantāt ca sarva dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: and all around with garlands of lamps,

original: bahuvidhābhiś ca divyamānuṣikībhiḥ sarvapūjābhiḥ satkuryādgurukuryānmānayet pūjayedarcayedapacāyet /🔽ayameva tebhyaḥ sa bhagavan sarvasattvebhya kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca divya mānuṣikībhiḥ sarva pūjābhiḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet  ayam eva tebhyaḥ sa bhagavan sarva sattvebhyaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: And with many kinds of divine and human offerings, he should honor, revere, respect, make offerings to, worship, and venerate them.

analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām abhiśraddadhat avakalpayan adhimucya prasanna cittaḥ bodhāya
translated: This, Blessed One, is the noble son or noble daughter who generates much more merit for those than the one who has faith in, contemplates, and has confidence in this perfection of wisdom, who has given rise to the mind of enlightenment

original: cittamutpādya adhyāśayataḥ śṛṇuyādudgṛhṇīyāddhārayedvācayet paryavāpnuyāt pravartayeddeśayedupadiśeduddiśet svādhyāyet /
analyzed: cittam utpādya adhyāśayataḥ śṛṇuyāt udgṛhṇīyāt dhārayet vācayet paryavāpnuyāt pravartayet deśayet upadiśet uddiśet su ādhyāyet
translated: with superior intention, listens to it, takes it up, bears it in mind, reads it aloud, masters it, teaches it, explains it, chants it, and repeats it;

analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayet
translated: and who, for the sake of the long-lasting existence of the true Dharma, would explain it in detail to others,

analyzed: artham asyāḥ vivṛṇuyāt
translated: would elucidate its meaning,

analyzed: manasā anvavekṣeta
translated: would contemplate it with the mind,

analyzed: yathā adhikayā ca prajñayā atra parimīmāṃsām āpadyeta
translated: and would apply discernment to it to the best of one's ability.

original: antaśaḥ pustakagatām api kṛtvā dhārayetsthāpayetsaddharmacirasthitihetoḥ mā buddhanetrīsamucchedo bhūt /
analyzed: antaśas pustaka gatām api kṛtvā dhārayet sthāpayet saddharma cira sthiti hetoḥ mā buddha netrī samucchedaḥ bhūt
translated: At the very least, one should take it up in book form, bear it, and establish it for the sake of the long-lasting existence of the true Dharma, so that the lineage of the Buddha may not be cut off,

analyzed: mā saddharma antardhānam
translated: and so that the true Dharma may not disappear.

original: bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ ca anugrahopasaṃhāraḥ kṛto bhaviṣyati netryavaikalyeneti /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām ca anugraha upasaṃhāraḥ kṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati netrī a vaikalyena iti
translated: It will be a favor and assistance to the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, through the non-deficiency of the eye.

analyzed: tām ca enām prajñāpāramitām satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet puṣpaiḥ dhūpaiḥ gandhaiḥ mālyaiḥ vilepanaiḥ cūrṇaiḥ vastraiḥ chatraiḥ dhvajaiḥ ghaṇṭābhiḥ
translated: And he should honor, respect, revere, and worship that perfection of wisdom with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners,

analyzed: samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: and all around with rows of lamps.

analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ pūjayet
translated: And he should worship it with many kinds of worship.

original: atha khalu bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat evametatkauśika / evam etat /🔽bahutaraṃ sa kauśika kulaputra vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /🔽aprameyaṃ sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat evam etat kauśika evam etat  bahutaram sa kauśika kula putra vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahutaram puṇyam prasavati  aprameyam sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: Then the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: It is so, Kauśika, it is so.🔽That son of good family or daughter of good family would generate even more merit than that, Kauśika, on that basis.🔽Kauśika, that son of good family or daughter of good family would generate even more merit than that, on that basis, which is immeasurable.

original: asaṃkhyeyaṃ sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: asaṃkhyeyam sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: Kauśika, that son of good family or daughter of good family would generate even more merit than that, on that basis, which is incalculable.

original: acintyaṃ sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: acintyam sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: That son of a good family or daughter of a good family, Kauśika, would produce merit that is incalculably greater than that.

original: atulyaṃ sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /🔽aparimāṇaṃ sa kauśika Vaidya
analyzed: atulyam sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahutaram puṇyam prasavati  aparimāṇam sa kauśika vaidya
translated: That son of a good family or daughter of a good family, Kauśika, would produce merit that is immeasurably greater than that.

original: kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: That son of a good family or daughter of a good family, Kauśika, would produce merit that is infinitely greater than that.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: prajñāpāramitānirjātā hi kauśika tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ sarvajñatā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā nirjātā hi kauśika tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām sarvajña tā
translated: Kauśika, the omniscience of the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones, is born from the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: sarvajña tā nirjātā ca tathāgata śarīrāṇām pūjā
translated: And the worship of the Tathāgata’s relics is born from omniscience.

original: tasmāttarhi kauśika yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmabhiśraddadhadavakalpayannadhimucya🔽prasannacitto bodhāya cittamutpādya adhyāśayataḥ śṛṇuyādudgṛhṇīyāddhārayedvācayetparyavāpnuyātpravartayeddeśayedupadiśeduddiśet /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kauśika yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām abhiśraddadhat avakalpayan adhimucya  prasanna cittaḥ bodhāya cittam utpādya adhyāśayataḥ śṛṇuyāt udgṛhṇīyāt dhārayet vācayet paryavāpnuyāt pravartayet deśayet upadiśet uddiśet
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family who, with faith, conviction, and aspiration,🔽having generated the thought of awakening, would listen to, take up, bear in mind, read aloud, master, teach, explain, expound, chant,

analyzed: su ādhyāyet
translated: and study this perfection of wisdom with the highest aim,

analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayet
translated: And should explain it extensively to others.

analyzed: artham asyāḥ vivṛṇuyāt
translated: One should expound its meaning.

analyzed: manasā anvavekṣeta
translated: One should contemplate it with the mind.

analyzed: yathā adhikayā ca prajñayā atra parimīmāṃsām āpadyeta
translated: And one should apply the highest wisdom to investigating it.🔽At least one should take it up in book form, hold it, and keep it, for the sake of the long duration of the true Dharma.

original: antaśaḥ pustakagatām api kṛtvā dhārayetsthāpayetsaddharmacirasthitihetoḥ mā buddhanetrīsamucchedo bhūt /
analyzed: antaśas pustaka gatām api kṛtvā dhārayet sthāpayet saddharma cira sthiti hetoḥ mā buddha netrī samucchedaḥ bhūt
translated: May the lineage of the Buddhas not be cut off.

analyzed: mā saddharma antardhānam
translated: May the true Dharma not disappear.

original: bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ ca anugrahopasaṃhāraḥ kṛto bhaviṣyati netryavaikalyeneti /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām ca anugraha upasaṃhāraḥ kṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati netrī a vaikalyena iti
translated: A favor and assistance will have been done to the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, through the non-deficiency of the eye.

analyzed: tām ca enām prajñāpāramitām satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet puṣpaiḥ dhūpaiḥ gandhaiḥ mālyaiḥ vilepanaiḥ cūṇaiḥ vastraiḥ chatraiḥ dhvajaiḥ ghaṇṭābhiḥ
translated: And one should honor that perfection of wisdom, respect it, revere it, worship it, adore it, venerate it with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, cloths, parasols, flags, and banners,

analyzed: patākābhiḥ samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: and all around with rows of lamps.

analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ pūjayet
translated: And one should worship it with many kinds of worship.

original: asya kauśika puṇyābhisaṃskārasya asau pūrvakastathāgatadhātugarbhaḥ saptaratnamayaḥ stūpasaṃskārajapuṇyābhisaṃskāraḥ śatatamīm api kalāṃ nopaiti /🔽sahasratamīmapi /
analyzed: asya kauśika puṇya abhisaṃskārasya asau pūrvakaḥ tathāgata dhātu garbhaḥ sapta ratna mayaḥ stūpa saṃskāra ja puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ śatatamīm api kalām na upaiti  sahasratamīm api
translated: Kauśika, this merit-making of this [stūpa] does not approach even a hundredth part of the merit-making from the previous stūpa enshrining the relics of the Tathāgata, made of the seven precious substances.🔽It does not approach even a thousandth part.

analyzed: śata sahasratamīm api
translated: It does not approach even a hundred-thousandth part.

analyzed: koṭītamīm api  koṭī śatatamīm api  koṭī sahasratamīm api
translated: It does not approach even a koṭi-th part.🔽It does not approach even a koṭi-hundred-th part.

analyzed: koṭī śata sahasratamīm api
translated: It does not approach even a koṭi-thousand-th part.🔽It does not approach even a koṭi-hundred-thousand-th part.

analyzed: koṭī niyuta śata sahasratamīm api kalām na upaiti
translated: It does not approach even a koṭi-niyuta-hundred-thousand-th part.

original: saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām api upamām api aupamyam api upanisām api upaniṣadam api na kṣamate //🔽atha khalu yāni tāni catvāriṃśaddevaputrasahasrāṇi śakreṇa devānāmindreṇa sārdhaṃ saṃnipatitāni tasyāmeva parṣadi saṃnipatitānyabhūvan /
analyzed: saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām api upamām api aupamyam api upanisām api upaniṣadam api na kṣamate  atha khalu yāni tāni catvāriṃśat deva putra sahasrāṇi śakreṇa devānām indreṇa sārdham saṃnipatitāni tasyām eva parṣadi saṃnipatitāni abhūvan
translated: It cannot bear even a fraction, even a count, even a calculation, even a comparison, even a similitude, even a basis, even a basis of comparison.

original: tāni śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocan udgṛhṇīṣva mārṣa prajñāpāramitām /🔽udgrahītavyā mārṣa prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: tāni śakram devānām indram etat avocan udgṛhṇīṣva mārṣa prajñāpāramitām  udgrahītavyā mārṣa prajñāpāramitā
translated: Then those forty thousand sons of gods who had assembled in that very assembly together with Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: Take up the perfection of wisdom, friend.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be taken up, friend.

analyzed: dhārayitavyā mārṣa prajñāpāramitā
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be borne in mind, friend.

analyzed: vācayitavyā mārṣa prajñāpāramitā
translated: 'You should recite the perfection of wisdom, friend.

original: paryavāptavyā mārṣa prajñāpāramitā /🔽pravartayitavyā mārṣa prajñāpāramitā /🔽deśayitavyā mārṣa prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: paryavāptavyā mārṣa prajñāpāramitā  pravartayitavyā mārṣa prajñāpāramitā  deśayitavyā mārṣa prajñāpāramitā
translated: 'You should master the perfection of wisdom, friend.🔽'You should expound the perfection of wisdom, friend.🔽'You should teach the perfection of wisdom, friend.

analyzed: upadeṣṭavyā mārṣa prajñāpāramitā  uddeṣṭavyā mārṣa prajñāpāramitā
translated: 'You should instruct in the perfection of wisdom, friend.🔽'You should expound the perfection of wisdom, friend.

analyzed: su ādhyātavyā mārṣa prajñāpāramitā
translated: 'You should recite the perfection of wisdom to yourself, friend.'

original: atha khalu bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindramāmantrayate sma udgṛhāṇa tvaṃ kauśika prajñāpāramitām /🔽dhāraya tvaṃ kauśika prajñāpāramitām /🔽vācaya tvaṃ kauśika prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śakram devānām indram āmantrayate smaḥ udgṛhāṇa tvam kauśika prajñāpāramitām  dhāraya tvam kauśika prajñāpāramitām  vācaya tvam kauśika prajñāpāramitām
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed Śakra, Lord of the Gods: 'You should take up the perfection of wisdom, Kauśika.🔽You should bear the perfection of wisdom in mind, Kauśika.🔽You should recite the perfection of wisdom, Kauśika.

original: paryavāpnuhi tvaṃ kauśika prajñāpāramitām /🔽pravartaya tvaṃ kauśika prajñāpāramitām /🔽deśaya tvaṃ kauśika prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: paryavāpnuhi tvam kauśika prajñāpāramitām  pravartaya tvam kauśika prajñāpāramitām  deśaya tvam kauśika prajñāpāramitām
translated: You should master the perfection of wisdom, Kauśika.🔽You should expound the perfection of wisdom, Kauśika.🔽You should teach the perfection of wisdom, Kauśika.

original: upadiśa tvaṃ kauśika prajñāpāramitām /🔽uddiśaya tvaṃ kauśika prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: upadiśa tvam kauśika prajñāpāramitām  tvam kauśika prajñāpāramitām
translated: You should instruct in the perfection of wisdom, Kauśika.🔽You should expound the perfection of wisdom, Kauśika.

analyzed: su ādhyāya tvam kauśika prajñāpāramitām
translated: You should recite the perfection of wisdom to yourself, Kauśika.

analyzed: tat kasya heto
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: yadā hi kauśika asurāṇāmevaṃrūpāḥ samudācārā utpatsyante devāṃstrāyastriṃśān yodhayiṣyāma iti /
analyzed: yadā hi kauśika asurāṇām evaṃrūpāḥ samudācārāḥ utpatsyante devān trāyastriṃśān yodhayiṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: For when such thoughts arise in the asuras, We will fight with the gods of the Thirty-Three,

analyzed: devaiḥ trāyastriṃśaiḥ sārdham saṃgrāmayiṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: We will engage in battle with the gods of the Thirty-Three,

original: tadā tvaṃ kauśika imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ samanvāhareḥ /
analyzed: tadā tvam kauśikaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām samanvāhareḥ
translated: then, Kauśika, you should recollect this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: svādhyāyeḥ
translated: you should recite it.

analyzed: evam teṣām asurāṇām te samudācārāḥ punar eva antardhāsyanti
translated: In this way, those thoughts of the asuras will disappear again.

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat mahāvidyeyaṃ bhagavan yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat mahā vidyā iyam bhagavan yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: When this had been said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One, This is a great knowledge, Blessed One, namely the perfection of wisdom.

original: apramāṇeyaṃ bhagavan vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽aparimāṇeyaṃ bhagavan Vaidya 🔽vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽niruttareyaṃ bhagavān vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: apramāṇā iyam bhagavan vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā  aparimāṇā iyam bhagavan vaidya  vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā  niruttarā iyam bhagavān vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This is an immeasurable knowledge, Blessed One, namely the perfection of wisdom.🔽This is an infinite knowledge, Blessed One, namely the perfection of wisdom.

original: anuttareyaṃ bhagavan vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽asameyaṃ bhagavan vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: anuttarā iyam bhagavan vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā  asamā iyam bhagavan vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This is an unsurpassed knowledge, Blessed One, namely the perfection of wisdom.🔽This is an unequalled knowledge, Blessed One, namely the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: asamasamā iyam bhagavan vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This is an unequaled and unequalled knowledge, Blessed One, namely the perfection of wisdom.

original: evamukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat evametatkauśika / evam etat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods, So it is, Kauśika, so it is.

original: mahāvidyeyaṃ kauśika yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽apramāṇeyaṃ kauśika vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽aparimāṇeyaṃ kauśika vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: mahā vidyā iyam kauśika yat uta prajñāpāramitā  apramāṇā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā  aparimāṇā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This, Kauśika, is a great knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom.🔽This, Kauśika, is an immeasurable knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom.🔽This, Kauśika, is an infinite knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom.

original: niruttareyaṃ kauśika vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽anuttareyaṃ kauśika vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽asameyaṃ kauśika vidyā yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: niruttarā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā  anuttarā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā  asamā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This, Kauśika, is an unsurpassed knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom.🔽This, Kauśika, is an unequaled knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom.🔽This, Kauśika, is an incomparable knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: asamasamā iyam kauśika vidyā yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This, Kauśika, is a knowledge equal to the unequaled, namely the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: imāṃ hi kauśika vidyāmāgamya paurvakāstathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: imām hi kauśika vidyām āgamya paurvakāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Kauśika, relying on this knowledge, the past Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones have fully awakened to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yat uta prajñāpāramitām
translated: Namely, the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye 'pi te kauśika bhaviṣyantyanāgate 'dhvani tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: ye pi te kauśika bhaviṣyanti anāgate dhvani tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Kauśika, those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones who will appear in the future

analyzed: anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: te 'pi kauśika imāmeva vidyāmāgamya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyante yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: te pi kauśika imām eva vidyām āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: They too, Kauśika, having relied on this very knowledge, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, namely, the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye 'pi kecitkauśika etarhi aprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavanto 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyante /
analyzed: ye pi kecid kauśika etarhi aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyante
translated: And also, Kauśika, those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who in the present time in the immeasurable, incalculable great trichiliocosm worlds fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: te 'pi kauśika imāmeva vidyāmāgamya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyante yaduta prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: te pi kauśika imām eva vidyām āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyante yat uta prajñāpāramitām
translated: they too, Kauśika, having relied on this very knowledge, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, namely, the perfection of wisdom.

original: aham api kauśika imāmeva vidyāmāgamya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddho yaduta prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: aham api kauśikaḥ imām eva vidyām āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ yat uta prajñāpāramitām
translated: And I, Kauśika, having relied on this very knowledge, have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, namely, the perfection of wisdom.

original: imāmeva kauśika vidyāmāgamya daśa kuśalāḥ karmapathā loke prabhāvyante /🔽catvāri dhyānāni bodhyaṅgasaṃprayuktāni loke prabhāvyante /
analyzed: imām eva kauśika vidyām āgamya daśa kuśalāḥ karma pathāḥ loke prabhāvyante  catvāri dhyānāni bodhyaṅga saṃprayuktāni loke prabhāvyante
translated: Relying on this very knowledge, Kauśika, the ten wholesome courses of action become manifest in the world.🔽The four meditations connected with the factors of awakening become manifest in the world.

analyzed: catvāri apramāṇāni bodhyaṅga saṃprayuktāni loke prabhāvyante
translated: The four immeasurables connected with the factors of awakening become manifest in the world.

analyzed: catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattayaḥ bodhyaṅga parigṛhītāḥ loke prabhāvyante
translated: The four formless attainments, taken up by the factors of awakening, shine forth in the world.

analyzed: ṣaḍabhijñāḥ bodhyaṅga saṃprayuktāḥ loke prabhāvyante
translated: The six higher knowledges, connected with the factors of awakening, shine forth in the world.

analyzed: saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣāḥ dharmāḥ loke prabhāvyante
translated: The thirty-seven factors of awakening shine forth in the world.

analyzed: saṃkṣepeṇa caturaśīti dharma skandha sahasrāṇi loke prabhāvyante
translated: In brief, the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma shine forth in the world.

analyzed: buddha jñānam svayaṃbhū jñānam acintya jñānam loke prabhāvyante
translated: The knowledge of a Buddha, the self-arisen knowledge, the inconceivable knowledge, shines forth in the world.

analyzed: imām eva kauśika vidyām āgamya yat uta prajñāpāramitām
translated: Relying on this very knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom, Kauśika,

original: yadāpi kauśika tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā loke notpadyante /
analyzed: yadā api kauśika tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ loke na utpadyante
translated: even when the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones do not arise in the world, Kauśika,

original: tadāpi kauśika bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ pūrvaśrutena prajñāpāramitāniṣyandena ye upāyakauśalyasamanvāgatā bhavanti /
analyzed: tadā api kauśika bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ pūrva śrutena prajñāpāramitā nisyandena ye upāya kauśalya samanvāgatāḥ bhavanti
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, endowed with the skill in means that comes from the outflow of the perfection of wisdom heard in the past,

original: te 'pi kauśika sattvānāmanukampakāḥ anukampāmupādāya imaṃ lokamāgamya daśa kuśalān karmapathān loke prabhāvayanti /
analyzed: te pi kauśika sattvānām anukampakāḥ anukampām upādāya imam lokam āgamya daśa kuśalān karma pathān loke prabhāvayanti
translated: they too, Kauśika, out of compassion for beings, out of compassion, having come to this world, proclaim the ten wholesome courses of action in the world.

original: catvāri dhyānāni bodhyaṅgaviprayuktāni loke prabhāvayanti /🔽catvāryapramāṇāni bodhyaṅgaviprayuktāni loke prabhāvayanti /
analyzed: catvāri dhyānāni bodhyaṅga viprayuktāni loke prabhāvayanti  catvāri apramāṇāni bodhyaṅga viprayuktāni loke prabhāvayanti
translated: They manifest the four concentrations in the world, which are not connected with the factors of awakening.🔽They manifest the four immeasurables in the world, which are not connected with the factors of awakening.

analyzed: catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattīḥ bodhyaṅga viyuktāḥ loke prabhāvayanti
translated: They manifest the four formless attainments in the world, which are not connected with the factors of awakening.

analyzed: pañca abhijñāḥ bodhyaṅga viprayuktāḥ loke prabhāvayanti
translated: They manifest the five higher knowledges in the world, which are not connected with the factors of awakening.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kauśika candramaṇḍalamāgamya sarvā oṣadhīḥ tārā yathābalaṃ yathāsthāmamavabhāsayanti /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika candra maṇḍalam āgamya sarvāḥ oṣadhīḥ tārāḥ yathābalam yathāsthāmam avabhāsayanti
translated: Just as, Kauśika, all the herbs and stars are illuminated by the moon's orb according to their strength and power,

analyzed: nakṣatrāṇi ca yathābalam yathāsthāmam avabhāsayanti
translated: and the constellations are illuminated according to their strength and power,

original: evameva kauśika tathāgatasyārhataṃ samyaksaṃbuddhasya atyayena saddharmasyāntardhāne
analyzed: evam eva kauśika tathāgatasya ārhatam samyaksaṃbuddhasya atyayena saddharmasya antardhāne
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, after the passing of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, and the disappearance of the true Dharma,

original: tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmanutpādāt yā kāciddharmacaryā samacaryā asamacaryā
analyzed: tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām anutpādāt yā kācid dharma caryā sama caryā asama caryā
translated: when the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones do not appear, whatever practice of Dharma, practice of equality, unequalled practice,

analyzed: kuśala caryā loke prajñāyate prabhāvyate
translated: practice of virtue is known and manifested in the world,

analyzed: sarvā sā bodhisattva nirjātā bodhisattva pramāvitā vaidya
translated: all that is born from the Bodhisattva, is approved by the Bodhisattva, is manifested by the Bodhisattva,

analyzed: bodhisattva upāya kauśalya pravarti tā
translated: is set in motion by the skillful means of the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: tat ca bodhisattvānām upāya kauśalyam prajñāpāramitā nirjātam veditavyam
translated: And that skillful means of the bodhisattvas should be known as born from the perfection of wisdom.

original: punaraparaṃ kauśika imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgṛhṇaṃtāṃ dhārayatāṃ vācayatāṃ paryavāpnuvatāṃ
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇaṃtām dhārayatām vācayatām paryavāpnuvatām
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, for those sons of good family or daughters of good family who will take up, bear in mind, read aloud, master,

original: pravartayatāṃ deśayatāmupadiśatāmuddiśatāṃ svādhyāyatāṃ likhatāṃ manasi kurvatāṃ
analyzed: pravartayatām deśayatām upadiśatām uddiśatām su ādhyāyatām likhatām manasi kurvatām
translated: spread, teach, explain, expound, recite, and write out this perfection of wisdom, and who will pay attention to it and bring it to mind,

original: samanvāharatāṃ ca kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ vā tannidānaṃ bahavo dṛṣṭadhārmikā guṇāḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyāḥ /
analyzed: samanvāharatām ca kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām vā tad nidānam bahavaḥ dṛṣṭa dhārmikāḥ guṇāḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyāḥ
translated: many qualities that are visible in this very life should be expected as a result.

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat katamaiḥ punarbhagavan dṛṣṭadhārmikairguṇaiḥ samanvāgatāste kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca 🔽bhaviṣyanti /🔽bhagavānāha na te kauśika kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā viṣamāparihāreṇa kālaṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat katamaiḥ punar bhagavan dṛṣṭa dhārmikaiḥ guṇaiḥ samanvāgatāḥ te kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca  / bhaviṣyanti  bhagavān āha na te kauśika kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā viṣama a parihāreṇa kālam kariṣyanti
translated: When this was said, Śakra, lord of the gods, said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, what are those qualities that are visible in this very life that those sons of good family and daughters of good family will possess?

original: na viṣeṇa kālaṃ kariṣyanti /🔽na śastreṇa kālaṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: na viṣeṇa kālam kariṣyanti  na śastreṇa kālam kariṣyanti
translated: The Blessed One said, Kauśika, those sons of good family or daughters of good family will not meet with untimely death due to unfavorable circumstances.🔽They will not die by poison.🔽They will not die by weapons.

analyzed: na agninā kālam kariṣyati 🔽na udakena kālam kariṣyanti
translated: They will not die by fire.🔽They will not die by water.

analyzed: na daṇḍena kālam kariṣyanti
translated: They will not die by the rod.

analyzed: na kālam kariṣyanti
translated: They will not die by a weapon.

original: utpannotpannāścaiṣāmupadravā rājato vā rājaputrato vā rājamantrito vā rājamahāmātrato vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ samanvāharatāṃ vā svādhyāyatāṃ
analyzed: utpanna utpannāḥ ca eṣām upadravāḥ rājataḥ vā rāja putrataḥ vā rāja mantritaḥ vā rāja mahāmātrataḥ vā imām prajñāpāramitām samanvāharatām vā su ādhyāyatām
translated: And if any calamities should arise for them, from the king or the prince or the king’s minister or the king’s counselor, if they bring to mind this perfection of wisdom, or recite it,

original: vā punarevāntardhāsyanti /🔽teṣāṃ ca enāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ punaḥ punaḥ samanvāharatāṃ vā svādhyāyatāṃ vā ye tatropasaṃkrāmeyuravatāraprekṣiṇo
analyzed: vā punar eva antardhāsyanti  teṣām ca enām prajñāpāramitām punar punar samanvāharatām vā su ādhyāyatām vā ye tatra upasaṃkrāmeyuḥ avatāra prekṣiṇaḥ
translated: then they will disappear again.

original: 'vatāragaveṣiṇo rājāno vā rājaputrā vā rājamantriṇo vā rājamahāmātrā vā /
analyzed: vatāra gaveṣiṇaḥ rājānaḥ vā rāja putrāḥ vā rāja mantriṇaḥ vā rāja mahāmātrāḥ vā
translated: And if kings or princes or king’s ministers or king’s counselors should come to them, seeking an opportunity,

original: na te 'vatāraṃ lapsyante yathāpi nāma prajñāpāramitāparigṛhītatvāt /🔽upasaṃkrāntānāṃ ca teṣāṃ rājñāṃ vā rājaputrāṇāṃ vā rājamantriṇāṃ vā /
analyzed: na te vatāram lapsyante yathā api nāma prajñāpāramitā parigṛhīta tvāt  upasaṃkrāntānām ca teṣām rājñām vā rāja putrāṇām vā rāja mantriṇām vā
translated: seeking to find an opportunity, they will not find an opportunity, because they are upheld by the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: rāja mahāmātrāṇām vā ālapitu kāma tā bhaviṣyati  abhibhāṣitu kāma tā bhaviṣyati
translated: And when those kings or princes or king’s ministers or king’s counselors have come, they will want to talk to them.🔽They will want to converse with them.

analyzed: pratisaṃmoditavyam ca te maṃsyante
translated: They will want to be friendly with them.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: iyaṃ hi kauśika prajñāpāramitā sarvasattvānāmantike maitropasaṃhāreṇa maitracittatayā karuṇopasaṃhāreṇa karuṇacittatayā pratyupasthitā /🔽tasmāttarhi kauśika ye 'pi te vyālasarīsṛpakāntāramadhyagatāḥ /
analyzed: iyam hi kauśika prajñāpāramitā sarva sattvānām antike maitra upasaṃhāreṇa maitra citta tayā karuṇā upasaṃhāreṇa karuṇa citta tayā pratyupasthitā  tasmāt tarhi kauśika ye pi te vyāla sarīsṛpa kāntāra madhya gatāḥ
translated: For this perfection of wisdom, Kauśika, is present near all beings with the accumulation of friendliness, with a friendly mind, with the accumulation of compassion, with a compassionate mind.🔽Therefore, Kauśika, even those sons of good family or daughters of good family who are in the midst of a wilderness inhabited by predatory animals and reptiles,

original: teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ vā manuṣyā vā amanuṣyā vā avatāraprekṣiṇo 'vatāragaveṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām vā manuṣyāḥ vā amanuṣyāḥ vā avatāra prekṣiṇaḥ vatāra gaveṣiṇaḥ
translated: whether they are humans or non-humans who seek an opportunity and look for an opportunity,

original: te 'pi teṣāṃ kauśika avatāraṃ na lapsyante sthāpayitvā pūrvakarmavipākam //
analyzed: te pi teṣām kauśika avatāram na lapsyante sthāpayitvā pūrva karma vipākam
translated: they will not find an opportunity for them, Kauśika, except for the ripening of former karma.

original: atha khalvanyatīrthyānāṃ parivrājakānāmupālambhābhiprāyāṇāṃ śataṃ tasyāṃ velāyāṃ yena bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāmati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu anya tīrthyānām parivrājakānām upālambha abhiprāyāṇām śatam tasyām velāyām yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāmati sma
translated: Then at that time a hundred non-Buddhist wandering mendicants, with the intention of finding fault, approached where the Blessed One was.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro dūrata eva āgacchatastānanyatīrthyān parivrājakān dṛṣṭvā
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ dūratas eva āgacchataḥ tān anya tīrthyān parivrājakān dṛṣṭvā
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, seeing from afar those non-Buddhist wandering mendicants who were coming,

original: teṣāṃ cittāni vyavalokya evaṃ cintayāmāsa ime khalu anyatīrthyāḥ parivrājakā upālambhābhiprāyā
analyzed: teṣām cittāni vyavalokya evam cintayāmāsa ime khalu anya tīrthyāḥ parivrājakāḥ upālambha abhiprāyā
translated: and observing their thoughts, thought thus: These non-Buddhist wandering mendicants, with the intention of finding fault,

original: yena bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāmanti sma /🔽yannvahaṃ yāvanmātro mayāṃ bhagavato 'ntikādasyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pradeśa udgṛhītaḥ /
analyzed: yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāmanti sma  yat nu aham yāvanmātraḥ mayām bhagavataḥ ntikāt asyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pradeśaḥ udgṛhītaḥ
translated: and approached the Blessed One.

analyzed: tāvanmātram smṛtyā samanvāhareyam svādhyāyeyam pravartayeyam
translated: I will recollect, recite, and expound just as much of this perfection of wisdom as I have received from the Blessed One.

analyzed: yathā ete nyatīrthāḥ parivrājakāḥ bhagavantam na upasaṃkrāmeyuḥ
translated: So that these wandering mendicants of other sects will not approach the Blessed One.

original: evamasyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyā bhāṣyamāṇāyā nāntarāyaḥ syāditi /🔽atha khalu śakro devānāmindro yāvanmātro bhagavato 'ntikādasyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pradeśaḥ udgṛhītaḥ /
analyzed: evam asyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ bhāṣyamāṇāyāḥ na antarāyaḥ syāt iti  atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ yāvanmātraḥ bhagavataḥ ntikāt asyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pradeśaḥ udgṛhītaḥ
translated: So that there will be no obstacle to the teaching of this perfection of wisdom.

original: tāvanmātraṃ smṛtyā samanvāharati sma /🔽svādhyāyati sma /🔽pravartayati sma /
analyzed: tāvanmātram smṛtyā samanvāharati sma  su ādhyāyati sma  pravartayati sma
translated: Then indeed Śakra, Lord of the Gods, recollected, recited, and expounded just as much of this perfection of wisdom as he had received from the Blessed One.

original: atha te 'nyatīrthāḥ parivrājakā dūrāddūrataraṃ bhagavantaṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya tenaiva dvāreṇa tenaiva mārgeṇa punareva niṣkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: atha te nyatīrthāḥ parivrājakāḥ dūrāt dūrataram bhagavantam pradakṣiṇīkṛtya tena eva dvāreṇa tena eva mārgeṇa punar eva niṣkrāntāḥ
translated: Then those wandering mendicants of other sects circumambulated the Blessed One three times and left by the same gate and the same path by which they had come.

analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya etat abhūt vaidya
translated: Then indeed the venerable Śāriputra thought this: The Blessed One has not counteracted the going forth of these wandering mendicants of other sects.

original: kimatra kāraṇaṃ yena ime 'nyatīrthyāḥ parivrājakā dūrāddūrataraṃ bhagavantaṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya tenaiva dvāreṇa tenaiva mārgeṇa punareva niṣkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: kim atra kāraṇam yena ime nyatīrthyāḥ parivrājakāḥ dūrāt dūrataram bhagavantam pradakṣiṇīkṛtya tena eva dvāreṇa tena eva mārgeṇa punar eva niṣkrāntāḥ
translated: What is the reason that these non-Buddhist wanderers, having circumambulated the Blessed One from afar, have now left by the same gate and the same path by which they came?

original: atha khalu bhagavānāyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya imamevaṃrūpaṃ cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya imam evaṃrūpam cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing by his own mind the kind of thought that had occurred to the venerable Śāriputra,

original: āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocat śakreṇa śāriputra devānāmindreṇa teṣāmanyatīrthyānāṃ
analyzed: āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat śakreṇa śāriputra devānām indreṇa teṣām anya tīrthyānām
translated: said this to the venerable Śāriputra: Śāriputra, Śakra, lord of the gods, having observed the thoughts of those non-Buddhist wanderers

original: parivrājakānāmupālambhābhiprāyāṇāṃ cittāni vyavalokya iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā smṛtyā
analyzed: parivrājakānām upālambha abhiprāyāṇām cittāni vyavalokya iyam prajñāpāramitā smṛtyā
translated: with the intention of criticizing them, has remembered this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: samanvāhṛtā svādhyāyitā pravartitā
translated: recited it, and expounded it.

original: teṣāmanyatīrthyānāṃ parivrājakānāṃ vigrahītukāmānāṃ vivaditukāmānāṃ virodhayitukāmānāṃ nivartanārtham /🔽yathā asyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyā bhāṣyamāṇāyā ete 'nyatīrthyāḥ parivrājakā nopasaṃkrāmeyuriti /
analyzed: teṣām anya tīrthyānām parivrājakānām vigrahītu kāmānām vivaditu kāmānām virodhayitu kāmānām nivartana artham  yathā asyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ bhāṣyamāṇāyāḥ ete nyatīrthyāḥ parivrājakāḥ na upasaṃkrāmeyuḥ iti
translated: In order to turn back those non-Buddhist wanderers who desire to argue, who desire to dispute, who desire to contradict.🔽So that while this perfection of wisdom is being taught, those non-Buddhist wanderers might not approach.

analyzed: mā antarāyam kārṣuḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ bhāṣyamāṇāyāḥ iti
translated: So that they might not create obstacles while this perfection of wisdom is being taught.

analyzed: mayā ca śakrasya devānām indrasya abhyanujñātam
translated: And I have given permission to Śakra, lord of the gods.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: nāhaṃ śāriputra teṣāmanyatīrthyānāṃ parivrājakānāmekasyāpi śuklaṃ dharmaṃ samanupaśyāmi /
analyzed: na aham śāriputra teṣām anya tīrthyānām parivrājakānām ekasya api śuklam dharmam samanupaśyāmi
translated: Śāriputra, I do not see even one wholesome quality in those non-Buddhist wanderers.

original: sarve te śāriputra upālambhābhiprāyāḥ pratihatacittā upasaṃkramitukāmā abhūvan //
analyzed: sarve te śāriputra upālambha abhiprāyāḥ pratihata cittāḥ upasaṃkramitu kāmāḥ abhūvan
translated: Śāriputra, all of them had the intention of criticizing and had hostile minds, and they wanted to approach.

original: atha khalu mārasya pāpīyasya etadabhūt imāstathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya catasraḥ parṣadaḥ saṃnipatitāḥ saṃniṣaṇṇāstathāgatasya saṃmukhībhūtāḥ
analyzed: atha khalu mārasya pāpīyasya etat abhūt imāḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya catasraḥ parṣadaḥ saṃnipatitāḥ saṃniṣaṇṇāḥ tathāgatasya saṃmukhībhūtāḥ
translated: Then this occurred to the evil Māra: These four assemblies of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One have gathered together and are seated, facing the Tathāgata,

original: ime ca kāmāvacarā rūpāvacarāś ca devaputrāḥ saṃmukhībhūtāḥ /
analyzed: ime ca kāmāvacarāḥ rūpāvacarāḥ ca deva putrāḥ saṃmukhībhūtāḥ
translated: and these gods of the desire realm and form realm are present.

analyzed: niyatam atra bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ vyākariṣyante nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Certainly here the bodhisattva mahāsattvas will be predicted to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yat nu aham upasaṃkrāmeyam vicakṣuḥkaraṇāya iti
translated: Let me approach to create confusion.

original: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīyāṃścaturaṅgabalakāyamabhinirmāya yena bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāmati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīyān caturaṅga balakāyam abhinirmāya yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāmati sma
translated: Then the evil Māra, having created an army of four divisions, approached where the Blessed One was.

original: atha khalu śakrasya devānāmindrasyaitadabhūt māro batāyaṃ pāpīyāṃścaturaṅgabalakāyamabhinirmāya yena bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāmati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasya etat abhūt māraḥ bata ayam pāpīyān caturaṅga balakāyam abhinirmāya yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāmati sma
translated: Then this occurred to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: “This wicked Māra has created an army of four divisions and is approaching the Fortunate One.

original: yaścāyaṃ caturaṅgasya balakāyasya vyūhaḥ /🔽nāyaṃ rājño bimbisārasya caturaṅgasya balakāyasya vyūhaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca ayam catur aṅgasya balakāyasya vyūhaḥ  na ayam rājñaḥ bimbisārasya caturaṅgasya balakāyasya vyūhaḥ
translated: And this is the array of an army of four divisions.🔽This is not the array of an army of four divisions of King Bimbisāra,

original: nāpi rājñaḥ prasenajitaścaturaṅgasya balakāyasya vyūhaḥ /🔽nāpi śākyānāṃ caturaṅgasya balakāyasya vyūhaḥ /
analyzed: na api rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ caturaṅgasya balakāyasya vyūhaḥ  na api śākyānām caturaṅgasya balakāyasya vyūhaḥ
translated: nor is it the array of an army of four divisions of King Prasenajit,🔽nor is it the array of an army of four divisions of the Śākyas,

analyzed: na api licchavīnām caturaṅgasya balakāyasya vyūhaḥ
translated: nor is it the array of an army of four divisions of the Licchavis,

analyzed: yaḥ yam māreṇa pāpīyasā abhinirmitaḥ
translated: which has been created by the wicked Māra.

original: samanubaddho dīrgharātraṃ māraḥ pāpīyān bhagavato 'vatāraprekṣī avatāragaveṣī /
analyzed: samanubaddhaḥ dīrgharātram māraḥ pāpīyān bhagavataḥ vatāra prekṣī avatāra gaveṣī
translated: For a long time the wicked Māra has been attached to the Fortunate One, seeking an opportunity, seeking an entrance.

analyzed: sattvānām ca viheṭhana abhiprāyaḥ
translated: And he is intent on harming beings.

original: yannvahamimāmeva prajñāpāramitāṃ smṛtyā samanvāhareyaṃ svādhyāyeyaṃ pravartayeyamiti /
analyzed: yat nu aham imām eva prajñāpāramitām smṛtyā samanvāhareyam su ādhyāyeyam pravartayeyam iti
translated: Let me now, with mindfulness, bring to mind, recite, and expound this very perfection of wisdom.”

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindra imāmeva prajñāpāramitāṃ smṛtyā samanvāharati sma svādhyāyati sma pravartayati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ imām eva prajñāpāramitām smṛtyā samanvāharati sma su ādhyāyati sma pravartayati sma
translated: Then indeed Śakra, Lord of the Gods, with mindfulness brought to mind this very perfection of wisdom, recited it, and expounded it.

original: yathā yathā ca śakro devānāmindra imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ smṛtyā samanvāharati sma svādhyāyati sma pravartayati sma /
analyzed: yathā yathā ca śakraḥ devānām indraḥ imām prajñāpāramitām smṛtyā samanvāharati sma su ādhyāyati sma pravartayati sma
translated: And as Śakra, Lord of the Gods, brought to mind this perfection of wisdom with mindfulness, recited it, and expounded it,

original: tathā tathā māraḥ pāpīyāṃstenaiva mārgeṇa punareva pratyudāvṛttaḥ //
analyzed: tathā tathā māraḥ pāpīyān tena eva mārgeṇa punar eva pratyudāvṛttaḥ
translated: in the very same way Māra, the evil one, turned back by that very path.

original: atha khalu trāyastriṃśatkāyikā devaputrā divyāni māndārapuṣpāṇyabhinirmāya vihāyasā antarīkṣagatā yena bhagavāṃstenābhyavakiranti sma /
analyzed: atha khalu trāyastriṃśat kāyikāḥ deva putrāḥ divyāni māndāra puṣpāṇi abhinirmāya vihāyasā antarīkṣa gatāḥ yena bhagavān tena abhyavakiranti sma
translated: Then indeed the gods of the Thirty-Three created divine coral tree flowers, and while traveling through the sky they scattered them over the Blessed One.

original: yena bhagavāṃstena tāni divyāni māndāravapuṣpāṇyabhiprakiranti sma /
analyzed: yena bhagavān tena tāni divyāni māndārava puṣpāṇi abhiprakiranti sma
translated: They scattered those divine coral tree flowers over the Blessed One.

original: evaṃ codānamudānayanti sma cirasya bateyaṃ prajñāpāramitā jāmbūdvīpakānāṃ manuṣyāṇāmupāvṛtteti /
analyzed: evam ca udānam udānayanti sma cirasya bata iyam prajñāpāramitā jāmbūdvīpakānām manuṣyāṇām upāvṛttā iti
translated: And they exclaimed: At long last, the perfection of wisdom has appeared to the people of Jambudvīpa!

original: punareva ca divyāni māndāravāṇi puṣpāṇi gṛhītvā yena bhagavāṃstenābhyavakiranti sma /
analyzed: punar eva ca divyāni māndāravāṇi puṣpāṇi gṛhītvā yena bhagavān tena abhyavakiranti sma
translated: And again they took divine coral tree flowers and scattered them over the Blessed One.

analyzed: abhiprakiranti sma
translated: and scattered them.

original: evaṃ cāvocan ye kecidbhagavan sattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣiṣyante bhāvayiṣyanti /
analyzed: evam ca avocan ye kecid bhagavan sattvāḥ prajñāpāramitām bhāṣiṣyante bhāvayiṣyanti
translated: And they said, Bhagavan, any beings who will teach the perfection of wisdom, who will meditate on it,

analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām cariṣyanti
translated: and who will practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: na teṣāṃ māro vā mārakāyikā vā devatā avatāraṃ lapsyante /🔽na te bhagavan sattvā avarakeṇa kuśalamūlena Vaidya
analyzed: na teṣām māraḥ vā māra kāyikāḥ vā devatāḥ avatāram lapsyante  na te bhagavan sattvāḥ avarakeṇa kuśala mūlena vaidya
translated: Māra or the gods of Māra's retinue will not find an opportunity to harm them.

analyzed: samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Bhagavan, those beings will not be endowed with an inferior wholesome root.

analyzed: ye imām prajñāpāramitām śroṣyanti
translated: Those who will hear this perfection of wisdom,

original: śrutva codgrahīṣyanti /🔽dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti /
analyzed: śrutvā ca udgrahīṣyanti  dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti
translated: having heard it, will take it up,🔽will bear it in mind, will recite it, will master it, will promote it, will teach it,

original: upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti /🔽pūrvajinakṛtādhikārāste bhagavan sattvā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti  pūrva jina kṛta adhikārāḥ te bhagavan sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: will expound it, will reveal it, will proclaim it, will chant it,🔽and will study it.

analyzed: yeṣām iyam prajñāpāramitā śrotra avabhāsam āgamiṣyati
translated: Bhagavan, those beings who will cause this perfection of wisdom to come into the range of hearing,🔽what to speak of those who will take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, promote it, teach it, expound it,🔽reveal it, proclaim it, chant it,

original: kaḥ punarvādo ye enāmudgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ ye enām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti
translated: and study it.

analyzed: tathatvāya śikṣiṣyante  tathatvāya pratipatsyante
translated: They will train in suchness.🔽They will practice suchness.

analyzed: tathatvāya yogam āpatsyante
translated: They will apply themselves to suchness.

analyzed: tathāgata paryupāsitāḥ te bhagavan sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Blessed One, those beings will have attended to the Tathāgata.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ato hi sarvajñatā gaveṣitavyā yaduta prajñāpāramitātaḥ /
analyzed: atas hi sarvajña tā gaveṣitavyā yat uta prajñāpāramitātaḥ
translated: Because this—namely, the perfection of wisdom—is where omniscience is to be sought.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan yāni kānicidratnāni mahāratnāni /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan yāni kānicid ratnāni mahā ratnāni
translated: Blessed One, it is just as all the precious jewels, all the great precious jewels,

analyzed: sarvāṇi tāni mahā samudra prabhāvitāni
translated: are all produced from the great ocean.

analyzed: sarvāṇi tāni mahā samudrāt gaveṣitavyāni
translated: All of them are to be sought in the great ocean.

original: evameva bhagavan sarvajñatāmahāratnaṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ prajñāpāramitāmahāsamudrādgaveṣitavyam /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavan sarvajña tā mahā ratnam tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām prajñāpāramitā mahā samudrāt gaveṣitavyam
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, the great precious jewel of omniscience of the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones, is to be sought in the great ocean of the perfection of wisdom.

original: evamukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat evametatkauśika / evam etat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: “It is so, Kauśika, it is so.

original: atonirjātaṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ sarvajñatāmahāratnaṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitāmahāsamudrāt //
analyzed: atonirjātam tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām sarvajña tā mahā ratnam yat uta prajñāpāramitā mahā samudrāt
translated: The great precious jewel of omniscience of the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones, is born from this—namely, the great ocean of the perfection of wisdom.”

original: atha khalvāyuṣmānānando bhagavantametadavocat na bhagavan dānapāramitāyā varṇaṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat na bhagavan dāna pāramitāyāḥ varṇam bhāṣate
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, you do not speak the praises of the perfection of giving,

analyzed: na nāmadheyam parikīrtayati
translated: you do not proclaim its name.

analyzed: na śīla pāramitāyāḥ  na kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ
translated: You do not speak the praises of the perfection of morality,🔽the perfection of patience,

analyzed: na vīrya pāramitāyāḥ
translated: the perfection of perseverance,

analyzed: na bhagavan dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ varṇam bhāṣate
translated: Blessed One, you do not speak the praises of the perfection of concentration,

analyzed: na nāmadheyam parikīrtayati
translated: you do not proclaim its name.

original: api tu prajñāpāramitāyā evaikasyā bhagavān varṇaṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: api tu prajñāpāramitāyāḥ eva ekasyāḥ bhagavān varṇam bhāṣate
translated: But Blessed One, you do speak the praises of only the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: nāmadheyam ca parikīrtayati
translated: and you do proclaim its name.

analyzed: bhagavān āha evam etat ānanda evam etat
translated: The Blessed One said: Thus it is, Ānanda, thus it is.

original: prajñāpāramitāyā evāhamānanda varṇaṃ bhāṣe nāmadheyaṃ ca parikīrtayāmi /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyāḥ eva aham ānanda varṇam bhāṣe nāmadheyam ca parikīrtayāmi
translated: Ānanda, I do speak the praises of the perfection of wisdom and proclaim its name,

analyzed: na anyāsām pāramitānām
translated: but not of the other perfections.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: prajñāpāramitā hi ānanda pūrvaṃgamā pañcānāṃ pāramitānām /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā hi ānanda pūrvaṃgamā pañcānām pāramitānām
translated: Ānanda, the perfection of wisdom is the forerunner of the five perfections.

original: tatkiṃ manyase ānanda apariṇāmitaṃ dānaṃ sarvajñatāyāṃ dānapāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhate /
analyzed: tat kim manyase ānanda a pariṇāmitam dānam sarvajña tāyām dāna pāramitā nāmadheyam labhate
translated: What do you think, Ānanda, does the perfection of giving receive the name perfection of giving when it is not dedicated to omniscience?

analyzed: āyuṣmān ānandaḥ āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: The venerable Ānanda said: No indeed, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāha tatkiṃ manyase ānanda apariṇāmitaṃ śīlamapariṇāmitā kṣāntirapariṇāmitaṃ vīryamapariṇāmitaṃ dhyānam /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat kim manyase ānanda apariṇāmitam śīlam apariṇāmitā kṣāntiḥ apariṇāmitam vīryam apariṇāmitam dhyānam
translated: The Blessed One said, What do you think, Ānanda, is morality, patience, vigor, and concentration not transformed?

original: tatkiṃ manyase ānanda apariṇāmitā prajñā sarvajñatāyāṃ prajñāpāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhate /
analyzed: tat kim manyase ānanda a pariṇāmitā prajñā sarvajña tāyām prajñāpāramitā nāmadheyam labhate
translated: What do you think, Ānanda, is wisdom not transformed, does it receive the name 'perfection of wisdom' in relation to omniscience?

analyzed: ānandaḥ āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: Ānanda said, No, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāha tatkiṃ manyase tvamānanda acintyā sā prajñā yā kuśalamūlāni sarvajñatāpariṇāmena pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat kim manyase tvam ānanda acintyā sā prajñā yā kuśala mūlāni sarvajña tā pariṇāmena pariṇāmayati
translated: The Blessed One said, What do you think, Ānanda, is that wisdom, which transforms wholesome roots by dedicating them to omniscience, inconceivable?

analyzed: ānandaḥ āha evam etat bhagavan
translated: Ānanda said, So it is, Blessed One.

analyzed: evam etat sugata
translated: So it is, Well-Gone One.

analyzed: acintyā sā bhagavan prajñā
translated: Blessed One, that wisdom is inconceivable.

analyzed: paramā acintyā sā bhagavan prajñā
translated: Blessed One, that wisdom is supremely inconceivable.

original: yā kuśalamūlāni sarvajñatāpariṇāmena pariṇāmayati bhagavānāha tasmāttarhi ānanda paramatvātsā prajñā pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhate /
analyzed: yā kuśala mūlāni sarvajña tā pariṇāmena pariṇāmayati bhagavān āha tasmāt tarhi ānanda parama tvāt sā prajñā pāramitā nāmadheyam labhate
translated: Blessed One, it transforms wholesome roots by dedicating them to omniscience. The Blessed One said, Therefore, Ānanda, because of its supremacy, that wisdom receives the name 'perfection.'

original: yayā sarvajñatāyāṃ pariṇāmitāni kuśalamūlāni pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhante /
analyzed: yayā sarvajña tāyām pariṇāmitāni kuśala mūlāni pāramitā nāmadheyam labhante
translated: By which wholesome roots dedicated to omniscience receive the name 'perfections.'

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda sarvajñatāpariṇāmitakuśalamūlatvātprajñāpāramitā pañcānāṃ pāramitānāṃ pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā pariṇāyikā /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda sarvajña tā pariṇāmita kuśala mūla tvāt prajñāpāramitā pañcānām pāramitānām pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā pariṇāyikā
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, because the wholesome roots are dedicated to omniscience, the perfection of wisdom is the forerunner, the leader, and the guide of the five perfections.

original: anena yogena antargatāḥ pañca pāramitāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāmeva ānanda ṣaṭpāramitāparipūrṇādhivacanametadyaduta prajñāpāramiteti /
analyzed: anena yogena antargatāḥ pañca pāramitāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām eva ānanda ṣaṣ pāramitā paripūrṇa adhivacanam etat yat uta prajñāpāramitā iti
translated: By this yoga, the five perfections are included in the perfection of wisdom itself. Ānanda, this is a designation for the perfection of wisdom, namely, the fulfillment of the six perfections.

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda prajñāpāramitāyāṃ parikīrtitāyāṃ sarvāḥ ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ parikīrtitā bhavanti /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda prajñāpāramitāyām parikīrtitāyām sarvāḥ ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ parikīrtitāḥ bhavanti
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, when the perfection of wisdom is proclaimed, all six perfections are proclaimed.

original: tadyathāpi nāma ānanda mahāpṛthivyāṃ bījāni prakīrṇāni sāmagrīṃ labhamānāni virohanti /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma ānanda mahā pṛthivyām bījāni prakīrṇāni sāmagrīm labhamānāni virohanti
translated: Just as, Ānanda, seeds scattered on the great earth grow when they obtain the necessary conditions,

analyzed: mahā pṛthivī ca teṣām bījānām pratiṣṭhā
translated: and the great earth is the support for those seeds,

original: Vaidya mahāpṛthivīpratiṣṭhitāni ca tāni bījāni virohanti /
analyzed: vaidya mahā pṛthivī pratiṣṭhitāni ca tāni bījāni virohanti
translated: and those seeds, Ānanda, grow supported by the great earth,

original: evameva ānanda prajñāpāramitāsaṃgṛhītāḥ pañca pāramitāḥ sarvajñatāyāṃ pratiṣṭhante /
analyzed: evam eva ānanda prajñāpāramitā saṃgṛhītāḥ pañca pāramitāḥ sarvajña tāyām pratiṣṭhante
translated: in the same way, Ānanda, the five perfections included in the perfection of wisdom are established in omniscience.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā pratiṣṭhitāḥ pañca pāramitāḥ virohanti
translated: The five perfections, established in the perfection of wisdom, grow.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā parigṛhīta tvāt ca pāramitā nāmadheyam labhante
translated: And because they are embraced by the perfection of wisdom, they obtain the name of perfections.

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda prajñāpāramitaiva pañcānāṃ pāramitānāṃ pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā pariṇāyakā //
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda prajñāpāramitā eva pañcānām pāramitānām pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā pariṇāyakā
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, the perfection of wisdom alone is the forerunner, the leader, and the guide of the five perfections.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat na tāvadime bhagavaṃstathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena prajñāpāramitāyāḥ sarve guṇāḥ
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat na tāvat ime bhagavan tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena prajñāpāramitāyāḥ sarve guṇāḥ
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Awakened One has not yet

original: yān guṇān sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā parigṛhṇīte prajñāpāramitāmudgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya pravartya deśayitvā upadiśya uddiśya
analyzed: yān guṇān sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā parigṛhṇīte prajñāpāramitām udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya pravartya deśayitvā upadiśya uddiśya
translated: taught all the qualities of the perfection of wisdom that a son of good family or a daughter of good family who has taken up, borne in mind, recited, understood, spread, taught, explained, uttered,

analyzed: svādhyāyya
translated: and mastered the perfection of wisdom would obtain.

original: atha hi mayā yo bhagavato 'ntikādasyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pradeśa udgṛhītaḥ /
analyzed: atha hi mayā yaḥ bhagavataḥ ntikāt asyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pradeśaḥ udgṛhītaḥ
translated: Then I have taught a portion of this perfection of wisdom in the presence of the Blessed One.

analyzed: sa pravartitaḥ
translated: That has been spread.

analyzed: bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu kauśika
translated: The Blessed One said, Good, good, Kauśika!

original: na khalu punaḥ kauśika kevalaṃ yaḥ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyatyupadekṣyatyuddekṣyati🔽tasyaiva kevalamamī guṇā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: na khalu punar kauśika kevalam yaḥ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati  tasya eva kevalam amī guṇāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Kausika, it is not only that one who will take up, bear in mind, recite, understand, expound, teach, explain, expound, and master the perfection of wisdom will have just these qualities.

original: yo 'pi kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhitvā pustakagatāṃ kṛtvā dhārayiṣyati sthāpayiṣyati saddharmacirasthitihetoḥ
analyzed: yaḥ pi kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām likhitvā pustaka gatām kṛtvā dhārayiṣyati sthāpayiṣyati saddharma cira sthiti hetoḥ
translated: Kausika, any son or daughter of good family who, having written out this perfection of wisdom, made it into a book, and bore it in mind, would establish it, for the sake of the long endurance of the true Dharma,

analyzed: mā buddha netrī samucchedaḥ bhūt
translated: May the lineage of the Buddhas not be cut off.

analyzed: mā saddharma antardhānam
translated: May the true Dharma not disappear.

original: bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ cānugrahopasaṃhāraḥ kṛto bhaviṣyati netryavaikalyeneti /🔽tāṃ caināṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ satkariṣyati gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati pūjayiṣyati arcayiṣyati
analyzed: bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām ca anugraha upasaṃhāraḥ kṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati netrī a vaikalyena iti  tām ca enām prajñāpāramitām satkariṣyati gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati pūjayiṣyati arcayiṣyati
translated: A favor will have been done to the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, by not being deficient in the eye.

analyzed: apacāyiṣyati puṣpaiḥ dhūpaiḥ gandhaiḥ mālyaiḥ vilepanaiḥ cūrṇaiḥ vastraiḥ chatraiḥ dhvajaiḥ ghaṇṭābhiḥ patākābhiḥ
translated: And he will honor that perfection of wisdom, revere, respect, worship, adore it with flowers, incense, scents, garlands, ointments, aromatic powders, cloths, umbrellas, flags, little bells, banners,

analyzed: samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: and all around with garlands of lamps.🔽And he will make a vow to attain supreme enlightenment.

analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ pūjayiṣyati
translated: and with many kinds of worship, he will worship it.

original: tasyāpyahaṃ kauśika kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā enān dṛṣṭadhārmikān guṇān vadāmi //
analyzed: tasya api aham kauśika kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā enān dṛṣṭa dhārmikān guṇān vadāmi
translated: I also, Kauśika, declare these visible qualities for that son of good family or daughter of good family.

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat aham api bhagavaṃstasyāpi kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ saṃvidhāsyāmi /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat aham api bhagavan tasya api kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim saṃvidhāsyāmi
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, I too will provide protection, defense, and security for that son of good family or daughter of good family.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhitvā pustakagatāṃ kṛtvā dhārayiṣyati sthāpayiṣyati saddharmacirasthitihetoḥ mā buddhanetrīsamucchedo bhūt /
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām likhitvā pustaka gatām kṛtvā dhārayiṣyati sthāpayiṣyati saddharma cira sthiti hetoḥ mā buddha netrī samucchedaḥ bhūt
translated: He who, having written this perfection of wisdom, made it into a book, and upholds it, establishes it, for the sake of the long duration of the true Dharma, so that the Buddha-eye may not be interrupted,

analyzed: mā saddharma antardhānam
translated: so that the true Dharma may not disappear,

original: bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ cānugrahopasaṃhāraḥ kṛto bhaviṣyati netryavaikalyeneti /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām ca anugraha upasaṃhāraḥ kṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati netrī a vaikalyena iti
translated: and so that there may be assistance and support for the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, without deficiency in the eye.

original: tāṃ caināṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ satkariṣyati gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati pūjayiṣyati arcayiṣyati
analyzed: tām ca enām prajñāpāramitām satkariṣyati gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati pūjayiṣyati arcayiṣyati
translated: And he will honor that perfection of wisdom, revere it, respect it, make offerings to it, worship it,

analyzed: apacāyiṣyati puṣpaiḥ dhūpaiḥ gandhaiḥ mālyaiḥ vilepanaiḥ cūrṇaiḥ vastraiḥ chatraiḥ dhvajaiḥ ghaṇṭābhiḥ patākābhiḥ
translated: will honor it with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners,

analyzed: samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: and all around with garlands of lamps.

analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ pūjayiṣyati
translated: and with many kinds of worship.

original: kaḥ punarvādo yaḥ enāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhiṣyati udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ yaḥ enām prajñāpāramitām likhiṣyati udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati
translated: What need is there to speak of someone who writes out this perfection of wisdom, takes it up, bears it in mind, reads it aloud,

analyzed: paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati satkariṣyati
translated: masters it, teaches it, explains it, expounds it, recites it, and honors it,

analyzed: gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati pūjayiṣyati arcayiṣyati apacāyiṣyati puṣpaiḥ dhūpaiḥ gandhaiḥ mālyaiḥ vilepanaiḥ cūrṇaiḥ vastraiḥ chatraiḥ dhvajaiḥ ghaṇṭābhiḥ
translated: and with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners,

analyzed: samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: and all around with garlands of lamps,

analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ pūjayiṣyati
translated: and with many kinds of worship, worships it?

analyzed: bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu kauśika
translated: The Blessed One said, Excellent, excellent, Kauśika!

original: tasya khalu punaḥ kauśika kulaputrasya kuladuhiturvā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ svādhyāyato bahūni devaputraśatānyupasaṃkramiṣyanti /🔽bahūni devaputrasahasrāṇi Vaidya
analyzed: tasya khalu punar kauśika kula putrasya kula duhituḥ vā imām prajñāpāramitām su ādhyāyataḥ bahūni deva putra śatāni upasaṃkramiṣyanti  bahūni devaputra sahasrāṇi vaidya
translated: Kauśika, many hundreds of gods will approach that son of a good family or daughter of a good family who is reciting this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: bahūni deva putra śata sahasrāṇi dharma śravaṇāya upasaṃkramiṣyanti
translated: Many thousands of gods, many hundreds of thousands of gods will approach to listen to the Dharma.

original: te ca devaputrā dharmaṃ śṛṇvantastasya dharmabhāṇakasya pratibhānamupasaṃhartavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: te ca devaputrāḥ dharmam śṛṇvantaḥ tasya dharma bhāṇakasya pratibhānam upasaṃhartavyam maṃsyante
translated: And those gods, listening to the Dharma, will think that they should provide inspiration to that Dharma teacher.

original: yadāpi sa dharmabhāṇako na jalpitukāmo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yadā api sa dharma bhāṇakaḥ na jalpitu kāmaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Even when that Dharma teacher does not want to speak,

original: tadāpi tasya te devaputrāstenaiva dharmagauraveṇa pratibhānamupasaṃhartavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: tadā api tasya te deva putrāḥ tena eva dharma gauraveṇa pratibhānam upasaṃhartavyam maṃsyante
translated: then too those gods, out of respect for the Dharma, will think that they should provide inspiration.

original: yathā tasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā bhāṣitumeva chando bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yathā tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā bhāṣitum eva chandaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: So that the son of a good family or daughter of a good family will have the desire to speak.

original: imam api sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikaṃ guṇaṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: imam api sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikam guṇam parigṛhṇāti
translated: Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family obtains this visible good quality.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyatyupadekṣyatyuddekṣyati svādhyāsyati //
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: Whoever will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, spread it, teach it, explain it, chant it, and repeat it,

original: punaraparaṃ kauśika tasya kulaputrasya kuladuhiturvā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣamāṇasya
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika tasya kula putrasya kula duhituḥ vā imām prajñāpāramitām bhāṣamāṇasya
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, for that son of a good family or daughter of a good family who is speaking this perfection of wisdom,

original: catasṝṇāṃ parṣadāmagrato nāvalīnacittatā bhaviṣyati mā khalu māṃ kaścitparyanuyuñjīta
analyzed: catasṝṇām parṣadām agratas na avalīna citta tā bhaviṣyati mā khalu mām kaścid paryanuyuñjīta
translated: in the presence of the four assemblies there will be no timidity, lest someone should question me

analyzed: upālambha abhiprāyaḥ iti
translated: with the intention of finding fault.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi tasya prajñāpāramitā rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ karoti /🔽sa upālambhān api prajñāpāramitāvihārī na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi tasya prajñāpāramitā rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim karoti  saḥ upālambhān api prajñāpāramitā vihārī na samanupaśyati
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom provides protection, defense, and guard for him.🔽He who dwells in the perfection of wisdom does not see any fault.

analyzed: upālambha karān api prajñāpāramitā vihārī na samanupaśyati
translated: He who dwells in the perfection of wisdom does not see anyone who causes fault.

analyzed: yaḥ pi upālabhyeta tam api na samanupaśyati
translated: He also does not see anyone who is being faulted.

analyzed: tām api prajñāpāramitām na samanupaśyati
translated: He also does not see that perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ prajñāpāramitāparigṛhītasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā anena paryāyeṇa na kaścitparyanuyogo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitā parigṛhītasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā anena paryāyeṇa na kaścid paryanuyogaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In the same way, for a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who is embraced by the perfection of wisdom, there will be no objection by this method.

analyzed: sa ca na utrasiṣyati  na saṃtrasiṣyati
translated: And he will not be frightened.🔽He will not be terrified.

analyzed: na saṃtrāsam āpatsyate
translated: He will not fall into terror.

original: imān api sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikān guṇān parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: imān api sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikān guṇān parigṛhṇāti
translated: Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family also obtains these visible qualities,

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyatyupadekṣyatyuddekṣyati svādhyāsyati //
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, understand it, proclaim it, teach it, explain it, chant it, and meditate on it with love.

original: punaraparaṃ kauśika sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā priyo bhaviṣyati mātāpitṝṇāṃ mitrāmātyajñātisālohitaśramaṇabrāhmaṇānāṃ hitānāṃ ca /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā priyaḥ bhaviṣyati mātā pitṝṇām mitra amātya jñāti sālohita śramaṇa brāhmaṇānām hitānām ca
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family will be dear to their parents, friends, ministers, relatives, kinsmen, ascetics, and brahmins, and to those who are well-disposed.

analyzed: pratibalaḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: And he will be able.

original: śaktaś ca bhaviṣyati utpannotpannānāṃ parapravādināṃ sahadharmeṇa nigrahāya /
analyzed: śaktaḥ ca bhaviṣyati utpanna utpannānām parapravādinām sahadharmeṇa nigrahāya
translated: And he will be able to restrain with the Dharma those who are opponents and raise objections, as they arise.

analyzed: paraiḥ ca pratyanuyujyamānaḥ pratyanuyoga vyākaraṇa samarthaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And when questioned by others, he will be able to answer their questions.

original: imān api sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikān guṇān parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: imān api sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikān guṇān parigṛhṇāti
translated: Kauśika, that son of good family or daughter of good family will also obtain these visible good qualities.

original: yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyatyupadekṣyatyuddekṣyati
analyzed: yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati
translated: That son of good family or daughter of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, go forth to it, teach it, explain it, expound it,

analyzed: su ādhyāsyati
translated: recite it to himself, and thoroughly master it.

original: yatra khalu punaḥ kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhitvā pustakagatāṃ kṛtvā pūjāpūrvaṃgamaṃ sthāpayiṣyati pūjayiṣyati /
analyzed: yatra khalu punar kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām likhitvā pustaka gatām kṛtvā pūjā pūrvaṃgamam sthāpayiṣyati pūjayiṣyati
translated: Where, Kauśika, a son of good family or daughter of good family, having written out this perfection of wisdom in book form, will install it, and will honor it with worship.

original: tatra kauśika ye keciccāturmahārājakāyikeṣu deveṣu devaputrā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: tatra kauśika ye kecid cāturmahārājakāyikeṣu deveṣu deva putrāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: There, Kauśika, whatever gods there are in the realm of the Four Great Kings who have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

analyzed: te pi tatra āgantavyam maṃsyante
translated: they will think to come there.

original: te 'pi tatrāgatya enāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ pustakagatāṃ prekṣiṣyante vandiṣyante namaskariṣyantyudgrahīṣyanti
analyzed: te pi tatra āgatya enām prajñāpāramitām pustaka gatām prekṣiṣyante vandiṣyante namaskariṣyanti udgrahīṣyanti
translated: They too, having come there, will behold this perfection of wisdom written in book-form, will worship it, revere it, honor it, make offerings to it,

original: dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti /
analyzed: dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti
translated: will take it up, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, teach it, explain it, expound it, recite it from memory,

original: prekṣya vanditvā namaskṛtya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryāvāpya pravartya deśayitvopadiśyoddiśya Vaidya
analyzed: prekṣya vanditvā namaskṛtya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryāvāpya pravartya deśayitvā upadiśya uddiśya vaidya
translated: having beheld it, having worshipped it, having revered it, having honored it, having made offerings to it, having taken it up, having borne it in mind, having read it aloud, having mastered it, having taught it, having explained it, having expounded it, having recited it from memory,

analyzed: su ādhyāyya punar eva prakramitavyam maṃsyante
translated: they will again think of setting out.

original: evaṃ ye kecitkauśika trāyastriṃśeṣu deveṣu devaputrā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: evam ye kecid kauśika trāyastriṃśeṣu deveṣu deva putrāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: Thus, Kausika, those sons of gods who in the Thirty-Three gods have set out for full enlightenment,

analyzed: te pi tatra āgantavyam maṃsyante
