translated: they will bear it in mind, they will recite it, they will study it, they will promulgate it, they will teach it, they will expound it, they will proclaim it, they will repeat it.

original: prekṣya vanditvā namaskṛtyodgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya pravartya deśayitvopadiśyoddiśya svādhyāyya punareva prakramitavyaṃ maṃsyante
analyzed: prekṣya vanditvā namaskṛtya udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya pravartya deśayitvā upadiśya uddiśya su ādhyāyya punar eva prakramitavyam maṃsyante
translated: Having beheld it, worshipped it, revered it, taken it up, borne it in mind, recited it, studied it, promulgated it, taught it, expounded it, proclaimed it, repeated it, they will think to depart again.

original: tasya khalu punaḥ kauśika kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā gṛhaṃ vā layanaṃ vā prāsādo vā surakṣito bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar kauśika kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā gṛham vā layanam vā prāsādaḥ vā su rakṣitaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the house, dwelling, or palace of that son or daughter of good family will be well-protected.

original: na ca tasya kaścidviheṭhako bhaviṣyati sthāpayitvā pūrvakarmavipākena /
analyzed: na ca tasya kaścid viheṭhakaḥ bhaviṣyati sthāpayitvā pūrva karma vipākena
translated: And no one will harm him, except as a result of past actions.”

original: imam api sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikaṃ guṇaṃ parigrahīṣyati
analyzed: imam api sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikam guṇam parigrahīṣyati
translated: “Kauśika, this son of a good family or daughter of a good family will also obtain this visible good quality:

original: yatra hi nāma evaṃ mahaujaskā devā nāgā yakṣā gandharvā asurā garuḍāḥ kinnarā mahoragā
analyzed: yatra hi nāma evam mahā ojaskāḥ devāḥ nāgāḥ yakṣāḥ gandharvāḥ asurāḥ garuḍāḥ kinnarāḥ mahoragāḥ
translated: For in this way, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas,

analyzed: manuṣyāḥ amanuṣyāḥ vai āgantavyam maṃsyante
translated: humans, and non-humans who have great power will think to come.”

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat kathaṃ punarbhagavan sa kulaputro
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat katham punar bhagavan sa kula putraḥ
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One, “Blessed One, how will that son of a good family

original: vā kuladuhitā vā evaṃ jānīyāt iha devā vā nāgā vā yakṣā vā gandharvā vā asurā vā
analyzed: vā kula duhitā vā evam jānīyāt iha devāḥ vā nāgāḥ vā yakṣāḥ vā gandharvāḥ vā asurāḥ vā
translated: or daughter of a good family know that gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras,

original: garuḍā vā kinnarā vā mahoragā va manuṣyā vā amanuṣyā vā āgacchanti imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ🔽śrotuṃ draṣṭuṃ vandituṃ namaskartumudgrahītuṃ dhārayituṃ vācayituṃ paryavāptuṃ pravartayituṃ
analyzed: garuḍāḥ vā kinnarāḥ vā mahoragāḥ vā manuṣyāḥ vā amanuṣyāḥ vā āgacchanti imām prajñāpāramitām  śrotum draṣṭum vanditum namaskartum udgrahītum dhārayitum vācayitum paryavāptum pravartayitum
translated: garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, or non-humans have come here to listen to,🔽see, pay homage to, bow down to, take up, uphold, recite, master, teach,

analyzed: deśayitum upadeṣṭum uddeṣṭum su ādhyātum iti
translated: explain, expound, recite to oneself, or meditate on this perfection of wisdom?”

original: evamukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat sacetkauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatra udāramavabhāsaṃ saṃjānīte /🔽niṣṭhā tena kulaputreṇa vā Vaidya
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat saced kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatra udāram avabhāsam saṃjānīte  niṣṭhā tena kula putreṇa vā vaidya
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: If, Kauśika, a son of good family or a daughter of good family perceives a great light there,

original: kuladuhitrā vā tatra gantavyā iha devo vā nāgo vā yakṣo vā gandharvo vā asuro vā garuḍo vā kinnaro vā mahorago vā manuṣyo vā amanuṣyo vā
analyzed: kula duhitrā vā tatra gantavyā iha devaḥ vā nāgaḥ vā yakṣaḥ vā gandharvaḥ vā asuraḥ vā garuḍaḥ vā kinnaraḥ vā mahoragaḥ vā manuṣyaḥ vā amanuṣyaḥ vā
translated: that son of good family or daughter of good family should go there, thinking: 'This is certainly a god or nāga or yakṣa or gandharva or asura or garuḍa or kinnara or mahoraga or human or non-human

analyzed: upasaṃkrāntaḥ iti
translated: who has approached.'

original: punaraparaṃ sacetkauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatra amānuṣaṃ gandhaṃ ghrāsyatyanāghrātapūrvam /🔽ghrātvā ca tadgandhaṃ niṣṭhā tena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā tatra gantavyā
analyzed: punar aparam saced kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatra amānuṣam gandham ghrāsyati an āghrāta pūrvam  ghrātvā ca tad gandham niṣṭhā tena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā tatra gantavyā
translated: Moreover, if, Kauśika, a son of good family or a daughter of good family smells there a non-human fragrance that has never been smelled before,

original: iha devo vā nāgo vā yakṣo vā gandharvo vā asuro vā garuḍo vā kinnaro vā mahorago
analyzed: iha devaḥ vā nāgaḥ vā yakṣaḥ vā gandharvaḥ vā asuraḥ vā garuḍaḥ vā kinnaraḥ vā mahā uragaḥ
translated: and having smelled that fragrance, that son of good family or daughter of good family should go there, thinking: 'This is certainly a god or nāga or yakṣa or gandharva or asura or garuḍa or kinnara or mahoraga

original: vā manuṣyo vā amanuṣyo vā āgata iti /
analyzed: vā manuṣyaḥ vai amanuṣyaḥ vai āgataḥ iti
translated: or human or non-human who has come.'

analyzed: upasaṃkrāntaḥ iti
translated: that it has approached.

original: punaraparaṃ sacetkauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatra amānuṣaṃ gandhaṃ ghrāsyati anāghrātapūrvam /
analyzed: punar aparam saced kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatra amānuṣam gandham ghrāsyati an āghrāta pūrvam
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, if a son of good family or daughter of good family there smells a non-human fragrance, never smelled before,

original: ghrātvā ca tadgandhaṃ niṣṭhā tena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā tatra gantavyāḥ /
analyzed: ghrātvā ca tad gandham niṣṭhā tena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā tatra gantavyāḥ
translated: and having smelled that fragrance, that son of good family or daughter of good family should conclude and go there,

original: iha devo vā nāgo vā yakṣo vā gandharvo vā asuro vā garuḍo va kinnaro vā mahorago vā manuṣyo vāamanuṣyo vāāgata iti /
analyzed: iha devaḥ vā nāgaḥ vā yakṣaḥ vā gandharvaḥ vā asuraḥ vā garuḍaḥ vā kinnaraḥ vā mahoragaḥ vā manuṣyaḥ vā amanuṣyaḥ vā āgataḥ iti
translated: thinking: 'A god or nāga or yakṣa or gandharva or asura or garuḍa or kinnara or mahoraga or human or non-human has come here.'

analyzed: upasaṃkrāntaḥ iti
translated: [They should think:] 'They have approached.'

original: punaraparaṃ sacetkauśika kulaputro va kuladuhitā vā caukṣasamudācāro bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: punar aparam saced kauśika kula putraḥ kula duhitā vā caukṣa samudācāraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, if a son of good family or daughter of good family has pure conduct,

analyzed: śuci samudācāraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: has pure behavior,

original: tasya tayā caukṣasamudācāratayā śucisamudācāratayā te devā nāgā yakṣā gandharvā asurā garuḍāḥ kinnarā mahoragā manuṣyā amanuṣyā vā āgantavyaṃ
analyzed: tasya tayā caukṣa samudācāra tayā śucisamudācāratayā te devāḥ nāgāḥ yakṣāḥ gandharvāḥ asurāḥ garuḍāḥ kinnarāḥ mahoragāḥ manuṣyāḥ amanuṣyāḥ vā āgantavyam
translated: those gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans will think that they should come

analyzed: maṃsyante
translated: to that son of good family or daughter of good family.

original: ye ca tatra devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragā manuṣyā amanuṣyā vā āgatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ye ca tatra deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoragāḥ manuṣyāḥ amanuṣyāḥ vā āgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And those gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans who have come there,

original: te tasya tayā caukṣasamudācāratayā śucisamudācāratayā āttamanaskāḥ pramuditāḥ prītisaumanasyajātā bhaviṣyanti /🔽yāś ca tatra alpaujaskā alpaujaskā devatā adhyuṣitā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: te tasya tayā caukṣa samudācāra tayā śucisamudācāratayā ātta manaskāḥ pramuditāḥ prīti saumanasya jātāḥ bhaviṣyanti  yāḥ ca tatra alpa ojaskāḥ alpa ojaskāḥ devatāḥ adhyuṣitāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They, with their pure conduct, their pure practice, will be uplifted, delighted, joyful, and happy.

analyzed: tāḥ tatas upakramitavyam maṃsyante
translated: And the gods there who have little power and little influence will think to move away from there.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: teṣāmeva hi mahaujaskānāṃ mahaujaskānāṃ devānāṃ nāgāna yakṣāṇāṃ gandharvāṇāmasurāṇāṃ
analyzed: teṣām eva hi mahā ojaskānām mahā ojaskānām devānām nāgān yakṣāṇām gandharvāṇām asurāṇām
translated: Because those gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras,

original: garuḍānāṃ kinnarāṇāṃ mahoragāṇāṃ manuṣyāṇāṃ mamanuṣyāṇāṃ vā śriyaṃ ca tejaś ca gauravaṃ🔽ca asahamānā eva tā alpaujaskā alpaujaskā devatā tato 'pakramitavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: garuḍānām kinnarāṇām mahoragāṇām manuṣyāṇām ma manuṣyāṇām vā śriyam ca tejaḥ ca gauravam  ca a sahamānāḥ eva tāḥ alpa ojaskāḥ alpa ojaskāḥ devatā upakramitavyam maṃsyante
translated: garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans who have great power and great influence will not be able to bear the glory, splendor, and majesty🔽of those gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans who have great power and great influence. Those gods who have little power and little influence will think to move away from there.

original: yathā yathā khalu punaḥ kauśika te mahaujaskā mahaujaskā devā nāgā yakṣā gandharvā asurā garuḍāḥ kinnarā mahoragā manuṣyā amanuṣyā vā abhīkṣṇamupasaṃkramitavyaṃ
analyzed: yathā yathā khalu punar kauśika te mahā ojaskāḥ mahā ojaskāḥ devāḥ nāgāḥ yakṣāḥ gandharvāḥ asurāḥ garuḍāḥ kinnarāḥ mahoragāḥ manuṣyāḥ amanuṣyāḥ vā abhīkṣṇam upasaṃkramitavyam
translated: As those gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans who have great power and great influence will frequently come to visit,

original: tathā tathā sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā prasādabahulo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā tathā sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā prasāda bahulaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In that way, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family will have a lot of faith.

original: imam api sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikaṃ guṇaṃ parigrahīṣyati /
analyzed: imam api sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikam guṇam parigrahīṣyati
translated: Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family will also acquire this visible good quality.

original: tena khalu punaḥ kauśika kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā tasya dharmanetrīsthānasya parisāmantake 'śuciracaukṣasamudācāro na pracārayitavyaḥ
analyzed: tena khalu punar kauśika kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā tasya dharma netrī sthānasya parisāmantake śuciḥ acaukṣa samudācāraḥ na pracārayitavyaḥ  /
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family should not engage in impure or unclean conduct in the vicinity of that place where the Dharma method is being taught,

analyzed: tasyām guru gaurava tā paripūrim upādāya
translated: in order to fulfill the utmost respect for it.

original: punaraparaṃ kauśika tasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā na kāyaklamatho na cittaklamatha utpatsyate /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā na kāya klamathaḥ na citta klamathaḥ utpatsyate
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family will not experience fatigue of the body or fatigue of the mind.

analyzed: sa sukham eva śayyām kalpayiṣyati
translated: He or she will arrange a bed comfortably.

analyzed: sukham ca prakramiṣyati
translated: He or she will set out comfortably.

original: suptaś ca san na pāpakān svapnān drakṣati /
analyzed: suptaḥ ca san na pāpakān svapnān drakṣati
translated: While sleeping, he or she will not see bad dreams.

analyzed: paśyan ca punar tathāgatān eva arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān drakṣyati
translated: And seeing, he or she will see only Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones.

analyzed: stūpān eva drakṣyati
translated: He or she will see only stūpas.

analyzed: bodhisattvān eva drakṣyati
translated: He or she will see only bodhisattvas.

analyzed: tathāgata śrāvakān eva drakṣyati
translated: He or she will see only the Tathāgata's śrāvakas.

original: śabdāṃś ca śṛṇvan pāramitāśabdāneva śroṣyati /🔽bodhipakṣāneva dharmān drakṣyati /
analyzed: śabdān ca śṛṇvan pāramitā śabdān eva śroṣyati  bodhi pakṣān eva dharmān drakṣyati
translated: And hearing sounds, he will only hear the sounds of the perfections.🔽He will only see the factors of enlightenment.

analyzed: bodhivṛkṣān eva drakṣyati  teṣu ca tathāgatān eva arhataḥ vaidya
translated: He will only see the Bodhi trees.

analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhān abhisaṃbudhyamānān drakṣyati
translated: And in them, he will only see the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones, attaining enlightenment.

analyzed: tathā abhisaṃbuddhānām ca dharma cakra pravartanam drakṣyati
translated: And he will see the setting in motion of the wheel of the Dharma by those who have attained enlightenment.

original: bahūṃś ca bodhisattvāneva drakṣyati imāmeva prajñāpāramitāṃ saṃgāyamānān prajñāpāramitāsaṃgītiratān evaṃ sarvajñatā parigrahītavyā /
analyzed: bahūn ca bodhisattvān eva drakṣyati imām eva prajñāpāramitām saṃgāyamānān prajñāpāramitā saṃgīti ratān evam sarvajña tā parigrahītavyā
translated: And he will see many Bodhisattvas only singing this very perfection of wisdom, delighting in the singing of the perfection of wisdom, thus should all-knowledge be taken up,

analyzed: evam buddhakṣetram viśodhayitavyam
translated: thus should the Buddha-field be purified.

original: ityupāyakauśalaṃ ca upadiśataḥ /🔽udāraṃ ca buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmabhisaṃbodhiśabdaṃ śroṣyati amuṣyāṃ diśi amuṣmin
analyzed: iti upāya kauśalam ca upadiśataḥ  udāram ca buddhānām bhagavatām abhisaṃbodhi śabdam śroṣyati amuṣyām diśi amuṣmin
translated: Thus he will be taught skillful means.

original: digbhāge amuṣmin lokadhātau amuko 'sau nāmnā tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho bahubhirbodhisattvaśrāvakāṇāṃ
analyzed: digbhāge amuṣmin lokadhātau amukaḥ sau nāmnā tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ bahubhiḥ bodhisattva śrāvakāṇām
translated: And he will hear the great sound of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, attaining supreme enlightenment: 'In such and such a direction, in such and such a region, in such and such a world system, that one named so-and-so, that Tathagata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, together with many Bodhisattvas and Disciples,

analyzed: śataiḥ bahubhiḥ bodhisattva śrāvaka sahasraiḥ bahubhiḥ bodhisattva śrāvaka śata sahasraiḥ  bahubhiḥ bodhisattva śrāvaka koṭībhiḥ bahubhiḥ bodhisattva śrāvaka koṭī śataiḥ bahubhiḥ bodhisattva śrāvaka koṭī sahasraiḥ
translated: with many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas and śrāvakas, with many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas and śrāvakas,🔽with many tens of millions of bodhisattvas and śrāvakas, with many hundreds of tens of millions of bodhisattvas and śrāvakas, with many thousands of tens of millions of bodhisattvas and śrāvakas,

analyzed: bahubhiḥ bodhisattva śrāvaka koṭī śata sahasraiḥ bahubhiḥ bodhisattva śrāvaka koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ
translated: with many hundreds of thousands of tens of millions of bodhisattvas and śrāvakas, with many quintillions of bodhisattvas and śrāvakas,

analyzed: parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ dharmam deśayati iti
translated: surrounded and revered, teaching the Dharma.

original: yaś ca khalu punaḥ kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imānevaṃrūpān svapnān drakṣyati /🔽sa sukhameva svapsyati /
analyzed: yaḥ ca khalu punar kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imān evaṃrūpān svapnān drakṣyati  sa sukham eva svapsyati
translated: And, Kauśika, that son or daughter of good family who will see such dreams as these,🔽will sleep happily,

analyzed: sukham ca pratibhotsyate
translated: and will wake up happily.

original: ojaḥprakṣiptaṃ ca kāyaṃ sukhaṃ ca pratisaṃvedayiṣyati /
analyzed: ojaḥ prakṣiptam ca kāyam sukham ca pratisaṃvedayiṣyati
translated: And he will experience his body as filled with energy and blissful.

analyzed: laghu ladhu eva ca pratisaṃvedayiṣyati
translated: And he will experience it as light, very light.

analyzed: na ca asya adhimātrayā āhāra gṛddhyā citta saṃtatiḥ utpatsyate
translated: And his mind-stream will not arise with excessive greed for food.

analyzed: mṛdukā ca asya āhāra saṃjñā bhavati
translated: And he will have a mild perception of food.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kauśika bhikṣoryogācārasya samādhervyutthitasya manasikārapariṣyanditena cittena na balavatyāhāre gṛddhirbhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika bhikṣoḥ yoga ācārasya samādheḥ vyutthitasya manasikāra pariṣyanditena cittena na balavatī āhāre gṛddhiḥ bhavati
translated: Just as, Kauśika, for a monk who is a yogācāra, when he has arisen from meditative concentration, with a mind moistened by mental attention, there is no strong attachment to food,

analyzed: mṛdukā ca asya āhāra saṃjñā bhavati
translated: and he has a mild perception of food.

original: evameva kauśika tasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā na balavatyāhāre gṛddhirbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā na balavatī āhāre gṛddhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, for that son of a good family or daughter of a good family, there will be no strong attachment to food.

analyzed: mṛdukā ca asya āhāra saṃjñā bhaviṣyati
translated: And he will have a mild perception of food.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: evaṃ hyetatkauśika bhavati yathāpi nāma prajñāpāramitābhāvanāyogānuyuktatvāttasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā tathā hyasya amanuṣyāḥ kāye
analyzed: evam hi etat kauśika bhavati yathā api nāma prajñāpāramitā bhāvanā yoga anuyukta tvāt tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā tathā hi asya amanuṣyāḥ kāye
translated: Because, Kauśika, it is just like this: for that son of a good family or daughter of a good family who is devoted to the yoga of cultivating the perfection of wisdom, in that way the non-humans will think to take away the vital force from his body.

original: oja upasaṃhartavyaṃ maṃsyante /🔽imān api sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikān guṇān parigṛhṇāti //
analyzed: ojaḥ upasaṃhartavyam maṃsyante  imān api sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikān guṇān parigṛhṇāti
translated: They will think to take away the vital force from his body.🔽Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family obtains these visible good qualities.

original: punaraparaṃ kauśika yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhitvā
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām likhitvā
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family who, having written out this perfection of wisdom,

original: pustakagatāṃ kṛtvā pūjāpūrvaṃgamaṃ sthāpayet pūjayennodgṛhṇīyānna dhārayenna vācayenna
analyzed: pustaka gatām kṛtvā pūjā pūrvaṃgamam sthāpayet pūjayet na udgṛhṇīyāt na dhārayet na vācayet na
translated: Having made it into a book, he should establish it with worship at the forefront, worship it, not take it up, not hold it, not recite it,

analyzed: paryavāpnuyāt na pravartayet na deśayet na upadiśet na uddiśet na su ādhyāyet
translated: not master it, not practice it, not teach it, not instruct, not recite it, not study it.

original: ayameva tataḥ sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: ayam eva tatas sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: Kauśika, that son of good family or daughter of good family generates even more merit than that.

original: yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmabhiśraddadhadavakalpayannadhimucya
analyzed: yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām abhiśraddadhat avakalpayan adhimucya
translated: The son of good family or daughter of good family who, with faith, conviction, and confidence in this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: prasanna cittaḥ bodhāya cittam utpādya adhyāśayataḥ śṛṇuyāt udgṛhṇīyāt dhārayet vācayet paryavāpnuyāt pravartayet deśayet upadiśet uddiśet su ādhyāyet
translated: with a mind bent on enlightenment, should listen to it, take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, teach it, instruct in it, recite it, study it,

analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayet
translated: and explain it in detail to others,

analyzed: artham asyāḥ vivṛṇuyāt
translated: explain its meaning,

analyzed: manasā anvavekṣeta
translated: contemplate it with the mind,

analyzed: yathā adhikayā ca prajñayā atra parimīmāṃsām āpadyeta
translated: and apply critical reflection to it with the highest wisdom,

original: antaśaḥ pustakagatām api kṛtvā dhārayetsthāpayetsaddharmacirasthitihetoḥ mā buddhanetrīsamucchedo bhūt /
analyzed: antaśas pustaka gatām api kṛtvā dhārayet sthāpayet saddharma cira sthiti hetoḥ mā buddha netrī samucchedaḥ bhūt
translated: and at least make it into a book, hold it, and establish it for the sake of the long duration of the true Dharma, so that the Buddha's eye may not be interrupted,

analyzed: mā saddharma antardhānam
translated: May the true Dharma not disappear.

original: bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ cānugrahopasaṃhāraḥ kṛto bhaviṣyati netryavaikalyeneti /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām ca anugraha upasaṃhāraḥ kṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati netrī a vaikalyena iti
translated: A favor has been done to the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas by providing the eye of the Dharma.

analyzed: tām ca enām prajñāpāramitām satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet puṣpaiḥ dhūpaiḥ gandhaiḥ mālyaiḥ vile panaiḥ cūrṇaiḥ vastraiḥ chatraiḥ dhvajaiḥ ghaṇṭābhiḥ
translated: And he should honor, respect, revere, and worship that perfection of wisdom with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners,

original: samantācca dīpamālābhiḥ bahuvidhābhiś ca pūjābhiḥ pūjayet /
analyzed: samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ pūjayet
translated: and all around with rows of lamps, and with many kinds of worship.

original: ayameva tataḥ sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: ayam eva tatas sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: Kauśika, that son of good family or daughter of good family thereby produces even more merit than that.

original: tasmāttarhi kauśika imān dṛṣṭadhārmikān viśiṣṭān guṇān parigṛhītukāmena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā iyameva prajñāpāramitā abhiśraddhātavyā
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kauśika imān dṛṣṭa dhārmikān viśiṣṭān guṇān parigṛhītu kāmena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā iyam eva prajñāpāramitā abhiśraddhātavyā  /
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, a son of good family or daughter of good family who wishes to obtain these special qualities in this very life should have faith in just this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: vaidya  avakalpayitavyā adhibhoktavyā
translated: physician🔽should conceive of it, should enjoy it,

original: prasannacittena bodhāya cittamutpādya satkṛtya adhyāśayena śrotavyā udgrahītavyā
analyzed: prasanna cittena bodhāya cittam utpādya satkṛtya adhyāśayena śrotavyā udgrahītavyā
translated: with a clear mind, having generated the mind of enlightenment, having honored it, with a superior motivation, it should be listened to, it should be received,

original: dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyā upadeṣṭavyā uddeṣṭavyā svādhyātavyā /🔽parebhyaś ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayitavyā /
analyzed: dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyā upadeṣṭavyā uddeṣṭavyā su ādhyātavyā  parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayitavyā
translated: It should be borne in mind, recited, mastered, promulgated, explained, taught, expounded, and studied.🔽It should be fully revealed to others.

analyzed: arthataḥ vivaritavyā
translated: It should be opened up in terms of its meaning.

analyzed: manasā anvavekṣitavyā
translated: It should be contemplated with the mind.

analyzed: yathā adhikayā ca prajñayā atra parimīmāṃsām āpadyeta
translated: One should apply the highest wisdom to it.

original: antaśaḥ pustakagatām api kṛtvā sthāpayitavyā pūjayitavyā saddharmacirasthitihetoḥ mā buddhanetrīsamucchedo bhūt /
analyzed: antaśas pustaka gatām api kṛtvā sthāpayitavyā pūjayitavyā saddharma cira sthiti hetoḥ mā buddha netrī samucchedaḥ bhūt
translated: At least it should be made into a book and placed in a shrine and worshipped, for the sake of the long continuance of the true Dharma. Let there be no interruption of the lineage of the Buddhas.

analyzed: mā saddharma antardhānam
translated: Let there be no disappearance of the true Dharma.

original: bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ cānugrahopasaṃhāraḥ kṛto bhaviṣyati netryavaikalyeneti /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām ca anugraha upasaṃhāraḥ kṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati netrī a vaikalyena iti
translated: A favor will have been done to the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas by not being deficient in the eye.

original: arthikānāṃ ca kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ ca saṃvibhāgaṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: arthikānām ca kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām ca saṃvibhāgam kariṣyāmi
translated: And I will share it with those sons and daughters of good family who are interested.

original: mama ca pareṣāṃ ca kalyāṇasattvānāṃ buddhanetrīmahācakṣuravaikalyatā bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: mama ca pareṣām ca kalyāṇa sattvānām buddha netrī mahā cakṣuḥ a vaikalya tā bhaviṣyati iti
translated: For myself and others, for those of wholesome nature, there will be no deficiency in the great eye of the lineage of the Buddhas.

original: sadā ca satkartavyā gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā arcayitavyā apacāyitavyā puṣpairdhūpairgandhairmālyairvilepanaiścūrṇairvastraiśchatrairdhvajairghaṇṭābhiḥ
analyzed: sadā ca satkartavyā gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā arcayitavyā apacāyitavyā puṣpaiḥ dhūpaiḥ gandhaiḥ mālyaiḥ vilepanaiḥ cūrṇaiḥ vastraiḥ chatraiḥ dhvajaiḥ ghaṇṭābhiḥ
translated: and should always be honored, revered, respected, worshipped, venerated, and esteemed with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, banners, and flags,

analyzed: samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: and all around with garlands of lamps.

analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ pūjayitavyā iti
translated: and with many kinds of offerings, one should make offerings.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām aprameya guṇa dhāraṇa pāramitā stūpasatkāraparivartaḥ nāma tṛtīyaḥ
translated: In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the third chapter is named The Chapter on the Merits of Upholding the Perfection of Wisdom and Worshipping a Stupa.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: guṇa parikīrtana parivartaḥ caturthaḥ
translated: The fourth chapter on the proclamation of qualities.

original: punaraparaṃ bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindramāmantrayate sma sacetkauśika ayaṃ te jambūdvīpaḥ paripūrṇaścūlikābaddhastathāgataśarīrāṇāṃ dīyeta /
analyzed: punar aparam bhagavān śakram devānām indram āmantrayate sma saced kauśika ayam te jambūdvīpaḥ paripūrṇaḥ cūlikā baddhaḥ tathāgata śarīrāṇām dīyeta
translated: Moreover, the Blessed One addressed Śakra, Lord of the Gods: If, Kauśika, this Jambudvīpa were filled up to the top with Tathāgata's bodily relics,

analyzed: iyam ca prajñāpāramitā likhitvā upanāmyeta
translated: and this Perfection of Wisdom were written down and presented,

original: tata ekatareṇa bhāgena pravāryamāṇo 'nayordvayorbhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ katamaṃ tvaṃ kauśika bhāgaṃ gṛhṇīyāḥ /
analyzed: tatas ekatareṇa bhāgena pravāryamāṇaḥ nayoḥ dvayoḥ bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ katamam tvam kauśika bhāgam gṛhṇīyāḥ
translated: if one were to choose between these two, which part would you choose, Kauśika, between these two parts that have been set out?

original: śakra āha sacenme bhagavan ayaṃ jambūdvīpaḥ paripūrṇaścūlikābaddhastathāgataśarīrāṇāṃ dīyeta /🔽iyaṃ ca prajñāpāramitā likhitvopanāmyeta /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha saced me bhagavan ayam jambūdvīpaḥ paripūrṇaḥ cūlikā baddhaḥ tathāgata śarīrāṇām dīyeta  iyam ca prajñāpāramitā likhitvā upanāmyeta
translated: Śakra said, “Blessed One, if I were given this Jambudvīpa filled up to the top with the relics of the Tathāgata,🔽and if I were given this perfection of wisdom written out in book form,

original: tata ekatareṇa bhāgena pravāryamāṇo 'nayordvayorbhāgayoḥ sthāpitayorimāmevāhaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitāṃ parigṛhṇīyām /
analyzed: tatas ekatareṇa bhāgena pravāryamāṇaḥ nayoḥ dvayoḥ bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ imām eva aham bhagavan prajñāpāramitām parigṛhṇīyām
translated: and I had to choose between the two, Blessed One, I would choose this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: yathā api nāma tathāgata netrī citrīkāreṇa
translated: Because it is the Tathāgata’s guide, his magic display.

analyzed: etat hi tathāgatānām bhūta arthikam śarīram
translated: This is the Tathāgata’s true body.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: uktam hi etat bhagavatā dharma kāyāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ
translated: Because the Blessed One has said, ‘The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have the Dharma as their body.’

original: mā khalu punarimaṃ bhikṣavaḥ satkāyaṃ kāyaṃ manyadhvam /
analyzed: mā khalu punar imam bhikṣavaḥ sat kāyam kāyam manyadhvam
translated: Monks, do not think that this body is the real body.

analyzed: dharmakāya pariniṣpattitaḥ mām bhikṣavaḥ drakṣyatha
translated: Monks, you should see me as perfected by the perfection of the Dharma body.

original: eṣa ca tathāgatakāyo bhūtakoṭiprabhāvito draṣṭavyo yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: eṣa ca tathāgata kāyaḥ bhūtakoṭi prabhāvitaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: And this body of the Tathāgata should be seen as manifested by the reality limit, namely, this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: na khalu punar me bhagavan teṣu tathāgata śarīreṣu a gauravam
translated: Blessed One, I do not lack respect for those relics of the Tathāgata.

original: gauravameva me bhagavaṃsteṣu tathāgataśarīreṣu /🔽api tu khalu punarbhagavan itaḥ prajñāpāramitāto nirjātāni tathāgataśarīrāṇi pūjāṃ labhante /
analyzed: gauravam eva me bhagavan teṣu tathāgata śarīreṣu  api tu khalu punar bhagavan itas prajñāpāramitātaḥ nirjātāni tathāgata śarīrāṇi pūjām labhante
translated: I do have reverence, Blessed One, for those relics of the Tathāgata.🔽But, Blessed One, it is from this perfection of wisdom that the relics of the Tathāgata have issued forth, and so they obtain worship.

original: tasmāttarhi bhagavan anayaiva prajñāpāramitayā pūjitayā teṣām api tathāgataśarīrāṇāṃ paripūrṇā pūjā kṛtā bhavati /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhagavan anayā eva prajñāpāramitayā pūjitayā teṣām api tathāgata śarīrāṇām paripūrṇā pūjā kṛtā bhavati
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, by worshipping just this perfection of wisdom, they have made full worship of those relics of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā nirjāta tvāt tathāgata śarīrāṇām
translated: Because the relics of the Tathāgata have issued forth from the perfection of wisdom.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan sudharmāyāṃ devasabhāyāmahaṃ yasmin samaye divye svake āsane niṣaṇṇo bhavāmi /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan sudharmāyām deva sabhāyām aham yasmin samaye divye svake āsane niṣaṇṇaḥ bhavāmi
translated: Blessed One, it is just as in the Sudharmā assembly hall of the gods, when I am seated on my own divine seat,

analyzed: tadā mama deva putrāḥ upasthānāya āgacchanti
translated: then the gods come to attend on me.

analyzed: yasmin samaye na niṣaṇṇaḥ bhavāmi
translated: When I am not seated,

original: atha tasmin samaye yanmamāsanaṃ tatra devaputrā mama gauraveṇa tadāsanaṃ namaskṛtya pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punareva prakrāmanti /
analyzed: atha tasmin samaye yat mama asanam tatra deva putrāḥ mama gauraveṇa tat āsanam namaskṛtya pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punar eva prakrāmanti
translated: then at that time the gods bow down to that seat of mine out of respect for me, circumambulate it, and then depart again.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: iha hi kila āsane niṣadya śakro devānāmindro devānāṃ trāyastriṃśānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayatīti /
analyzed: iha hi kila āsane niṣadya śakraḥ devānām indraḥ devānām trāyastriṃśānām dharmam deśayati iti
translated: For it is said that Indra, lord of the gods, sits here on this throne and teaches the Dharma to the gods of the Thirty-Three.

original: evameva bhagavan maheśākhyahetupratyayabhūtā prajñāpāramitā /🔽tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sarvajñatāyā āhārikā /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavat maheśākhya hetu pratyaya bhūtā prajñāpāramitā  tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sarvajña tāyāḥ āhārikā
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the cause and condition for the great and eminent [attainments].🔽It brings about the omniscience of the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

analyzed: sarvajña tāyāḥ ca tathāgata śarīrāṇi āśraya bhūtāni
translated: And the relics of the Tathagata are the basis for omniscience.

analyzed: na tu tāni pratyaya bhūtāni
translated: But they are not the causal conditions.

analyzed: na kāraṇa bhūtāni jñānasya utpādāya
translated: They are not the cause for the arising of knowledge.

original: evameva bhagavan sarvajñajñānahetukā tathāgataśarīreṣu pūjā kṛtā bhavati /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavan sarvajña jñāna hetukā tathāgata śarīreṣu pūjā kṛtā bhavati
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, worship of the relics of the Tathagata is done because of the cause of the knowledge of omniscience.

original: tasmāttarhi bhagavan anayordvayorbhāgayoḥ sthāpitayorimāmevāhaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitāṃ parigṛhṇīyām /🔽na khalu punarme bhagavaṃsteṣu tathāgataśarīreṣvagauravam /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhagavan anayoḥ dvayoḥ bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ imām eva aham bhagavan prajñāpāramitām parigṛhṇīyām  na khalu punar me bhagavan teṣu tathāgata śarīreṣu a gauravam
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, if these two parts were set before me, I would choose this perfection of wisdom, Blessed One.🔽Blessed One, I do not lack respect for those relics of the Tathagata.

analyzed: gauravam eva me bhagavan teṣu tathāgata śarīreṣu
translated: Blessed One, I have respect for those relics of the Tathagata.

original: api tu khalu punarbhagavaṃstāni tathāgataśarīrāṇi prajñāpāramitāparibhāvitatvātpūjāṃ labhante /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar bhagavan tāni tathāgata śarīrāṇi prajñāpāramitā paribhāvita tvāt pūjām labhante
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, those relics of the Tathāgata are worshipped because they are imbued with the perfection of wisdom.

original: tiṣṭhatu khalu punarbhagavan ayaṃ jambūdvīpastathāgataśarīrāṇāṃ paripūrṇaścūlikābaddhaḥ /🔽tiṣṭhatu cāturmahādvīpako lokadhātustathāgataśarīrāṇāṃ paripūrṇaścūlikābaddhaḥ /
analyzed: tiṣṭhatu khalu punar bhagavan ayam jambūdvīpaḥ tathāgata śarīrāṇām paripūrṇaḥ cūlikā baddhaḥ  tiṣṭhatu cāturmahādvīpakaḥ lokadhātuḥ tathāgata śarīrāṇām paripūrṇaḥ cūlikā baddhaḥ
translated: Let alone, Blessed One, this Jambudvīpa filled with relics of the Tathāgata up to its brim.🔽Let alone the four-continent world system filled with relics of the Tathāgata up to its brim.

original: tiṣṭhatu sāhasro lokadhātustathāgataśarīrāṇāṃ paripūrṇaścūlikābaddhaḥ /🔽tiṣṭhatu bhagavan dvisāhasro madhyamo lokadhātustathāgataśarīrāṇāṃ paripūrṇaścūlikābaddhaḥ /
analyzed: tiṣṭhatu sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ tathāgata śarīrāṇām paripūrṇaḥ cūlikā baddhaḥ  tiṣṭhatu bhagavan dvi sāhasraḥ madhyamaḥ lokadhātuḥ tathāgata śarīrāṇām paripūrṇaḥ cūlikā baddhaḥ
translated: Let alone the world system of a thousand worlds filled with relics of the Tathāgata up to its brim.🔽Let alone, Blessed One, the medium world system of a million worlds filled with relics of the Tathāgata up to its brim.

analyzed: ayam eva bhagavan tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ tathāgata śarīrāṇām paripūrṇaḥ cūlikā baddhaḥ
translated: This very great trichiliocosm, Blessed One, filled with relics of the Tathāgata up to its brim,

analyzed: ekaḥ bhāgaḥ kṛtvā sthāpyeta
translated: having made it one part, would be established.

original: iyaṃ ca prajñāpāramitā likhitvā dvitīyo bhāgaḥ sthāpyeta /
analyzed: iyam ca prajñāpāramitā likhitvā dvitīyaḥ bhāgaḥ sthāpyeta
translated: And this perfection of wisdom, having been written, would be established as a second part.

original: anayordvayorbhāgayoḥ sthāpitayorekatareṇa bhāgena pravāryamāṇo 'nayordvayorbhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoryaste bhāgo 'bhipretastamekaṃ bhāgaṃ gṛhāṇeti /
analyzed: anayoḥ dvayoḥ bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ ekatareṇa bhāgena pravāryamāṇaḥ nayoḥ dvayoḥ bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ yaḥ te bhāgaḥ bhipretaḥ tam ekam bhāgam gṛhāṇa iti
translated: When these two parts are set out, being asked to choose one of these two parts, take whichever part you prefer from these two parts that are set out.

original: tatra imāmevāhaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitāṃ parigṛhṇīyām /🔽na khalu Vaidya
analyzed: tatra imām eva aham bhagavan prajñāpāramitām parigṛhṇīyām  na khalu vaidya
translated: There, Blessed One, I would take this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: punar bhagavan teṣu tathāgata śarīreṣu a gauravam
translated: Indeed, Blessed One, I would not choose the Tathāgata's relics.

analyzed: gauravam eva me bhagavan teṣu tathāgata śarīreṣu
translated: Blessed One, I have respect for those Tathāgata's relics themselves.

original: api tu khalu punarbhagavaṃstāni tathāgataśarīrāṇi prajñāpāramitāparibhāvitāni pūjāṃ labhante /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar bhagavan tāni tathāgata śarīrāṇi prajñāpāramitā paribhāvitāni pūjām labhante
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, those Tathāgata's relics receive worship because they are developed by the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tathāgata śarīrāṇi hi sarvajña jñāna āśraya bhūtāni
translated: For the Tathāgata's relics are the basis for the knowledge of all-knowing.

analyzed: tat api sarvajña jñānam prajñāpāramitā nirjātam
translated: And that knowledge of all-knowing arises from the perfection of wisdom.

original: tasmāttarhi bhagavan anayordvayorbhāgayoḥ sthāpitayorimāmevāhaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitāṃ parigṛhṇīyām /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhagavan anayoḥ dvayoḥ bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ imām eva aham bhagavan prajñāpāramitām parigṛhṇīyām
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, from these two parts that are set out, I would take this perfection of wisdom itself, Blessed One.

original: na khalu punar me bhagavaṃsteṣu tathāgataśarīreṣvagauravam /
analyzed: na khalu punar me bhagavan teṣu tathāgata śarīreṣu a gauravam
translated: Blessed One, I do not lack respect for those Tathāgata's relics.

analyzed: gauravam eva me bhagavan teṣu tathāgata śarīreṣu
translated: I have great respect for those relics of the Tathāgata, Blessed One.

original: api tu khalu punarbhagavan itaḥ prajñāpāramitāto nirjātāni tāni tathāgataśarīrāṇi pūjāṃ labhante yaduta prajñāpāramitāparibhāvitatvāt /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar bhagavan itas prajñāpāramitātaḥ nirjātāni tāni tathāgata śarīrāṇi pūjām labhante yat uta prajñāpāramitā paribhāvita tvāt
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, those relics of the Tathāgata that have come forth from this perfection of wisdom receive worship because they are saturated with the perfection of wisdom.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan anarghaṃ maṇiratnamebhirevaṃrūpairguṇaiḥ samanvāgataṃ syāt /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan anargham maṇi ratnam ebhiḥ evaṃrūpaiḥ guṇaiḥ samanvāgatam syāt
translated: Blessed One, it is just as if a priceless jewel possessed such and such qualities.

analyzed: tat yathā tat yatra yatra sthāpyeta
translated: Wherever it is placed,

original: tatra tatra manuṣyā vā amanuṣyā vā avatāraṃ na labheran /
analyzed: tatra tatra manuṣyāḥ vā amanuṣyāḥ vā avatāram na labheran
translated: men or non-men will not find an opportunity there.

original: yatra yatra vā amanuṣyagṛhītaḥ kaścidbhavet puruṣo vā strī vā /
analyzed: yatra yatra vā amanuṣya gṛhītaḥ kaścid bhavet puruṣaḥ vā strī vā
translated: Or wherever a man or woman is seized by a non-human spirit,

original: tatra tatra tasmin maṇiratne praveśitamātre so 'manuṣyastato 'pakrāmet /🔽vātenāpi bādhyamānasya dhamyamāne śarīre tanmaṇiratnaṃ sthāpyeta /
analyzed: tatra tatra tasmin maṇi ratne praveśita mātre saḥ manuṣyaḥ tatas upakrāmet  vātena api bādhyamānasya dhamyamāne śarīre tat maṇi ratnam sthāpyeta
translated: as soon as that jewel is brought there, that non-human spirit will depart from there.🔽Even if someone is afflicted by wind, with the body burning, that jewel should be placed there.

analyzed: tasya tam vātam nigṛhṇīyāt
translated: It will stop that wind.

analyzed: na vivardhayet
translated: It will not increase.

analyzed: upaśamayet  pittena api dahyamāne śarīre sthāpyeta
translated: It will subside.🔽Even if the body is burning with bile, it should be placed there.

analyzed: tasya tat api pittam nigṛhṇīyāt
translated: It will stop that bile.

analyzed: na vivardhayet
translated: One should not increase it.

analyzed: upaśamayet
translated: One should pacify it.

original: śleṣmaṇāpi parigṛddhe sarvato bādhyamāne śarīre sthāpyeta /
analyzed: śleṣmaṇā api parigṛddhe sarvatas bādhyamāne śarīre sthāpyeta
translated: If the body is oppressed on all sides by excessive phlegm, it should be placed there.

analyzed: tasya tam api śleṣmāṇam nigṛhṇīyāt
translated: It would restrain that phlegm of his.

analyzed: na vivardhayet
translated: One should not increase it.

analyzed: upaśamayet  sāṃnipātikena api vyādhinā duḥkhitasya śarīre sthāpyeta
translated: One should pacify it.🔽If one is suffering from a disease of the three humors, it should be placed on the body.

original: tasya tam api sāṃnipātikaṃ vyādhiṃ nigṛhṇīyāt /
analyzed: tasya tam api sāṃnipātikam vyādhim nigṛhṇīyāt
translated: It would restrain that disease of the three humors of his.

analyzed: na vivardhayet
translated: One should not increase it.

analyzed: upaśamayet
translated: One should pacify it.

analyzed: andhakāra tamisrāyām ca rātrau api avabhāsam kuryāt
translated: It would also create light even in a dark night.

original: uṣṇe cāpi vartamāne yasmin pṛthivīpradeśe sthāpyeta /
analyzed: uṣṇe ca api vartamāne yasmin pṛthivī pradeśe sthāpyeta
translated: And if it were placed on a spot on the earth where it is hot,

analyzed: sa pṛthivī pradeśaḥ śītalaḥ bhavet
translated: that spot on the earth would become cool.

original: śīte cāpi vartamāne yasmin pṛthivīpradeśe sthāpyeta /
analyzed: śīte ca api vartamāne yasmin pṛthivī pradeśe sthāpyeta
translated: And if it were placed on a spot on the earth where it is cold,

original: sa pṛthivīpradeśa uṣṇo bhavet /🔽yasmiṃś ca pṛthivīpradeśe āśīviṣā anuvicareyuḥ /
analyzed: sa pṛthivī pradeśaḥ uṣṇaḥ bhavet  yasmin ca pṛthivī pradeśe āśīviṣāḥ anuvicareyuḥ
translated: that spot on the earth would become warm.

analyzed: tathā anye pi kṣudrajantavaḥ
translated: And if poisonous snakes and other small creatures were to move on that spot on the earth,

analyzed: tatra api pṛthivī pradeśe dhāryeta
translated: even there, on that spot on the earth, it should be placed.

analyzed: sthāpitam vā bhavet
translated: Or it may have been placed.

analyzed: te pi āśīviṣāḥ te ca kṣudra jantavaḥ tatas upakrāmeyuḥ
translated: Those poisonous snakes and those small creatures would flee from there.

original: sacedbhagavan strī vā puruṣo vā āśīviṣeṇa daṣṭo bhavet /
analyzed: saced bhagavan strī vā puruṣaḥ vā āśīviṣeṇa daṣṭaḥ bhavet
translated: Blessed One, if a woman or man were bitten by a poisonous snake,

analyzed: tasya tat maṇi ratnam daśyeta
translated: and that jewel were shown to it,

original: tasya sahadaṃśanenaiva maṇiratnasya tadviṣaṃ pratihanyeta vigacchet /
analyzed: tasya saha daṃśanena eva maṇi ratnasya tat viṣam pratihanyeta vigacchet
translated: by the mere contact with the jewel, that poison would be destroyed and would leave.

original: ebhiścānyaiś ca bhagavan evaṃrūpairguṇaiḥ samanvāgataṃ tanmaṇiratnaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: ebhiḥ ca anyaiḥ ca bhagavan evaṃrūpaiḥ guṇaiḥ samanvāgatam tat maṇi ratnam bhavet
translated: Blessed One, that jewel would be endowed with such and other qualities.

original: yeṣām api keṣāṃcidbhagavan akṣiṣvarbudaṃ vā timiraṃ vā akṣirogo vā paṭalaṃ vā bhavet /
analyzed: yeṣām api keṣāṃcid bhagavan akṣiṣu arbudam vā timiram vā akṣi rogaḥ vā paṭalam vā bhavet
translated: Blessed One, for those whose eyes have cataracts, or are blind, or have eye diseases, or have films over them,

analyzed: teṣām ca tat maṇi ratnam akṣiṣu sthāpyeta
translated: if that jewel were placed in their eyes,

original: teṣāṃ sthāpitamātreṇaiva te 'kṣidoṣā nirghātaṃ praśamaṃ gaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: teṣām sthāpita mātreṇa eva te kṣi doṣāḥ nirghātam praśamam gaccheyuḥ
translated: as soon as it is placed, those eye diseases would be cured and pacified.

original: etaiś ca anyaiś ca bhagavan evaṃrūpairguṇaiḥ samanvāgataṃ tanmaṇiratnaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: etaiḥ ca anyaiḥ ca bhagavan evaṃrūpaiḥ guṇaiḥ samanvāgatam tat maṇi ratnam bhavet
translated: Blessed One, that jewel would be endowed with such and other qualities.

analyzed: yatra ca udake sthāpyeta
translated: Wherever it is placed in water,

analyzed: tat api udakam eka varṇam kuryāt svakena varṇena
translated: it would make that water the same color as itself.

analyzed: saced pāṇḍareṇa vastreṇa pariveṣṭya udake prakṣipyeta
translated: If it were wrapped in a white cloth and thrown into the water,

analyzed: tat udakam pāṇḍarīkuryāt
translated: it would whiten that water.

original: evaṃ sacennīlena pītena lohitena māñjiṣṭhena eteṣāmanyeṣāṃ vā nānāprakārāṇāṃ vastrāṇāmanyatamena vastreṇa tanmaṇiratnaṃ veṣṭayitvā vā baddhvā
analyzed: evam saced nīlena pītena lohitena māñjiṣṭhena eteṣām anyeṣām vā nānā prakārāṇām vastrāṇām anyatamena vastreṇa tat maṇi ratnam veṣṭayitvā vā baddhvā
translated: In the same way, if that jewel gem were wrapped in or tied up in a cloth of any of those various colors, blue, yellow, red, or magenta, or in a cloth of any other color, and

analyzed: vā udake prakṣipyeta
translated: were thrown into water,

original: tena tena vastrarāgeṇa tattatsvabhāvavarṇaṃ tadudakaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: tena tena vastra rāgeṇa tad tad svabhāva varṇam tat udakam kuryāt
translated: the water would take on that color and have that appearance, according to the color of the cloth.

analyzed: yaḥ pi tasya udakasya kaluṣa bhāvaḥ tam api prasādayet
translated: It would also purify any turbidity that the water might have.

original: ebhir api bhagavan evaṃrūpairguṇaiḥ samanvāgataṃ tanmaṇiratnaṃ bhavet //🔽atha khalvāyuṣmānānandaḥ śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat kiṃ punaḥ kauśika devaloka Vaidya
analyzed: ebhiḥ api bhagavan evaṃrūpaiḥ guṇaiḥ samanvāgatam tat maṇi ratnam bhavet  atha khalu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ śakram devānām indram etat avocat kim punar kauśika deva loka vaidya
translated: Blessed One, that jewel gem would possess such qualities.

analyzed: eva tāni maṇi ratnāni santi
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: But, Kauśika, are those jewel gems only in the world of the gods,

original: uta jāmbūdvīpakānām api manuṣyāṇāṃ tāni maṇiratnāni santi /
analyzed: uta jāmbūdvīpakānām api manuṣyāṇām tāni maṇi ratnāni santi
translated: or are they also in Jambudvīpa for human beings?

original: śakra āha deveṣvāryānanda tāni maṇiratnāni santi /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha deveṣu ārya ānanda tāni maṇi ratnāni santi
translated: Śakra said, Noble Ānanda, those jewel gems are in the gods' realm,

original: api tu khalu punarjāmbudvīpakānām api manuṣyāṇāṃ maṇiratnāni santi /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar jāmbudvīpakānām api manuṣyāṇām maṇi ratnāni santi
translated: but they are also in Jambudvīpa for human beings.

original: tāni tu gurukāṇi alpāni parīttāni guṇavikalāni /
analyzed: tāni tu gurukāṇi alpāni parīttāni guṇa vikalāni
translated: However, they are heavy, small, few, and lacking in qualities.

original: na taistathārūpairguṇaiḥ samanvāgatāni /🔽tatteṣāṃ divyānāṃ maṇiratnānāṃ śatatamīm api kalāṃ nopayānti /🔽sahasratamīmapi /
analyzed: na taiḥ tathārūpaiḥ guṇaiḥ samanvāgatāni  tat teṣām divyānām maṇi ratnānām śatatamīm api kalām na upayānti  sahasratamīm api
translated: They are not endowed with such qualities.🔽They do not approach even a hundredth part of those divine jewel gems.🔽They do not approach even a thousandth part.

analyzed: śata sahasratamīm api
translated: They do not approach even a hundred-thousandth part.

analyzed: koṭītamīm api  koṭī śatatamīm api  koṭī sahasratamīm api
translated: They do not approach even a koṭi-th part.🔽They do not approach even a hundred koṭi-th part.

analyzed: koṭī śata sahasratamīm api
translated: They do not approach even a thousand koṭi-th part.🔽They do not approach even a hundred thousand koṭi-th part.

analyzed: koṭī niyuta śata sahasratamīm api kalām na upayānti
translated: They do not approach even a koṭi-niyuta-śata-thousand-th part.

original: saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām api upamām api aupamyam api upanisām api upaniṣadam api na kṣamante nopayānti /
analyzed: saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām api upamām api aupamyam api upanisām api upaniṣadam api na kṣamante na upayānti
translated: They are not able to, they do not approach, even the number, the part, the calculation, the comparison, the similitude, the basis, or the basis of a basis.

analyzed: yāni khalu punar deveṣu
translated: And again, those among the gods

original: tāni laghūni sarvākāraguṇaparipūrṇāni /🔽yatra ca karaṇḍake tanmaṇiratnaṃ prakṣiptaṃ bhavati utkṣiptaṃ vā /
analyzed: tāni laghūni sarva ākāra guṇa paripūrṇāni  yatra ca karaṇḍake tat maṇi ratnam prakṣiptam bhavati utkṣiptam vā
translated: are light, completely filled with all aspects of qualities.🔽And in whatever box that jewel gem is placed, whether taken out or not,🔽even when that jewel gem is taken out from the box, that box is still desirable.

original: tata uddhṛte 'pi tasmin maṇiratne karaṇḍakāt spṛhaṇīya eva sa karaṇḍako bhavati /🔽tairmaṇiratnaguṇaiḥ parā tatra karaṇḍake spṛhotpadyate /
analyzed: tatas uddhṛte pi tasmin maṇi ratne karaṇḍakāt spṛhaṇīyaḥ eva sa karaṇḍakaḥ bhavati 🔽taiḥ maṇi ratna guṇaiḥ parā tatra karaṇḍake spṛhā utpadyate
translated: Because of the qualities of that jewel gem, there arises a strong desire for that box.

original: evameva bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyā ete guṇāḥ sarvajñajñānasya ca /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyāḥ ete guṇāḥ sarvajña jñānasya ca
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, these qualities belong to the perfection of wisdom and to the knowledge of all modes.

original: yena parinirvṛtasyāpi tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya tāni tathāgataśarīrāṇi pūjāṃ labhante sarvajñajñānasyemāni tathāgataśarīrāṇi
analyzed: yena parinirvṛtasya api tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya tāni tathāgata śarīrāṇi pūjām labhante sarvajña jñānasya imāni tathāgata śarīrāṇi
translated: By which, even after the complete Nirvana of the Tathagata, the Realised One, the supremely Enlightened One, those relics of the Tathagata receive worship, because they are the relics of the Tathagata of the knowledge of all modes.

original: yathā ca bhagavan sarvalokadhātuṣu buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ dharmadeśanā prajñāpāramitānirjātatvātpūjyā /
analyzed: yathā ca bhagavan sarva lokadhātuṣu buddhānām bhagavatām dharma deśanā prajñāpāramitā nirjāta tvāt pūjyā
translated: And just as, Blessed One, in all world systems the teaching of the Dharma by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, is to be worshipped because it is born from the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: evam dharma bhāṇakasya dharma deśanā prajñāpāramitā nirjāta tvāt pūjyā
translated: in the same way the teaching of the Dharma by the expounder of Dharma is to be worshipped because it is born from the perfection of wisdom.

original: yathā ca bhagavan rājapuruṣo rājānubhāvānmahato janakāyasya akutobhayaḥ pūjyaḥ /
analyzed: yathā ca bhagavan rāja puruṣaḥ rāja anubhāvāt mahataḥ jana kāyasya akutobhayaḥ pūjyaḥ
translated: And just as, Blessed One, the king's man, through the king's power, is fearless among the great crowd of people and is to be worshipped,

original: evaṃ sa dharmabhāṇako dharmakāyānubhāvānmahato janakāyasya akutobhayaḥ pūjyaḥ /
analyzed: evam sa dharma bhāṇakaḥ dharmakāya anubhāvāt mahataḥ jana kāyasya akutobhayaḥ pūjyaḥ
translated: in the same way that expounder of Dharma, through the power of the Dharma body, is fearless among the great crowd of people and is to be worshipped.

original: yathā ca dharmadeśanā dharmabhāṇakāś ca pūjāṃ labhante /
analyzed: yathā ca dharma deśanā dharma bhāṇakāḥ ca pūjām labhante
translated: And just as the teaching of the Dharma and the expounders of Dharma receive worship,

analyzed: evam tāni tathāgata śarīrāṇi pūjām labhante
translated: in the same way those relics of the Tathagata receive worship.

original: tasmāttarhi bhagavan tiṣṭhatu trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātustathāgataśarīrāṇāṃ paripūrṇaścūlikābaddhaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhagavan tiṣṭhatu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ tathāgata śarīrāṇām paripūrṇaḥ cūlikā baddhaḥ
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, let a great trichiliocosm be filled up to the top with the relics of the Tathāgata,

analyzed: ye pi bhagavan gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ lokadhātavaḥ
translated: and let all those world systems, Blessed One, numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: te 'pi sarve tathāgataśarīrāṇāṃ paripūrṇāścūlikābaddhā eko bhāgaḥ sthāpyeta /
analyzed: te pi sarve tathāgata śarīrāṇām paripūrṇāḥ cūlikā baddhāḥ ekaḥ bhāgaḥ sthāpyeta
translated: be filled up to the top with the relics of the Tathāgata, and one part be set aside.

original: iyaṃ ca prajñāpāramitā likhitvā dvitīyo bhāgaḥ sthāpyeta /🔽tatra cenmāṃ bhagavan kaścideva pravārayedanyatareṇa bhāgena /
analyzed: iyam ca prajñāpāramitā likhitvā dvitīyaḥ bhāgaḥ sthāpyeta  tatra ced mām bhagavan kaścid eva pravārayet anyatareṇa bhāgena
translated: And let this perfection of wisdom be written out and a second part be set aside.🔽And if, Blessed One, someone were to ask me to choose between these two parts that have been set aside,

original: pravāryamāṇo 'nayorbhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ yaste bhāgo 'bhipretaḥ tamekaṃ bhāgaṃ parigṛhṇīṣveti /
analyzed: pravāryamāṇaḥ nayoḥ bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ yaḥ te bhāgaḥ bhipretaḥ tam ekam bhāgam parigṛhṇīṣva iti
translated: and were to say, 'Choose whichever one of these two parts you prefer,'

original: tatra imāmevāhaṃ bhagavaṃstayordvayorbhāgayoḥ sthāpitayorbhāgaṃ gṛhṇīyāṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitām /🔽na khalu punarbhagavan mama teṣu tathāgataśarīreṣvagauravam /
analyzed: tatra imām eva aham bhagavan tayoḥ dvayoḥ bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ bhāgam gṛhṇīyām yat uta prajñāpāramitām  na khalu punar bhagavat mama teṣu tathāgata śarīreṣu a gauravam
translated: then, Blessed One, I would choose this perfection of wisdom from among those two parts that have been set aside.🔽Blessed One, it is not that I have no respect for those relics of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: gauravam eva bhagavan teṣu tathāgata śarīreṣu
translated: Blessed One, I have respect for those relics of the Tathāgata.

original: api tu khalu punarbhagavan prajñāpāramitāparibhāvitā sarvajñatā /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar bhagavan prajñāpāramitā paribhāvitā sarvajña tā
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, all-knowledge is perfected by the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: sarvajña tā nirjātā ca tathāgata śarīrāṇām pūjā bhavati
translated: And the worship of the Tathāgata's relics arises from all-knowledge.

original: tasmāttarhi bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyāṃ pūjitāyāmatītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ pūjā kṛtā bhavati //
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyām pūjitāyām atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām pūjā kṛtā bhavati
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, when the perfection of wisdom is worshipped, worship is done to the past, future, and present Buddhas, Blessed Ones.

original: punaraparaṃ bhagavan ye 'prameyeṣvasaṃkhyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavanta etarhi tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti /
analyzed: punar aparam bhagavan ye prameyeṣu asaṃkhyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ etarhi tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who are now present in the immeasurable and incalculable world systems,

original: tān dharmatayā draṣṭukāmena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caritavyam /
analyzed: tān dharma tayā draṣṭu kāmena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā prajñāpāramitāyām caritavyam
translated: a son of good family or a daughter of good family who wishes to see them by means of the true nature should practice the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpattavyam
translated: One should apply oneself to the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā bhāvayitavyā
translated: One should meditate on the perfection of wisdom.

original: evamukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat evametatkauśika / evam etat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: It is so, Kauśika, it is so.

original: ye 'pi te kauśika abhūvannatīte 'dhvani tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: ye pi te kauśika abhūvan atīte dhvani tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Kauśika, those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones who were in the past, who attained supreme perfect awakening,

original: te 'pi kauśika imāmeva prajñāpāramitāmāgamya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: te pi kauśika imām eva prajñāpāramitām āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: They too, Kauśika, having relied on just this perfection of wisdom, have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: Vaidya ye 'pi te kauśika bhaviṣyantyanāgate 'dhvani tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: vaidya ye pi te kauśika bhaviṣyanti anāgate dhvani tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Kauśika, those who will be the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones in the future,

original: te 'pi kauśika imāmeva prajñāpāramitāmāgamya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyante /
analyzed: te pi kauśika imām eva prajñāpāramitām āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: they too, Kauśika, having relied on just this perfection of wisdom, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ye 'pi te kauśika etarhi aprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavantastiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti /🔽te 'pi kauśika buddhā bhagavantaḥ imāmeva prajñāpāramitāmāgamya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: ye pi te kauśika etarhi aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti  te pi kauśika buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ imām eva prajñāpāramitām āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Kauśika, those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who at present exist, remain, and live in immeasurable, incalculable world systems,🔽they too, Kauśika, the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, having relied on just this perfection of wisdom, have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: aham api kauśika etarhi tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ imāmeva prajñāpāramitāmāgamya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ //
analyzed: aham api kauśika etarhi tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ imām eva prajñāpāramitām āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: Kauśika, I too, at present, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, having relied on just this perfection of wisdom, have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat mahāpāramiteyaṃ bhagavan yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat mahā pāramitā iyam bhagavan yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One: Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is a great perfection.

original: sarvasattvānāṃ hi bhagavaṃstathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaścittacaritāni samyak prajānāti saṃpaśyati /
analyzed: sarva sattvānām hi bhagavan tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ citta caritāni samyak prajānāti saṃpaśyati
translated: Blessed One, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One correctly knows and sees the mental activities of all beings.

analyzed: bhagavān āha evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: The Blessed One said, So it is, Kauśika, so it is.

original: tathā hi kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dīrgharātraṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carati /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dīrgharātram prajñāpāramitāyām carati
translated: For, Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom for a long time.

original: tena sarvasattvānāṃ cittacaritāni prajñāpāramitāyāṃ samyak prajānāti saṃpaśyati //
analyzed: tena sarva sattvānām citta caritāni prajñāpāramitāyām samyak prajānāti saṃpaśyati
translated: Therefore, in the perfection of wisdom he correctly knows and sees the mental activities of all beings.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat kiṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyāmeva bodhisattvo mahāsattvaścarati nānyāsu pāramitāsu /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kim bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyām eva bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ carati na anyāsu pāramitāsu
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One: Blessed One, does the bodhisattva mahāsattva practice only in the perfection of wisdom, not in the other perfections?

original: bhagavānāha sarvāsu kauśika ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu bodhisattvo mahāsattvaścarati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha sarvāsu kauśika ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ carati
translated: The Blessed One said, Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices in all six perfections.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ kauśika prajñāpāramitaiva atra pūrvaṃgamā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dānaṃ vā dadataḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kauśika prajñāpāramitā eva atra pūrvaṃgamā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dānam vā dadataḥ
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, it is indeed the perfection of wisdom that is the forerunner here for the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is practicing generosity,

analyzed: śīlam vā rakṣataḥ  kṣāntyā vā saṃpādayamānasya
translated: guarding morality,🔽cultivating patience,

analyzed: vīryam vai ārabhamāṇasya
translated: exerting vigor,

analyzed: dhyānam vā samāpadyamānasya
translated: meditating in concentration,

original: dharmān vā vipaśyataḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitaivātra pūrvaṃgamā /
analyzed: dharmān vā vipaśyataḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā eva atra pūrvaṃgamā
translated: or practicing insight into phenomena. The perfection of wisdom is the forerunner here for the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: na ca kauśika āsāṃ ṣaṇṇāṃ pāramitānāmupāyakauśalyaparigṛhītānāṃ prajñāpāramitāpariṇāmitānāṃ sarvajñatāpariṇāmitānāṃ viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: na ca kauśikaḥ āsām ṣaṇṇām pāramitānām upāya kauśalya parigṛhītānām prajñāpāramitā pariṇāmitānām sarvajña tā pariṇāmitānām viśeṣaḥ
translated: And, Kauśika, there is no distinction between these six perfections when they are embraced by skillful means, when they are dedicated to the perfection of wisdom, and when they are dedicated to omniscience.

analyzed: na ca nānākaraṇam upalabhyate
translated: No difference is perceived.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kauśika jambudvīpe nānāvṛkṣā nānāvarṇā nānāsaṃsthānā nānāpatrā nānāpuṣpā nānāphalā nānārohapariṇāhasaṃpannāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika jambudvīpe nānā vṛkṣāḥ nānā varṇāḥ nānā saṃsthānāḥ nānā patrāḥ nānā puṣpāḥ nānā phalāḥ nānā āroha pariṇāha saṃpannāḥ
translated: Just as, Kauśika, in Jambudvīpa there are various trees with various colors, various shapes, various leaves, various flowers, various fruits, and various sizes and circumferences,

original: na ca teṣāṃ vṛkṣāṇāṃ chāyāyā viśeṣo vā nānākaraṇaṃ vā prajñāyate /
analyzed: na ca teṣām vṛkṣāṇām chāyāyāḥ viśeṣaḥ vā nānākaraṇam vā prajñāyate
translated: and no distinction or difference is perceived in the shade of those trees,

original: api tu chāyā chāyetyevaṃ saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: api tu chāyā chāyā iti evam saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: but rather they are all counted as 'shade, shade.'

original: evameva kauśika āsāṃ ṣaṇṇāṃ pāramitānāmupāyakauśalyaparigṛhītānāṃ prajñāpāramitāpariṇāmitānāṃ sarvajñatāpariṇāmitānāṃ na viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: evam eva kauśikaḥ āsām ṣaṇṇām pāramitānām upāya kauśalya parigṛhītānām prajñāpāramitā pariṇāmitānām sarvajña tā pariṇāmitānām na viśeṣaḥ
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, there is no distinction between these six perfections when they are embraced by skillful means, when they are dedicated to the perfection of wisdom, and when they are dedicated to omniscience.

analyzed: na ca nānākaraṇam upalabhyate
translated: And no difference is perceived.

original: evamukte śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat mahāguṇasamanvāgateyaṃ bhagavan yaduta prajñāpāramitā /🔽aprameyaguṇasamanvāgateyaṃ bhagavan yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat mahā guṇa samanvāgatā iyam bhagavan yat uta prajñāpāramitā  aprameya guṇa samanvāgatā iyam bhagavan yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One: Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is endowed with great qualities.🔽Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is endowed with immeasurable qualities.

analyzed: aparyanta guṇa samanvāgatā iyam bhagavan yat uta prajñāpāramitā iti
translated: Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is endowed with limitless qualities.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām guṇaparikīrtanaparivartaḥ nāma caturthaḥ
translated: In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, this is the fourth chapter, named The Praise of Qualities.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: puṇyaparyāya parivartaḥ pañcamaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Accumulation of Merit, the Fifth

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat yo bhagavan kulaputro vā kuladuhitā
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat yaḥ bhagavan kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, that son of good family or daughter of good family

analyzed: vā imām prajñāpāramitām abhiśraddadhat avakalpayan adhimucya prasanna cittaḥ bodhāya
translated: who has faith in this perfection of wisdom, who contemplates it, who has confidence in it, who with a clear mind

analyzed: cittam utpādya adhyāśayataḥ śṛṇuyāt udgṛhṇīyāt dhārayet vācayet paryavāpnuyāt pravartayet deśayet upadiśet uddiśet su ādhyāyet
translated: Having generated the mind, one should listen to it, take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, promulgate it, teach it, explain it, expound it, and study it with a superior intention.

analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayet
translated: One should also explain it in detail to others.

analyzed: artham asyāḥ vivṛṇuyāt
translated: One should elucidate its meaning.

analyzed: manasā anvavekṣeta
translated: One should contemplate it with the mind.

analyzed: yathā adhikayā ca prajñayā atra parimīmāṃsām āpadyeta
translated: One should apply superior wisdom to examine it.

original: antaśaḥ pustakagatām api kṛtvā dhārayetsthāpayetsaddharmacirasthitihetoḥ mā buddhanetrīsamucchedo bhūt /
analyzed: antaśas pustaka gatām api kṛtvā dhārayet sthāpayet saddharma cira sthiti hetoḥ mā buddha netrī samucchedaḥ bhūt
translated: At the very least, one should write it down in a book, bear it, and establish it for the sake of the long duration of the true Dharma. May the lineage of the Buddhas not be cut off.

analyzed: mā saddharma antardhānam
translated: May the true Dharma not disappear.

original: bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ ca anugrahopasaṃhāraḥ kṛto bhaviṣyati netryavaikalyeneti /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām ca anugraha upasaṃhāraḥ kṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati netrī a vaikalyena iti
translated: A favor and benefit will have been done to the Bodhisattvas, the Great Beings, through the non-deficiency of the eye.

original: evamimaṃ nirdeśaṃ śrutvā evaṃmahārthikā bateyaṃ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: evam imam nirdeśam śrutvā evam mahārthikā bata iyam prajñāpāramitā
translated: Having heard this instruction, one should think, This perfection of wisdom is indeed so greatly beneficial.

analyzed: evaṃmahā anuśaṃsā
translated: It has such great advantages.

analyzed: evam mahā phalā  evaṃmahā vipākā bata iyam prajñāpāramitā
translated: It has such great fruits.🔽This perfection of wisdom indeed has such great results.

analyzed: evam bahu guṇa samanvāgatā iyam prajñāpāramitā
translated: This perfection of wisdom is endowed with so many qualities.

analyzed: a parityajanīyā mayā prajñāpāramitā
translated: The perfection of wisdom should not be abandoned by me.

analyzed: rakṣitavyā mama prajñāpāramitā
translated: I should protect the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: gopāyitavyā mama prajñāpāramitā
translated: I should keep the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: parama durlabhā hi iyam prajñāpāramitā iti adhimuñcet
translated: This perfection of wisdom is extremely difficult to obtain, one should have conviction in that.

analyzed: svayam eva ca enām prajñāpāramitām satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet puṣpaiḥ dhūpaiḥ gandhaiḥ mālyaiḥ vilepanaiḥ cūrṇaiḥ vastraiḥ chatraiḥ dhvajaiḥ ghaṇṭābhiḥ
translated: And one should oneself honor, revere, respect, worship, venerate, and esteem the perfection of wisdom with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners,

analyzed: samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: and all around with garlands of lamps.

original: bahuvidhābhiś ca pūjābhiḥ yo vā anyaḥ saṃpūjya parasmai cārthikāya chandikāya kulaputrāya kuladuhitre vā yācamānāya dadyādupanāmayenniryātayetparityajet /
analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ yaḥ vā anyaḥ saṃpūjya parasmai ca arthikāya chandikāya kula putrāya kula duhitre vā yācamānāya dadyāt upanāmayet niryātayet parityajet
translated: And with many kinds of worship, or if another, having fully worshipped, would give to another who is a seeker, a desirer, a son of good family, a daughter of good family, who asks, would present, would dedicate, would give up,

analyzed: antaśas pustaka gatām api kṛtvā
translated: even having made it into a book.

original: katarastayorbhagavan kulaputrayoḥ kuladuhitrorvā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet yo vā parityāgabuddhiryo vā na parityāgabuddhiḥ /
analyzed: kataraḥ tayoḥ bhagavan kula putrayoḥ kula duhitroḥ vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavet yaḥ vā parityāga buddhiḥ yaḥ vā na parityāga buddhiḥ
translated: Which of the two, Blessed One, would produce much more merit, the one who has the intention to give up, or the one who does not have the intention to give up, the son of good family or the daughter of good family?🔽Subhūti, the son of good family or the daughter of good family who would give up, present, dedicate, and give up the perfection of wisdom, even having made it into a book, would produce much more merit than the one who would not give up.

original: evamukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat tena hi kauśika tvāmevātra pratiprakṣyāmi /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat tena hi kauśika tvām eva atra pratiprakṣyāmi
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: Well then, Kauśika, I will ask you about this.

analyzed: yathā te kṣamate vyākuryāḥ
translated: You may answer as you see fit.

original: tatkiṃ manyase kauśika yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya śarīraṃ satkṛtya paricareddhārayet satkuryādgurukuryānmānayet 🔽pūjayedarcayedapacāyet svayameva /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kauśika yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya śarīram satkṛtya paricaret dhārayet satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet  / pūjayet arcayet apacāyet svayam eva
translated: What do you think, Kauśika? If a son of good family or daughter of good family, after the Tathāgata's parinirvāṇa, were to honor, venerate, respect,

original: yo vā anyaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tathāgataśarīraṃ svayaṃ ca satkuryādgurukuryānmānayetpūjayedarcayedapacāyet /
analyzed: yaḥ vā anyaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tathāgata śarīram svayam ca satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet
translated: and make offerings to the Tathāgata's body, and if another son of good family or daughter of good family were to honor, venerate, respect,

analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayet
translated: and make offerings to the Tathāgata's body, and were to explain it in detail to others,

original: dadyāt saṃvibhajet vaistārikī pūjā bhaviṣyatīti sattvānāṃ cānukampāmupādāya /
analyzed: dadyāt saṃvibhajet vaistārikī pūjā bhaviṣyati iti sattvānām ca anukampām upādāya
translated: and were to give it away and share it, thinking 'May the worship be widespread,' out of compassion for sentient beings,

original: katarastayordvayoḥ kulaputrayoḥ kuladuhitrorvā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: kataraḥ tayoḥ dvayoḥ kula putrayoḥ kula duhitroḥ vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: which of those two sons of good family or daughters of good family would generate more merit?

original: kiṃ yaḥ svayaṃ ca pūjayet parebhyaś ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayeddadyāt saṃvibhajet /
analyzed: kim yaḥ svayam ca pūjayet parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayet dadyāt saṃvibhajet
translated: Which would be the one who honors it themselves and explains it in detail to others, gives it away and shares it?

original: kiṃ vā yaḥ svayameva pratyātmaṃ pūjayet /
analyzed: kim vā yaḥ svayam eva pratyātmam pūjayet
translated: Or, rather, he who himself worships [the relics] in his own mind?

original: śakra āha yo bhagavan kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā svayaṃ ca tathāgataśarīraṃ satkuryādgurukuryānmānayetpūjayedarcayedapacāyet /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha yaḥ bhagavan kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā svayam ca tathāgata śarīram satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyet
translated: Śakra said: Blessed One, if a son of good family or a daughter of good family, having honored, revered, and worshipped the Tathāgata's body,

original: parebhyaś ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayeddadyātsaṃvibhajet vaistārikī pūjā bhaviṣyatīti sattvānāṃ cānukampāmupādāya /
analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayet dadyāt saṃvibhajet vaistārikī pūjā bhaviṣyati iti sattvānām ca anukampām upādāya
translated: and having taken pity on beings, would give and share it extensively with others, saying May the worship be extensive,

original: ayamevānayordvayoḥ kulaputrayoḥ kuladuhitrorvā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: ayam eva anayoḥ dvayoḥ kula putrayoḥ kula duhitroḥ vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: this would produce much more merit for these two sons or daughters of good family.

translated: It is so, Kauśika, that a son of good family or a daughter of good family, having written this perfection of wisdom, made it into a book, would take it up, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, teach it, explain it, recite it, and practice it.

original: parasmai cārthikāya chandikāya kulaputrāya kuladuhitre vā yācamānāya dadyādupanāmayenniryātayetparityajedantaśaḥ pustakagatām api kṛtvā /

translated: And to another Dharma practitioner, a son or daughter of good family who is in need and asks for it, he or she should give it, offer it, dedicate it, and let it go, even if it is only written down in a book.

analyzed: ayam eva kauśika tayoḥ dvayoḥ kula putrayoḥ vaidya

original: punaraparaṃ kauśika yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā yatra yatra bhājanībhūtāḥ kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā syuḥ asyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ /

translated: Śakra said, A lot, Blessed One.

translated: A lot, Sugata.

analyzed: yogam āpatsyate

original: evamasyeyaṃ prajñāpāramitā bhūyasyā mātrayā bhāvanāṃ vṛddhiṃ virūḍhiṃ vipulatāṃ paripūriṃ gamiṣyatīti /
