original: evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ sthaviro maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat yadi so 'saṃvidyamānaṃ vastu asaṃvidyamānamārambaṇamārambaṇīkuryāt /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ maitreyam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat yadi saḥ saṃvidyamānam vastu a saṃvidyamānam ārambaṇam ārambaṇīkuryāt
translated: When this was said, the elder Subhuti said to the bodhisattva mahasattva Maitreya: If he makes non-existent things, non-existent objects, his object,

original: nimittīkuryāt tatkathamasya saṃjñāviparyāsaścittaviparyāso dṛṣṭiviparyāso na bhavet /
analyzed: nimittīkuryāt tat katham asya saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ citta viparyāsaḥ dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ na bhavet
translated: how can he not have the perversion of perception, the perversion of mind, the perversion of view?

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ tathā
translated: Why is that? Because

original: hi rāgo 'pyasaṃvidyamānaṃ vastu anitye nityamiti duḥkhe sukhamiti anātmanyātmeti aśubhe śubhamiti vikalpya saṃkalpya utpadyate /
analyzed: hi vastu anitye nityam iti duḥkhe sukham iti anātmani ātmā iti aśubhe śubham iti vikalpya saṃkalpya utpadyate
translated: thus, desire arises having conceptualized and imagined a non-existent thing, in the impermanent as permanent, in suffering as happiness, in the non-self as self, in the impure as pure.

analyzed: saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ citta viparyāsaḥ dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ
translated: The perversion of perception, the perversion of mind, the perversion of view.

original: athāpi yathā vastu yathā ārambaṇaṃ yathā ākārastathā bodhistathā cittam /
analyzed: atha api yathā vastu yathā ārambaṇam yathā ākāraḥ tathā bodhiḥ tathā cittam
translated: But if the object, the object, the aspect are as they are, then the awakening is as it is, and the mind is as it is.

analyzed: evam sarva dharmāḥ sarva dhātavaḥ
translated: Thus all dharmas, all elements,

original: yadi ca yathā vastu yathā ārambaṇaṃ yathā ākārastathā bodhistathā cittam /
analyzed: yadi ca yathā vastu yathā ārambaṇam yathā ākāraḥ tathā bodhiḥ tathā cittam
translated: And if the awakening is as the object, as the basis, as the aspect, so is the mind,

original: tatkatamairvastubhiḥkatamairārambaṇaiḥ katamairākāraiḥ katamaṃ cittamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: tat katamaiḥ vastubhiḥ katamaiḥ ārambaṇaiḥ katamaiḥ ākāraiḥ katamam cittam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati
translated: then in which objects, in which bases, in which aspects does one dedicate the mind to supreme perfect awakening?

original: katamadvā anumodanāsahagataṃ puṇyakriyāvastu kva anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: katamat vā anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu kva anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati
translated: Or in which object of wholesome action accompanied by rejoicing does one dedicate to supreme perfect awakening?

original: Vaidya atha khalu maitreyo bodhisattvo mahāsattva āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtiṃ sthavirametadavocat
analyzed: vaidya atha khalu maitreyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim sthaviram etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya said this to the elder Subhūti:

original: nedamārya subhūte navayānasaṃprasthitasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya purato bhāṣitavyaṃ nopadeṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na idam ārya subhūte nava yāna saṃprasthitasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya puratas bhāṣitavyam na upadeṣṭavyam
translated: Venerable Subhūti, this should not be taught or explained in front of a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has newly set out in the vehicle.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yad api hi syāttasya śraddhāmātrakaṃ premamātrakaṃ prasādamātrakaṃ gauravamātrakam /
analyzed: yat api hi syāt tasya śraddhā mātrakam prema mātrakam prasāda mātrakam gaurava mātrakam
translated: Whatever little faith, little love, little confidence, and little respect he has,

analyzed: tat api tasya sarvam antardhīyeta
translated: all that will disappear for him.

original: avinivartanīyasyedamārya subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya purato bhāṣitavyamupadeṣṭavyam /
analyzed: a vinivartanīyasya idam ārya subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya puratas bhāṣitavyam upadeṣṭavyam
translated: This, noble Subhuti, should be taught and expounded in front of a bodhisattva mahasattva who is irreversible.

original: yo vā kalyāṇamitropastabdho sattvo mahāsattvo bhavet /
analyzed: yaḥ vā kalyāṇa mitra upastabdhaḥ sattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhavet
translated: This should be taught and expounded in front of a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is irreversible, or of a sentient being who is supported by a spiritual friend.

original: so 'tra nāvaleṣyate na saṃleṣyate na vipatsyati na viṣādamāpatsyate /
analyzed: saḥ tra na avaleṣyate na saṃleṣyate na vipatsyati na viṣādam āpatsyate
translated: That one will not be overwhelmed, will not be terrified, will not be frightened, will not be seized with panic.

analyzed: na vipṛṣṭhīkariṣyati mānasam
translated: He will not turn his mind away.

analyzed: na bhagnapṛṣṭhīkariṣyati
translated: He will not turn his back.

analyzed: na utrasiṣyati na saṃtrasiṣyati na saṃtrāsam āpatsyate
translated: He will not tremble, will not be frightened, will not be seized with panic.

original: evaṃ ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anumodanāsahagataṃ puṇyakriyāvastu sarvajñatāyāṃ pariṇāmayitavyam //
analyzed: evam ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu sarvajña tāyām pariṇāmayitavyam
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should dedicate the wholesome action associated with rejoicing to omniscience.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtiḥ sthaviro maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat yena maitreya cittenānumodya yatpariṇāmayati /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ maitreyam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat yena maitreya cittena anumodya yat pariṇāmayati
translated: Then the elder Subhūti said this to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya: Maitreya, with whatever mind one rejoices and dedicates,

analyzed: tat cittam kṣīṇam niruddham vigatam vipariṇatam
translated: that mind is destroyed, ceased, departed, and transformed.

analyzed: tat katamat tat cittam yena pariṇāmayati anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye
translated: Which is that mind with which one dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

analyzed: katamat vā tat cittam anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu yat pariṇāmayati anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye
translated: Or what is that object of meritorious action accompanied by rejoicing, which one dedicates to highest genuine full Awakening?

original: kathaṃ vā śakyaṃ cittena cittaṃ pariṇāmayituṃ yadā dvayościttayoḥ samavadhānaṃ nāsti /
analyzed: katham vā śakyam cittena cittam pariṇāmayitum yadā dvayoḥ cittayoḥ samavadhānam na asti
translated: Or how can one mind be transformed into another mind, when there is no simultaneity of two minds?

analyzed: na ca tad citta svabhāva tā śakyā pariṇāmayitum
translated: And the nature of that mind cannot be transformed.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtiṃ sthavirametadavocat mā khalvārya
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim sthaviram etat avocat mā khalu ārya
translated: Then indeed Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the elder Subhūti: Noble Subhūti,

original: subhūte navayānasaṃprasthitā bodhisattvā mahāsattvā imaṃ nirdeśaṃ śrutvā utrasiṣuḥ
analyzed: subhūte nava yāna saṃprasthitāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ imam nirdeśam śrutvā utrasiṣuḥ
translated: may the newly set out bodhisattva mahāsattvas, having heard this teaching, not be frightened,

analyzed: saṃtrasiṣuḥ saṃtrāsam āpatsyante
translated: not be terrified, and not fall into terror.

original: kathaṃ cārya subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena tadanumodanāsahagataṃ puṇyakriyāvastu anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayitavyam /
analyzed: katham ca ārya subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena tad anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayitavyam
translated: And how, noble Subhūti, should the bodhisattva mahāsattva transform that object of meritorious action accompanied by rejoicing into highest genuine full Awakening?

original: kathaṃ ca anumodanāsahagataṃ puṇyakriyāvastu parigṛhṇatā anumodanāsahagataṃ cittaṃ pariṇāmayatā tadanumodanāsahagataṃ cittaṃ suparigṛhītaṃ
analyzed: katham ca anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu parigṛhṇatā anumodanā sahagatam cittam pariṇāmayatā tad anumodanā sahagatam cittam su parigṛhītam
translated: And how, when taking up the wholesome action consisting of rejoicing, does one who is taking up the wholesome action consisting of rejoicing, with a mind accompanied by rejoicing, take up that mind accompanied by rejoicing,

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtiḥ sthaviro maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamārabhya maitreyaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ maitreyam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam ārabhya maitreyam
translated: Then the elder Subhuti, beginning with the Bodhisattva, the great being Maitreya,

original: bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamadhiṣṭhānaṃ kṛtvā maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamāmantrayate
analyzed: bodhisattvam mahāsattvam adhiṣṭhānam kṛtvā maitreyam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āmantrayate
translated: taking the Bodhisattva, the great being Maitreya, as the basis, addressed the Bodhisattva, the great being Maitreya,

original: sma iha maitreya bodhisattvo mahāsattvasteṣāmatītānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ chinnavartmanāṃ
analyzed: sma iha maitreya bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ teṣām atītānām buddhānām bhagavatām chinna vartmanām
translated: saying: Here, Maitreya, the Bodhisattva, the great being, of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, who have entered Parinirvana,

analyzed: chinna vartmanīnām chinna prapañca bhava netrīkāṇām paryātta bāṣpāṇām mardita kaṇṭakānām apahṛta bhārāṇām anuprāpta svaka arthānām
translated: whose paths have been cut off, whose paths have been cut off, whose elaborations and existences have been cut off, whose tears have been exhausted, whose thorns have been crushed, who have laid down the burden,

analyzed: parikṣīṇa bhava saṃyojanānām samyagājñāsu vimukta cittānām sarva cetaḥ vaśi parama pāramitā prāptānām
translated: who have attained their own goal, who have destroyed the fetters of existence, whose minds have been liberated by perfect knowledge, who have attained the utmost perfection of all mental control,

original: daśasu dikṣu aprameyāsaṃkhyeyeṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu ekaikasyāṃ diśi
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu aprameya asaṃkhyeyeṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu ekaikasyām diśi
translated: In the ten directions, in the immeasurable and incalculable great trichiliocosms of world systems, in each direction,

original: ekaikasmiṃś ca trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau aprameyāsaṃkhyeyānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ
analyzed: ekaikasmin ca tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau aprameya asaṃkhyeyānām buddhānām bhagavatām
translated: in each great trichiliocosm, there are immeasurable and incalculable Buddhas, Blessed Ones,

analyzed: parinirvṛtānām yāvat prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhānām
translated: who have passed into parinirvāṇa, from the time they first gave rise to the mind of enlightenment up to the time they fully awakened to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: yāvacca anupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvṛtānāṃ yāvacca saddharmo nāntarhitaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat ca an upadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvṛtānām yāvat ca saddharmaḥ na antarhitaḥ
translated: up to the time they passed into parinirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without remainder, up to the time the true Dharma disappeared.

original: etasminnantare yāni teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ kuśalamūlāni pāramitāpratisaṃyuktāni /
analyzed: etasmin antare yāni teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām kuśala mūlāni pāramitā pratisaṃyuktāni
translated: In this period, there are the roots of virtue of those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, connected with the perfections,

original: yaś ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ puṇyābhisaṃskāraḥ kuśalamūlābhisaṃskāraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ kuśala mūla abhisaṃskāraḥ
translated: and the meritorious formations of those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, the formations of roots of virtue,

original: yaś ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ śīlaskandhaḥ samādhiskandhaḥ prajñāskandho vimuktiskandho vimuktijñānadarśanaskandhaḥ / Vaidya
analyzed: yaḥ ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām śīla skandhaḥ samādhi skandhaḥ prajñā skandhaḥ vimukti skandhaḥ vimukti jñāna darśana skandhaḥ vaidya
translated: and the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of concentration, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation of those Buddhas, Blessed Ones,

analyzed: yā ca hita eṣitā  yā ca mahā maitrī
translated: and the desire for what is beneficial,🔽and the great love,🔽and the great compassion,

analyzed: yā ca mahā karuṇā
translated: and the great equanimity.

analyzed: ye ca aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ buddha guṇāḥ
translated: and the immeasurable and incalculable qualities of the Buddhas,

analyzed: yaḥ ca taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ dharmaḥ deśitaḥ
translated: and the Dharma that has been taught by those Blessed Buddhas,

original: ye ca tasmin dharme śikṣitā adhimuktāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tasmin dharme śikṣitāḥ adhimuktāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: and those who have trained in that Dharma, who have had aspirations for it, and who have been established in it,

analyzed: teṣām ca yāni kuśala mūlāni
translated: and their roots of virtue,

original: ye ca tairbuddhairbhagavadbhirbodhisattvā mahāsattvāvyākṛtā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: ye ca taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ a vyākṛtāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: and those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas who have been predicted by those Blessed Buddhas to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: teṣām ca yāni kuśala mūlāni ṣaṣ pāramitā pratisaṃyuktāni
translated: and their roots of virtue connected with the six perfections,

original: ye ca pratyekabuddhayānikāḥ pudgalā vyākṛtāḥ pratyekabodhau /
analyzed: ye ca pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ pudgalāḥ vyākṛtāḥ pratyeka bodhau
translated: and those individuals who follow the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle and have been predicted to Pratyekabodhi,

analyzed: teṣām ca yāni kuśala mūlāni
translated: and their roots of virtue,

original: yāni ca śrāvakayānikānāṃ pudgalānāṃ dānamayāni kuśalamūlāni śīlamayāni kuśalamūlāni bhāvanāmayāni kuśalamūlāni /🔽yāni ca śaikṣāṇyanāsravāṇi kuśalamūlāni /
analyzed: yāni ca śrāvaka yānikānām pudgalānām dāna mayāni kuśala mūlāni śīla mayāni kuśala mūlāni bhāvanā mayāni kuśala mūlāni  yāni ca śaikṣāṇi anāsravāṇi kuśala mūlāni
translated: and the roots of virtue consisting of giving, morality, and meditation for individuals who follow the Śrāvaka Vehicle,🔽and the untainted roots of virtue of those in training,

analyzed: yāni ca aśaikṣāṇi anāsravāṇi kuśala mūlāni
translated: and the untainted roots of virtue of those beyond training,

original: yaiś ca tasmin dharme pṛthagjanaiḥ kuśalamūlānyavaropitāni /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca tasmin dharme pṛthagjanaiḥ kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni
translated: and the roots of virtue planted by ordinary beings in that Dharma,

analyzed: yaiḥ ca deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣyaiḥ vā sa dharmaḥ śrutaḥ
translated: And by those gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans who have heard that Dharma,

analyzed: śrutvā ca kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni
translated: and having heard it, have planted roots of virtue,

original: yaiś ca tiryagyonigatair api sattvaiḥ sa dharmaḥ śrutaḥ /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca tiryagyoni gataiḥ api sattvaiḥ sa dharmaḥ śrutaḥ
translated: and by those beings who have been reborn in the animal realm who have heard that Dharma,

analyzed: śrutvā ca kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni
translated: and having heard it, have planted roots of virtue,

original: yaiś ca teṣu buddheṣu bhagavatsu parinirvāpayatsu parinirvṛteṣu ca kuśalamūlānyavaropitāni /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca teṣu buddheṣu bhagavatsu parinirvāpayatsu parinirvṛteṣu ca kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni
translated: and by those who have planted roots of virtue in those Blessed Buddhas who are attaining parinirvāṇa or have already attained parinirvāṇa,

analyzed: teṣām ca sarveṣām yāni kuśala mūlāni
translated: and all those roots of virtue,

original: tāni sarvāṇyekato 'bhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā niravaśeṣya niravaśeṣamanumodeta /
analyzed: tāni sarvāṇi ekatas bhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā niravaśeṣya niravaśeṣam anumodeta
translated: having collected them all together, having combined them, having weighed them, having left out none, one should rejoice in them without remainder.

original: anumodya anumodanāsahagataṃ puṇyakriyāvastu anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayate /
analyzed: anumodya anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayate
translated: Having rejoiced, one should dedicate the wholesome action associated with rejoicing to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: pariṇāmayato bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kathaṃ na saṃjñāviparyāso na cittaviparyāso na dṛṣṭiviparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: pariṇāmayataḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya katham na saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ na citta viparyāsaḥ na dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: When a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is dedicating in this way, how does he avoid the perversions of conceptualization, mind, and view?

original: evamukte maitreyo bodhisattvo mahāsattva āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtiṃ sthavirametadavocat sacedārya subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo yena cittena yatpariṇāmayati /
analyzed: evam ukte maitreyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim sthaviram etat avocat saced ārya subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yena cittena yat pariṇāmayati
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya said to the elder Subhūti, If, noble Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva does not conceive of the mind by which he dedicates,

analyzed: tasmin citte na citta saṃjñī bhavati
translated: as a mind,

original: evaṃ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anumodanāsahagataṃ puṇyakriyāvastu anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: evam bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmitam bhavati
translated: then the bodhisattva mahāsattva's act of merit associated with rejoicing is dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yathā taccittaṃ na saṃjānīte idaṃ taccittamiti /
analyzed: yathā tat cittam na saṃjānīte idam tat cittam iti
translated: Just as that mind does not cognize 'this is that mind,'

original: evaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na saṃjñāviparyāso na cittaviparyāso na dṛṣṭiviparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: evam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ na citta viparyāsaḥ na dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva has no reversal of perception, no reversal of mind, no reversal of view.

analyzed: atha yena cittena yat pariṇāmayati
translated: But if the mind by which he dedicates

original: taccittaṃ saṃjānīte idaṃ taccittamiti cittasaṃjñī bhavati /
analyzed: tat cittam saṃjānīte idam tat cittam iti citta saṃjñī bhavati
translated: cognizes that mind as 'this is that mind,' and he has the perception of mind,

original: evaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saṃjñāviparyāsaścittaviparyāso dṛṣṭiviparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: evam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ citta viparyāsaḥ dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: then the bodhisattva mahāsattva has a reversal of perception, a reversal of mind, a reversal of view.

analyzed: saced punar bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yat cittam pariṇāmayati
translated: If, on the other hand, the bodhisattva mahāsattva dedicates the mind by which he dedicates

analyzed: tat cittam evam saṃjānīte
translated: That mind cognizes thus.

analyzed: evam samanvāharati
translated: It reflects thus.

translated: Now, if he cognizes that mind by which he transforms, thinking 'this is that mind', he becomes one who has the notion of mind.

original: evaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saṃjñāviparyāsaścittaviparyāso dṛṣṭiviparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: evam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ citta viparyāsaḥ dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus, for the bodhisattva-mahāsattva, there is a perversion of perception, a perversion of mind, and a perversion of view.

analyzed: saced punar bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yat cittam pariṇāmayati
translated: But if the bodhisattva-mahāsattva cognizes that mind by which he transforms,

original: taccittamevaṃ saṃjānīte evaṃ samanvāharati taccittaṃ samanvāhriyamāṇameva kṣīṇaṃ kṣīṇamityevaṃ saṃjānīte /
analyzed: tat cittam evam saṃjānīte evam samanvāharati tat cittam samanvāhriyamāṇam eva kṣīṇam kṣīṇam iti evam saṃjānīte
translated: and thus reflects, 'that mind, when reflected upon, is known to be exhausted, exhausted',

analyzed: niruddham vigatam vipariṇatam iti evam saṃjānīte
translated: and he cognizes it thus, 'it is ceased, departed, transformed',

analyzed: yat ca kṣīṇam na tat śakyam pariṇāmayitum
translated: and what is exhausted cannot be transformed,

analyzed: yena api cittena pariṇāmyate
translated: and by that very mind by which it is transformed,

analyzed: tasya api cittasya sā eva dharma tā
translated: that mind also has that very nature,

original: yair api dharmaiḥ pariṇāmyate /🔽teṣām api dharmāṇāṃ Vaidya
analyzed: yaiḥ api dharmaiḥ pariṇāmyate  teṣām api dharmāṇām vaidya
translated: and by those dharmas by which it is transformed,

analyzed: sā eva dharmatā
translated: those dharmas also have that very nature,

analyzed: yeṣu api dharmeṣu pariṇāmyate
translated: and in those dharmas into which it is transformed,

analyzed: teṣām api dharmāṇām sā eva dharma tā iti
translated: they also have that very nature.

analyzed: saced evam pariṇāmayati
translated: If he transforms in this way,

analyzed: samyak pariṇāmayati
translated: he transforms correctly.

analyzed: na mithyā pariṇāmayati
translated: He does not transform falsely.

analyzed: evam ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena pariṇāmayitavyam
translated: Thus should the Bodhisattva, the great being, transform.

analyzed: punar aparam ārya subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām
translated: Moreover, noble Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, of the past, future, and present Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

analyzed: bhagavatām chinna vartmanām chinna vartmanīnām chinna prapañca bhava netrīkāṇām aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām
translated: whose path has been cut off, whose path has been cut off, whose path of proliferation and becoming has been cut off, of the immeasurable, innumerable

analyzed: yāvat prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: from the time of the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the time when they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: abhisaṃbudhyante ca
translated: they have fully awakened, and will fully awaken

original: yāvacca nirupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvṛtāḥ parinirvāsyanti parinirvānti ca /
analyzed: yāvat ca nirupadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvṛtāḥ parinirvāsyanti parinirvānti ca
translated: up to the time when they will have fully passed into the Nirvana which leaves no skandhas behind, have fully passed, and will fully pass

original: yāvacca saddharmo nāntarhito nāntardhāsyati nāntardadhāti ca /
analyzed: yāvat ca saddharmaḥ na antarhitaḥ na antardhāsyati na antardadhāti ca
translated: up to the time when the true Dharma has disappeared, will disappear, and is disappearing.

original: etasminnantare yāni teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ ṣaṭpāramitāpratisaṃyuktāni kuśalamūlāni /
analyzed: etasmin antare yāni teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām ṣaḍ pāramitā pratisaṃyuktāni kuśala mūlāni
translated: In this interval, whatever wholesome roots there are of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, connected with the six perfections,

original: yaś ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ śīlaskandhaḥ samādhiskandhaḥ prajñāskandho vimuktiskandho vimuktijñānadarśanaskandhaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām śīla skandhaḥ samādhi skandhaḥ prajñā skandhaḥ vimukti skandhaḥ vimukti jñāna darśana skandhaḥ
translated: And the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of concentration, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

analyzed: yā ca hita eṣitā  yā ca mahā maitrī
translated: And the desire for benefit,🔽And the great love,

analyzed: yā ca mahā karuṇā
translated: And the great compassion,

analyzed: ye ca aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ buddha guṇāḥ
translated: And the immeasurable and incalculable qualities of the Buddhas,

original: yaiś ca tairbuddhairbhagavadbhirdharmo deśito deśayiṣyate deśyate ca /🔽ye ca tasmin dharme śikṣitāḥ śikṣiṣyante śikṣante ca /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ dharmaḥ deśitaḥ deśayiṣyate deśyate ca  ye ca tasmin dharme śikṣitāḥ śikṣiṣyante śikṣante ca
translated: And the Dharma that has been, will be, and is being taught by those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,🔽And those who have trained, will train, and are training in that Dharma,

analyzed: adhimuktāḥ adhimokṣayiṣyanti adhimokṣayanti ca
translated: Who have been, will be, and are resolved upon it,

analyzed: sthitāḥ sthāsyanti tiṣṭhanti ca
translated: Who have stood, will stand, and are standing in it,

analyzed: teṣām ca sarveṣām yāni kuśala mūlāni
translated: And all their roots of virtue,

original: ye ca tairbuddhairbhagavadbhirbodhisattvā mahāsattvā vyākṛtā vyākariṣyante vyākriyante ca anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: ye ca taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ vyākṛtāḥ vyākariṣyante vyākriyante ca anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas who have been, will be, and are being prophesied by those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: teṣām ca sarveṣām yāni kuśala mūlāni
translated: And all their roots of virtue,

original: ye ca pratyekabuddhayānikāḥ pudgalā vyākṛtā vyākariṣyante vyākriyante ca pratyekabodhau /
analyzed: ye ca pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ pudgalāḥ vyākṛtāḥ vyākariṣyante vyākriyante ca pratyeka bodhau
translated: And those individuals who are followers of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle who have been, will be, and are being prophesied to Pratyekabuddhahood,

original: teṣāṃ ca sarveṣāṃ yāni kuśalamūlāni /🔽yāni ca śrāvakayānikānāṃ pudgalānāṃ dānamayāni kuśalamūlāni śīlamayāni kuśalamūlāni bhāvanāmayāni kuśalamūlāni /
analyzed: teṣām ca sarveṣām yāni kuśala mūlāni  yāni ca śrāvaka yānikānām pudgalānām dāna mayāni kuśala mūlāni śīla mayāni kuśala mūlāni bhāvanā mayāni kuśala mūlāni
translated: And all their wholesome roots,🔽and the wholesome roots consisting of giving, morality, and meditation of the persons in the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

analyzed: yāni ca śaikṣāṇi anāsravāṇi kuśala mūlāni
translated: and the wholesome roots of the learners that are without outflows,

analyzed: yāni ca aśaikṣāṇi anāsravāṇi kuśala mūlāni
translated: and the wholesome roots of the adepts that are without outflows,

original: yaiś ca tasmin dharme pṛthagjanaiḥ kuśalamūlānyavaropitāni avaropayiṣyante 'varopyante ca /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca tasmin dharme pṛthagjanaiḥ kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni avaropayiṣyante varopyante ca
translated: and the wholesome roots that are planted in that Dharma by the worldlings, will plant, have planted, and are planting,

original: yaiś ca devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragairmanuṣyāmanuṣyairvā sa dharmaḥ śrutaḥ śroṣyate śrūyate ca /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoragaiḥ manuṣya amanuṣyaiḥ vā sa dharmaḥ śrutaḥ śroṣyate śrūyate ca
translated: and by which gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans have heard, will hear, and are hearing that Dharma,

analyzed: śrutvā ca kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni avaropayiṣyante varopyante ca
translated: and having heard, have planted, will plant, and are planting wholesome roots,

original: yaiś ca tiryagyonigatair api sattvaiḥ sa dharmaḥ śrutaḥ śroṣyate śrūyate ca /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca tiryagyoni gataiḥ api sattvaiḥ sa dharmaḥ śrutaḥ śroṣyate śrūyate ca
translated: and by which beings born as animals have heard, will hear, and are hearing that Dharma,

analyzed: śrutvā ca kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni avaropayiṣyante varopyante ca
translated: and having heard, have planted, will plant, and are planting wholesome roots,

original: yaiś ca sattvaisteṣu buddheṣu bhagavatsu parinirvṛteṣu parinirvāsyatsu parinirvāyatsu ca kuśalamūlānyavaropitāni avaropayiṣyante 'varopyante
analyzed: yaiḥ ca sattvaiḥ teṣu buddheṣu bhagavatsu parinirvṛteṣu parinirvāsyatsu parinirvāyatsu ca kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni avaropayiṣyante varopyante
translated: And those sentient beings who have planted wholesome roots in those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who have attained final nirvāṇa, who will attain final nirvāṇa, who are attaining final nirvāṇa,

analyzed: teṣām ca sarveṣām yāni kuśala mūlāni
translated: and all their wholesome roots,

original: tāni sarvāṇyakato 'bhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā niravaśeṣya niravaśeṣamagrayā anumodanayā anumodeta /
analyzed: tāni sarvāṇi akataḥ bhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā niravaśeṣya niravaśeṣam agrayā anumodanayā anumodeta
translated: having combined them all together, having collected them together, having weighed them, having left out nothing, having left out nothing whatsoever, he should rejoice in them with the highest rejoicing,

original: śreṣṭhayā jyeṣṭhayā varayā pravarayā praṇītayā uttamayā anuttamayā niruttamayā asamayā asamasamayā anumodanayā anumodeta /🔽evamanumodya anumodanāsahagataṃ puṇyakriyāvastu anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayāmīti vācaṃ bhāṣeta anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodherāhārakaṃ
analyzed: śreṣṭhayā jyeṣṭhayā varayā pravarayā praṇītayā uttamayā anuttamayā niruttamayā asamayā asamasamayā anumodanayā anumodeta  evam anumodya anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayāmi iti vācam bhāṣeta anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ āhārakam
translated: with the best, the most excellent, the foremost, the supreme, the unsurpassed, the unequalled, the equal of the unequaled rejoicing, he should rejoice.

analyzed: bhavatu iti
translated: Having rejoiced thus, he should utter this statement: 'I dedicate the wholesome action associated with rejoicing to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,' or 'May it lead to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.'

original: tasya kathaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na saṃjñāviparyāso na cittaviparyāso na dṛṣṭiviparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: tasya katham bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ na citta viparyāsaḥ na dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: How does that Bodhisattva-Mahāsattva not have the inversion of perception, the inversion of mind, or the inversion of view?

original: sacetpariṇāmayan evaṃ samanvāharati te dharmāḥ kṣīṇā niruddhā vigatā vipariṇatāḥ /🔽sa ca dharmo 'kṣayo yatra pariṇāmyate ityevaṃ pariṇāmitaṃ bhavatyanuttarāyāṃ Vaidya
analyzed: saced pariṇāmayan evam samanvāharati te dharmāḥ kṣīṇāḥ niruddhāḥ vigatāḥ vipariṇatāḥ  sa ca dharmo kṣayaḥ yatra pariṇāmyate iti evam pariṇāmitam bhavati anuttarāyām vaidya
translated: If, while dedicating, he reflects in this way: ‘Those dharmas have ceased, stopped, disappeared, and changed;

analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: and that dharma into which one dedicates is imperishable.’ In this way, the dedication becomes dedicated to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: saced punar evam upaparīkṣate na dharmaḥ dharmam pariṇāmayati
translated: If, on the other hand, he examines in this way: ‘A dharma does not dedicate a dharma,’

analyzed: iti api pariṇāmitam bhavati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: in this way also the dedication becomes dedicated to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: evaṃ bhadantaṃ subhūte pariṇāmayato bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na saṃjñāviparyāso na cittaviparyāso na dṛṣṭiviparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: evam bhadantam subhūte pariṇāmayataḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ na citta viparyāsaḥ na dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: Venerable Subhūti, when a bodhisattva-mahāsattva dedicates in this way, he does not have the perversion of perception, the perversion of thought, or the perversion of view.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi sa tāṃ pariṇāmanāṃ nābhiniviśate /
analyzed: tathā hi sa tām pariṇāmanām na abhiniviśate
translated: Because he does not cling to that dedication.

original: sacetpunarevaṃ saṃjānīte na cittaṃ cittaṃ jānāti /
analyzed: saced punar evam saṃjānīte na cittam cittam jānāti
translated: If, on the other hand, he perceives in this way: ‘The mind does not know the mind,’

analyzed: na dharmaḥ dharmam jānāti
translated: ‘A dharma does not know a dharma,’

analyzed: iti api pariṇāmitam bhavati anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye
translated: in this way also the dedication becomes dedicated to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: ayam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anuttaraḥ pariṇāmaḥ
translated: This is the unsurpassed dedication of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

analyzed: saced punar bodhisattvaḥ tam puṇya abhisaṃskāram saṃjānīte
translated: If, on the other hand, the bodhisattva perceives that meritorious action,

analyzed: na pariṇāmayati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: and does not dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: why is that?

analyzed: tathā hi sa tām pariṇāmanām abhiniviśate
translated: Because he is attached to that dedication.

original: sacetpunarasyaivaṃ bhavati so 'pi puṇyābhisaṃskāro viviktaḥ śāntaḥ /
analyzed: saced punar asya evam bhavati saḥ pi puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ viviktaḥ śāntaḥ
translated: If, on the other hand, he thinks that meritorious action is also secluded and peaceful,

original: yadapyanumodanāsahagataṃ puṇyakriyāvastu tad api viviktaṃ śāntamiti pariṇāmayatyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yat api anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu tat api viviktam śāntam iti pariṇāmayati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: and dedicates the meritorious action associated with rejoicing to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment as secluded and peaceful,

original: sacedevam api na saṃjānīte sarvasaṃskārāḥ śāntā viviktā iti /
analyzed: saced evam api na saṃjānīte sarva saṃskārāḥ śāntāḥ viviktāḥ iti
translated: if he does not perceive all conditioned things as peaceful and secluded in this way,

original: evamiyaṃ tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā yad api tatteṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ parinirvṛtānāṃ kuśalamūlam /
analyzed: evam iyam tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā yat api tat teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām parinirvṛtānām kuśala mūlam
translated: then that is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's perfection of wisdom regarding the wholesome roots of those Buddhas and Blessed Ones who have attained parinirvāṇa.

analyzed: yādṛśaḥ eva sa pariṇāmaḥ tādṛśam eva tat kuśala mūlam
translated: Just as is that dedication, just like that are those wholesome roots.

original: yenāpi tatpariṇāmitaṃ tad api tajjātikaṃ tallakṣaṇaṃ tannikāyaṃ tatsvabhāvam /
analyzed: yena api tat pariṇāmitam tat api tad jātikam tad lakṣaṇam tad nikāyam tad svabhāvam
translated: By what it is dedicated, that is also of that kind, of that characteristic, of that class, of that nature.

analyzed: saced evam saṃjānīte
translated: If he perceives in this way,

analyzed: na pariṇāmayati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: He does not dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: na hi buddhā bhagavanto nimittayogena pariṇāmanāmabhyanujānanti /
analyzed: na hi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ nimitta yogena pariṇāmanām abhyanujānanti
translated: Because the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, do not allow dedication through a sign.

analyzed: yat ca atītam tat kṣīṇam niruddham vigatam vipariṇatam
translated: And what is past has ceased, ended, departed, and changed;

analyzed: yat api anāgatam tat api asaṃprāptam
translated: and what is future has not yet come;

analyzed: pratyutpannasya sthitiḥ na upalabhyate
translated: and the present is not apprehended as remaining.

original: yacca nopalabhyate tannaiva nimittaṃ na viṣayaḥ /
analyzed: yat ca nā upalabhyate tat nā eva nimittam na viṣayaḥ
translated: And what is not apprehended is neither a sign nor an object.

analyzed: saced evam nimittīkaroti
translated: If he makes it into a sign in that way,

analyzed: na samanvāharati na pariṇāmayati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: he does not dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: atha smṛtivaikalyena na nimittīkaroti na samanvāharati na manasi karoti smṛtivaikalyādanavabodhādvā /
analyzed: atha smṛti vaikalyena na nimittīkaroti na samanvāharati na manasi karoti smṛti vaikalyāt anavabodhāt vā
translated: But if he does not make it into a sign due to a lack of mindfulness, does not bring it to mind, does not pay attention to it, due to a lack of mindfulness or lack of understanding,

analyzed: evam api na pariṇāmayati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: in that case also he does not dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: atha tad nimitam samanvāharati
translated: But if he brings that sign to mind,

analyzed: na ca nimittīkaroti
translated: and does not make it into a sign,

original: evaṃ pariṇāmitaṃ bhavati tatkuśalamūlaṃ bodhisattvena mahāsattvenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: evam pariṇāmitam bhavati tat kuśala mūlam bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: in that way the bodhisattva mahāsattva has dedicated that wholesome action to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: evamatra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena śikṣitavyam idaṃ tadbodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyopāyakauśalaṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: evam atra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena śikṣitavyam idam tat bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya upāya kauśalam veditavyam
translated: In this way, a bodhisattva great being should train here. This should be known as the skill in means of a bodhisattva great being,

analyzed: yena upāya kauśalena kuśala mūlam pariṇāmayati
translated: through which skill in means they dedicate the wholesome roots.

analyzed: saḥ āsannaḥ sarvajña tāyāḥ
translated: They are close to omniscience.

original: atra copāyakauśalaṃ śikṣitukāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena iyameva prajñāpāramitā
analyzed: atra ca upāya kauśalam śikṣitu kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena iyam eva prajñāpāramitā
translated: And for one who wishes to train in this skill in means, this very perfection of wisdom

original: abhīkṣṇaṃ śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā
analyzed: abhīkṣṇam śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā
translated: should be listened to again and again, taken up, borne in mind, recited, mastered,

analyzed: deśayitavyā upadeṣṭavyā uddeṣṭavyā su ādhyātavyā paripraśnīkartavyā
translated: taught, explained, expounded, recited, and thoroughly inquired into.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: na hi prajñāpāramitāmanāgamya śakyeyamaśrutavatā prajñāpāramitāpariṇāmanākriyā praveṣṭum /
analyzed: na hi prajñāpāramitām an āgamya śakyā iyam a śrutavatā prajñāpāramitā pariṇāmanā kriyā praveṣṭum
translated: Without coming to the perfection of wisdom, it is not possible for one who has not heard it to enter into the practice of dedicating the perfection of wisdom.

original: tatra ya evaṃ vadet śakyamanāgamya prajñāpāramitāṃ tatpuṇyakriyāvastu anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayitumiti /
analyzed: tatra yaḥ evam vadet śakyam an āgamya prajñāpāramitām tat puṇya kriyā vastu anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayitum iti
translated: There, one who would say this: 'It is possible to dedicate that wholesome action to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening without coming to the perfection of wisdom,'

analyzed: sa mā evam vocat iti syāt vacanīyaḥ
translated: should be addressed thus: 'Do not speak thus.'

original: api tu khalu punaḥ sa pudgalo nimittīkṛtya vikalpya ca yathābhūtamayathābhūte yathābhūtasaṃjñī upalambhamanupalambhe pariṇāmayet /

translated: thus I dedicate it to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.'

original: evamanumodamāna evaṃ pariṇāmayan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'naparāddho bhavati /

analyzed: anutpannā aniruddhā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā

analyzed: tathā eva namaskartavyā śāriputra prajñāpāramitā yathā śāstā  atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasya etat abhūt kutas nu bata iyam āryasya śāriputrasya pṛcchā jātā
translated: Śāriputra, you should pay homage to the perfection of wisdom as you would to the Teacher.🔽Then this occurred to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: From where has this question arisen for the noble Śāriputra?

analyzed: kiṃnidānā bata iyam āryasya śāriputrasya pṛcchā jātā
translated: What is the cause of this question of the noble Śāriputra?

translated: Then indeed Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Venerable Śāriputra: From where, Noble Śāriputra, did this question of yours arise?

original: kiṃnidānā bateyamāryasya śāriputrasya pṛcchā jātā /🔽evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyaparigṛhītaḥ
analyzed: kiṃnidānā bata iyam āryasya śāriputrasya pṛcchā jātā  evam ukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ śakram devānām indram etat avocat prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya parigṛhītaḥ
translated: What is the cause of this question of yours, Noble Śāriputra?🔽When this was said, the Venerable Śāriputra said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: Kauśika, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is embraced by the perfection of wisdom and skillful means,

analyzed: kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nu modanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu sarvajña tāyām pariṇāmayan teṣām
translated: when dedicating the wholesome action associated with rejoicing to omniscience,🔽and that wholesome action of generosity

translated: of those bodhisattvas of the past who practiced with reference points,🔽and that wholesome action of morality,🔽that wholesome action of patience,🔽that wholesome action of vigor,

analyzed: yaḥ ca śīla mayaḥ yaḥ ca kṣānti mayaḥ yaḥ ca vīrya mayaḥ yaḥ ca dhyāna mayaḥ puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ
translated: and that wholesome action of concentration,

analyzed: tam sarvam abhibhavati iti
translated: surpasses them all.

analyzed: mama iyam etad nidānā pṛcchā jātā
translated: This is the cause of my question.

original: api nu khalu punaḥ kauśika prajñāpāramitaiva pūrvaṃgamā pañcānāṃ pāramitānāṃ sarvajñatāmārgāvatārāya /
analyzed: api nu khalu punar kauśika prajñāpāramitā eva pūrvaṃgamā pañcānām pāramitānām sarvajña tā mārga avatārāya
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, is it not the perfection of wisdom itself that precedes the five perfections in entering the path to omniscience?

original: tadyathāpi nāma kauśika jātyandhānāṃ śataṃ vā sahasraṃ vā śatasahasraṃ vā apariṇāyakamabhavyaṃ mārgāvatārāya /

translated: Just as, Kauśika, a hundred or a thousand or a hundred thousand blind from birth cannot enter a path without a guide,

original: abhavyaṃ grāmaṃ vā nagaraṃ vā nigamaṃ vā gantum /

translated: and are unable to go to a village or town or city,

original: evameva kauśika dānaṃ śīlaṃ kṣāntivīryaṃ dhyānaṃ ca prajñāpāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika dānam śīlam kṣānti vīryam dhyānam ca prajñāpāramitā nāmadheyam labhate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, giving, morality, patience, perseverance, and concentration obtain the name of perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: jāti andha bhūtam bhavati vinā prajñāpāramitayā apariṇāyaka tvāt
translated: They become like the blind from birth without the perfection of wisdom, because they lack a guide.

analyzed: abhavyam sarvajña tā mārga avatārāya
translated: They are unable to enter the path to omniscience.

analyzed: kutas punar sarvajña tām anuprāpsyati
translated: How then will they attain omniscience?

original: yadā punaḥ kauśika dānaṃ śīlaṃ kṣāntirvīyaṃ dhyānaṃ ca prajñāpāramitāparigṛhītaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yadā punar kauśika dānam śīlam kṣāntiḥ vīyam dhyānam ca prajñāpāramitā parigṛhītam bhavati
translated: But when, Kauśika, giving, morality, patience, perseverance, and concentration are taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: tadā pāramitā nāmadheyam pāramitā śabdam labhate
translated: then they obtain the name of perfection, the word perfection.

original: tadā hyāsāṃ cakṣuḥpratilambho bhavati pañcānāṃ pāramitānāṃ sarvajñatāmārgāvatārāya sarvajñatānuprāptaye //
analyzed: tadā hi āsām cakṣuḥ pratilambhaḥ bhavati pañcānām pāramitānām sarvajña tā mārga avatārāya sarvajña tā anuprāptaye
translated: For then the five perfections obtain eyes in order to enter the path to omniscience and attain omniscience.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocat kathaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā abhinirhartavyā /

analyzed: evam vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām
translated: Likewise, the accomplishment of feeling, perception, volitional formations,

analyzed: vijñānasya śāriputra abhinirhāraḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: and consciousness should be seen, Śāriputra.

analyzed: yaḥ śāriputra pañcānām skandhānām abhinirhāraḥ
translated: Śāriputra, the accomplishment of the five aggregates

analyzed: ayam śāriputra prajñāpāramitāyāḥ abhinirhāraḥ iti ucyate
translated: is called the accomplishment of the perfection of wisdom, Śāriputra.

original: evamabhinirhāreṇa pañcānāṃ skandhānāmabhinirhāraḥ prajñāpāramitāyā abhinirhāro 'bhinirhāra ityucyate //
analyzed: evam abhinirhāreṇa pañcānām skandhānām abhinirhāraḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ abhinirhāraḥ bhinirhāraḥ iti ucyate
translated: Thus, the accomplishment of the five aggregates through such an accomplishment is called the accomplishment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocat evamabhinirhāreṇa abhinirhṛtā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā katamaṃ dharmamarpayati /
