translated: When this was said, the venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, when the perfection of wisdom is accomplished through such an accomplishment, what dharma does it point to?

original: bhagavānāha evamabhinirhṛtā śāriputra prajñāpāramitā na kaṃciddharmamarpayati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha evam abhinirhṛtā śāriputra prajñāpāramitā na kaṃcid dharmam arpayati
translated: The Blessed One said, Thus, Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom, when fully accomplished, does not bestow anything on anyone.

analyzed: yadā sā śāriputra na kaṃcid dharmam arpayati
translated: When, Śāriputra, it does not bestow anything on anyone,

analyzed: tadā prajñāpāramitā iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: then it is reckoned as the perfection of wisdom.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro bhagavantametadavocat kimiyaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sarvajñatām api nārpayati /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kim iyam bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sarvajña tām api na arpayati
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, does this perfection of wisdom not even bestow omniscience?

original: bhagavānāha yatkauśika evaṃ vadasi kimiyaṃ prajñāpāramitā sarvajñatām api nārpayatīti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha yat kauśika evam vadasi kim iyam prajñāpāramitā sarvajña tām api na arpayati iti
translated: The Blessed One said, Kauśika, as for what you say - 'does this perfection of wisdom not even bestow omniscience?'

analyzed: na yathā upalambhaḥ tathā arpayati
translated: It does not bestow as it is apprehended.

analyzed: na yathā nāma tathā arpayati
translated: It does not bestow as it is named.

analyzed: na yathā abhisaṃskāraḥ tathā arpayati
translated: It does not bestow as it is imagined.

analyzed: śakraḥ āha katham tarhi bhagavan arpayati
translated: Śakra said, Well then, Blessed One, how does it bestow?

analyzed: bhagavān āha yathā kauśika na arpayati tathā arpayati
translated: The Blessed One said, Kauśika, it bestows as it does not bestow.

original: śakra āha āścaryaṃ bhagavan yāvadiyaṃ prajñāpāramitā na kaṃciddharmamutpādayati /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha āścaryam bhagavan yāvat iyam prajñāpāramitā na kaṃcid dharmam utpādayati
translated: Śakra said, It is amazing, Blessed One, that this perfection of wisdom does not produce any dharma at all,

analyzed: na kaṃcid dharmam nirodhayati
translated: and does not stop any dharma.

analyzed: sarva dharmāṇām anutpādāya anirodhāya pratyupasthitā anupasthitā prajñāpāramitā
translated: The perfection of wisdom is present and not present for the non-production, non-cessation of all dharmas.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocat sacedevam api bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo saṃjñāsyate /🔽dūrīkariṣyati imāṃ prajñāpāramitām /🔽riktīkariṣyati imāṃ prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat saced evam api bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saṃjñāsyate  dūrīkariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām  riktīkariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti said this to the Blessed One: If, Blessed One, a Bodhisattva, a great being, would cognize even thus,🔽he would keep far away from this perfection of wisdom.🔽He would empty this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tucchīkariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: He would make this perfection of wisdom void.

analyzed: na kariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: He would not do this perfection of wisdom.

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocat evametatsubhūte / evam etat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat evam etat subhūte evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to the venerable Subhuti: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

analyzed: asti eṣa subhūte paryāyaḥ yena vaidya
translated: There is this method, Subhuti, by which method

analyzed: paryāyeṇa dūrīkariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām  riktīkariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: a doctor would keep far away from this perfection of wisdom.🔽He would empty this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tucchīkariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: He would make this perfection of wisdom void.

analyzed: na kariṣyati imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: He would not do this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ hi subhūte paridīpitāyāṃ na rūpaṃ paridīpitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām hi subhūte paridīpitāyām na rūpam paridīpitam bhavati
translated: For, Subhuti, when the perfection of wisdom is explained, form is not explained.

original: na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ
translated: not feeling, not perception, not volitional formations,🔽

analyzed: na vijñānam paridīpitam bhavati
translated: It is not feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness.

original: na srotaāpattiphalaṃ paridīpitaṃ bhavati /🔽na sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ paridīpitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na srotaāpatti phalam paridīpitam bhavati  na sakṛdāgāmi phalam paridīpitam bhavati
translated: It is not the fruit of stream-entry that is revealed.🔽It is not the fruit of once-returning that is revealed.

analyzed: na anāgāmi phalam paridīpitam bhavati
translated: It is not the fruit of non-returning that is revealed.

original: nārhattvaṃ paridīpitaṃ bhavati /🔽na pratyekabuddhatvaṃ paridīpitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na arhat tvam paridīpitam bhavati  na pratyekabuddha tvam paridīpitam bhavati
translated: It is not arhatship that is revealed.🔽It is not individual enlightenment that is revealed.

analyzed: na buddha tvam paridīpitam bhavati
translated: It is not Buddhahood that is revealed.

original: sthaviraḥ subhūtirāha mahāpāramiteyaṃ bhagavan yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: sthaviraḥ subhūtiḥ āha mahā pāramitā iyam bhagavan yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: The elder Subhūti said, Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is a great perfection.

original: bhagavānāha tatkiṃ manyase subhūte katamena paryāyeṇa mahāpāramiteyaṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat kim manyase subhūte katamena paryāyeṇa mahā pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: The Blessed One said, What do you think, Subhūti? In what sense is this perfection of wisdom a great perfection?

original: sthaviraḥ subhūtirāha na bhagavan rūpaṃ mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti /
analyzed: sthaviraḥ subhūtiḥ āha na bhagavan rūpam mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti
translated: The elder Subhūti said, Blessed One, it is not that form is made great or made small.

analyzed: na rūpam saṃkṣipati na vikṣipati
translated: It is not that form is contracted or expanded.

original: evaṃ na vedanāṃ na saṃjñāṃ na saṃskārān /
analyzed: evam na vedanām na saṃjñām na saṃskārān
translated: Similarly, it is not that feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness are made great or made small.

analyzed: na bhagavan vijñānam mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti
translated: Blessed One, it is not that consciousness is made great or made small.

analyzed: na vijñānam saṃkṣipati na vikṣipati
translated: It is not that consciousness is contracted or expanded.

analyzed: yāni api tāni tathāgatasya tathāgata balāni
translated: Those powers of a Tathāgata,

original: tāny api na balīkaroti na durbalīkaroti /
analyzed: tāni api na balīkaroti na durbalīkaroti
translated: he does not make them powerful or weak,

analyzed: na saṃkṣipati na vikṣipati
translated: does not contract or expand them.

analyzed: yā api sā sarvajña tā
translated: And that omniscience,

analyzed: tām api na mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti
translated: he does not make it great or small,

analyzed: na saṃkṣipati na vikṣipati
translated: does not contract or expand it.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: asaṃkṣiptā avikṣiptā hi bhagavan sarvajña tā
translated: Because, Blessed One, omniscience is not contracted or expanded.

original: sacedevam api bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ saṃjānīte /
analyzed: saced evam api bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saṃjānīte
translated: If, Blessed One, a bodhisattva great being cognizes it in this way,

analyzed: carati prajñāpāramitāyām note
translated: he practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: na carati according to Conze's translation /
analyzed: na carati according to conzes translation
translated: He does not practice according to Conze's translation.

original: kiṃ punarevaṃ saṃjānānaḥ evamahaṃ sarvajñajñānasamanvāgata sattvebhyo dharmaṃ deśayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: kim punar evam saṃjānānaḥ evam aham sarvajña jñāna samanvāgata sattvebhyaḥ dharmam deśayiṣyāmi
translated: Moreover, if he cognizes thus: In this way I, endowed with omniscient knowledge, will teach the Dharma to beings,

analyzed: evam imān sattvān parinirvāpayiṣyāmi iti
translated: in this way I will bring these beings to complete nirvāṇa,

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: why is that?

original: na hyeṣa prajñāpāramitāniṣyando ya imān sattvān parinirvāpayiṣyāmīti sattvopalambhaḥ /
analyzed: na hi eṣa prajñāpāramitā nisyandaḥ yaḥ imān sattvān parinirvāpayiṣyāmi iti sattva upalambhaḥ
translated: Because this is not the outflow of the perfection of wisdom: I will bring these beings to complete nirvāṇa, which is the perception of beings.

analyzed: eṣaḥ eva asya mahā anupalambhaḥ syāt
translated: This would be his great perception.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sattva asvabhāva jātikā hi prajñāpāramitā veditavyā  sattva asvabhāva tayā prajñāpāramitā svabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of beings should be known as the nature of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The nature of beings being empty, the nature of the perfection of wisdom should be known as empty.🔽The nature of beings being isolated, the nature of the perfection of wisdom should be known as isolated.

original: sattvaviviktatayā prajñāpāramitāviviktatā veditavyā /🔽sattvācintyatayā prajñāpāramitācintyatā veditavyā /🔽sattvāvināśadharmatayā prajñāpāramitāvināśadharmatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sattva vivikta tayā prajñāpāramitā vivikta tā veditavyā  sattva acintya tayā prajñāpāramitā acintya tā veditavyā  sattva avināśa dharma tayā prajñāpāramitā vināśa dharma tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of beings being inconceivable, the nature of the perfection of wisdom should be known as inconceivable.🔽The nature of beings being indestructible, the nature of the perfection of wisdom should be known as indestructible.

analyzed: sattva an abhisaṃbodhana tayā prajñāpāramitā an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā  sattva yathābhūta artha an abhisaṃbodhana tayā prajñāpāramitā yathābhūta artha an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of beings being non-awakened, the nature of the perfection of wisdom should be known as non-awakened.🔽The nature of beings being non-fully awakened to the meaning as it is, the nature of the perfection of wisdom should be known as non-fully awakened to the meaning as it is.

analyzed: sattva bala samudāgamana tayā tathāgata bala samudāgamana tā veditavyā
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be known as the perfection of the Tathagata's powers.

original: anena bhagavan paryāyeṇa mahāpāramiteyaṃ yaduta prajñāpāramitā //
analyzed: anena bhagavan paryāyeṇa mahā pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: By this method, Blessed One, this is a great perfection, namely the perfection of wisdom.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocat yo bhagavan iha gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat yaḥ bhagavan iha gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One: Blessed One, whoever in this deep perfection of wisdom

original: bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'dhimokṣayiṣyati na kāṅkṣiṣyati na vicikitsiṣyati na dhandhāyiṣyati /
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dhimokṣayiṣyati na kāṅkṣiṣyati na vicikitsiṣyati na dhandhāyiṣyati
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva will have conviction, will not doubt, will not be uncertain, will not be confused.

original: kutaḥ sa bhagavaṃścyuta ihopapanno veditavyaḥ /🔽kiyacciracaritāvī ca sa bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: kutas sa bhagavan cyutaḥ iha upapannaḥ veditavyaḥ  kiyat cira caritāvī ca sa bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: From where, Blessed One, will he be reborn here?

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāmarthataś ca dharmataś ca arthanayataś ca dharmanayataś ca anugamiṣyati anubhotsyate 'nubodhayiṣyati ca /
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām arthataḥ ca dharmataḥ ca artha nayataḥ ca dharma nayataḥ ca anugamiṣyati anubhotsyate nubodhayiṣyati ca
translated: For how long has that bodhisattva mahāsattva practiced, Blessed One, that he will follow, experience, and realize this perfection of wisdom in terms of its meaning and its teaching, in terms of the method of its meaning and the method of its teaching?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocat sa śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat sa śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Śāriputra: That bodhisattva mahāsattva, Śāriputra,

original: 'nyebhyo lokadhātubhyaścyuto buddhān bhagavataḥ paryupāsya paripṛcchya ihopapanno veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: nyebhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ cyutaḥ buddhān bhagavataḥ paryupāsya paripṛcchyaḥ iha upapannaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: should be known as one who has passed away from other world systems, has attended to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, has asked questions, and has been reborn here.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yaḥ kaścicchāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nyebhyo lokadhātubhyaścyuto buddhān bhagavataḥ paryupāsya paripṛcchaya Vaidya
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nyebhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ cyutaḥ buddhān bhagavataḥ paryupāsya vaidya
translated: Śāriputra, whoever a bodhisattva mahāsattva may be who has passed away from other world systems, has attended to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, has asked questions,

analyzed: iha upapannaḥ bhavati
translated: and has been reborn here,

original: sa imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāṃ deśyamānāmupadiśyamānāmuddiśyamānāṃ śṛṇuyāt /
analyzed: saḥ imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām bhāṣyamāṇām deśyamānām upadiśyamānām uddiśyamānām śṛṇuyāt
translated: He would hear this profound perfection of wisdom being taught, being shown, being made known, being expounded.

original: imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śrutvā atra śāstṛsaṃjñāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāmutpādayet śāstā me saṃmukhībhūt iti /
analyzed: imām prajñāpāramitām śrutvā atra śāstṛ saṃjñām prajñāpāramitāyām utpādayet śāstā me saṃmukhībhūt iti
translated: Having heard this perfection of wisdom, he would generate the notion of a teacher towards the perfection of wisdom, thinking 'The teacher has appeared to me.'

analyzed: śāstā me dṛṣṭaḥ iti cittam utpādayati
translated: He would generate the thought 'The teacher has been seen by me.'

analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām deśyamānāyām upadiśyamānāyām uddiśyamānāyām śrotram avadadhāti
translated: When the perfection of wisdom is being taught, being shown, being made known, being expounded, he would lend an ear.

analyzed: satkṛtya śṛṇoti
translated: He would listen respectfully.

analyzed: kathām na upacchinatti
translated: He would not interrupt the story.

original: ciracaritāvī sa śāriputra tathārūpo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: cira caritāvī sa śāriputra tathārūpaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Śāriputra, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one who has practiced for a long time.

original: bahubuddhaparyupāsitaḥ sa śāriputra tathārūpo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ //
analyzed: bahu buddha paryupāsitaḥ sa śāriputra tathārūpaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Śāriputra, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one who has attended many buddhas.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocat śakyā punarbhagavan prajñāpāramitā śrotuṃ vā upalakṣyayituṃ vā samanvāhartuṃ vā upapādayituṃ
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat śakyā punar bhagavan prajñāpāramitā śrotum vā upalakṣyayitum vā samanvāhartum vā upapādayitum
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, is it possible to hear the perfection of wisdom, to understand it, to comprehend it, to realize it,

analyzed: vā upadhārayitum vā
translated: or to grasp it?

original: iyaṃ sā prajñāpāramitā /🔽iha vā sā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: iyam sā prajñāpāramitā  iha vā sā prajñāpāramitā
translated: This is that perfection of wisdom.🔽Or this perfection of wisdom is here,

analyzed: amutra vā sā prajñāpāramitā
translated: or that perfection of wisdom is over there.

original: anena vā ākāreṇa liṅgena nimitteneti śakyā nirdeṣṭuṃ vā śrotuṃ vā /
analyzed: anena vai ākāreṇa liṅgena nimittena iti śakyāḥ nirdeṣṭum vā śrotum vā
translated: It cannot be indicated, heard, or understood by this aspect, sign, or indication.

original: bhagavānāha no hīdaṃ subhūte /🔽neyaṃ subhūte prajñāpāramitā skandhaśo vā dhātuśo vā āyatanaśo vā śakyā nirdeṣṭuṃ vā śrotuṃ vā upalakṣayituṃ vā samanvāhartuṃ vā upapādayituṃ
analyzed: bhagavān āha no hi idam subhūte  na iyam subhūte prajñāpāramitā skandhaśas vā dhātuśas vā āyatanaśas vā śakyā nirdeṣṭum vā śrotum vā upalakṣayitum vā samanvāhartum vā upapādayitum
translated: The Blessed One said, No, Subhuti.🔽Subhuti, this perfection of wisdom cannot be indicated, heard, perceived, contemplated, or understood by way of the aggregates, elements, or sense bases.

analyzed: vā upadhārayitum vā
translated: It cannot be indicated, heard, perceived, contemplated, or understood.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sarva dharma vivikta tvāt subhūte
translated: Subhuti, it is because all phenomena are isolated.

original: atyantaviviktatvātsubhūte sarvadharmāṇāṃ na śakyā prajñāpāramitā nirdeṣṭuṃ vā śrotuṃ vā upalakṣayituṃ vā samanvāhartuṃ vā upapādayituṃ vā upadhārayituṃ 🔽vā /
analyzed: atyanta vivikta tvāt subhūte sarva dharmāṇām na śakyā prajñāpāramitā nirdeṣṭum vā śrotum vā upalakṣayitum vā samanvāhartum vā upapādayitum vā upadhārayitum  vā
translated: Subhuti, because all phenomena are utterly isolated, the perfection of wisdom cannot be indicated, heard, perceived, contemplated, or understood.

analyzed: na ca anyatra skandha dhātu āyatanebhyaḥ prajñāpāramitā avaboddhavyā
translated: And the perfection of wisdom should not be understood apart from the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: skandhadhātvāyatanameva hi subhūte śūnyaṃ viviktaṃ śāntam /
analyzed: skandha dhātu āyatanam eva hi subhūte śūnyam viviktam śāntam
translated: Subhuti, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases themselves are empty, isolated, and peaceful.

original: iti hi prajñāpāramitā ca skandhadhātvāyatanaṃ ca advayametadadvaidhīkāraṃ śūnyatvādviviktatvāt /
analyzed: iti hi prajñāpāramitā ca skandha dhātu āyatanam ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram śūnya tvāt vivikta tvāt
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom and the aggregates, elements, and sense fields are non-dual, indivisible, empty, and isolated.

analyzed: evam śānta tvāt na upalabhyate
translated: Thus, because of peace, it is not perceived.

analyzed: yaḥ n upalambhaḥ sarva dharmāṇām
translated: The non-perception of all phenomena

analyzed: sā prajñāpāramitā iti ucyate
translated: is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: yadā na bhavati saṃjñā samajñā prajñaptirvyavahāraḥ /
analyzed: yadā na bhavati saṃjñā samajñā prajñaptiḥ vyavahāraḥ
translated: When there is no conception, right conception, designation, or convention,

analyzed: tadā prajñāpāramitā iti ucyate
translated: then it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: sthaviraḥ subhūtirāha kiyacciracaritāvī sa bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyo ya iha gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogamāpatsyate /
analyzed: sthaviraḥ subhūtiḥ āha kiyat cira caritāvī sa bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ yaḥ iha gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpatsyate
translated: The elder Subhūti said, Blessed One, how long has that bodhisattva mahāsattva been practicing, who will engage in this profound perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: bhagavān āha vibhajya vyākaraṇīyam etat subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām indriya adhimātra tayā
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, this should be explained by distinguishing it according to the bodhisattvas' mahāsattvas' superior faculties.

original: syātkhalu punaḥ subhūte paryāyo yena paryāyeṇa bodhisattvā bahūni buddhaśatāni bahūni
analyzed: syāt khalu punar subhūte paryāyaḥ yena paryāyeṇa bodhisattvāḥ bahūni buddha śatāni bahūni
translated: Subhūti, there may be a case where bodhisattvas, by that method, having seen many hundreds of buddhas,

original: buddhasahasrāṇi bahūni buddhaśatasahasrāṇi dṛṣṭvā teṣāmantike brahmacaryaṃ caritvā
analyzed: buddha sahasrāṇi bahūni buddha śata sahasrāṇi dṛṣṭvā teṣām antike brahmacaryam caritvā
translated: many thousands of buddhas, many hundreds of thousands of buddhas, having practiced the holy life in their presence,

analyzed: imām prajñāpāramitām na śraddadhyuḥ na adhimuñceyuḥ
translated: They will not have faith in this perfection of wisdom, they will not believe in it.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: pūrvam api teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmantikādasyāṃ gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ deśyamānāyāmupadiśyamānāyāmagauravatā abhūt /
analyzed: pūrvam api teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt asyām gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām deśyamānāyām upadiśyamānāyām agaurava tā abhūt
translated: Previously, when this deep perfection of wisdom was being taught, being shown, being revealed by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, they had no respect for it.

analyzed: agaurava tayā a śuśrūṣaṇa tā  a śuśrūṣaṇa tayā a paryupāsana tā
translated: Because of their lack of respect, they did not listen.🔽Because of not listening, they did not attend on it.

analyzed: a paryupāsana tayā a paripṛcchana tā  a paripṛcchana tayā a śraddadhāna tā
translated: Because of not attending on it, they did not ask questions.🔽Because of not asking questions, they did not have faith.

analyzed: a śraddadhāna tayā tatas upakrāntāḥ
translated: Because of not having faith, they left that assembly.

original: te tatonidānaṃ dharmavyasanasaṃvartanīyena karmaṇā kṛtena saṃcitena ācitena upacitena
analyzed: te tatonidānam dharma vyasana saṃvartanīyena karmaṇā kṛtena saṃcitena ācitena upacitena
translated: Because of that, they have created, accumulated, heaped up, and collected karma that leads to the destruction of the Dharma.

original: etarhy api gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ deśyamānāyāmupadiśyamānāyāmapakrāmanti /
analyzed: etarhi api gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām deśyamānāyām upadiśyamānāyām apakrāmanti
translated: Even now, when this deep perfection of wisdom is being taught, being shown, being revealed, they leave.

original: agauravatayā aśraddadhānā anadhimuñcanto na kāyena na cittena sāmagrīṃ dadati /
analyzed: agaurava tayā aśraddadhānāḥ an adhimuñcantaḥ na kāyena na cittena sāmagrīm dadati
translated: Because of their lack of respect, they do not have faith, they do not believe, they do not give their whole mind to it.

original: te sāmagrīmadadānā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ na jānanti na paśyanti na budhyante na vedayante /
analyzed: te sāmagrīm a dadānāḥ imām prajñāpāramitām na jānanti na paśyanti na budhyante na vedayante
translated: Those who do not give the collection, they do not know, do not see, do not understand, do not feel this perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ te prajñāpāramitāṃ na śraddadhati /🔽aśraddadhānā na śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: evam te prajñāpāramitām na śraddadhati  a śraddadhānāḥ na śṛṇvanti
translated: Thus they do not have faith in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Those who do not have faith do not listen.

original: Vaidya aśṛṇvanto na jānanti /🔽ajānanto na paśyanti /
analyzed: vaidya a śṛṇvantaḥ na jānanti  a jānantaḥ na paśyanti
translated: Those who do not listen do not know.🔽Those who do not know do not see.

analyzed: a paśyantaḥ na budhyante
translated: Those who do not see do not understand.

analyzed: a budhyamānāḥ dharma vyasana saṃvartanīyam karma kurvanti
translated: Those who do not understand create karma that leads to the destruction of the Dharma.

analyzed: saṃcinvanti ācinvanti upacinvanti
translated: They accumulate, collect, and hoard it.

original: te tena dharmavyasanasaṃvartanīyena karmaṇā kṛtena saṃcitena ācitena upacitena duṣprajñasaṃvartanīyaṃ karmābhisaṃskariṣyanti /🔽tena te duṣprajñasaṃvartanīyena karmaṇā abhisaṃskṛtena saṃcitenācitenopacitena imāṃ
analyzed: te tena dharma vyasana saṃvartanīyena karmaṇā kṛtena saṃcitena ācitena upacitena duṣprajña saṃvartanīyam karma abhisaṃskariṣyanti  tena te duṣprajña saṃvartanīyena karmaṇā abhisaṃskṛtena saṃcitena ācitena upacitena imām
translated: Having created, accumulated, collected, and hoarded that karma leading to the destruction of the Dharma, they will create karma leading to bad wisdom.🔽Having created, accumulated, collected, and hoarded that karma leading to bad wisdom, they will reject, oppose, and turn away from this perfection of wisdom

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāṃ deśyamānāmupadiśyamānāṃ pratyākhyāsyanti pratikṣepsyanti pratikrokṣyanti /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām bhāṣyamāṇām deśyamānām upadiśyamānām pratyākhyāsyanti pratikṣepsyanti pratikrokṣyanti
translated: which is being taught, explained, and shown.

analyzed: pratikṣipya ca apakramiṣyanti
translated: Having rejected it, they will leave.

original: asyāḥ khalu punaḥ subhūte prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pratyākhyānena pratikṣepeṇa pratikrośena atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sarvajñatā 🔽pratyākhyātā bhavati /🔽pratikṣiptā bhavati /
analyzed: asyāḥ khalu punar subhūte prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pratyākhyānena pratikṣepeṇa pratikrośena atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām sarvajña tā  / pratyākhyātā bhavati  pratikṣiptā bhavati
translated: of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present is rejected,

analyzed: pratikruṣṭā bhavati
translated: repudiated, and reviled.

analyzed: te sva saṃtānān upahatya dagdhāḥ pareṣām api alpabuddhikānām alpa prajñānām alpa puṇyānām alpa kuśala mūlānām
translated: Having harmed their own continuum and burned themselves, they will also cause others of little intelligence, little wisdom, little merit, and little wholesome roots,

analyzed: pudgalānām śraddhā mātraka samanvāgatānām prema mātraka samanvāgatānām prasāda mātraka samanvāgatānām
translated: individuals endowed with mere faith, endowed with mere love, endowed with mere confidence,

analyzed: chanda mātraka samanvāgatānām ādi karmikāṇām abhavya rūpāṇām tat api śraddhā mātrakam prema mātrakam
translated: endowed with mere aspiration, beginners, and those of an unsuitable form, to lose that mere faith, that mere love,

analyzed: prasāda mātrakam chanda mātrakam vicchandayiṣyanti vivecayiṣyanti vivartayiṣyanti
translated: that mere confidence, and that mere aspiration. They will separate them, alienate them, and turn them away.

analyzed: na atra śikṣitavyam iti vakṣyanti
translated: They will say, 'One should not train in this.'

analyzed: na etat buddha vacanam iti vācam bhāṣiṣyante
translated: They will speak the words, 'This is not the word of the Buddha.'

original: evaṃ te ātmasaṃtānānupahatya vivecya parasaṃtānānapyupahatya vivecya prajñāpāramitāmabhyākhyāsyanti /
analyzed: evam te ātma saṃtānān upahatya vivecya para saṃtānān api upahatya vivecya prajñāpāramitām abhyākhyāsyanti
translated: Thus, having harmed and separated their own continuums, they will also harm and separate the continuums of others, and will slander the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām abhyākhyātāyām sarvajña tā abhyākhyātā bhavati
translated: When the perfection of wisdom is slandered, omniscience is slandered.

analyzed: sarvajña tāyām abhyākhyātāyām atīta anāgata pratyutpannāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bhyākhyātāḥ bhavanti
translated: When omniscience is slandered, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present are slandered.

analyzed: te buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt apakrāntāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will turn away from the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

analyzed: dharmāt parimuktāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be separated from the Dharma.

analyzed: saṃghāt paribāhyāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be outside the Saṅgha.

original: evaṃ teṣāṃ sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ triratnātparibāhyabhāvo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam teṣām sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam triratnāt paribāhya bhāvaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Thus, in every way, they will be completely and totally separated from the Three Jewels.

original: te sattvānāṃ hitasukhopacchedakriyayā mahānirayavipākasaṃvartanīyaṃ karma upaceṣyanti /
analyzed: te sattvānām hita sukha upaccheda kriyayā mahāniraya vipāka saṃvartanīyam karma upaceṣyanti
translated: They will accumulate karma that leads to the ripening of a great hell, by cutting off the welfare and happiness of beings.

analyzed: te anena evaṃrūpeṇa karma abhisaṃskāreṇa upasthāpitena samutthāpitena dharma vyasana saṃvartanīyena
translated: By that kind of karmic formation, which is presented and aroused, which leads to the destruction of the Dharma,

original: duṣprajñasaṃvartanīyena karmaṇā bahūni varṣaśatāni bahūni varṣasahasrāṇi bahūni varṣaśatasahasrāṇi
analyzed: duṣprajña saṃvartanīyena karmaṇā bahūni varṣa śatāni bahūni varṣa sahasrāṇi bahūni varṣa śata sahasrāṇi
translated: Due to actions that lead to bad wisdom, they will be reborn in the great hells for many hundreds of years, many thousands of years, many hundreds of thousands of years,🔽many hundreds of millions of years, many billions of years, many trillions of years,

original: bahūni varṣakoṭīśatāni bahūni varṣakoṭīsahasrāṇi bahūni varṣakoṭīśatasahasrāṇi bahūni🔽varṣakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi mahānirayeṣūpapatsyante /
analyzed: bahūni varṣa koṭī śatāni bahūni varṣa koṭī sahasrāṇi bahūni varṣa koṭī śata sahasrāṇi bahūni  varṣa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi mahānirayeṣu upapatsyante
translated: many quadrillions of years.

analyzed: te mahānirayāt mahānirayam saṃkramiṣyanti
translated: They will go from one great hell to another great hell.

original: teṣāṃ tathā suciraṃ mahānirayānmahānirayaṃ saṃkrāmatāṃ tejaḥsaṃvartanī prādurbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām tathā su ciram mahānirayāt mahānirayam saṃkrāmatām tejaḥ saṃvartanī prādurbhaviṣyati
translated: While they are thus going from one great hell to another great hell for a very long time, a conflagration will appear.

original: tejaḥsaṃvartanyāṃ prādurbhūtāyāṃ ye 'nyeṣu lokadhātuṣu mahānirayāḥ /🔽tatra te kṣepsyante /🔽te teṣu mahānireyaṣu upapatsyante /
analyzed: tejaḥ saṃvartanyām prādurbhūtāyām ye nyeṣu lokadhātuṣu mahānirayāḥ  tatra te kṣepsyante  te teṣu mahānireyaṣu upapatsyante
translated: When the conflagration appears, they will be thrown into the great hells in other world systems.🔽They will be reborn there in the great hells.

original: te tatra vikṣiptāsteṣu mahānirayeṣūpapannāḥ samānāstatrāpi mahānirayānmahānirayaṃ saṃkramiṣyanti /
analyzed: te tatra vikṣiptāḥ teṣu mahānirayeṣu upapannāḥ samānāḥ tatra api mahānirayāt mahānirayam saṃkramiṣyanti
translated: When they are thrown there and reborn in those great hells, they will go from one great hell to another great hell.

original: teṣāṃ tatrāpi mahānirayānmahānirayaṃ saṃkrāmatāṃ tatrāpi punareva tathaiva tejaḥsaṃvartanī prādurbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām tatra api mahānirayāt mahānirayam saṃkrāmatām tatra api punar eva tathā eva tejaḥ saṃvartanī prādurbhaviṣyati
translated: Even there, when they pass from one great hell to another great hell, there too a conflagration will appear just as before.

original: te tasyāṃ tejaḥsaṃvartanyāṃ prādurbhūtāyāṃ tataścyutāḥ samānāḥ punareva anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu ye mahānirayāstatra kṣepsyante /
analyzed: te tasyām tejaḥ saṃvartanyām prādurbhūtāyām tatas cyutāḥ samānāḥ punar eva anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu ye mahānirayāḥ tatra kṣepsyante
translated: When that conflagration appears, they will be reborn in other world systems in the great hells.

analyzed: te teṣu mahānirayeṣu upapatsyante
translated: They will be reborn in those great hells.

analyzed: te tatra api tathā eva mahānirayāt mahānirayam saṃkramiṣyanti
translated: Even there, they will pass from one great hell to another great hell in the same way.

original: teṣāṃ tatrāpi suciraṃ mahānirayānmahānirayaṃ saṃkrāmatāṃ tatrāpi tathaiva tejaḥsaṃvartanī prādurbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām tatra api su ciram mahānirayāt mahānirayam saṃkrāmatām tatra api tathā eva tejaḥ saṃvartanī prādurbhaviṣyati
translated: Even there, when they pass from one great hell to another great hell for a long time, there too a conflagration will appear just as before.

original: te tasyāṃ tejaḥsaṃvartanyāṃ prādurbhūtāyāṃ punareva tataścyutāstenaiva akṣīṇena sāvaśeṣeṇa karmaṇā ihaiva lokadhātau punaḥ kṣepsyante /
analyzed: te tasyām tejaḥ saṃvartanyām prādurbhūtāyām punar eva tatas cyutāḥ tena eva akṣīṇena sa avaśeṣeṇa karmaṇā iha eva lokadhātau punar kṣepsyante
translated: When that conflagration appears, they will be reborn here in this world system again, with that karma not exhausted and still remaining.

analyzed: kṣiptāḥ santaḥ mahānirayeṣu upapatsyante
translated: When reborn, they will be reborn in the great hells.

original: te punareva tāni mahānirayeṣu mahānti mahānirayaduḥkhāni Vaidya 🔽pratyanubhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: te punar eva tāni mahānirayeṣu mahānti mahāniraya duḥkhāni vaidya 🔽pratyanubhaviṣyanti
translated: They will again experience the great sufferings of the great hells.

analyzed: tāvat pratyanubhaviṣyanti
translated: They will experience that for a long time.

analyzed: yāvat punar eva tejaḥ saṃvartanī prādurbhaviṣyati
translated: Until the conflagration of fire appears again.

analyzed: evam te bahu duḥkha vedanīyam karma pratyanubhaviṣyanti
translated: Thus they will experience karma that is to be felt as much suffering.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: yathā api nāma durbhāṣita tvāt vācaḥ
translated: It is just as if, because of bad speech,

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocat pañca bhagavan ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat pañca bhagavan ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, the five heinous actions

original: kṛtānyupacitāni asya manoduścaritasya vāgduścaritasya ca na prativarṇikāny api na
analyzed: kṛtāni upacitāni asya manaḥ duścaritasya vāc duścaritasya ca na api na
translated: are done and accumulated. They are not even similar to this mental misconduct and verbal misconduct,

original: anurūpāṇy api na pratirūpāṇy api bhavanti /
analyzed: anurūpāṇi api na pratirūpāṇi api bhavanti
translated: not even suitable, not even appropriate.

analyzed: bhagavān āha evam etat śāriputra evam etat
translated: The Blessed One said, So it is, Śāriputra. It is just as you say.

original: pañcānantaryāṇi śāriputra karmāṇi kṛtānyupacitānyasya manoduścaritasya ca vāgduścaritasya
analyzed: pañca ānantaryāṇi śāriputra karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni asya manaḥ duścaritasya ca vāc duścaritasya
translated: The five heinous actions, Śāriputra, are done and accumulated. They are not even similar to this mental misconduct and verbal misconduct,

original: ca na prativarṇikāny api na anurūpāṇy api na pratirūpāṇy api asya karmaṇaḥ kṛtasya
analyzed: ca na prativarṇikāni api na anurūpāṇi api na pratirūpāṇi api asya karmaṇaḥ kṛtasya
translated: not even suitable, not even appropriate, for this action that is done,

analyzed: saṃcitasya ācitasya upacitasya
translated: accumulated, heaped up, and well-performed.

original: ye kecidimāṃ gambhīrā prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāṃ deśyamānāmupadiśyamānāmuddiśyamānāṃ pratibādhitavyāṃ maṃsyante /🔽pratikṣepsyanti /
analyzed: ye kecid imām gambhīrā prajñāpāramitām bhāṣyamāṇām deśyamānām upadiśyamānām uddiśyamānām pratibādhitavyām maṃsyante  pratikṣepsyanti
translated: Those who, when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, explained, demonstrated, and expounded, will think to oppose it,🔽will reject it,

analyzed: pratikrokṣyanti
translated: will oppose it,

analyzed: na atra śikṣitavyam iti vakṣyanti
translated: will say 'one should not train in this,'

analyzed: na iyam tathāgata bhāṣitā iti vācam bhāṣiṣyante
translated: will say 'this is not spoken by the Tathāgata,'

original: tato 'nyān api sattvān vivecayiṣyanti /🔽te svasaṃtānānupahatya parasaṃtānānupahaniṣyanti /
analyzed: tatas nyān api sattvān vivecayiṣyanti  te sva saṃtānān upahatya para saṃtānān upahaniṣyanti
translated: then they will cause other beings to fall away.🔽Having harmed their own continuum, they will harm the continuum of others.

original: te svasaṃtānān saviṣān kṛtvā parasaṃtānān saviṣān kariṣyanti /
analyzed: te sva saṃtānān sa viṣān kṛtvā para saṃtānān sa viṣān kariṣyanti
translated: Having made their own continuum poisonous, they will make the continuum of others poisonous.

analyzed: svayam naṣṭāḥ parān api nāśayiṣyanti
translated: Having themselves perished, they will cause others to perish as well.

original: svayaṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāmajānānā anavabudhyamānāḥ parān api grāhayiṣyanti /
analyzed: svayam gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām a jānānāḥ an avabudhyamānāḥ parān api grāhayiṣyanti
translated: Not knowing and not understanding the profound perfection of wisdom themselves, they will cause others to grasp at it.

analyzed: na atra śikṣitavyam iti vācam bhāṣiṣyante
translated: They will say 'one should not train in this.'

analyzed: na aham śāriputra evaṃrūpāṇām pudgalānām darśanam api abhyanujānāmi
translated: Śāriputra, I do not even allow seeing such people,

original: kutastaiḥ saha saṃvāsaṃ kuto vā lābhasatkāraṃ kutaḥ sthānam /
analyzed: kutas taiḥ saha saṃvāsam kutas vā lābha satkāram kutas sthānam
translated: how much more so dwelling with them, or gain and honor, or a place to stay.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: dharmadūṣakā hi te śāriputra tathārūpāḥ pudgalā veditavyā iti /🔽kasambakajātāste śāriputra tathārūpāḥ pudgalā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: dharma dūṣakāḥ hi te śāriputra tathārūpāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ iti  kasambakajātāḥ te śāriputra tathārūpāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: For they are corrupters of the Dharma, Śāriputra, such persons should be known to be of that kind.🔽They are born in a mixed caste, Śāriputra, such persons should be known to be of that kind.

original: kṛṣṇānirjātikāḥ kṛṣṇāhijātikāste śāriputra tathārūpāḥ pudgalā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: kṛṣṇā nirjātikāḥ kṛṣṇāhi jātikāḥ te śāriputra tathārūpāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: They are born in a black family, born in a family of black snakes, Śāriputra, such persons should be known to be of that kind.

original: teṣāṃ śāriputra tathārūpāṇāṃ pudgālānāṃ ye śrotavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: teṣām śāriputra tathārūpāṇām pudgālānām ye śrotavyam maṃsyante
translated: Śāriputra, all those who will think to listen to such persons,

analyzed: sarve te anayena vyasanam āpatsyante
translated: all of them will fall into misfortune through that.

analyzed: ye ca śāriputra prajñāpāramitām dūṣayanti
translated: And, Śāriputra, those who corrupt the perfection of wisdom,

original: ime te śāriputra dharmadūṣakāḥ pudgalā veditavyāḥ /🔽śāriputra āha na bhagavatā tasya pudgalasya tatropapannasya mahānirayagatasyātmabhāvasya pramāṇamākhyātam /
analyzed: ime te śāriputra dharma dūṣakāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ  śāriputraḥ āha na bhagavatā tasya pudgalasya tatra upapannasya mahāniraya gatasya ātma bhāvasya pramāṇam ākhyātam
translated: they, Śāriputra, should be known as persons who corrupt the Dharma.🔽Śāriputra said, The Blessed One has not declared the measure of the body of that person who has been reborn there, in the great hell.

original: bhagavānāha tiṣṭhatu śāriputra tasya pudgalasya tatropapannasya mahānirayagatasyātmabhāvasya pramāṇam /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tiṣṭhatu śāriputra tasya pudgalasya tatra upapannasya mahāniraya gatasya ātma bhāvasya pramāṇam
translated: The Blessed One said, Let that measure of the body of that person who has been reborn there, in the great hell, be set aside, Śāriputra.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: mā tathārūpasya pudgalasya tadātmabhāvasya pramāṇaṃ śrutvā uṣṇaṃ rūdhiraṃ mukhādāgacchet /
analyzed: mā tathārūpasya pudgalasya tad ātma bhāvasya pramāṇam śrutvā uṣṇam rūdhiram mukhāt āgacchet
translated: Do not, having heard the measure of such a person's body, have hot blood gush from your mouth.

analyzed: maraṇam vā nigacchet
translated: Or suffer death.

analyzed: maraṇa mātrakam vā duḥkham āgāḍham ābādham spṛśet
translated: Or experience intense suffering leading to death.

analyzed: dahyeta vā
translated: Or be burned.

analyzed: śoka śalyaḥ vai asya āviśet
translated: Or be pierced by the dart of sorrow.

analyzed: mahā prapātam vā prapatet
translated: Or fall into a great abyss.

analyzed: upaśuṣyeta vā mlāyeta vā
translated: Or wither away and fade.

original: maiva mahāpratibhayaṃ tasyātmabhāvasya pramāṇamaśrauṣīdyasyeme doṣāḥ saṃvidyante //
analyzed: mā eva mahā pratibhayam tasya ātma bhāvasya pramāṇam aśrauṣīt yasya ime doṣāḥ saṃvidyante
translated: Do not hear the measure of that fearful body, for which these faults exist.

original: na bhagavānāyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasyāvakāśaṃ karoti iyattasyātmabhāvasya pramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: na bhagavān āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya avakāśam karoti iyat tasya ātma bhāvasya pramāṇam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: The Blessed One does not give permission to the Venerable Śāriputra to say, The measure of that body will be so much.

original: dvitīyakam api tṛtīyakamapyāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocat ākhyātu me bhagavāṃstasya pudgalasyātmabhāvasya pramāṇam /
analyzed: dvitīyakam api tṛtīyakam api āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat ākhyātu me bhagavān tasya pudgalasya ātma bhāvasya pramāṇam
translated: For a second and third time, the Venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, May the Blessed One tell me the measure of that person's body.

original: paścimāyā janatāyā ālokaḥ kṛto bhaviṣyatianena vāṅbhanaḥkarmaṇā kṛtena saṃcitenopacitenopacitena evaṃ mahāntaṃ mahānirayeṣvātmabhāvaṃ parigṛhṇīteti
analyzed: paścimāyāḥ janatāyāḥ ālokaḥ kṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati anena vāc bhanaḥ karmaṇā kṛtena saṃcitena upacitena upacitena evam mahāntam mahānirayeṣu ātma bhāvam parigṛhṇīta iti
translated: Light will be brought to the people of the future, who will think, 'By such verbal and mental actions done, accumulated, and stored up, one takes on such a huge body in the great hells.'

original: bhagavānāha eṣa eva śāriputra paścimāyā janatāyā ālokaḥ kṛto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha eṣaḥ eva śāriputra paścimāyāḥ janatāyāḥ ālokaḥ kṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The Blessed One said: This, Śāriputra, will be a light for future generations,

original: yadanena vāṅbhanoduścaritena akuśalena karmābhisaṃskāreṇa abhisaṃskṛtena saṃcitenācitenopacitena iyacciraduḥkhaṃ pratyanubhaviṣyatīti /🔽yā etasyaiva śāriputra duḥkhasyāprameyatā bahuduḥkhatā Vaidya
analyzed: yat anena vāc bhanaḥ duścaritena akuśalena karma abhisaṃskāreṇa abhisaṃskṛtena saṃcitena ācitena upacitena iyat cira duḥkham pratyanubhaviṣyati iti  yāḥ etasya eva śāriputra duḥkhasya aprameya tā bahu duḥkha tā vaidya
translated: that through this verbal misconduct, this unwholesome action, this formation, having formed it, having accumulated it, having heaped it up, he will experience such long-lasting suffering.

original: vyākhyātā / eṣa eva śuklāṃśikasya kulaputrasya kuladuhiturvā saṃvego bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: vyākhyātāḥ eṣaḥ eva śukla aṃśikasya kula putrasya kula duhituḥ vā saṃvegaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: This very immeasurable suffering, this much suffering, Śāriputra, has been explained by the doctor. This very [explanation] will be a warning for a son or daughter of good family who is on the side of the wholesome.

original: tataḥ sa tebhyo dharmavyasanasaṃvartanīyebhyaḥ karmabhyo vinivṛtya puṇyābhisaṃskārameva kuryāt /
analyzed: tatas sa tebhyaḥ dharma vyasana saṃvartanīyebhyaḥ karmabhyaḥ vinivṛtya puṇya abhisaṃskāram eva kuryāt
translated: Then, turning away from those actions that lead to the destruction of the Dharma, he should only perform meritorious actions.

original: jīvitahetor api saddharmaṃ na pratikṣepsyati mā bhūdasmākam api tādṛśairduḥkhai samavadhānamiti //
analyzed: jīvita hetoḥ api saddharmam na pratikṣepsyati mā bhūt asmākam api tādṛśaiḥ duḥkhaiḥ samavadhānam iti
translated: Even for the sake of life, he should not reject the true Dharma, thinking 'May we not encounter such suffering.'

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocat susaṃvṛtakāyakarmavākkarmamanaskarmaṇā bhagavan kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā bhavitavyam
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat su saṃvṛta kāya karma vāc karma manaḥ karmaṇā bhagavan kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā bhavitavyam
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, a son or daughter of good family should be very restrained in body, speech, and mind.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: yatra hi nāma bhagavan evaṃrūpeṇa vāgdurbhāṣitena iyān mahāpuṇyaskandhaḥ prasūyate /
analyzed: yatra hi nāma bhagavan evaṃrūpeṇa vāc durbhāṣitena iyān mahā puṇya skandhaḥ prasūyate
translated: For, Blessed One, such a great heap of merit is produced from such a verbal offense.

original: katamena punarbhagavan karmaṇā iyān mahāpuṇyaskandhaḥ prasūyate /
analyzed: katamena punar bhagavan karmaṇā iyān mahā puṇya skandhaḥ prasūyate
translated: But, Blessed One, by what action is such a great heap of merit produced?

original: bhagavānāha evaṃrūpeṇa subhūte vāgdurbhāṣitena iyān mahāpuṇyaskandhaḥ prasūyate /
analyzed: bhagavān āha evaṃrūpeṇa subhūte vāc durbhāṣitena iyān mahā puṇya skandhaḥ prasūyate
translated: The Blessed One said: Subhūti, such a great heap of merit is produced from such a verbal offense.

original: ihaiva te subhūte mohapuruṣāḥ svākhyāte dharmavinaye pravrajitā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: iha eva te subhūte moha puruṣāḥ su ākhyāte dharma vinaye pravrajitāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Subhūti, right here in this well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya, those foolish men will become renunciants.

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ dūṣayitavyāṃ maṃsyante /🔽pratikṣeptavyāṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: ye imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām dūṣayitavyām maṃsyante  pratikṣeptavyām maṃsyante
translated: Those who will think to criticize this profound perfection of wisdom,🔽who will think to reject it,

analyzed: pratibādhitavyām maṃsyante
translated: who will think to oppose it.

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ ca pratibādhitāyāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ buddhabodhiḥ pratibādhitā bhavati /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām ca pratibādhitāyām buddhānām bhagavatām buddha bodhiḥ pratibādhitā bhavati
translated: And when the perfection of wisdom is opposed, the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, is opposed.

original: buddhabodhau pratibādhitāyāmatītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sarvajñatā pratibādhitā bhavati /
analyzed: buddha bodhau pratibādhitāyām atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām sarvajña tā pratibādhitā bhavati
translated: When the enlightenment of the Buddhas is opposed, the omniscience of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present is opposed.

analyzed: sarvajña tāyām pratibādhitāyām saddharmaḥ pratibādhitaḥ bhavati
translated: When omniscience is opposed, the true Dharma is opposed.

analyzed: saddharme pratibādhite tathāgata śrāvaka saṃghaḥ pratibādhitaḥ bhavati
translated: When the true Dharma is obstructed, the community of the Tathāgata's disciples is obstructed.

original: tathāgataśrāvakasaṃghe 'pi pratibādhite evaṃ tasya sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ triratnātparibāhyabhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: tathāgata śrāvaka saṃghe pi pratibādhite evam tasya sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam triratnāt paribāhya bhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: And when the community of the Tathāgata's disciples is obstructed, then in that way, for that one, all of everything in every way is completely excluded from the Three Jewels.

analyzed: aprameya asaṃkhyeyataraḥ ca mahān akuśala karma abhisaṃskāraḥ parigṛhītaḥ bhavati
translated: And an even more immeasurable and incalculably great accumulation of unwholesome karma is taken up.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocat ko 'tra bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo yatsa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kaḥ tra bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One, What is the cause here, Blessed One, what is the condition, that those sons of good family or daughters of good family who have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, having heard this deep perfection of wisdom, will not copy it, will not study it, will not pay attention to it?

original: bhagavānāha mārādhiṣṭhito vā subhūte sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha māra dhiṣṭhitaḥ vā subhūte sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bhaviṣyati
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, that son of good family or daughter of good family will either be possessed by Māra,

original: duṣprajñasaṃvartanīyena vā karmaṇā gambhīreṣu dharmeṣu nāsya śraddhā /
analyzed: duṣprajña saṃvartanīyena vā karmaṇā gambhīreṣu dharmeṣu na asya śraddhā
translated: or they will be endowed with unwholesome actions that lead to bad wisdom, and they will have no faith in the profound dharmas.

analyzed: na asya prasādaḥ
translated: They will have no serenity.

original: ābhyāṃ subhūte dvābhyāṃ pāpābhyāṃ dharmābhyāṃ samanvāgataḥ sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ pratibādhiṣyate /
analyzed: ābhyām subhūte dvābhyām pāpābhyām dharmābhyām samanvāgataḥ sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām pratibādhiṣyate
translated: Subhūti, that son of good family or daughter of good family who is endowed with these two unwholesome dharmas will obstruct this perfection of wisdom.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā pāpamitrahastagato vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā pāpa mitra hasta gataḥ vā bhaviṣyati
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family will have fallen into the hands of bad friends.

analyzed: an abhiyuktaḥ vā bhaviṣyati
translated: Or they will be unengaged.

analyzed: skandha abhiniviṣṭaḥ vā bhaviṣyati
translated: Or they will be attached to the aggregates.

original: ātmotkarṣī pareṣāṃ paṃsako doṣāntaraprekṣī vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ātma utkarṣī pareṣām paṃsakaḥ doṣa antara prekṣī vā bhaviṣyati
translated: Or they will be self-aggrandizing, disparaging others, and looking for faults in others.

original: ebhirapi subhūte caturbhirākāraiḥ sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā samanvāgato bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ebhiḥ api subhūte caturbhiḥ ākāraiḥ sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā samanvāgataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Subhuti, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family will be endowed with these four aspects.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāṃ deśyamānāmupadiśyamānāṃ pratibādhitavyāṃ maṃsyate iti //
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām bhāṣyamāṇām deśyamānām upadiśyamānām pratibādhitavyām maṃsyate iti
translated: Who, when this perfection of wisdom is being taught, explained, and shown, will think to oppose it.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām nirayaparivartaḥ nāma saptamaḥ
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the seventh chapter is named The Chapter on Hells.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

analyzed: viśuddhiparivartaḥ ṣṭamaḥ
translated: Chapter 8: Purity

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocat duradhimocā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā anabhiyuktena kuśalamūlavirahitena pāpamitrahastagatena
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat duradhimocā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā anabhiyuktena kuśala mūla virahitena pāpa mitra hasta gatena
translated: Then the Venerable Subhuti said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is difficult to fathom for one who is not engaged, who is devoid of wholesome actions, who has fallen into the hands of bad friends.

analyzed: bhagavān āha evam etad subhūte evam etat
translated: The Blessed One said: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: duradhimocā subhūte prajñāpāramitā anabhiyuktena parīttakuśalamūlena durmedhasā anarthikena
analyzed: duradhimocā subhūte prajñāpāramitā anabhiyuktena parītta kuśala mūlena durmedhasā anarthikena
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is difficult to fathom for one who is not diligent, who has little wholesome action, who is dull-witted, who is not interested,

analyzed: alpa śrutena hīna prajñena pāpa mitra upastabdhena a śuśrūṣaṇa a paripṛcchaka jātīyena kuśaleṣu
translated: who has little learning, who has inferior wisdom, who is supported by bad friends, who is of the type that does not listen or ask questions, who is not diligent

analyzed: dharmeṣu anabhiyuktena

original: subhūtirāha kiyadgambhīrā bateyaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitā duradhimocatayā /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha kiyat gambhīrā bata iyam bhagavan prajñāpāramitā duradhimoca tayā
translated: Subhūti said, How profound, Blessed One, is this perfection of wisdom, in that it is difficult to fathom?

analyzed: iha kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran rūpe na tiṣṭhati
translated: Here, Kauśika, a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom does not stand in form.

analyzed: rūpam iti na tiṣṭhati
translated: He does not stand in 'form'.

original: yataḥ kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvo rūpe na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: yatas kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ rūpe na tiṣṭhati
translated: Because, Kauśika, a bodhisattva mahāsattva does not stand in form.

analyzed: rūpam iti na tiṣṭhati
translated: He does not stand in 'form'.

analyzed: evam rūpe yogam āpadyate
translated: Thus he applies himself to form.

original: evaṃ vedanāyāṃ saṃjñāyāṃ saṃskāreṣu /🔽vijñāne na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: evam vedanāyām saṃjñāyām saṃskāreṣu  vijñāne na tiṣṭhati
translated: Thus he applies himself to feeling, perception, volitional formations,🔽and consciousness.🔽He does not stand in consciousness.

analyzed: vijñānam iti na tiṣṭhati
translated: He does not stand in 'consciousness'.

original: yataḥ kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvo vijñāne na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: yatas kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vijñāne na tiṣṭhati
translated: Because, Kauśika, a bodhisattva mahāsattva does not stand in consciousness.

analyzed: vijñānam iti na tiṣṭhati
translated: He does not stand in 'consciousness'.

original: evaṃ vijñāne yogamāpadyate /🔽rūpamiti kauśika na yojayati /
analyzed: evam vijñāne yogam āpadyate  rūpam iti kauśika na yojayati
translated: Thus he applies himself to consciousness.🔽Kauśika, he does not join with 'form'.

analyzed: yatas kauśika rūpam iti na yojayati
translated: Because, Kauśika, he does not join with 'form'.

analyzed: evam rūpam iti na tiṣṭhati
translated: Thus he does not stand in 'form'.🔽Thus he does not stand in feeling, perception, volitional formations,

analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ  vijñānam iti kauśika na yojayati
translated: and consciousness.🔽Kauśika, he does not join with 'consciousness'.

analyzed: yatas kauśika vijñānam iti na yojayati
translated: Because, Kauśika, he does not join with 'consciousness'.

analyzed: evam vijñānam iti na tiṣṭhati
translated: Thus he does not stand in 'consciousness'.

analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitāyām sthitaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus he stands in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: evam yogam āpadyate
translated: Thus he applies himself.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocat gambhīrā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /🔽duravagāhā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat gambhīrā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā  duravagāhā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is profound.🔽Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is difficult to fathom.

analyzed: durudgrahā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is difficult to grasp.

analyzed: apramāṇā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.

original: bhagavānāha evametacchāriputra / evametat /🔽rūpaṃ gambhīramiti śāriputra na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha evam etat śāriputra evam etat  rūpam gambhīram iti śāriputra na tiṣṭhati
translated: The Blessed One said, So it is, Śāriputra. So it is.🔽Śāriputra, one does not abide thinking 'form is profound.'

original: yataḥ śāriputra rūpaṃ gambhīramiti na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: yatas śāriputra rūpam gambhīram iti na tiṣṭhati
translated: Because, Śāriputra, one does not abide thinking 'form is profound,'

analyzed: evam rūpe yogam āpadyate
translated: one practices in that way with regard to form.

original: evaṃ vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārāḥ /🔽vijñānaṃ śāriputra gambhīramiti na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ  vijñānam śāriputra gambhīram iti na tiṣṭhati
translated: Likewise with regard to feeling, perception, volitional formations,🔽and consciousness, Śāriputra, one does not abide thinking 'consciousness is profound.'

original: yataḥ śāriputra vijñānaṃ gambhīramiti na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: yatas śāriputra vijñānam gambhīram iti na tiṣṭhati
translated: Because, Śāriputra, one does not abide thinking 'consciousness is profound,'

original: evaṃ vijñāne yogamāpadyate /🔽rūpaṃ śāriputra gambhīramiti na yogamāpadyate Vaidya /
analyzed: evam vijñāne yogam āpadyate  rūpam śāriputra gambhīram iti na yogam āpadyate vaidya
translated: one practices in that way with regard to consciousness.🔽Śāriputra, one does not practice with regard to form thinking 'form is profound.'

original: yataḥ śāriputra rūpaṃ gambhīramiti na yogamāpadyate /
analyzed: yatas śāriputra rūpam gambhīram iti na yogam āpadyate
translated: Because, Śāriputra, one does not practice with regard to form thinking 'form is profound,'

analyzed: evam rūpam gambhīram iti na tiṣṭhati
translated: one does not abide thinking 'form is profound.'

analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: Likewise with regard to feeling, perception, volitional formations,🔽and consciousness,

analyzed: vijñānam śāriputra gambhīram iti na yogam āpadyate
translated: Śāriputra, one does not engage in union with the idea that consciousness is profound.

original: yataḥ śāriputra vijñānaṃ gambhīramiti na yogamāpadyate /
analyzed: yatas śāriputra vijñānam gambhīram iti na yogam āpadyate
translated: Because, Śāriputra, one does not engage in union with the idea that consciousness is profound.

analyzed: evam vijñānam gambhīram iti na tiṣṭhati
translated: Thus, one does not abide with the idea that consciousness is profound.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocat gambhīrā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā avinivartanīyasya vyākṛtasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya 🔽purato bhāṣitavyā /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat gambhīrā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā a vinivartanīyasya vyākṛtasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya  puratas bhāṣitavyā
translated: When this was said, the venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, the profound perfection of wisdom should be taught in the presence of a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has been predicted as irreversible.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sa hi bhagavat na kāṅkṣiṣyati
translated: Because, Blessed One, he will not doubt,

original: na vicikitsiṣyati na dhaṃdhāyiṣyati na vivadiṣyati //🔽atha khalu śakro devānāmindra āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocat sacetpunarārya śāriputra avyākṛtasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya purata iyaṃ
analyzed: na vicikitsiṣyati na dhaṃdhāyiṣyati na vivadiṣyati  atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat saced punar ārya śāriputra avyākṛtasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya puratas iyam
translated: will not be uncertain, will not be confused, will not dispute.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā bhāṣyeta
translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, said to the venerable Śāriputra, If, noble Śāriputra, this perfection of wisdom were to be taught in the presence of a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has not been predicted,

analyzed: kaḥ doṣaḥ bhavet
translated: what would be the problem?🔽Kauśika, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has not been predicted hears this profound perfection of wisdom, he will doubt, be uncertain, be confused, and dispute.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat dūrataḥ sa kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattva āgato veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ śakram devānām indram etat avocat dūratas sa kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āgataḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Śāriputra said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods, Kauśika, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as having come from afar.

original: cirayānasaṃprasthitaḥ paripakvakuśalamūlaḥ sa kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: cira yāna saṃprasthitaḥ paripakva kuśala mūlaḥ sa kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Kauśika, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as having set out in the vehicle for a long time and as having ripened wholesome roots,

original: yo'vyākṛta imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya /
analyzed: yaḥ vyākṛtaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya
translated: who, having been predicted, will obtain this perfection of wisdom for the sake of seeing, paying homage, serving, and listening to it.

original: śrutvā ca notrasiṣyati na saṃtrasiṣyati na saṃtrāsamāpatsyate /
analyzed: śrutvā ca na utrasiṣyati na saṃtrasiṣyati na saṃtrāsam āpatsyate
translated: Having heard it, he will not tremble, be frightened, or become terrified.

original: na cedānīmasau cireṇa vyākaraṇaṃ pratilapsyate'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: na ca idānīm asau cireṇa vyākaraṇam pratilapsyate in uttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: And now, he will not receive the prediction of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment for a long time.

analyzed: āsannam tasya vyākaraṇam veditavyam
translated: His prediction should be known as imminent.

original: sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo naikaṃ vā dvau vā trīn vā tathāgatānarhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhānatikramiṣyati /
analyzed: sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na ekam vā dvau vā trīn vā tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān atikramiṣyati
translated: That bodhisattva mahāsattva will not pass beyond one, two, or three tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas.

analyzed: tatas vyākaraṇam pratilapsyate in uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Then he will receive the prediction of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: api tu tān ārāgayiṣyati
translated: But he will please them.

analyzed: ārāgayitvā tān tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān na virāgayiṣyati
translated: Having pleased those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones, he will not displease them.

analyzed: tathāgata darśanam ca vyākaraṇena avandhyam kariṣyati
translated: And he will make the vision of the Tathāgatas fruitful by receiving a prophecy.

analyzed: tathāgata darśanāt ca tatas vyākaraṇam pratilapsyate in uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And from the vision of the Tathāgatas, he will receive the prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yāvat ca vyākaraṇam pratilapsyate in uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And as long as he will receive the prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: tāvat avandhyam kariṣyati tathāgata darśana vandana paryupāsana upasthānam yāvat na anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ iti
translated: for that long he will make the vision, worship, service, and offerings to the Tathāgatas fruitful, until he fully awakens to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocat dūrataḥ sa bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattva āgato bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat dūratas sa bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āgataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, that bodhisattva mahāsattva will have come from afar.

analyzed: cira yāna saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: He will have set out on the vehicle for a long time.

original: paripakvakuśalamūlo hi bhagavan sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: paripakva kuśala mūlaḥ hi bhagavan sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Blessed One, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one whose wholesome roots are mature,

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya /
analyzed: yaḥ imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya
translated: who will obtain this profound perfection of wisdom in order to see it, to worship it, to attend to it, and to listen to it.

original: kaḥ punarvādo'tra yaḥ śrutvā codgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyatyupadekṣyatyuddekṣyati svādhyāsyati
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ utra yaḥ śrutvā ca udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: How much more so for one who, having heard it, would take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, teach it, explain it, expound it, chant it, and meditate on it with focused mind!

original: atha khalu bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocat evametacchāriputra / evametat /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat evam etat śāriputra evam etat
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the Venerable Śāriputra, So it is, Śāriputra, so it is!

original: dūrataḥ sa śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattva āgato veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: dūratas sa śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āgataḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Śāriputra, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as having come from afar.

analyzed: cira yāna saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: He has set out in the vehicle for a long time.

original: paripakvakuśalamūlo hi sa śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: paripakva kuśala mūlaḥ hi sa śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Śāriputra, that bodhisattva mahāsattva will have ripened his wholesome roots,

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya /
analyzed: yaḥ imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya
translated: who will obtain this profound perfection of wisdom in order to see it, to pay homage to it, to attend to it, and to listen to it.

original: kaḥ punarvādo'tra yaḥ śrutvā codgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyatyupadekṣyatyuddekṣyati svādhyāsyati
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ utra yaḥ śrutvā ca udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: How much more so for one who, having heard it, would take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, teach it, explain it, expound it, chant it, and meditate on it with focused mind!

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocat pratibhāti me bhagavan /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat pratibhāti me bhagavan
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, it occurs to me,

analyzed: pratibhāti me sugata aupamya udāharaṇam
translated: Sugata, a simile occurs to me.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan yo'yaṃ bodhisattvayānikaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā svapnāntaragato'pi bodhimaṇḍe niṣīdet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan yaḥ ayam bodhisattva yānikaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā svapna antara gataḥ api bodhimaṇḍe niṣīdet
translated: Just as, Blessed One, this son of a good family or daughter of a good family belonging to the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, even while gone into a dream, would sit on the terrace of enlightenment,

analyzed: veditavyam etat bhagavan
translated: it should be known, Blessed One,

analyzed: ayam bodhisattvaḥ vaidya
translated: that this bodhisattva

analyzed: mahāsattvaḥ āsannaḥ unuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodheḥ abhisaṃbodhāya iti
translated: great being is near to the complete enlightenment of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: evameva bhagavan yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavan yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām lapsyate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family who will obtain this profound perfection of wisdom for the sake of seeing, for the sake of worshipping, for the sake of attending, for the sake of listening,

original: kaḥ punarvādaḥ śrutvā codgrahītuṃ dhārayituṃ vācayituṃ paryavāptuṃ pravartayituṃ deśayituṃ upadeṣṭuṃ uddeṣṭuṃ svādhyāpanāya /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ śrutvā ca udgrahītum dhārayitum vācayitum paryavāptum pravartayitum deśayitum upadeṣṭum uddeṣṭum svādhyāpanāya
translated: how much more so for the sake of listening and having listened, for the sake of taking it up, for the sake of keeping it, for the sake of reading it, for the sake of fully completing it, for the sake of expounding it, for the sake of teaching it, for the sake of expounding it, for the sake of reciting it to oneself,

analyzed: veditavyam etat bhagavan dūra toyam bodhisattva yānikaḥ pudgalaḥ āgataḥ cira yāna saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: it should be known, Blessed One, that this person belonging to the vehicle of the bodhisattvas has come from afar, has set out in the vehicle for a long time.

analyzed: āsannaḥ uyam bodhisattva yānikaḥ pudgalaḥ vyākaraṇasya
translated: This person belonging to the vehicle of the bodhisattvas is near to the prediction.

original: vyākariṣyantyenaṃ buddhā bhagavanto bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodherabhisaṃbodhāyeti /🔽cirayānasaṃprasthitaḥ paripakvakuśalamūlo hi sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: vyākariṣyanti enam buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bodhisattvam mahāsattvam anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ abhisaṃbodhāya iti  cira yāna saṃprasthitaḥ paripakva kuśala mūlaḥ hi sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, will prophesy that Bodhisattva Mahāsattva to be fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yasya iyam gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā upapatsyate intaśas śravaṇāya api
translated: It should be known that that Bodhisattva Mahāsattva has long set out in the vehicle, and his wholesome roots are mature, if this profound perfection of wisdom will occur to him, even just for hearing it.

original: kaḥ punarvādo'tra bhagavan yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā enāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyati
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādāḥ utra bhagavan yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā enām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati
translated: How much more so, Blessed One, for the son of a good family or daughter of a good family who will take up this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyatyupadekṣyatyuddekṣyati svādhyāsyati /
analyzed: dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati deśayiṣyati upadekṣyati uddekṣyati su ādhyāsyati
translated: retain it, read it, understand it, teach it, explain it, chant it, instruct others in it, recite it, and study it.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: bhūyastvena hi bhagavan dharmavyasanasaṃvartanīyaiḥ sattvāḥ karmopacayairavihitāḥ /
analyzed: bhūyas tvena hi bhagavan dharma vyasana saṃvartanīyaiḥ sattvāḥ karma upacayaiḥ a vihitāḥ
translated: For the most part, Blessed One, beings are engaged in the accumulation of actions that lead to the destruction of the Dharma.

original: teṣāṃ bhūyastvena asyāṃ gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ cittāni pratikūlāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: teṣām bhūyaḥ tvena asyām gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām cittāni pratikūlāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: For the most part, their minds will be averse to this profound perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: cittāni parivellayiṣyanti
translated: Their minds will turn away from it.

original: na hyanupacitakuśalamūlāḥ sattvā asyāṃ bhūyastvena bhūtakoṭyāṃ praskandanti prasīdanti /🔽upacitakuśalamūlāḥ khalu punaste bhagavan sūpacitakuśalamūlāḥ kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraśca veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: na hi anupacita kuśala mūlāḥ sattvāḥ asyām bhūyastvena bhūtakoṭyām praskandanti prasīdanti  upacita kuśala mūlāḥ khalu punar te bhagavan su upacita kuśala mūlāḥ kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca veditavyāḥ
translated: For beings who have not accumulated wholesome roots do not generally leap to this limit of reality and find peace in it.

analyzed: yeṣām asyām bhūtakoṭyām cittam praskandati prasīdati
translated: Blessed One, those sons and daughters of good family who have accumulated wholesome roots, who have well-accumulated wholesome roots, should be known as those whose minds leap to this limit of reality and find peace in it.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan puruṣo yojanaśatikādaṭavīkāntārād dviyojanaśatikādvā triyojanaśatikādvā
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan puruṣaḥ yojana śatikāt aṭavī kāntārāt dvi yojana śatikāt vā tri yojana śatikāt vā
translated: Blessed One, it is as if a man were to emerge from a forest wilderness of one hundred leagues, or two hundred leagues, or three hundred leagues,

analyzed: catur yojana śatikāt vā pañca yojana śatikāt vā daśa yojana śatikāt vā aṭavī kāntārāt niṣkrāmet
translated: or four hundred leagues, or five hundred leagues, or ten hundred leagues.

original: sa niṣkramya paśyetpūrvanimittāni gopālakān vā paśupālakān vā sīmā vā ārāmasaṃpado vā vanasaṃpado vā /
analyzed: sa niṣkramya paśyet pūrva nimittāni gopālakān vā paśu pālakān vā sīmāḥ vā ārāma saṃpadaḥ vā vana saṃpadaḥ vā
translated: Having emerged, he would see former signs, such as cowherds, shepherds, or boundaries, or the abundance of parks or forests.

analyzed: nimittāni
translated: Then there would be other signs as well.

original: yairnimittairgrāmo vā nagaraṃ vā nigamo va sūcyeta /
analyzed: yaiḥ nimittaiḥ grāmaḥ vā nagaram vā nigamaḥ sūcyeta
translated: By which signs a village, town, or market town would be indicated.

original: tasya tāni pūrvanimittāni dṛṣṭaivaṃ bhavati yathemāni pūrvanimittāni dṛśyante /
analyzed: tasya tāni pūrva nimittāni dṛṣṭā evam bhavati yathā imāni pūrva nimittāni dṛśyante
translated: Having seen those former signs, he would think: 'Since these former signs are seen,

original: tathā āsanno me grāmo vā nagaraṃ vā nigamo vā iti /

analyzed: saḥ āśvāsa prāptaḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes one who has attained peace.

analyzed: na asya bhūyaḥ cora manasikāraḥ bhavati
translated: He no longer has thoughts of thieves.

original: evameva bhagavan yasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyeyaṃ gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā upavartate /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavan yasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya iyam gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā upavartate
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, for that bodhisattva mahāsattva to whom this profound perfection of wisdom comes,

analyzed: veditavyam tena bhagavan abhyāsannaḥ asmi anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: Blessed One, he should know that he is near to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: nacireṇa vyākaraṇam pratilapsyen uttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ iti
translated: He will soon receive the prophecy of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: nāpi tenotrasitavyaṃ na saṃtrasitavyaṃ na bhetavyaṃ śrāvakabhūmervā pratyekabuddhabhūmervā /
analyzed: na api tena utrasitavyam na saṃtrasitavyam na bhetavyam śrāvaka bhūmeḥ vā pratyekabuddha bhūmeḥ vā
translated: And he should not be frightened, terrified, or afraid of the level of the hearers or the level of the solitary buddhas.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi asyemāni pūrvanimittāni saṃdṛśyante yadutemāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ labhate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya /
analyzed: tathā hi asya imāni pūrva nimittāni saṃdṛśyante yat uta imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām labhate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya
translated: Because these are seen as the previous signs of his: namely, that he obtains this profound perfection of wisdom for the sake of seeing, paying homage, serving, and listening.

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat evam etat śāriputra evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Śāriputra: So it is, Śāriputra. So it is.

analyzed: pratibhātu te śāriputra punar api etat sthānam
