analyzed: dṛḍha pratiṣṭhānaḥ ca bhavet
translated: would be firmly established,

analyzed: abhirūpaḥ ca bhavet
translated: would be handsome,

analyzed: prāsādikaḥ ca bhavet
translated: would be pleasing,

analyzed: parama darśanīyaḥ ca bhavet
translated: would be supremely good-looking,

analyzed: bahu guṇa samanvāgataḥ ca bhavet
translated: would be endowed with many qualities,

analyzed: parama guṇa samanvāgataḥ ca bhavet
translated: would be endowed with supreme qualities,

analyzed: parama aiśvarya śīla śruta tyāga ādi guṇaiḥ ca samanvāgataḥ bhavet
translated: would be endowed with the qualities of supreme sovereignty, morality, learning, generosity, and so forth,

original: medhāvī ca bhavet /🔽vacanasamarthaś ca bhavet /🔽pratibhānasaṃpannaś ca bhavet /
analyzed: medhāvī ca bhavet  vacana samarthaḥ ca bhavet  pratibhāna saṃpannaḥ ca bhavet
translated: would be intelligent,🔽would be able to speak,🔽would be endowed with eloquence,

analyzed: pratipatti saṃpannaḥ ca bhavet
translated: would be endowed with practice,

analyzed: kāla jñaḥ ca bhavet  deśa jñaḥ ca bhavet
translated: would know the right time,🔽would know the place,

analyzed: sthāna jñaḥ ca bhavet
translated: would know the location,

analyzed: iṣvastre ca parama gatim gataḥ bhavet
translated: He would become one who has attained the highest skill in archery and weaponry.

original: bahupraharaṇāvaraṇaś ca bhavet /🔽sarvāsu ca kalāsu paramakuśalo bhavet /
analyzed: bahu praharaṇa āvaraṇaḥ ca bhavet  sarvāsu ca kalāsu parama kuśalaḥ bhavet
translated: He would become one who possesses many weapons and defenses.🔽He would become supremely skilled in all the arts.

original: supariniṣpannatayā sarveṣveva ca śilpasthāneṣu paramagatiko bhavet /
analyzed: su pariniṣpanna tayā sarveṣu eva ca śilpasthāneṣu parama gatikaḥ bhavet
translated: By being well-trained, he would become one who has attained the highest skill in all the crafts.

analyzed: smṛtimān ca bhavet  matimān ca bhavet
translated: He would become one who has mindfulness.🔽He would become one who has intelligence.

analyzed: gatimān ca bhavet  dhṛtimān ca bhavet
translated: He would become one who has understanding.🔽He would become one who has stability.

analyzed: nītimān ca bhavet
translated: He would become one who has good conduct.

analyzed: sarva śāstra viśāradaḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would become one who is confident in all the scriptures.

analyzed: mitravān ca bhavet  arthavān ca bhavet
translated: He would become one who has friends.🔽He would become one who has wealth.

analyzed: balavān ca bhavet
translated: He would become one who has strength.

analyzed: a hīna aṅgaḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would become one who is not deficient in any limb.

analyzed: paripūrṇa indriyaḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would become one who has complete faculties.

analyzed: sarva upakaraṇa saṃpannaḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would become one who is endowed with all the necessary implements.

original: bahujanasya ca priyo manaāpaś ca bhavet /
analyzed: bahu janasya ca priyaḥ manaāpaḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would become dear and pleasing to many people.

analyzed: sa yat yat eva kiṃcid kāryam ārabheta
translated: Whatever task he would undertake,

analyzed: tatra tatra sarvatra nistaraṇa samarthaḥ bhavet
translated: in that and everywhere he would be able to accomplish it.

analyzed: nayena ca vyavaharet
translated: And he would conduct himself with good policy.

analyzed: sarvatra ca asya mahā lābhaḥ bhavet
translated: And he would have great gain everywhere.

original: tena mahālābhena samanvāgataḥ san bahujanaṃ saṃvibhajet /
analyzed: tena mahā lābhena samanvāgataḥ san bahu janam saṃvibhajet
translated: Endowed with that great gain, he would share it with many people.

analyzed: satkartavyam ca satkuryāt
translated: One should honor those who should be honored.

original: gurukartavyaṃ ca gurukuryāt /🔽mānayitavyaṃ ca mānayet / Vaidya
analyzed: gurukartavyam ca gurukuryāt  mānayitavyam ca mānayet vaidya
translated: One should respect those who should be respected.🔽One should revere those who should be revered.

analyzed: pūjayitavyam ca pūjayet
translated: One should worship those who should be worshipped.

original: tatkiṃ manyase subhūte api nu sa puruṣastatonidānaṃ bhūyasyā mātrayā āttamanasko bhavet /🔽pramuditaś ca bhavet /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte api nu sa puruṣaḥ tatonidānam bhūyasyā mātrayā ātta manaskaḥ bhavet  pramuditaḥ ca bhavet
translated: What do you think, Subhuti, would that man, for that reason, become even more elated,🔽and would he become very joyful?

analyzed: prīti saumanasya jātaḥ ca bhavet
translated: And would he become filled with joy and gladness?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha evam etat bhagavan
translated: Subhuti said: It is so, Blessed One.

analyzed: evam etat sugata
translated: It is so, Well-Gone One.

original: bhagavānāha sa khalu punaḥ subhūte puruṣastayā mahāsaṃpattyā samanvāgato mātāpitṛputradārān
analyzed: bhagavān āha sa khalu punar subhūte puruṣaḥ tayā mahā saṃpattyā samanvāgataḥ mātā pitṛ putra dārān
translated: The Blessed One said: That man, Subhuti, endowed with that great wealth, taking his mother, father, sons, and wife,

original: gṛhītvā kenacideva kāraṇasāmagrīyogena mahāṭavīkāntāraṃ pratipanno bhavet mahāpratibhayaṃ
analyzed: gṛhītvā kenacid eva kāraṇa sāmagrī yogena mahā aṭavī kāntāram pratipannaḥ bhavet mahā pratibhayam
translated: by some combination of circumstances, would enter a great fearful

analyzed: bālānām bhīṣaṇam roma harṣaṇam
translated: wilderness, terrifying to the young, causing the hair to stand on end.

original: sa tatra praviṣṭaḥ saṃstān mātāpitṛputradārānabhayenābhinimantrayet mā bhaiṣṭa /
analyzed: sa tatra praviṣṭaḥ san tān mātā pitṛ putra dārān abhayena abhinimantrayet mā bhaiṣṭa
translated: Having entered there, he would invite his mother, father, sons, and wife with assurances, saying, Do not be afraid,

analyzed: mā bhaiṣṭa
translated: do not be afraid.

analyzed: aham itas yuṣmāt mahābhayabhairavāt aṭavī kāntārāt kṣemeṇa svastinā śīghram apakrāmayiṣyāmi
translated: I will quickly lead you out of this great fearful and terrifying wilderness to safety and well-being.

analyzed: śīghram parimocayiṣyāmi iti
translated: I will quickly deliver them.'

original: tatra khalu punaḥ subhūte aṭavīkāntāre tasya puruṣasya bahavaḥ pratyarthikāḥ bahavaḥ pratyamitrāḥ pratyupasthitā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: tatra khalu punar subhūte aṭavī kāntāre tasya puruṣasya bahavaḥ pratyarthikāḥ bahavaḥ pratyamitrāḥ pratyupasthitāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Subhūti, in that forest wilderness, many enemies and adversaries of that man would be present.

original: tatkiṃ manyase subhūte api nu sa śūraḥ puruṣastaiḥ pratyarthikaiḥ pratyamitrairabhyutthitairavinivartyo
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte api nu sa śūraḥ puruṣaḥ taiḥ pratyarthikaiḥ pratyamitraiḥ abhyutthitaiḥ a vinivartyaḥ
translated: What do you think, Subhūti? Would that brave man, having arisen from those enemies and adversaries, be unretreating,

analyzed: dṛḍha vīrya bala samanvāgataḥ prajñāvān ati snigdhaḥ sa anukrośaḥ dhīraḥ mahā saṃbhāra samanvāgataḥ tān
translated: endowed with firm vigor and strength, wise, very affectionate, compassionate, courageous, and endowed with great provisions,

analyzed: mātā pitṛ putra dārān parityajya tatas mahābhayabhairavāt aṭavī kāntārāt ātmānam ekam apakrāmayitavyam manyeta
translated: think to abandon his parents, wife, and children, and then escape alone from that great and terrifying forest wilderness, leaving them behind?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: Subhūti said, No, Blessed One.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: tathā hi bhagavan tasya puruṣasya tat mātā pitṛ putra dāram a parityaktam
translated: Blessed One, it is because that man has not abandoned his parents, wife, and children.

original: ādhyātmikaś ca bāhyaś ca balavān saṃbhāraḥ /
analyzed: ādhyātmikaḥ ca bāhyaḥ ca balavān saṃbhāraḥ
translated: He has an inner and outer powerful provision.

original: tasya tatra aṭavīkāntāre bahutarakāś ca śūratarakarāś ca dṛḍhapraharaṇatarakarāś
analyzed: tasya tatra aṭavī kāntāre bahu tarakāḥ ca śūratara karāḥ ca dṛḍha praharaṇa tara karāḥ
translated: In that forest wilderness, he has many more brave and strong-armed ones, with very firm weapons,

original: ca teṣāṃ pratyarthikānāṃ pratyamitrāṇāmanye udāratarakāḥ pratyarthikāḥ pratyamitrāstiṣṭhanti rakṣanti /
analyzed: ca teṣām pratyarthikānām pratyamitrāṇām anye udāratarakāḥ pratyarthikāḥ pratyamitrāḥ tiṣṭhanti rakṣanti
translated: and for those adversaries and enemies, there are other adversaries and enemies who are more outstanding, who stand and protect them.

original: te tasya pratyarthikāḥ pratyamitrā avatāraprekṣiṇo 'vatāragaveṣiṇo 'vatāraṃ na lapsyante /🔽tena sa bhagavan pratibalaḥ puruṣo 'kṣato 'nupahatastanmātāpitṛputradāramātmānaṃ
analyzed: te tasya pratyarthikāḥ pratyamitrāḥ avatāra prekṣiṇaḥ vatāra gaveṣiṇaḥ vatāram na lapsyante  tena sa bhagavan pratibalaḥ puruṣaḥ kṣataḥ na upahataḥ tad mātā pitṛ putra dāram ātmānam
translated: Those adversaries and enemies, who seek an opportunity and look for an opportunity, will not find an opportunity.🔽Therefore, Blessed One, that able man, unharmed and uninjured,

original: ca tato mahābhayabhairavādaṭavīkāntārācchaktaḥ kṣemeṇa svastinā śīghramapakrāmayituṃ
analyzed: ca tatas mahābhayabhairavāt aṭavī kāntārāt śaktaḥ kṣemeṇa svastinā śīghram apakrāmayitum
translated: is able to quickly and safely lead out of that great and fearful forest wilderness his mother, father, wife, children, and himself,

original: yāvadgrāmaṃ vā nagaraṃ vā nigamaṃ vā anuprāptaḥ syāt //
analyzed: yāvadgrāmam vā nagaram vā nigamam vā anuprāptaḥ syāt
translated: and to reach a village, town, or city.

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocat evameva subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat evam eva subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti, Just so, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: sarvasattvahitānukampī maitrīvihārī karuṇāvihārī muditāvihārī upekṣāvihārī upāyakauśalyena
analyzed: sarva sattva hita anukampī maitrī vihārī karuṇā vihārī muditā vihārī upekṣā vihārī upāya kauśalyena
translated: who is compassionate towards all beings, who dwells in loving-kindness, who dwells in compassion, who dwells in joy, who dwells in equanimity, who through skillful means

original: prajñāpāramitayā ca parigṛhītaḥ kuśalamūlāni samyagbuddhānujñātayā pariṇāmanayā pariṇāmya
analyzed: prajñāpāramitayā ca parigṛhītaḥ kuśala mūlāni samyak buddha anujñātayā pariṇāmanayā pariṇāmya
translated: has taken the wholesome roots that are blessed by the Buddhas and has transformed them through the transformation that is approved by them,

analyzed: kiṃca api śūnyatām ā animittam apraṇihitam ca samādhi vimokṣa mukhāni avatarati
translated: Although he enters the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness meditative stabilizations, the doors of liberation,

analyzed: na tu eva bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: he does not actualize the reality limit.

analyzed: yat uta śrāvaka bhūmau vā pratyekabuddha bhūmau vā
translated: That is to say, in the stage of the śrāvakas or in the stage of the pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hyasya balavattamā dṛḍhatamāś ca parigrāhakāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi asya balavattamāḥ dṛḍhatamāḥ ca parigrāhakāḥ
translated: Because his supports are very powerful and very firm, namely,

analyzed: yat uta prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalyam ca
translated: the perfection of wisdom and skill in means.

analyzed: tena asya aparityaktāḥ sarva sattvāḥ
translated: Because of that, he does not abandon all sentient beings.

original: tenaiṣa pratibalaḥ svastinā kṣemeṇa anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhum /
analyzed: tena eṣa pratibalaḥ svastinā kṣemeṇa anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum
translated: Therefore, he is able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in a safe and easy way.

original: yasmin samaye subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvasattvānāmantike maitrīcittamārambaṇīkṛtya tān paramayā maitryā paribadhnāti /
analyzed: yasmin samaye subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva sattvānām antike maitrī cittam ārambaṇīkṛtya tān paramayā maitryā paribadhnāti
translated: Subhūti, at that time when a bodhisattva great being, having taken all sentient beings as objects of attention, having generated a mind of loving kindness toward them, binds them with the highest loving kindness,

original: atrāntare bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kleśapakṣaṃ mārapakṣaṃ cātikramya śrāvakabhūmiṃ pratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ cātikramya tatra samādhāvavatiṣṭhate
analyzed: atra antare bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kleśa pakṣam māra pakṣam ca atikramya śrāvaka bhūmim pratyekabuddha bhūmim ca atikramya tatra samādhau avatiṣṭhate
translated: in the meantime the bodhisattva great being, having gone beyond the side of the afflictions and the side of Māra, having gone beyond the stage of the śrāvakas and the stage of the pratyekabuddhas, remains in that meditative stabilization.

original: aprāptaś ca sa subhūte āsravakṣayaṃ paramapāramitāyāṃ śūnyatāyāṃ parijayaṃ karoti /
analyzed: a prāptaḥ ca sa subhūte āsrava kṣayam parama pāramitāyām śūnyatāyām parijayam karoti
translated: And, Subhūti, he who has not yet attained the destruction of the defilements practices in emptiness, the highest perfection.

original: yasmin samaye subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śūnyatāsamādhivimokṣamukhena viharati /
analyzed: yasmin samaye subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śūnyatā samādhi vimokṣa mukhena viharati
translated: Subhūti, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells in the door of liberation of the emptiness samādhi,

original: atrāntare bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na cedānīṃ nānimittena samādhinā viharati /
analyzed: atrā antare bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na ca idānīm na animittena samādhinā viharati
translated: in the meantime the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not now dwell in the signless samādhi,

original: na cānena ānimittaḥ samādhiḥ sākṣātkṛto Vaidya bhavati /
analyzed: na ca anena ānimittaḥ samādhiḥ sākṣātkṛtaḥ vaidya bhavati
translated: and he has not yet realized the signless samādhi.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte pakṣī śakunirākāśe 'ntarīkṣe carati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte pakṣī śakuniḥ ākāśe ntarīkṣe carati
translated: Just as, Subhūti, a bird flies in the sky, in the open air,

analyzed: na ca bhūmau patati
translated: but does not descend to the ground,

analyzed: na ca kaṃcid niśrayam niśritya tiṣṭhati
translated: and does not stand relying on any support,

analyzed: ākāśe eva antarīkṣe viharati
translated: it dwells in the sky, in the open air,

original: na ca tatrāpi niśrito na pratiṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: na ca tatra api niśritaḥ na pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: but is not dependent or established even there.

original: evameva subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śūnyatāvihāreṇa viharati /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śūnyatā vihāreṇa viharati
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells in the dwelling of emptiness,

analyzed: śūnyatāyām parijayam karoti
translated: practices in emptiness,

analyzed: ā nimitta vihāreṇa ca viharati
translated: and dwells in the dwelling of signlessness,

analyzed: ā animitte ca parijayam karoti
translated: and practices in signlessness,

analyzed: apraṇihita vihāreṇa ca viharati
translated: and dwells in the dwelling of wishlessness,

analyzed: a praṇihite ca parijayam karoti
translated: And he cultivates the signless,

original: na ca śūnyatāyāṃ vā ānimitte vā apraṇihite vā patatyaparipūrṇairbuddhadharmaiḥ /
analyzed: na ca śūnyatāyām vā ānimitte vā apraṇihite vā patati aparipūrṇaiḥ buddha dharmaiḥ
translated: but does not fall into emptiness, or into the signless, or into the wishless, because his Buddha qualities are incomplete.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte balavāniṣvastrācārya iṣvastraśikṣāyāṃ suśikṣitaḥ supariniṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte balavān iṣvastra ācāryaḥ iṣvastra śikṣāyām su śikṣitaḥ su pariniṣṭhitaḥ
translated: Just as, Subhuti, a powerful master of archery, well trained, well practiced,

analyzed: saḥ ūrdhvam kāṇḍam kṣipet
translated: would shoot an arrow upwards,

original: ūrdhvaṃ kāṇḍaṃ kṣiptvā tadanyaiḥ kāṇḍaistatkāṇḍaṃ bhūmau patat pratinivārayet /
analyzed: ūrdhvam kāṇḍam kṣiptvā tad anyaiḥ kāṇḍaiḥ tat kāṇḍam bhūmau patat pratinivārayet
translated: and having shot the arrow upwards, would prevent it from falling to the ground with other arrows,

analyzed: vārayet
translated: would ward it off,

original: tasya paurvakasya kāṇḍasya kāṇḍaparaṃparayā bhūmau patanaṃ na dadyāt /
analyzed: tasya paurvakasya kāṇḍasya kāṇḍa paraṃparayā bhūmau patanam na dadyāt
translated: would not allow that first arrow to fall to the ground through a succession of arrows,

analyzed: tāvat tat kāṇḍam bhūmau na patat
translated: so long as that arrow would not fall to the ground,

original: yāvannākāṅkṣet aho batedaṃ kāṇḍaṃ bhūmau patediti /
analyzed: yāvat na ākāṅkṣet aho bata idam kāṇḍam bhūmau patet iti
translated: so long as it would not wish: 'Oh, may this arrow fall to the ground.'

original: evameva subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran upāyakauśalyaparigṛhītaḥ tāvattāṃ paramāṃ bhūtakoṭiṃ na sākṣātkaroti /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran upāya kauśalya parigṛhītaḥ tāvat tām paramām bhūtakoṭim na sākṣātkaroti
translated: In the same way, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom, taken hold of by skill in means, does not realize that highest, perfect enlightenment,

original: yāvanna tāni kuśalamūlānyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau paripakvāni suparipakvāni /
analyzed: yāvat na tāni kuśala mūlāni anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau paripakvāni su paripakvāni
translated: so long as those wholesome roots are not matured, are not well matured, for supreme enlightenment.

original: yadā tāni kuśalamūlānyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau paripakvāni bhavanti suparipakvāni /
analyzed: yadā tāni kuśala mūlāni anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau paripakvāni bhavanti su paripakvāni
translated: When those wholesome roots become mature and well matured for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: tadā tām paramām bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: then they realize that supreme reality limit.

original: tasmāttarhi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayatā evameteṣāṃ dharmāṇāṃ gambhīradharmatā pratyavekṣitavyā
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām caratā prajñāpāramitām bhāvayatā evam eteṣām dharmāṇām gambhīra dharma tā pratyavekṣitavyā
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom, who cultivates the perfection of wisdom, should contemplate in this way the profound nature of these dharmas.

original: na ca sākṣātkartavyā //🔽evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocat duṣkarakārako bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /🔽paramaduṣkarakārako bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /
analyzed: na ca sākṣāt kartavyā  evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat duṣkara kārakaḥ bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ  parama duṣkara kārakaḥ bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: But it should not be realized.🔽When this was said, the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices emptiness,

analyzed: yaḥ śūnyatāyām carati
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices emptiness,

analyzed: śūnya tayā ca viharati
translated: who dwells in emptiness,

analyzed: śūnyatām ca samādhim samāpadyate
translated: who enters the emptiness samādhi,

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: but does not realize the reality limit,🔽is a doer of what is difficult.

analyzed: ati āścaryam idam bhagavan
translated: This is a great wonder, Blessed One.

analyzed: parama āścaryam idam sugata
translated: This is a supreme wonder, Sugata.

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocat evametatsubhūte / evam etat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat evam etat subhūte evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti, So it is, Subhūti, so it is.

analyzed: duṣkara kārakaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who performs difficult tasks is a great being.

original: paramaduṣkarakārako bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ yaḥ śūnyatāyāṃ carati /🔽śūnyatāyāṃ ca viharati /
analyzed: parama duṣkara kārakaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yaḥ śūnyatāyām carati  śūnyatāyām ca viharati
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who performs the most difficult tasks is a great being, who practices emptiness.🔽And dwells in emptiness.

analyzed: śūnyatām ca samādhim samāpadyate
translated: And enters the emptiness meditative stabilization.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: But does not actualize the reality limit.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sarvasattvā aparityaktāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sarva sattvāḥ a parityaktāḥ
translated: Subhūti, it is because the bodhisattva mahāsattva has not abandoned all beings.

original: tasyeme evaṃrūpāḥ praṇidhānaviśeṣā bhavanti mayaite sarvasattvāḥ parimocayitavyā iti /
analyzed: tasya ime evaṃrūpāḥ praṇidhāna viśeṣāḥ bhavanti mayā ete sarva sattvāḥ parimocayitavyāḥ iti
translated: His special vows are of this kind: 'I must liberate all these beings.'

original: yadā bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ cittamabhinirharati sarvasattvā mamāparityaktāḥ /
analyzed: yadā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam cittam abhinirharati sarva sattvāḥ mama aparityaktāḥ
translated: When the bodhisattva mahāsattva generates this thought: 'All beings are not abandoned by me.

original: mayaite parimocayitavyā iti /🔽śūnyatāṃ ca samādhivimokṣamukhamabhinirharati /🔽ānimittaṃ ca samādhivimokṣamukhamabhinirharati /
analyzed: mayā ete parimocayitavyāḥ iti  śūnyatām ca samādhi vimokṣa mukham abhinirharati  ānimittam ca samādhi vimokṣa mukham abhinirharati
translated: I must liberate them.'🔽He generates the emptiness meditative stabilization, the door of liberation.🔽He generates the signless meditative stabilization, the door of liberation.

analyzed: apraṇihitam ca samādhi vimokṣa mukham abhinirharati
translated: He generates the wishless meditative stabilization, the door of liberation.

original: tadā upāyakauśalyasamanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ nāyamantarā bhūtakoṭiṃ sākṣātkariṣyatyaparipūrṇairbuddhadharmaiḥ /
analyzed: tadā upāya kauśalya samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ na ayam antarā bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkariṣyati a paripūrṇaiḥ buddha dharmaiḥ
translated: Then, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who possesses skillful means should be known. He will not actualize the limit of reality in between, with incomplete qualities of a Buddha.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: tathā hi asya upāya kauśalyam rakṣām karoti
translated: Because that skillful means protects him.

original: sa caivāsya cittotpādo yattasya sarvasattvā aparityaktāḥ /
analyzed: sa ca eva asya citta utpādaḥ yat tasya sarva sattvāḥ a parityaktāḥ
translated: And that is his thought of enlightenment, that he has not abandoned all beings.

original: sa evamanena cittotpādenopāyakauśalyena samanvāgato 'ntarā bhūtakoṭiṃ na sākṣātkaroti //
analyzed: saḥ evam anena citta utpādena upāya kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ ntarā bhūtakoṭim na sākṣātkaroti
translated: Thus, endowed with that thought of enlightenment and skillful means, he does not actualize the limit of reality in between.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte yadā bodhisattvo mahāsattva imāni gambhīrāṇi sthānāni pratyavekṣate /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte yadā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imāni gambhīrāṇi sthānāni pratyavekṣate
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva examines these profound subjects,

original: pratyavekṣitukāmo vā bhavati tadyathā śūnyatāṃ samādhivimokṣamukham /🔽ānimittaṃ samādhivimokṣamukham / Vaidya
analyzed: pratyavekṣitu kāmaḥ vā bhavati tat yathā śūnyatām samādhi vimokṣa mukham  ānimittam samādhi vimokṣa mukham vaidya
translated: or desires to examine them, such as the emptiness gate of liberation,🔽the signless gate of liberation,

analyzed: apraṇihitam samādhi vimokṣa mukham
translated: the wishless gate of liberation,

original: tenaivaṃ cittamabhinirhartavyam dīrgharātramamī sattvāḥ sattvasaṃjñayā upalambhe caranti /
analyzed: tena evam cittam abhinirhartavyam dīrgharātram amī sattvāḥ sattva saṃjñayā upalambhe caranti
translated: he should arouse the following thought: 'For a long time these beings have been practicing with the notion of beings and with grasping.

analyzed: teṣām sattvānām upalambha dṛṣṭikānām upalambha dṛṣṭi prahāṇāya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya dharmam deśayiṣyāmi
translated: For the sake of abandoning the view of grasping at real things of those beings who have the view of grasping at real things, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and teach the Dharma.'

analyzed: iti saṃcintya śūnyatām samādhi vimokṣa mukham samāpadyate
translated: Having thought in this way, he enters the emptiness meditative stabilization, the door of liberation.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: But he does not actualize the limit of reality.

analyzed: ānimittam samādhi vimokṣa mukham samāpadyate
translated: He enters the signless meditative stabilization, the door of liberation.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: But he does not actualize the limit of reality.

analyzed: apraṇihitam samādhi vimokṣa mukham samāpadyate
translated: He enters the wishless meditative stabilization, the door of liberation.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: But he does not actualize the limit of reality.

original: evaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nena cittotpādena anena copāyakauśalyena samanvāgato nāntarā bhūtakoṭiṃ sākṣātkaroti /
analyzed: evam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nena citta utpādena anena ca upāya kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ na antarā bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, endowed with this thought and this skillful means, does not actualize the limit of reality in the meantime.

original: na ca parihīyate maitrīsamādhito na karuṇāmuditopekṣāsamādhitaḥ /
analyzed: na ca parihīyate maitrī samādhitaḥ na karuṇā muditā upekṣā samādhitaḥ
translated: And he does not fall away from the meditative stabilization of loving-kindness, compassion, joy, or equanimity.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: upāyakauśalyaparigṛhīto hi bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śuklairdharmaiḥ /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya parigṛhītaḥ hi bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śuklaiḥ dharmaiḥ
translated: Because the bodhisattva mahāsattva, taken hold of by skillful means, increases more and more in bright qualities.

analyzed: tīkṣṇatarāṇi ca asya śraddhā ādīni indriyāṇi bhavanti
translated: And his faculties of faith and so forth become sharper.

analyzed: bala bodhya mārgam ca pratilabhate
translated: and he attains the path that leads to the increase of strength.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyaivaṃ bhavati dīrgharātramamī sattvā dharmasaṃjñayā upalambhe caranti /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evam bhavati dīrgharātram amī sattvāḥ dharma saṃjñayā upalambhe caranti
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, thinks thus: 'For a long time these beings have gone on taking up the idea of dharmas, and have gone on taking up the idea of a basis.

analyzed: teṣām upalambha dṛṣṭikānām upalambha dṛṣṭi prahāṇāya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya dharmam deśayiṣyāmi iti
translated: For the sake of the abandonment of the view of a basis of those who have the view of a basis, I will, having fully known unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, teach the Dharma.'

original: so 'nena cittotpādena paurvakeṇa copāyakauśalyena samanvāgataḥ śūnyatāṃ samādhivimokṣamukhaṃ samāpadyate /
analyzed: saḥ nena citta utpādena paurvakeṇa ca upāya kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ śūnyatām samādhi vimokṣa mukham samāpadyate
translated: Endowed with this thought of enlightenment and with skill in means, he enters on the concentration-door of emptiness, on the concentration-door of the signless, on the concentration-door of the wishless.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: But he does not realize the Reality limit.

analyzed: na ca parihīyate maitrī karuṇā muditā upekṣā samādhitaḥ
translated: And he does not fall away from the concentrations of friendliness, compassion, sympathetic joy, and impartiality.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: upāyakauśalyaparigṛhīto bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śūklairdharmaiḥ /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya parigṛhītaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śūklaiḥ dharmaiḥ
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being, who is taken hold of by skill in means, increases more and more in wholesome dharmas.

analyzed: tīkṣṇatarāṇi ca asya śraddhā ādīni indriyāṇi bhavanti
translated: And his faculties of faith, etc. become keener.

analyzed: bala bodhyaṅgāni mārgam ca pratilabhate
translated: and he attains the path that leads to the increase of strength.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyaivaṃ bhavati dīrgharātramamī sattvā nimittasaṃjñayā nimitte caranti /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evam bhavati dīrgharātram amī sattvāḥ nimitta saṃjñayā nimitte caranti
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, thinks thus: 'For a long time these beings have been practising with a sign, with a sign as the highest.

original: teṣāṃ nimittasaṃjñāprahāṇāya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhya dharmaṃ deśayiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: teṣām nimitta saṃjñā prahāṇāya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya dharmam deśayiṣyāmi iti
translated: For the sake of their abandoning the sign, I will, having fully known unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, teach them the Dharma.'

original: sa ānimittaṃ samādhivimokṣamukhaṃ samāpadyate sattvānāṃ kṛtaśaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ ā nimittam samādhi vimokṣa mukham samāpadyate sattvānām kṛtaśas
translated: He enters the door of the concentration of emptiness for the sake of beings.

original: so 'nena cittotpādena paurvakeṇa copāyakauśalyena samanvāgataḥ ānimittaṃ samādhivimokṣamukhaṃ samāpadyate /
analyzed: saḥ nena citta utpādena paurvakeṇa ca upāya kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ ā nimittam samādhi vimokṣa mukham samāpadyate
translated: Endowed with this thought and with the skill in means of the past, he enters the door of the concentration of emptiness.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: But he does not realize the reality limit.

original: na ca parihīyate maitryāḥ karuṇāyā muditāyā upekṣāyāḥ sarvasamādhitaḥ /
analyzed: na ca parihīyate maitryāḥ karuṇāyāḥ muditāyāḥ upekṣāyāḥ sarva samādhitaḥ
translated: And he does not fall away from love, compassion, joy, and equanimity, from all concentrations.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: upāyakauśalyaparigṛhīto hi bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śūklairdharmaiḥ /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya parigṛhītaḥ hi bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śūklaiḥ dharmaiḥ
translated: For the Bodhisattva, the great being, who is taken hold of by skill in means, the bright dharmas increase more and more.

analyzed: tīkṣṇatarāṇi ca asya śraddhā ādīni indriyāṇi bhavanti
translated: And his faculties of faith, etc. become sharper.

analyzed: balāni bodhyaṅgāni mārgam ca pratilabhate
translated: He obtains the powers, the limbs of enlightenment, and the path.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyaivaṃ bhavati dīrgharātramamī sattvā nityasaṃjñayā sukhasaṃjñayā ātmasaṃjñayā śubhasaṃjñayā
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evam bhavati dīrgharātram amī sattvāḥ nitya saṃjñayā sukha saṃjñayā ātma saṃjñayā śubha saṃjñayā
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, thinks thus: 'For a long time these beings have been with the perception of permanence, the perception of happiness, the perception of self, the perception of beauty,🔽

original: ca viparyastāḥ /🔽tathā kariṣyāmi yathā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhya nityasaṃjñāyāḥ sukhasaṃjñāyāḥ
analyzed: ca viparyastāḥ  tathā kariṣyāmi yathā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya nitya saṃjñāyāḥ sukha saṃjñāyāḥ
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, thinks thus: 'For a long time these beings have been mistaken about the idea of permanence, the idea of happiness, the idea of self, and the idea of beauty.🔽I will act in such a way that, having fully known unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, I will teach the Dharma for the abandonment of the idea of permanence, the idea of happiness,

original: ātmasaṃjñāyāḥ śubhasaṃjñāyā viparyāsasya prahāṇāya dharmaṃ deśayiṣyāmi anityametatsarvaṃ na nityamiti /
analyzed: ātma saṃjñāyāḥ śubha saṃjñāyāḥ viparyāsasya prahāṇāya dharmam deśayiṣyāmi anityam etat sarvam na nityam iti
translated: the idea of self, and the idea of beauty, and of the perversions. I will teach: All this is impermanent, not permanent.

analyzed: duḥkham etat sarvam na sukham iti
translated: All this is suffering, not happiness.

analyzed: anātmakam etat sarvam na etat sātmakam iti
translated: All this is non-self, not self.

analyzed: aśubham etat sarvam na etat śubham iti
translated: All this is impure, not beautiful.

original: so 'nena cittotpādena samanvāgataḥ paurvakeṇa copāyakauśalyena prajñāpāramitayā ca parigṛhīto nāntarā bhūtakoṭiṃ sākṣātkaroti Vaidya
analyzed: saḥ nena citta utpādena samanvāgataḥ paurvakeṇa ca upāya kauśalyena prajñāpāramitayā ca parigṛhītaḥ na antarā bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti vaidya
translated: Endowed with this thought, and with the skillful means of the past, and embraced by the perfection of wisdom, he does not in the meantime realize the reality limit,

analyzed: a paripūrṇeṣu buddha dharmeṣu
translated: until the Buddha-dharmas are fulfilled.

analyzed: evam apraṇihitam samādhi vimokṣa mukham upasaṃpadya viharati
translated: Thus he attains and abides in the concentration gate of liberation that is wishless.

analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: And he does not actualize the reality-limit.

original: na ca parihīyate maitrīto vā karuṇāto vā muditāto vā upekṣāto vā /
analyzed: na ca parihīyate maitrītaḥ vā karuṇātaḥ vā muditātaḥ vā upekṣātaḥ vā
translated: And he does not fall away from loving kindness, or from compassion, or from joy, or from equanimity.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: upāyakauśalyaparigṛhīto bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śūklairdharmaiḥ /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya parigṛhītaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhūyasyā mātrayā vivardhate śūklaiḥ dharmaiḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who is embraced by skillful means increases more and more in bright qualities.

analyzed: tīkṣṇatarāṇi ca asya śraddhā ādīni indriyāṇi bhavanti
translated: And his faculties of faith and so on become sharper.

analyzed: balāni bodhyaṅgāni mārgam ca pratilabhate
translated: He attains the powers, the factors of awakening, and the path.

original: yo hi kaścitsubhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattva imaṃ cittotpādamutpādayati /
analyzed: yaḥ hi kaścid subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imam citta utpādam utpādayati
translated: Subhūti, whatever bodhisattva mahāsattva arouses this thought:

original: ityapīme sattvā dīrgharātramupalambhe caritāvinaḥ etarhyupalambhe caranti /
analyzed: iti api ime sattvāḥ dīrgharātram upalambhe caritāvinaḥ etarhi upalambhe caranti
translated: 'For a long time these beings have practiced grasping, and now they practice grasping.

analyzed: nimitta saṃjñāyām caritāvinaḥ etarhi api nimitta saṃjñāyām caranti

analyzed: viparyāse caritāvinaḥ etarhi api viparyāse caranti
translated: They have practiced error, and now they practice error.

analyzed: piṇḍa saṃjñāyām caritāvinaḥ etarhi api piṇḍa saṃjñāyām caranti
translated: They have practiced the perception of a mass, and now they practice the perception of a mass.

original: abhūtasaṃjñāyāṃ caritāvinaḥ etarhy api abhūtasaṃjñāyāṃ caranti /
analyzed: abhūta saṃjñāyām caritāvinaḥ etarhi api abhūta saṃjñāyām caranti
translated: They have practiced the perception of what is unreal, and now they practice the perception of what is unreal.

original: mithyādṛṣṭau caritāvinaḥ etarhy api mithyādṛṣṭau caranti /
analyzed: mithyādṛṣṭau caritāvinaḥ etarhi api mithyādṛṣṭau caranti
translated: Those who have practiced wrong views in the past also practice wrong views now.

original: tathā kariṣyāmi yathaiṣāmete doṣāḥ sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ na bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tathā kariṣyāmi yathā eṣām ete doṣāḥ sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam na bhaviṣyanti
translated: I will act in such a way that all these faults of theirs will not exist in any way at all.

analyzed: na prajñāsyante
translated: They will not be known.

analyzed: iti evam sarva sattvān samanvāharati
translated: Thus he attends to all beings.

original: evaṃ ca bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nena smṛtisamanvāhāreṇa anena cittotpādena samanvāgataḥ
analyzed: evam ca bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nena smṛti samanvāhāreṇa anena citta utpādena samanvāgataḥ
translated: Thus the bodhisattva mahāsattva, endowed with this mindfulness and attention, with this thought,

analyzed: upāya kauśalyena ca samanvāgataḥ prajñāpāramitayā ca parigṛhītaḥ evam eteṣām gambhīrāṇām
translated: endowed with skillful means, and embraced by the perfection of wisdom, thus contemplating the true nature of these profound

original: dharmāṇāṃ dharmatāṃ pratyavekṣamāṇaḥ śūnyatāto vā ānimittato vā apraṇihitato vā anabhisaṃskārato
analyzed: dharmāṇām dharmatām pratyavekṣamāṇaḥ śūnyatātaḥ vā ā animittataḥ vā apraṇihitataḥ vā an abhisaṃskārataḥ
translated: dharmas from the perspective of emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-performance,

original: vā anutpādato vā ajātito vā abhāvato vā /
analyzed: vā anutpādataḥ vā ajātitaḥ vā abhāvataḥ vā
translated: non-arising, non-birth, and non-existence,

analyzed: asthānam etat subhūte na avakāśaḥ
translated: Subhūti, it is impossible and cannot happen

original: yatsa bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ jñānasamanvāgato 'nabhisaṃskāre vā patet /
analyzed: yat sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam jñāna samanvāgataḥ na abhisaṃskāre vā patet
translated: that the bodhisattva mahāsattva endowed with such knowledge would fall into non-performance,

analyzed: traidhātukena vā sārdham saṃvaset
translated: or associate with the three realms.

analyzed: na etat sthānam vidyate
translated: There is no such possibility.

original: evaṃ hi subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ paripraṣṭavyo bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmena katameṣāṃ dharmāṇāṃ
analyzed: evam hi subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ paripraṣṭavyaḥ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena katameṣām dharmāṇām
translated: In this way, Subhuti, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, who wants to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, be questioned by a Bodhisattva, a great being: 'Which dharmas

analyzed: parijayaḥ kartavyaḥ
translated: should be mastered?

analyzed: kiyat rūpāṇi ca cittāni abhinirhartavyāni
translated: What kinds of thoughts should be produced?

original: yāni cittānyabhinirharan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na śūnyatāṃ sākṣātkaroti /🔽na ānimittaṃ sākṣātkaroti /
analyzed: yāni cittāni abhinirharan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na śūnyatām sākṣātkaroti  na ā animittam sākṣātkaroti
translated: When a Bodhisattva, a great being, produces thoughts, he does not perceive emptiness,🔽he does not perceive signlessness,

analyzed: na a praṇihitam sākṣātkaroti  na an abhisaṃskāram sākṣātkaroti
translated: he does not perceive wishlessness,🔽he does not perceive non-performance,

analyzed: na anutpādam sākṣātkaroti  na ajātim sākṣātkaroti
translated: he does not perceive non-production,🔽he does not perceive non-birth,

analyzed: na abhāvam sākṣātkaroti
translated: he does not perceive non-existence,

analyzed: prajñāpāramitām ca bhāvayati
translated: but he cultivates the perfection of wisdom.

original: sacetsubhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bodhisattvena mahāsattvenaivaṃ pṛṣṭa evaṃ vyākaroti śūnyataiva bodhisattvena mahāsattvena manasi kartavyā
analyzed: saced subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evam pṛṣṭaḥ evam vyākaroti śūnyatā eva bodhisattvena mahāsattvena manasi kartavyā
translated: If, Subhuti, when a Bodhisattva, a great being, is questioned by a Bodhisattva, a great being, in this way, he answers thus: 'Emptiness alone should be attended to by a Bodhisattva, a great being,'

original: ānimittameva apraṇihitameva anabhisaṃskāra eva anutpāda eva ajātireva abhāva eva bodhisattvena mahāsattvena manasi kartavya iti /
analyzed: ānimittam eva apraṇihitam eva an abhisaṃskāraḥ eva anutpādaḥ eva ajātiḥ eva abhāvaḥ eva bodhisattvena mahāsattvena manasi kartavyaḥ iti
translated: The signless, the wishless, the unconditioned, non-production, non-birth, non-existence, should be attended to by the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

analyzed: saced tam sarva sattva aparityāga citta utpādam na upadarśayet
translated: If he does not demonstrate the generation of the thought of not abandoning all beings,

original: upāyakauśalyaṃ vā na vyākuryāt /🔽veditavyametatsubhūte nāyaṃ vyākṛto bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāvavinivartanīyatve taiḥ paurvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ
analyzed: upāya kauśalyam vā na vyākuryāt  veditavyam etat subhūte na ayam vyākṛtaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau a vinivartanīya tve taiḥ paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ
translated: or does not explain skillful means,

analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ
translated: Subhūti, it should be known that this bodhisattva mahāsattva has not been predicted to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment by those past tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: yaḥ hi asau a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya āveṇikaḥ dharmaḥ
translated: Because that unique dharma of the irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva,

analyzed: tam dharmam na sūcayati  na prabhāvayati
translated: that dharma he does not point out,🔽does not make clear,

analyzed: na upadarśayati
translated: does not demonstrate,

analyzed: na prajānāti
translated: does not understand,

analyzed: paripṛṣṭaḥ na vyākaroti
translated: when asked does not explain,

analyzed: na visarjayati
translated: does not resolve,

analyzed: na tām bhūmim avakrāmayati
translated: does not enter that stage,

analyzed: yaḥ vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bhūmiḥ iti
translated: which is the stage of the irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: subhūtirāha syātpunarbhagavan paryāyo yena paryāyeṇa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'vinivartanīyo Vaidya
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha syāt punar bhagavan paryāyaḥ yena paryāyeṇa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vinivartanīyaḥ vaidya
translated: Subhūti said, Blessed One, could there be a case where a bodhisattva mahāsattva would be irreversible,

original: bhavet / bhagavānāha syātsubhūte sa paryāyo yena paryāyeṇa sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'vinivartanīyo bhavet /
analyzed: bhavet bhagavān āha syāt subhūte sa paryāyaḥ yena paryāyeṇa sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vinivartanīyaḥ bhavet
translated: and yet not be a doctor? The Blessed One said, Subhūti, there could be such a case where that bodhisattva mahāsattva would be irreversible.

original: sacedbodhisattvo mahāsattva imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śrutvā vā aśrutvā va evaṃ pratipadyeta /
analyzed: saced bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām śrutvā vā a śrutvā vaḥ evam pratipadyeta
translated: If a bodhisattva mahāsattva, having heard this perfection of wisdom or not having heard it, practices in this way,

original: evaṃ visarjayet avinivartanīyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: evam visarjayet a vinivartanīyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: and answers in this way, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as irreversible.

original: subhūtirāha tena hi bhagavan bahavo bodhāya caranti /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha tena hi bhagavan bahavaḥ bodhāya caranti
translated: Subhūti said, Blessed One, then many are practicing for awakening.

analyzed: alpakāḥ punar ye evam visarjayanti
translated: But few answer in this way.

original: bhagavānāha tathā hi subhūte alpakāste bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ye vyākṛtā avinivartanīyāyāṃ jñānabhūmau /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tathā hi subhūte alpakāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ye vyākṛtāḥ a vinivartanīyāyām jñāna bhūmau
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, it is because few of those bodhisattva mahāsattvas are prophesied to the irreversible stage of knowledge.

analyzed: ye punar te vyākṛtāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: But those who will be prophesied,

analyzed: te evam visarjayiṣyanti
translated: they will answer in this way.

original: te te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā uttaptāvaropitakuśalamūlā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: te te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ uttapta avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas should be known as having cultivated roots of virtue that have been heated.

original: te te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā asaṃhāryāḥ sadevamānuṣāsureṇa lokena /
analyzed: te te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ asaṃhāryāḥ sa deva mānuṣa asureṇa lokena
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas are ungrabbable by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: sacetpunaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ svapnāntaragato 'pi svapnopamāḥ sarvadharmā iti vyavalokayati /
analyzed: saced punar subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ svapna antara gataḥ svapna upamāḥ sarva dharmāḥ iti vyavalokayati
translated: If, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, even while dreaming, contemplates that all dharmas are like a dream,

analyzed: na ca sākṣātkaroti
translated: but does not realize them,

original: idam api subhūte avinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya avinivartanīyalakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya a vinivartanīya lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: Subhūti, this should be known as a characteristic of an irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ svapnāntaragato 'pi śrāvakabhūmau vā pratyekabuddhabhūmau vā traidhātukāya ca spṛhāmanuśaṃsācittaṃ
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ svapna antara gataḥ śrāvaka bhūmau vā pratyekabuddha bhūmau vā traidhātukāya ca spṛhām anuśaṃsa acittam
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, even while dreaming, does not have a longing for the stage of the śrāvakas or the stage of the pratyekabuddhas or for the three realms,

original: idam api subhūte avinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya avinivartanīyalakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya a vinivartanīya lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: Subhūti, this should also be known as a characteristic of an irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ svapnāntaragato 'pyanekaśatāyāḥ parṣado
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ svapna antara gataḥ pi aneka śatāyāḥ parṣadaḥ
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, even while dreaming, does not see a gathering of many hundreds of assemblies,

analyzed: neka sahasrāyāḥ yāvat aneka koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāyāḥ parṣadaḥ madhya gatam maṇḍala māle
translated: in the middle of an assembly of many thousands, up to many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis, seated in a circle,

original: niṣaṇṇaṃ bhikṣusaṃghaparivṛtaṃ bodhisattvasaṃghapuraskṛtaṃ dharmaṃ deśayantaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ
analyzed: niṣaṇṇam bhikṣu saṃgha parivṛtam bodhisattva saṃgha puraskṛtam dharmam deśayantam tathāgatam arhantam
translated: surrounded by the saṅgha of bhikṣus, honored by the saṅgha of bodhisattvas, teaching the Dharma, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One,

analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddham ātmānam paśyati
translated: he sees himself.

original: idam api subhūte avinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyāvinivartanīyalakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya a vinivartanīya lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: This also, Subhūti, should be known as an irreversible characteristic of an irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ svapnāntaragato 'pi vaihāyasamabhyudgamya sattvebhyo dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ svapna antara gataḥ vaihāyasam abhyudgamya sattvebhyaḥ dharmam deśayati
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, even while dreaming, rises up into the air and teaches the Dharma to beings.

analyzed: tām ca vyāma prabhām saṃjānīte
translated: And he perceives that light extending a distance of one hundred yojanas.

analyzed: tān ca bhikṣūn abhinirmimīte
translated: And he emanates those bhikṣus,

original: ye 'nyāsu dikṣu gatvā anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṛtyaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: ye nyāsu dikṣu gatvā anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddha kṛtyam kurvanti
translated: who, having gone to other directions, perform the work of a buddha in other world systems.

analyzed: dharmam ca deśayanti
translated: And they teach the Dharma.

original: evam api subhūte svapnāntaragatoa'vinivartanīyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ saṃjānīte /
analyzed: evam api subhūte svapna antara gataḥ avinivartanīyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saṃjānīte
translated: In this way also, Subhūti, an irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one who dreams.

original: idam api subhūte avinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya avinivartanīyalakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya a vinivartanīya lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: This also, Subhūti, should be known as a mark of the irreversibility of a bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte svapnāntaragato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo notrasyati /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte svapna antara gataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na utrasyati
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, while dreaming, is not frightened,

analyzed: na saṃtrasyati
translated: does not tremble,

analyzed: na saṃtrāsam āpadyate
translated: and does not become terrified,

original: grāmaghāte vā nagaraghāte vā nigamaghāte vā janapadaghāte vā rāṣṭraghāte vā agnidāhe
analyzed: grāma ghāte vā nagara ghāte vā nigama ghāte vā janapada ghāte vā rāṣṭra ghāte vā agni dāhe
translated: when there is a destruction of villages, towns, cities, countries, or kingdoms, or a forest conflagration,

original: vā vartamāne vyālamṛgān vā tato 'nyān api vā kṣudramṛgajātīn dṛṣṭvā śiraśchede vā
analyzed: vā vartamāne vyāla mṛgān vā tatas nyān api vā kṣudra mṛga jātīn dṛṣṭvā śiraḥ chede vā
translated: or when seeing wild animals, or other small animals, or when beheading is imminent,

original: pratyupasthite tato 'nyāny api vā mahābhayabhairavāṇi duḥkhadaurmanasyāni vā prāpya
analyzed: pratyupasthite tatas nyāni api vā mahā bhaya bhairavāṇi duḥkha daurmanasyāni vā prāpya
translated: or when encountering other great fears and terrors, or suffering and mental anguish,

original: tato 'nyeṣām api vā sattvānāṃ mahābhayabhairavāṇi duḥkhāni dṛṣṭvā nāsya bhayabhairavamutpadyate /
analyzed: tatas nyeṣām api vā sattvānām mahā bhaya bhairavāṇi duḥkhāni dṛṣṭvā na asya bhaya bhairavam utpadyate
translated: or when seeing other beings encountering great fears and terrors, he does not give rise to fear and terror.

analyzed: na utrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate
translated: He is not frightened, does not tremble, and does not become terrified.

original: tataś ca svapnāntarātprativibuddhasya samanantaravyutthitasyaivaṃ bhavati svapnopamamidaṃ sarvaṃ traidhātukam /
analyzed: tatas ca svapna antarāt prativibuddhasya samanantara vyutthitasya evam bhavati svapna upamam idam sarvam traidhātukam
translated: Then, having awakened from that dream, immediately upon rising, he thinks, 'All this triple world is like a dream.'

original: evaṃ ca mayā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhya samyagdeśayatā dharmo deśayitavya iti /
analyzed: evam ca mayā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya samyak deśayatā dharmaḥ deśayitavyaḥ iti
translated: And he thinks, 'Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, I will teach the Dharma correctly, teaching the Dharma in this way.'

original: idam api subhūte avinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya avinivartanīyalakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya a vinivartanīya lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: This, Subhūti, should be known as a characteristic of the irreversibility of a bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: Vaidya punaraparaṃ subhūte avinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya svapnāntaragatasya
analyzed: vaidya punar aparam subhūte a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya svapna antara gatasya
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when an irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva is in a dream

original: nairayikān sattvān dṛṣṭvā evaṃ bhavati tathā kariṣyāmi yathā me 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhasya
analyzed: nairayikān sattvān dṛṣṭvā evam bhavati tathā kariṣyāmi yathā me nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya
translated: and sees beings in the hells, he thinks, 'I will act in such a way that when I have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: buddhakṣetre sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ sarve 'pyapāyā na bhaviṣyantīti /
analyzed: buddhakṣetre sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam sarve pi apāyāḥ na bhaviṣyanti iti
translated: in my Buddha-field, all bad rebirths will be completely and totally absent in every way.'

original: idam api subhūte avinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apāyapariśuddhilakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apāya pariśuddhi lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: This, Subhūti, should be known as a characteristic of the purification of bad rebirths for an irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: tatra subhūte kathaṃ vijñāyeta asyāvinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
analyzed: tatra subhūte katham vijñāyeta asya a vinivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: There, Subhūti, how should it be known that in the Buddha-field of this irreversible Bodhisattva Mahāsattva,

original: anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhasya buddhakṣetre sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ
analyzed: anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya buddhakṣetre sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam
translated: when he has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, all the lower realms will be completely and totally

analyzed: sarve pi apāyāḥ na bhaviṣyanti iti
translated: nonexistent in every way?

original: sacetsubhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ svapnāntaragato 'pi nirayagatāṃstiryakpretagatān vā sattvān dṛṣṭvā smṛtiṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: saced subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ svapna antara gataḥ u pi niraya gatān tiryak preta gatān vā sattvān dṛṣṭvā smṛtim pratilabhate
translated: If, Subhūti, a Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, even while dreaming, sees beings in the hells, as animals, or as hungry ghosts, and regains mindfulness,

original: sa tāṃ smṛtiṃ pratilabhya evaṃ cintayati tathā kariṣyāmi yathā me 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhasya
analyzed: sa tām smṛtim pratilabhya evam cintayati tathā kariṣyāmi yathā me nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya
translated: having regained that mindfulness, he thinks, I will act in such a way that in my Buddha-field, when I have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: buddhakṣetre sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ sarve 'pyapāyā na bhaviṣyantīti /🔽evaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apāyapariśuddhilakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: buddhakṣetre sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam sarve pi apāyāḥ na bhaviṣyanti iti  evam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apāya pariśuddhi lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: all the lower realms will be completely and totally nonexistent in every way.🔽In this way, Subhūti, the characteristic of purification from the lower realms of a Bodhisattva Mahāsattva should be known.

original: idam api subhūte avivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya avinivartanīyalakṣaṇaṃ veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte a vivartanīyasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya a vinivartanīya lakṣaṇam veditavyam
translated: This also, Subhūti, should be known as a characteristic of an irreversible Bodhisattva Mahāsattva.

original: punaraparaṃ subhūte svapnāntaragato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo nagaradāhe vā grāmadāhe
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte svapna antara gataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nagara dāhe vā grāma dāhe
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, while dreaming, sees a burning of a city, or a burning of a village,

original: vā vartamāne prativibuddhaḥ saṃstataḥ svapnādevaṃ samanvāharati yathā mayā svapnāntaragatena
analyzed: vā vartamāne prativibuddhaḥ san tatas svapnāt evam samanvāharati yathā mayā svapna antara gatena
translated: and when he has awakened, he thinks about that dream like this:

original: ye ākārāḥ yāni liṅgāni yāni nimittāni dṛṣṭāni /
analyzed: ye ākārāḥ yāni liṅgāni yāni nimittāni dṛṣṭāni
translated: Those aspects, those signs, those marks that I saw

analyzed: yaiḥ ākāraiḥ yaiḥ liṅgaiḥ yaiḥ nimittaiḥ a vivartanīyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dhārayitavyaḥ
translated: by which aspects, by which signs, by which marks an irreversible Bodhisattva, a great being, should be known,

original: te ākārāstāni liṅgāni tāni nimittāni mama saṃvidyante /
analyzed: te ākārāḥ tāni liṅgāni tāni nimittāni mama saṃvidyante
translated: those aspects, those signs, those marks are present in me.

original: etena satyena satyavacanena ayaṃ nagaradāho vā grāmadāho vā vartamāna upaśāmyatu /
analyzed: etena satyena satya vacanena ayam nagara dāhaḥ vā grāma dāhaḥ vā vartamānaḥ upaśāmyatu
translated: By this truth, by this utterance of the truth, may this burning of a city, or this burning of a village, which is taking place,

analyzed: śītiḥ bhavatu
translated: be pacified.🔽May it cool down.

analyzed: astam gacchatu
