analyzed: yāvat āsaptamam mātāmaha pitāmaha yugasya nāmadheyam udīrayiṣyati amuṣyām diśi tvam jātaḥ  amuṣmin janapade amuṣmin grāme vā nagare vā vaidya
translated: Up to the seventh generation of grandparents, he will proclaim the names, saying, 'You were born in this direction.

analyzed: nigame vā jātaḥ iti
translated: In this country, in this village or town, in this city or market town.'

analyzed: saced prakṛtvā mṛdukaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If he is naturally gentle,

original: tamenamevaṃ vakṣyati pūrvam api tvameva mṛduko 'bhūḥ /
analyzed: tam enam evam vakṣyati pūrvam api tvam eva mṛdukaḥ bhūḥ
translated: he will say to him, 'Before, you were also gentle.'

analyzed: saced prakṛtyā tīkṣṇa indriyaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If he has sharp faculties by nature,

original: tatastamevaṃ vakṣyati pūrvam api tvaṃ tīkṣṇendriyo 'bhūḥ /🔽sacedāraṇyako bhaviṣyati /🔽sacetpiṇḍapātiko bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tatas tam evam vakṣyati pūrvam api tvam tīkṣṇa indriyaḥ bhūḥ  saced āraṇyakaḥ bhaviṣyati  saced piṇḍapātikaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: then he will say to him, 'Before, you had sharp faculties.'🔽If he will be a forest dweller,🔽if he will be one who begs for alms,

analyzed: saced pāṃsukūlikaḥ bhaviṣyati  saced khalu paścādbhaktikaḥ bhaviṣyati  saced eka āsanikaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: if he will be one who wears robes made of rags,🔽if he will eat only after the noon meal,🔽if he will be one who lives alone,

analyzed: saced yāthāsaṃstarikaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: if he will be one who uses whatever seat is available,

original: sacetraicīvariko bhaviṣyati /🔽sacet śmaśāniko bhaviṣyati /🔽sacedvṛkṣamūliko bhaviṣyati /🔽sacennaiṣadyiko bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: saced traicīvarikaḥ bhaviṣyati  saced śmaśānikaḥ bhaviṣyati  saced vṛkṣamūlikaḥ bhaviṣyati  saced naiṣadyikaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If he will be a wearer of rag-robes,🔽if he will be a dweller in a charnel ground,🔽if he will be a dweller at the foot of a tree,

original: sacedabhyavakāśiko bhaviṣyati /🔽sacennāmantiko bhaviṣyati /🔽sacedalpecchaḥ saṃtuṣṭaḥ pravivikto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: saced abhyavakāśikaḥ bhaviṣyati  saced nām antikaḥ bhaviṣyati  saced alpa icchaḥ saṃtuṣṭaḥ praviviktaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: if he will be a dweller in the open air,🔽if he will be a dweller in a sheltered place,🔽if he will be one with few desires,

analyzed: saced apagata pāda mrakṣaṇaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: if he will be content, secluded,🔽if he will be one who does not wash his feet,

analyzed: saced mṛdu bhāṣī alpa vāc bhaviṣyati
translated: if he will be one who speaks gently and little,

original: tamenaṃ māraḥ pāpīyāṃstena tena dṛṣṭadhārmikeṇa guṇenādekṣyati pūrvam api tvamanena cānena ca guṇena samanvāgato 'bhūḥ /
analyzed: tam enam māraḥ pāpīyān tena tena dṛṣṭa dhārmikeṇa guṇena ādekṣyati pūrvam api tvam anena ca anena ca guṇena samanvāgataḥ bhūḥ
translated: then Māra the Evil One, with that and that visible quality, will praise him, saying, 'Formerly too you were endowed with this and that quality.

original: niyatastaṃ vyākṛtastaiḥ paurvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau avinivartanīyāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau /
analyzed: niyataḥ tam vyākṛtaḥ taiḥ paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau a vinivartanīyāyām bodhisattva bhūmau
translated: You are certainly predicted by those past Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones to the irreversible stage of a bodhisattva, to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi te amī evaṃrūpā dhutaguṇāḥ saṃvidyante /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi te amī evaṃrūpāḥ dhuta guṇāḥ saṃvidyante
translated: Why is that?🔽Because these such-like qualities of austerity exist in you.

analyzed: niścayena tvam pūrvam api etaiḥ eva dhuta guṇaiḥ samanvāgataḥ bhūḥ
translated: Certainly you were formerly endowed with just these qualities of austerity.

original: evaṃ sa tena paurvakeṇa nāmāpadeśena nāmādhiṣṭhānena pratyutpannadhutaguṇasaṃlekhena ca manyanāmutpādayiṣyati /
analyzed: evam sa tena paurvakeṇa nāma apadeśena nāma adhiṣṭhānena pratyutpanna dhuta guṇa saṃlekhena ca manyanām utpādayiṣyati
translated: In this way, he will generate conceit on account of his former name, on account of the basis of his name, and on account of his present qualities of austerity and simplicity.

original: tasyaivaṃ bhaviṣyati vyākṛto 'haṃ taiḥ paurvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tasya evam bhaviṣyati vyākṛtaḥ ham taiḥ paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: He will think, 'I have been predicted to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by those former tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas.'

analyzed: yathā me amī guṇāḥ saṃvidyante
translated: Because these qualities are found in me.

original: taṃ ca māraḥ pāpīyānevaṃ vakṣyati avinivartanīyastvaṃ vyākṛtastathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tam ca māraḥ pāpīyān evam vakṣyati a vinivartanīyaḥ tvam vyākṛtaḥ tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And that wicked Māra will say to him, 'You have been predicted by the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, to be irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi tava ete evaṃrūpā dhutaguṇā saṃvidyante /
analyzed: tathā hi tava ete evaṃrūpāḥ dhuta guṇā saṃvidyante
translated: Because you have these kinds of qualities of austerity.'

original: tasya khalu punaḥ subhūte māraḥ pāyīyān kadācidbhikṣuveṣeṇopasaṃkramiṣyati /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar subhūte māraḥ pāyīyān kadācid bhikṣu veṣeṇa upasaṃkramiṣyati
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, that wicked Māra will sometimes approach in the guise of a monk,

analyzed: kadācid bhikṣuṇī veṣeṇa  kadācid upāsaka veṣeṇa
translated: sometimes in the guise of a nun,🔽sometimes in the guise of a male lay follower,

analyzed: kadācid upāsikā veṣeṇa  kadācid brāhmaṇa veṣeṇa
translated: sometimes in the guise of a female lay follower,🔽sometimes in the guise of a brahmin,

analyzed: kadācid gṛhapati veṣeṇa  kadācid mātṛ veṣeṇa
translated: sometimes in the guise of a householder,🔽sometimes in the guise of a mother,

analyzed: kadācid pitṛ veṣeṇa
translated: sometimes in the guise of a father,

analyzed: kadācid bhrātṛ veṣeṇa
translated: Sometimes in the guise of a brother.

analyzed: kadācid bhaginī veṣeṇa
translated: Sometimes in the guise of a sister.

analyzed: kadācid mitra amātya jñāti sālohita veṣeṇa upasaṃkramiṣyati
translated: Sometimes in the guise of a friend, minister, relative, or kinsman, he will approach.

original: upasaṃkramyaivaṃ vakṣyati vyākṛtastvaṃ paurvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau avinivartanīyāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau
analyzed: upasaṃkramya evam vakṣyati vyākṛtaḥ tvam paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau a vinivartanīyāyām bodhisattva bhūmau
translated: Having approached, he will say, 'You have been predicted by the past Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, to the irreversible stage of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi te evaṃrūpā dhutaguṇāḥ saṃvidyante /
analyzed: tathā hi te evaṃrūpāḥ dhuta guṇāḥ saṃvidyante
translated: Because you have such qualities of austerity.

analyzed: ye vinivartanīyānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām guṇāḥ
translated: Those are the qualities of the irreversible bodhisattva mahasattvas.

original: ye khalu punaḥ subhūte mayā avinivartanīyānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ guṇā ākhyātāḥ ākārā liṅgāni nimittāni cākhyātāni /
analyzed: ye khalu punar subhūte mayā a vinivartanīyānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām guṇāḥ ākhyātāḥ ākārāḥ liṅgāni nimittāni ca ākhyātāni
translated: Those qualities, characteristics, signs, and indications of the irreversible bodhisattva mahasattvas that I have explained,

analyzed: tāni tasya na bhaviṣyanti
translated: will not be in him.

original: veditavyametatsubhūte tato 'nyairbodhisattvairmahāsattvaiḥ mārādhiṣṭhito batāyaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattva iti /
analyzed: veditavyam etat subhūte tatas nyaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ māra dhiṣṭhitaḥ bata ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ iti
translated: Subhuti, other bodhisattva mahasattvas should know that this bodhisattva mahasattva is possessed by Mara.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ye ākārā yāni liṅgāni yāni nimittāni avinivartanīyānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām /
analyzed: ye ākārāḥ yāni liṅgāni yāni nimittāni a vinivartanīyānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām
translated: Those aspects, those signs, those marks of irreversible bodhisattva great beings.

analyzed: tāni tasya na bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those will not be in him.

original: sa khalu punaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nena nāmādhiṣṭhānena abhimānamutpādayiṣyati /
analyzed: sa khalu punar subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nena nāma adhiṣṭhānena abhimānam utpādayiṣyati
translated: And, Subhūti, that bodhisattva great being will produce pride through that name designation.

original: abhimānamutpādya mānābhibhūtaḥ stambhābhibhūto mārādhiṣṭhānenābhibhūtastadanyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvānavamaṃsyate uccagghayiṣyati ullāpayiṣyati
analyzed: abhimānam utpādya māna abhibhūtaḥ stambha abhibhūtaḥ māra adhiṣṭhānena abhibhūtaḥ tad anyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān avamaṃsyate uccagghayiṣyati ullāpayiṣyati  /
translated: Having produced pride, overwhelmed by pride, overwhelmed by conceit, overwhelmed by Māra's influence, he will despise other bodhisattva great beings, will laugh at them, will deride them,

analyzed: kutsayiṣyati paṃsayiṣyati
translated: will disparage them, will defame them.

original: idam api subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena nāmādhiṣṭhānena mārakarma veditavyam //
analyzed: idam api subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena nāma adhiṣṭhānena māra karma veditavyam
translated: Subhūti, this also should be known by a bodhisattva great being as Māra's deed through a name designation.

original: Vaidya punaraparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena nāmāpadeśena nāmavyākaraṇena mārakarma veditavyam /
analyzed: vaidya punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena nāma apadeśena nāma vyākaraṇena māra karma veditavyam
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being should know Māra's deed through the announcement of a name and the prediction of a name.

original: kathaṃ ca subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena nāmāpadeśena nāmavyākaraṇena mārakarma veditavyam /
analyzed: katham ca subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena nāma apadeśena nāma vyākaraṇena māra karma veditavyam
translated: And how, Subhūti, should a bodhisattva great being know Māra's deed through the announcement of a name and the prediction of a name?

original: iha subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān bhikṣuveṣeṇopasaṃkramya bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamevaṃ vyākariṣyati
analyzed: iha subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān bhikṣu veṣeṇa upasaṃkramya bodhisattvam mahāsattvam evam vyākariṣyati
translated: Here, Subhuti, Mara, the Evil One, having approached in the guise of a monk, will predict to a Bodhisattva, a great being:

original: tavānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhasya sataḥ idaṃ nāmadheyaṃ bhaviṣyatīti
analyzed: tava anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya sataḥ idam nāmadheyam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: When you have fully known unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, your name will be such-and-such.

original: yadeva tena cittenānuvartitamanuvitarkitamanuvicāritaṃ bhavati aho bata me 'nuttarāṃ
analyzed: yat eva tena cittena anuvartitam anuvitarkitam anuvicāritam bhavati aho bata me nuttarām
translated: Whatever name he has mentally pursued, mentally investigated, and mentally analyzed, thinking Oh, when I have fully known unsurpassed,

analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya sataḥ idam evaṃrūpam nāmadheyam bhavet iti
translated: perfect enlightenment, may my name be of such-and-such a kind,

analyzed: tat eva nāmadheyam vyākariṣyati
translated: that very name he will predict.

original: tatra duṣprajñajātīyasya anupāyakuśalasya bodhisattvasyaivaṃ bhaviṣyati yathā mayā nāmadheyamanuvartitamanuvitarkitamanuvicāritam /
analyzed: tatra duṣprajña jātīyasya an upāya kuśalasya bodhisattvasya evam bhaviṣyati yathā mayā nāmadheyam anuvartitam anuvitarkitam anuvicāritam
translated: There, a Bodhisattva of the type with poor wisdom, unskilled in means, will think: Just as I have mentally pursued, mentally investigated, and mentally analyzed a name,

original: aho bata me 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhasya sataḥ idaṃ nāmadheyaṃ bhavediti /
analyzed: aho bata me nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya sataḥ idam nāmadheyam bhavet iti
translated: thinking 'Oh, when I have fully known unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, may my name be of such-and-such a kind,'

analyzed: tathā tena bhikṣuṇā nirdiṣṭam iti
translated: just as it has been indicated by that monk.

analyzed: saḥ evam yat ca nāmadheyam svayam anuvicintitam
translated: He will think thus: That name which I have mentally conceived,

original: yacca tena māreṇa pāpīyasā mārakāyikābhirvā devatābhirabhinirmitena mārādhiṣṭhitena vā bhikṣuṇā nāmadheyamudīritam /
analyzed: yat ca tena māreṇa pāpīyasā māra kāyikābhiḥ vā devatābhiḥ abhinirmitena māra adhiṣṭhitena vā bhikṣuṇā nāmadheyam udīritam
translated: And the name that was uttered by that evil Māra, or by a deity of Māra’s realm, or by a monk conjured up by Māra, or by a monk possessed by Māra,

original: tadubhayaṃ tulayitvā yathā ca mama cittotpāda utpannaḥ /
analyzed: tat ubhayam tulayitvā yathā ca mama citta utpādaḥ utpannaḥ
translated: having weighed both of them, as my thought of enlightenment has arisen,

original: yathā ca anena bhikṣuṇā nirdiṣṭaṃ mama nāmadheyaṃ sameti nāmnā /
analyzed: yathā ca anena bhikṣuṇā nirdiṣṭam mama nāmadheyam sameti nāmnā
translated: and as the name of the monk has been indicated, the name agrees with mine.

original: nāmavyākṛto 'haṃ taiḥ paurvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāviti maṃsyate /
analyzed: nāma vyākṛtaḥ ham taiḥ paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau iti maṃsyate
translated: I have been predicted by those former Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: yāni ca mayā subhūte avinivartanīyānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāmākārā liṅgāni nimittāni ākhyātāni /
analyzed: yāni ca mayā subhūte a vinivartanīyānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām ākārāḥ liṅgāni nimittāni ākhyātāni
translated: And, Subhūti, those aspects, signs, and indications of irreversible bodhisattva great beings that I have taught,

analyzed: tāni tasya na bhaviṣyanti
translated: he will not have them.

analyzed: sa taiḥ virahitaḥ nena nāma apadeśena nāma vyākaraṇena manyanām utpādayiṣyati
translated: Deprived of them, he will produce conceit from that indication of a name, that prediction of a name.

original: sa manyanāmutpādya tato 'nyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvānavamaṃsyate ahaṃ vyākṛto 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: sa manyanām utpādya tatas nyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān avamaṃsyate aham vyākṛtaḥ nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Having produced conceit, he will then despise other bodhisattva great beings, thinking ‘I have been predicted to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

analyzed: na ete vyākṛtāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau iti
translated: They have not been predicted to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: evaṃ sa tena mānena atimānena mānātimānena abhimānena mithyāmānena ca tadanyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvānavamanyamāno dūrīkariṣyati sarvajñatām /
analyzed: evam sa tena mānena atimānena māna atimānena abhimānena mithyāmānena ca tad anyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān avamanyamānaḥ dūrīkariṣyati sarvajña tām
translated: In this way, through that pride, excessive pride, pride that is worse than pride, pride, and false pride, they will despise other bodhisattva mahāsattvas and will turn away from omniscience.

analyzed: dūrīkariṣyati buddha jñānam
translated: They will turn away from the knowledge of a buddha.

analyzed: tasya prajñāpāramitayā a parigṛhītasya upāya kauśalya virahitasya kalyāṇa mitra virahitasya
translated: They, not being taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom, lacking skill in means, lacking a spiritual friend,

analyzed: pāpa mitra parigṛhītasya dvayoḥ bhūmyoḥ anyatarā bhūmiḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyā śrāvaka bhūmiḥ vā
translated: taken hold of by bad friends, should expect one of two levels, either the śrāvaka level

analyzed: pratyekabuddha bhūmiḥ vā
translated: or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: sacetpunaściraṃ suciraṃ saṃdhāvya saṃsṛtya enāmeva prajñāpāramitāmāgamya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmo bhavet /
analyzed: saced punar ciram su ciram saṃdhāvya saṃsṛtya enām eva prajñāpāramitām āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmaḥ bhavet
translated: If, after wandering for a long time in samsara, they should wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by coming to just this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: yadi ca asau upasarpet kalyāṇa mitrāṇi
translated: and if they should approach spiritual friends,

analyzed: abhīkṣṇam ca tāni upasaṃkramiṣyati
translated: and if they should frequently go to them,

analyzed: tena eva ca ātma bhāva pratilambhena tāvat pūrvakān citta utpādān vigarhiṣyati
translated: by just that attainment of a body they will condemn the thoughts they had previously.

analyzed: vāntīkariṣyati
translated: They will vomit them up.

analyzed: jugupsiṣyati  pratiniḥ srakṣyati
translated: will despise,🔽will reject,

analyzed: pratideśayiṣyati
translated: will disavow,

analyzed: tathā api buddha bhūmiḥ tasya durlabhā bhaviṣyati
translated: still, the stage of a Buddha will be difficult for him to attain.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tāvadgurutaraṃ hi subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mananāpattisthānam /
analyzed: tāvat gurutaram hi subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mananā āpatti sthānam
translated: Subhuti, the place of transgression through conceit is much more serious for a Bodhisattva, a great being.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte bhikṣoḥ śrāvakayānikasya śrāvakabhūmau catasro mūlāpattayo gurvyo bhavanti /🔽yato 'nyatarānyatarā māpattimadhyāpadya abhikṣurbhavatyaśramaṇo 'śākyaputrīyaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte bhikṣoḥ śrāvaka yānikasya śrāvaka bhūmau catasraḥ mūla āpattayaḥ gurvyaḥ bhavanti  yatas nyatara anyatarā mā āpattim adhyāpadya abhikṣuḥ bhavati a śramaṇaḥ śākyaputrīyaḥ
translated: Just as, Subhuti, for a monk in the vehicle of the disciples, the four grave offenses are serious,🔽from which, having committed any one of them, he is no longer a monk, no longer a holy man, no longer a son of the Sakyans.

analyzed: iyam eva tābhyaḥ catasṛbhyaḥ āpattibhyaḥ gurutarā āpattiḥ
translated: This very one is a more serious offense than those four offenses.

analyzed: yaḥ yam māna citta utpādaḥ
translated: This is the production of a conceited thought,

original: yaduta nāmāpadeśena bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyāvamānanayā mahānakuśalaścittotpāda utpannaḥ /
analyzed: yat uta nāma apadeśena bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya avamānanayā mahān akuśalaḥ citta utpādaḥ utpannaḥ
translated: namely, through the pretense of a name, the production of a very unwholesome thought of contempt for a Bodhisattva, a great being.

analyzed: ayam tābhyaḥ catasṛbhyaḥ āpattibhyaḥ gurutaraḥ citta utpādaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: This production of a thought should be known as a more serious offense than those four offenses.

analyzed: tiṣṭhantu subhūte catasraḥ gurvyaḥ mūla āpattayaḥ
translated: Let alone, Subhuti, the four grave offenses.

analyzed: pañcabhyaḥ pi subhūte ānantaryebhyaḥ vaidya
translated: Subhuti, a doctor who cures the five deadly diseases,🔽

analyzed: karmabhyaḥ gurutaraḥ yam citta utpādaḥ
translated: “Subhūti, this thought of enlightenment is heavier than the five actions of immediate retribution.

original: yo 'yaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmāpadeśena mānasahagataścittotpāda utpannaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ yam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāma apadeśena māna sahagataḥ citta utpādaḥ utpannaḥ
translated: This thought of enlightenment of a bodhisattva mahāsattva that has arisen accompanied by pride on account of the announcement of his name.

original: ayaṃ tebhyaḥ pañcabhya ānantaryebhyaḥ karmabhyo gurutaraścittotpādo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: ayam tebhyaḥ pañcabhyaḥ ānantaryebhyaḥ karmabhyaḥ gurutaraḥ citta utpādaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: This thought of enlightenment should be known as heavier than those five actions of immediate retribution.

original: iti hi subhūte anenāpi nāmāpadeśena sūkṣmasūkṣmāṇi mārakarmāṇyutpatsyante /
analyzed: iti hi subhūte anena api nāma apadeśena sūkṣma sūkṣmāṇi māra karmāṇi utpatsyante
translated: In this way, Subhūti, even through this announcement of his name, subtle and subtle māra-actions will arise.

analyzed: tāni bodhisattvena mahāsattvena boddhavyāni
translated: Those should be understood by the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

analyzed: anyebhyaḥ ca avabodhayitavyāni
translated: And he should awaken others to them.

original: buddhvā ca vivarjayitavyāni //🔽punaraparaṃ subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān vivekaguṇena bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamupasaṃkramya codayiṣyati smārayiṣyati /
analyzed: buddhvā ca vivarjayitavyāni  punar aparam subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān viveka guṇena bodhisattvam mahāsattvam upasaṃkramya codayiṣyati smārayiṣyati
translated: And having understood, he should avoid them.”🔽“Furthermore, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one, approaching a bodhisattva mahāsattva with the quality of solitude, will admonish and remind him.

original: kathaṃ ca subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān vivekaguṇena bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamupasaṃkramya codayiṣyati smārayiṣyati /
analyzed: katham ca subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān viveka guṇena bodhisattvam mahāsattvam upasaṃkramya codayiṣyati smārayiṣyati
translated: And how, Subhūti, will Māra the wicked one, approaching a bodhisattva mahāsattva with the quality of solitude, admonish and remind him?

original: iha subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamupasaṃkramiṣyati /
analyzed: iha subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān bodhisattvam mahāsattvam upasaṃkramiṣyati
translated: Here, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one will approach a bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: upasaṃkramyaivaṃ vakṣyati vivekasya tathāgato varṇavādī araṇyavanaprasthagiriguhāśmaśānapalālapuñjādiṣu vihartavyamiti /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya evam vakṣyati vivekasya tathāgataḥ varṇa vādī araṇya vana prastha giri guhā śmaśāna palāla puñja ādiṣu vihartavyam iti
translated: Having approached, he will say, 'The Tathāgata praises solitude. One should dwell in forests, groves, on mountain peaks, in caves, in charnel grounds, in heaps of straw, and so on.'

original: na cāhaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evaṃvidhaṃ vivekaṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: na ca aham subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evaṃvidham vivekam vadāmi
translated: But, Subhūti, I do not speak of such solitude for a bodhisattva mahāsattva,

original: yaduta āraṇyakāni prāntāni śayanāsanāni vijanapadāni viviktāni /
analyzed: yat uta āraṇyakāni prāntāni śayanāsanāni vijanapadāni viviktāni
translated: namely, solitary places such as forests, groves, mountain peaks, caves, charnel grounds, heaps of straw, and so on.

analyzed: vividhāni vana prastha giri guhā śmaśāna palāla puñja ādīni
translated: Various forest groves, mountain peaks, caves, charnel grounds, heaps of straw, and so on.

original: subhūtirāha katamaḥ punaḥ sa bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anyo viveko
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha katamaḥ punar sa bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anyaḥ
translated: Subhūti said, But what, Blessed One, is that other solitude of a bodhisattva mahāsattva,

original: yadi vā āraṇyakāni prāntāni śayanāsanāni vijanapadāni viviktāni vividhāni vanaprasthagiriguhāśmaśānapalālapuñjādīni /
analyzed: yadi vā āraṇyakāni prāntāni śayana āsanāni vijanapadāni viviktāni vividhāni vanaprastha giri guhā śmaśāna palāla puñja ādīni
translated: whether it is solitary places such as forests, groves, mountain peaks, caves, charnel grounds, heaps of straw, and so on,

analyzed: yadi tāni na adhyāvasati
translated: if he does not dwell in them?

analyzed: kiyat rūpaḥ punar bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anyaḥ vivekaḥ
translated: To what extent, Blessed One, is there another solitude of a bodhisattva mahāsattva?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocat sacetsubhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo vivikto bhavati śrāvakapratisaṃyuktairmanasikāraiḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat saced subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ viviktaḥ bhavati śrāvaka pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti, “Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva is secluded from mental activities associated with the śrāvakas,

analyzed: viviktaḥ bhavati pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ
translated: and is secluded from mental activities associated with the pratyekabuddhas,

original: evaṃ sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo vivikto viharati /
analyzed: evam sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ viviktaḥ viharati
translated: then that bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells in seclusion.

original: grāmānte 'pi hi viharan prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyaparigṛhītaḥ sarvasattvamaitrīmahākaruṇāvihāreṇa viharet /
analyzed: grāma ante hi viharan prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya parigṛhītaḥ sarva sattva maitrī mahā karuṇā vihāreṇa viharet
translated: Even if he dwells near a village, if he is embraced by the perfection of wisdom and skillful means, he dwells in the dwelling of great compassion and friendliness towards all beings.

original: anena vihāreṇa viharan vivikta eva sa viharati /
analyzed: anena vihāreṇa viharan viviktaḥ eva sa viharati
translated: Dwelling in this dwelling, he dwells in seclusion itself.

original: ayaṃ khalu punaḥ subhūte mayā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktamanasikāraviveko 'nujñātaḥ /
analyzed: ayam khalu punar subhūte mayā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyukta manasikāra vivekaḥ nujñātaḥ
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, this seclusion of the bodhisattva mahāsattva from mental activities associated with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas has been allowed by me.

original: anena vivekena viharan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo rātriṃdivānyatināmayati /
analyzed: anena vivekena viharan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ rātriṃdivāni atināmayati
translated: Dwelling in this seclusion, the bodhisattva mahāsattva spends his days and nights.

analyzed: viviktaḥ viharati
translated: He dwells in seclusion.

analyzed: saced bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ raṇya vana prastha giri guhā śmaśāna prānta śayana āsaneṣu anena vihāreṇa viharati
translated: If a bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells in these abodes in the wilderness, in forests, at the foot of trees, in empty places, in mountain glens, in charnel grounds, or in remote places,

analyzed: viviktaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ viharati
translated: then that bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells in solitude.

original: yaṃ punaḥ subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān vivekamupadekṣyati araṇyavanaprasthagiriguhāśmaśānaprāntaśayanāsanavihārān /
analyzed: yam punar subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān vivekam upadekṣyati araṇya vana prastha giri guhā śmaśāna prānta śayana āsana vihārān
translated: But, Subhūti, that Māra, the evil one, will teach solitude, the wilderness, forests, the foot of trees, empty places, mountain glens, charnel grounds, and remote abodes.

original: sa tena vivekena śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktairmanasikāraiḥ saṃkīrṇa eva san prajñāpāramitāyāmanabhiyujyamāno na sarvajñajñānaṃ paripūrayati
analyzed: sa tena vivekena śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ saṃkīrṇaḥ eva san prajñāpāramitāyām an abhiyujyamānaḥ na sarvajña jñānam paripūrayati
translated: He, dwelling in that solitude, with thoughts associated with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, not applying himself to the perfection of wisdom, does not fulfill the knowledge of all modes.

original: evaṃ sa saṃkīrṇavihāreṇa viharan so 'pariśuddhena manasikāreṇa viharan apariśuddhakāyavāṅmanaḥkarmāntaḥ eva bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam sa saṃkīrṇa vihāreṇa viharan saḥ u pariśuddhena manasikāreṇa viharan a pariśuddha kāya vāc manaḥ karmāntaḥ eva bhaviṣyati
translated: Thus, he, dwelling in that mixed dwelling, with impure thought, dwells with impure bodily, verbal, and mental action.

original: apariśuddhakāyavāṅmanaḥkarmānta eva saṃstato 'nyān api bodhisattvān mahāsattvān grāmāntavihāriṇo
analyzed: a pariśuddha kāya vāc manaḥ karmāntaḥ eva san tatas nyān api bodhisattvān mahāsattvān grāma anta vihāriṇaḥ
translated: With impure bodily, verbal, and mental action, he will surpass other bodhisattva mahāsattvas who dwell in villages,

analyzed: saṃkīrṇān śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ prajñā upāya mahā karuṇā vihāra vihāriṇaḥ vamaṃsyate
translated: He will despise those who dwell in the practice of wisdom, means, and great compassion, thinking, They are defiled by associating with śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: araṇye 'pi viharan so 'pariśuddhakāyavāṅmanaḥkarmāntaḥ san saṃkīrṇavihāryeva bhavati /
analyzed: araṇye pi viharan saḥ pariśuddha kāya vāc manaḥ karmāntaḥ san saṃkīrṇa vihārī eva bhavati
translated: Even if he dwells in the wilderness, if his physical, verbal, and mental actions are impure, he is still dwelling in defilement.

analyzed: na vivikta vihārī
translated: He is not dwelling in solitude.

analyzed: sa prajñā upāya mahā karuṇā vihāra vihāriṇaḥ vaidya
translated: He despises those who dwell in the practice of wisdom, means, and great compassion,

analyzed: grāma ante viharataḥ pariśuddha kāya vāc manaḥ karma samudācārān śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyukta manasikāra viviktān asaṃkīrṇān
translated: those who dwell in the village, whose physical, verbal, and mental conduct is pure, who are free from thoughts associated with śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who are not defiled,

analyzed: śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ tān tāvat saḥ vamanyamānaḥ na dhyāna samādhi samāpatti vimokṣa abhijñānām lābhī bhaviṣyati
translated: who are free from thoughts associated with śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas. Despising them in this way, he will not attain the dhyānas, concentrations, meditative absorptions, liberations, and higher knowledges.

analyzed: na ca asya tāḥ paripūrim gamiṣyanti
translated: And he will not perfect them.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: tathā hi saḥ nu pāya kuśalaḥ bhavati
translated: Because he is unskilled in means.

original: kiṃcāpi subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo yojanaśatikeṣvaṭavīkāntāreṣu viharedapagatavyālamṛgapakṣisaṃgheṣu
analyzed: kiṃca api subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yojana śatikeṣu aṭavī kāntāreṣu viharet apagata vyāla mṛga pakṣi saṃgheṣu
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, even if a bodhisattva mahāsattva were to dwell in forests and wildernesses extending for hundreds of yojanas, free from the hordes of wild animals and birds,

original: apagatakṣudramṛgavyālayakṣarākṣasānuvicariteṣu apagatacaurakāntārabhayabhairavopadraveṣu saṃtiṣṭhet /🔽varṣaṃ vā varṣaśataṃ vā varṣasahasraṃ vā varṣaśatasahasraṃ vā varṣakoṭīṃ vā varṣakoṭīśataṃ vā varṣakoṭīsahasraṃ vā varṣakoṭīśatasahasraṃ vā
analyzed: apagata kṣudra mṛga vyāla yakṣa rākṣasa anuvicariteṣu apagata caura kāntāra bhaya bhairava upadraveṣu saṃtiṣṭhet  varṣam vā varṣa śatam vā varṣa sahasram vā varṣa śata sahasram vā varṣa koṭīm vā varṣa koṭī śatam vā varṣa koṭī sahasram vā varṣa koṭī śata sahasram vā
translated: free from the haunts of small animals, goblins, and rākṣasas, free from the fear, terror, and harm of thieves and robbers,

analyzed: varṣa koṭī niyuta śata sahasram vā
translated: for one year, or one hundred years, or one thousand years, or one hundred thousand years, or one million years, or one hundred million years, or one billion years,

analyzed: tatas vai upari
translated: or more than that,

original: imaṃ ca vivekaṃ mayopadiṣṭaṃ na jānīyāt /
analyzed: imam ca vivekam mayā upadiṣṭam na jānīyāt
translated: and did not know this solitude taught by me,

analyzed: yena vivekena bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dhyā āśaya saṃprasthitaḥ dhyā āśaya saṃpannaḥ viharati
translated: by which solitude a bodhisattva mahāsattva, set out in superior intention, endowed with superior intention, dwells.

analyzed: tam saḥ nu pāya kuśalaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ jānan araṇya paramaḥ viharati
translated: That bodhisattva mahāsattva, unskilled in means, ignorant, dwells in the forest as supreme.

analyzed: tatra ca viveke niśritaḥ ālīnaḥ dhī avasitaḥ dhī avasāyam āpannaḥ
translated: And, relying on that solitude, he is attached, clinging, and grasping.

original: naiva me subhūte etāvatā sa bodhisattvaścittamārādhayati /
analyzed: na eva me subhūte etāvatā sa bodhisattvaḥ cittam ārādhayati
translated: Subhūti, I do not think that bodhisattva has pleased me that much.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yaḥ subhūte viveko bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ mayā ākhyātaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ subhūte vivekaḥ bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām mayā ākhyātaḥ
translated: Subhūti, the solitude of bodhisattva mahāsattvas that I have taught,

original: tena vivekena viharannasmin viveke na saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: tena vivekena viharan asmin viveke na saṃdṛśyate
translated: while dwelling in that solitude, is not seen in this solitude.

original: tamenaṃ māraḥ pāpīyānupasaṃkramya uparyantarīkṣe vihāyasi sthitvā evaṃ vakṣyati sādhu sādhu kulaputra /
analyzed: tam enam māraḥ pāpīyān upasaṃkramya upari antarīkṣe vihāyasi sthitvā evam vakṣyati sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: Then Māra the Evil One, having approached, standing in the air above, will say this: 'Excellent, excellent, son of good family!

original: eṣa bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ tathāgatena viveka ākhyātaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tathāgatena vivekaḥ ākhyātaḥ
translated: This is the solitude taught by the Tathāgata for bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

analyzed: anena eva tvam kula putra vivekena vihara
translated: Son of good family, dwell in just this solitude.

analyzed: evam tvam kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: In this way you will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.'

original: sa tato vivekātpunareva araṇyādgrāmāntamavatīrya tadanyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān
analyzed: sa tatas vivekāt punar eva araṇyāt grāma antam avatīrya tad anyān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān
translated: Then, having descended from that solitude, from the forest, into the vicinity of the village, he will despise other bodhisattva mahāsattvas

analyzed: peśalān bhikṣūn sabrahmacāriṇaḥ kalyāṇa dharmaṇaḥ saṃkīrṇān śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ
translated: who are skillful, monks, celibate, virtuous, unmixed, with thoughts connected to śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

analyzed: pariśuddha kāya vāc manaḥ karmāntān jīvān avamaṃsyate
translated: whose bodily, verbal, and mental actions are pure.

original: sa evaṃ vakṣyati saṃkīrṇavihāreṇa bateme āyuṣmanto viharanti /
analyzed: saḥ evam vakṣyati saṃkīrṇa vihāreṇa bata ime āyuṣmantaḥ viharanti
translated: He will say, 'Venerable ones, you are living in a crowded dwelling,

analyzed: na vivikta vihāreṇa
translated: not in a secluded dwelling.

analyzed: ākīrṇa vihāreṇa bata ime āyuṣmantaḥ viharanti
translated: Venerable ones, you are living in a crowded dwelling,

analyzed: na vivikta vihāreṇa viharanti iti
translated: not in a secluded dwelling.'

original: ye te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā viviktavihāreṇa viharanti /🔽tān saṃkīrṇavihāreṇa codayiṣyati /
analyzed: ye te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ vivikta vihāreṇa viharanti  tān saṃkīrṇa vihāreṇa codayiṣyati
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are living in a secluded dwelling,🔽he will accuse them of living in a crowded dwelling.

analyzed: ākīrṇa vihāreṇa codayiṣyati
translated: He will accuse them of living in a crowded dwelling.

analyzed: ye ca te saṃkīrṇa vihāreṇa viharanti
translated: And those who are living in a crowded dwelling,

analyzed: tān sa vivikta vihāreṇa samudācariṣyati
translated: he will practice with them in a secluded dwelling.

analyzed: tatra gauravam utpādayiṣyati
translated: He will generate respect there.

analyzed: yatra ca gauravam utpādayitavyam
translated: And where respect should be generated,

analyzed: tatra mānam utpādayiṣyati
translated: there he will generate pride.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: aham amanuṣyaiḥ codye
translated: I am accused by non-humans.

analyzed: aham amanuṣyaiḥ smārye
translated: I am reminded by non-humans.

original: eṣa subhūte vihāro yenāhaṃ vihāreṇa viharāmi /
analyzed: eṣa subhūte vihāraḥ yena aham vihāreṇa viharāmi
translated: This is the dwelling, Subhūti, by which I dwell.

analyzed: kam grāma anta vihāriṇam amanuṣyāḥ codayiṣyanti
translated: Which one living in a village will non-humans accuse?

analyzed: kam grāma antare viharantam amanuṣyāḥ smārayiṣyanti
translated: Which one living in another village will non-humans remind?

analyzed: iti evam hi bodhisattva yānikān pudgalān avamaṃsyate
translated: Thus he will despise those individuals who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: ayam subhūte bodhisattva caṇḍālaḥ veditavyaḥ  bodhisattva dūṣī veditavyaḥ
translated: This, Subhūti, should be known as a Bodhisattva-caṇḍāla.🔽He should be known as a Bodhisattva-corrupter.

analyzed: bodhisattva pratirūpakaḥ veditavyaḥ  bodhisattva prativarṇikaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: He should be known as a Bodhisattva-counterfeit.🔽He should be known as a Bodhisattva-impostor.

analyzed: bodhisattva kāraṇḍavakaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: He should be known as a Bodhisattva-kākavandhu.

analyzed: cauraḥ śramaṇa veṣeṇa  cauraḥ bodhisattva yānikānām pudgalānām
translated: He is a thief in the guise of an ascetic.🔽He is a thief of those who have set out in the Great Vehicle.

analyzed: cauraḥ sa devakasya lokasya
translated: He is a thief of the world with its gods.

original: tajjātīyaḥ khaluḥ punaḥ subhūte pudgalo na sevitavyo na bhaktavyo na paryupāsitavyaḥ /
analyzed: tad jātīyaḥ khalu punar subhūte pudgalaḥ na sevitavyaḥ na bhaktavyaḥ na paryupāsitavyaḥ
translated: Such a person, Subhūti, should not be attended upon, should not be served, should not be honored.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: abhimānapatitā hi te tathārūpāḥ pudgalā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: abhimāna patitāḥ hi te tathārūpāḥ pudgalāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: They should be known as persons who have fallen into pride.

translated: The Blessed One said, So it is, Subhūti. It is just as you say.

original: syātsubhūte paryāyo yena paryāyeṇa yenaiva asaṅgalakṣaṇena prajñāpāramitā saṃvidyate /
analyzed: syāt subhūte paryāyaḥ yena paryāyeṇa yena eva asaṅga lakṣaṇena prajñāpāramitā saṃvidyate
translated: Subhūti, there is a way in which, by that way, all dharmas would exist by that very unattached characteristic by which the perfection of wisdom exists.

analyzed: tena eva asaṅga lakṣaṇena sarva dharmāḥ saṃvidyante
translated: By that very unattached characteristic, all dharmas exist.

analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ hi subhūte śūnyāḥ

original: tasmāttarhi subhūte yenaiva asaṅgalakṣaṇena prajñāpāramitā viviktā śūnyā /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi subhūte yena eva asaṅga lakṣaṇena prajñāpāramitā viviktā śūnyā
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, by that very unattached characteristic by which the perfection of wisdom is isolated, empty,

analyzed: tena eva asaṅga lakṣaṇena sarva dharmāḥ viviktāḥ śūnyāḥ
translated: by that very unattached characteristic, all dharmas are isolated, empty.

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha yadi bhagavan sarva dharmāḥ viviktāḥ
translated: Subhūti said, Blessed One, if all dharmas are isolated,

original: sarvadharmāḥ śūnyāḥ /🔽kathaṃ bhagavan sattvānāṃ saṃkleśaḥ prajñāyate /
analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ śūnyāḥ  katham bhagavan sattvānām saṃkleśaḥ prajñāyate

analyzed: katham bhagavan sattvānām vyavadānam prajñāyate

analyzed: na ca bhagavan viviktam saṃkliśyate

original: na bhagavan viviktaṃ vyavadāyati /🔽na ca bhagavan śūnyaṃ saṃkliśyate /
analyzed: na bhagavan viviktam vyavadāyati  na ca bhagavan śūnyam saṃkliśyate

analyzed: na ca bhagavan śūnyam vyavadāyati

analyzed: na ca bhagavan viviktam vā śūnyam vā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate

analyzed: anyatra api bhagavan śūnyatāyāḥ sarva dharmaḥ na upalabhyate

analyzed: yaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ vā  abhisaṃbhotsyate vā
translated: In which one has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,🔽will fully awaken,

analyzed: abhisaṃbudhyate vā

original: kathaṃ vā vayaṃ bhagavan asya bhāṣitasyārthamājānīmaḥ /
analyzed: katham vā vayam bhagavan asya bhāṣitasya artham ājānīmaḥ

analyzed: deśayatu bhagavan

analyzed: deśayatu sugata
translated: Let the Well-Gone One teach it.

analyzed: dīrgharātram sattvāḥ ahaṃkāre mamakāre caranti

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha evam etat bhagavan
translated: Subhuti said, So it is, Blessed One.

analyzed: evam etat sugata

analyzed: bhagavān āha evam khalu subhūte sattvānām saṃkleśaḥ prajñāyate

original: evaṃ caran bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarveṣāṃ śrāvakayānikānāṃ pratyekabuddhayānikānāṃ ca pudgalānāṃ caryāmabhibhavati /
analyzed: evam caran bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarveṣām śrāvaka yānikānām pratyekabuddha yānikānām ca pudgalānām caryām abhibhavati
translated: In this way, Blessed One, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing like this, surpasses the practice of all the individuals who are in the Śrāvakayāna and Pratyekabuddhayāna.

analyzed: an abhibhūtam ca sthānam pratilabhate
translated: And he attains a place that is not surpassed.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: an abhibhūtam hi bhagavan buddha tvam tathāgata tvam svayaṃbhū tvam sarvajña tvam
translated: Because, Blessed One, Buddhahood, Tathāgathood, Self-Arisenhood, and Omniscience are not surpassed.

original: anenāpi bhagavan manasikāreṇa prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktena vihāreṇa viharan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo rātriṃdinānyatināmayet /
analyzed: anena api bhagavat manasikāreṇa prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktena vihāreṇa viharan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ rātriṃdināni atināmayet
translated: Blessed One, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who dwells with this mental activity connected with the perfection of wisdom, connected with this dwelling, would spend the days and nights.

analyzed: āsannaḥ syāt anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: He would be close to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: kṣipram ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta
translated: And he would quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocat evametatsubhūte / evam etat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat evam etat subhūte evam etat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti: So it is, Subhūti, so it is.

original: evaṃ caran subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaścarati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: evam caran subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like this practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ hi caran subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na rūpe carati /
analyzed: evam hi caran subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na rūpe carati
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like this does not practice in form.

original: na vedanāyāṃ na saṃjñāyāṃ na saṃskāreṣu /
analyzed: na vedanāyām na saṃjñāyām na saṃskāreṣu
translated: Not in feeling, not in perception, not in volitional formations,🔽

analyzed: na vijñāne carati
translated: He does not practice in feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness.

original: evaṃ caran subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'navamardanīyo bhavati sadevamānuṣāsureṇa lokena /
analyzed: evam caran subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nava mardanīyaḥ bhavati sa deva mānuṣa asureṇa lokena
translated: Thus practicing, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, is not overcome by the world with its gods, men, and Asuras.

original: evaṃ caran subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarveṣāṃ śrāvakayānikānāṃ pratyekabuddhayānikānāṃ ca pudgalānāṃ caryāmabhibhavati /
analyzed: evam caran subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarveṣām śrāvaka yānikānām pratyekabuddha yānikānām ca pudgalānām caryām abhibhavati
translated: Thus practicing, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, surpasses the practice of all the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: an abhibhūtam ca sthānam pratilabhate
translated: And he obtains a position that is not overcome.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: anabhibhūtaṃ hi subhūte buddhatvaṃ tathāgatatvaṃ svayaṃbhūtvaṃ sarvajñatvam /
analyzed: an abhibhūtam hi subhūte buddha tvam tathāgata tvam svayaṃbhū tvam sarvajña tvam
translated: For, Subhuti, Buddhahood, Tathagatahood, Self-Existenthood, and Omniscience are not overcome.

original: anenāpi subhūte manasikāreṇa prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktena vihāreṇa viharan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo rātriṃdinānyatināmayet /🔽āsannaḥ syādanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: anena api subhūte manasikāreṇa prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktena vihāreṇa viharan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ rātriṃdināni atināmayet  āsannaḥ syāt anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: By this thought also, Subhuti, connected with the perfection of wisdom, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should spend the nights and days.🔽He would be near to supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: kṣipram ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta
translated: And he would quickly fully awaken to supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: sacetkhalu punaḥ subhūte ye jambūdvīpe sattvāḥ /
analyzed: saced khalu punar subhūte ye jambūdvīpe sattvāḥ
translated: If, on the other hand, Subhuti, all the beings in Jambudvipa

analyzed: te sarve pūrvācaramam mānuṣyakam ātmabhāvam pratilabheran
translated: All of them would obtain a human body for the first and last time.

analyzed: mānuṣyakam ātma bhāvam pratilabhya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayeran
translated: Having obtained a human body, they would arouse the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādya yāvajjīvam tiṣṭheyuḥ
translated: Having aroused the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, they would remain for as long as they live.

original: yāvajjīvaṃ tiṣṭhanto yāvajjīvaṃ sarvatathāgatān satkuryurgurukuryurmānayeyuḥ pūjayeyurarcayeyurapacāyeyuḥ /
analyzed: yāvajjīvam tiṣṭhantaḥ yāvajjīvam sarva tathāgatān satkuryuḥ gurukuryuḥ mānayeyuḥ pūjayeyuḥ arcayeyuḥ apacāyeyuḥ
translated: Remaining for as long as they live, they would honor, respect, revere, and worship all the Tathagatas for as long as they live.

analyzed: evam sarva sattvebhyaḥ pi dānam dadyuḥ
translated: In the same way, they would give gifts to all beings.

analyzed: tat ca dānam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayeyuḥ
translated: And they would dedicate that gift to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: tatkiṃ manyase subhūte api nu te bodhisattvā mahāsattvāstatonidānaṃ bahu puṇyaṃ prasaveyuḥ /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte api nu te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ tatonidānam bahu puṇyam prasaveyuḥ
translated: What do you think, Subhuti, would those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas generate much merit on that basis?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha bahu bhagavan
translated: Subhuti said: Much, Blessed One.

analyzed: bahu sugata
translated: Much, Sugata.

original: bhagavānāha ataḥ khalu punaḥ subhūte sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha atas khalu punar subhūte sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: The Blessed One said: Therefore, Subhuti, that son or daughter of good family generates even more merit.

analyzed: yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ eka divasam api prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ viharati
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who dwells for even one day with thoughts associated with the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: vaidya tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that, O Physician?

original: yathā yathā hi subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktairmanasikārai rātriṃdivaṃ viharati /
analyzed: yathā yathā hi subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ rātriṃdivam viharati
translated: As the bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells day and night with thoughts associated with the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: tathā tathā sarva sattvānām dakṣiṇīya tām gacchati
translated: to that extent he becomes worthy of offerings from all beings.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi subhūte nāsti tadanyeṣāṃ sattvānāṃ tādṛśaṃ maitrīsahagataṃ cittam /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte na asti tad anyeṣām sattvānām tādṛśam maitrī sahagatam cittam
translated: Because, Subhūti, there is no such mind endowed with friendliness in other beings,

analyzed: yathā tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: like that of that bodhisattva mahāsattva.

analyzed: sthāpayitvā buddhān bhagavataḥ
translated: Except for the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  apratipudgalāḥ hi subhūte tathāgatāḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?🔽Subhūti, the Tathāgatas are without a peer.

analyzed: nirupamāḥ hi subhūte tathāgatāḥ
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgatas are incomparable.

original: acintyadharmasamanvāgatā hi subhūte tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ //
analyzed: acintya dharma samanvāgatāḥ hi subhūte tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones are endowed with inconceivable qualities.

original: kathaṃ ca subhūte sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tāvattatpuṇyamabhinirharati /
analyzed: katham ca subhūte sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tāvat tat puṇyam abhinirharati
translated: And how, Subhūti, does that son of a good family or daughter of a good family generate that much merit?

original: tādṛśyā subhūte prajñayā samanvāgataḥ sa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhavati /
analyzed: tādṛśyā subhūte prajñayā samanvāgataḥ sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhavati
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva has such wisdom.

original: yādṛśyā prajñayā samanvāgato vadhyagatāniva sarvasattvān paśyati /
analyzed: yādṛśyā prajñayā samanvāgataḥ vadhya gatān iva sarva sattvān paśyati
translated: With such wisdom, he sees all beings as if they were being led to execution.

analyzed: tena tasyām velāyām mahā karuṇā parigṛhītaḥ bhavati
translated: At that time, he is embraced by great compassion.

original: sa divyena cakṣuṣā vyavalokayan aprameyānasaṃkhyeyānaparimeyānaparimāṇān sattvānānantaryakarmasamanvāgatān paśyati /
analyzed: sa divyena cakṣuṣā vyavalokayan aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān aparimeyān aparimāṇān sattvān ānantarya karma samanvāgatān paśyati
translated: With his divine eye, he sees immeasurable, incalculable, boundless, limitless beings who possess the karma for immediate retribution.

original: akṣaṇaprāptāṃś ca vihanyamānāṃś ca dṛṣṭijālapraticchannāṃś ca mārgamapratilabhamānān /🔽aparāṃś ca kṣaṇaprāptān paśyati /
analyzed: akṣaṇa prāptān ca vihanyamānān ca dṛṣṭi jāla praticchannān ca mārgam a pratilabhamānān  aparān ca kṣaṇa prāptān paśyati
translated: He sees them as having attained unfavorable conditions, being harmed, covered by the net of views, and not obtaining the path.🔽He also sees others who have attained favorable conditions.

analyzed: kṣaṇān ca virāgayataḥ paśyati
translated: He sees them detaching from favorable conditions.

original: tasya tasyāṃ velāyāṃ mahān saṃvega utpadyate /
analyzed: tasya tasyām velāyām mahān saṃvegaḥ utpadyate
translated: At that time, he gives rise to great urgency.

original: te cāsya sarvasattvāstayā mahāmaitryā tayā ca mahākaruṇayā sphāritvā manasikṛtā bhavanti ahameteṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ sattvānāṃ nātho bhaviṣyāmi /
analyzed: te ca asya sarva sattvāḥ tayā mahā maitryā tayā ca mahā karuṇayā sphāritvā manasi kṛtāḥ bhavanti aham eteṣām sarveṣām sattvānām nāthaḥ bhaviṣyāmi
translated: And he brings to mind all those beings, thinking, I will be the protector of all these beings.

analyzed: aham enān sarva sattvān sarva duḥkhebhyaḥ mocayiṣyāmi iti
translated: I will liberate all those beings from all suffering.

original: na ca tena vā anyena vā nimittena sārdhaṃ saṃvasati /
analyzed: na ca tena vā anyena vā nimittena sārdham saṃvasati
translated: He does not live together with that or any other reason.

original: ayam api subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahān prajñāloko 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhum /
analyzed: ayam api subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahān prajñā lokaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum
translated: This, Subhūti, is a great light of wisdom for a bodhisattva mahāsattva to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: anena hi subhūte vihāreṇa viharanto bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sarvalokasya dakṣiṇīyatāṃ parigṛhṇanti /
analyzed: anena hi subhūte vihāreṇa viharantaḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sarva lokasya dakṣiṇīya tām parigṛhṇanti
translated: For, Subhūti, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who dwell in this dwelling take hold of being worthy of offerings from the entire world.

analyzed: na ca vivartante nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: And they do not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: yeṣāṃ ca dāyakānāṃ dānapatīnāṃ ca paribhuñjate cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkārān /
analyzed: yeṣām ca dāyakānām dānapatīnām ca paribhuñjate cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārān
translated: And they enjoy the robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, medicines for sickness, and other personal belongings of those donors and patrons.

analyzed: asyām prajñāpāramitāyām su upasthita cittāḥ
translated: With their minds well-established in this perfection of wisdom.

original: teṣāṃ dāyakānāṃ dānapatīnāṃ ca dānadakṣiṇāṃ viśodhayanti /
analyzed: teṣām dāyakānām dānapatīnām ca dāna dakṣiṇām viśodhayanti
translated: They purify the gifts and offerings of those donors and patrons.

analyzed: sarvajña tā ca eṣām āsannībhavati
translated: And they draw near to omniscience.

original: tasmāttarhi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena amoghaṃ rāṣṭraṃ piṇḍaṃ paribhoktukāmena
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena amogham rāṣṭram piṇḍam paribhoktu kāmena
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to enjoy the alms-food of a country that is not in vain

original: sarvasattvānāṃ mārgamupadeṣṭukāmena vipulamavabhāsaṃ kartukāmena saṃsāragatān sattvān🔽saṃsārātparimocayitukāmena sarvasattvānāṃ cakṣurviśodhayitukāmena anena prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktena
analyzed: sarva sattvānām mārgam upadeṣṭu kāmena vipulam avabhāsam kartu kāmena saṃsāra gatān sattvān  saṃsārāt parimocayitu kāmena sarva sattvānām cakṣuḥ viśodhayitu kāmena anena prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktena
translated: One who wishes to teach the path to all beings, who wishes to make a vast illumination, who wishes to liberate beings dwelling in cyclic existence

analyzed: manasikāreṇa vihartavyam
translated: from cyclic existence, who wishes to purify the eye of all beings, should dwell with this attention connected with the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: saced anena manasikāreṇa vihartum icchati
translated: If one wishes to dwell with this attention,

analyzed: tena prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktāḥ manasikārāḥ samanvāhartavyāḥ
translated: one should bring to mind the attentions connected with the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: yaḥ hi enān samanvāhartavyān maṃsyate
translated: For whoever thinks to bring them to mind,

analyzed: saḥ eva asya manasikāraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: that itself will be his attention.

analyzed: tatas nyeṣām manasikārāṇām prajñāpāramitā virahitānām avakāśaḥ na dātavyaḥ
translated: Then no opportunity should be given for other attentions devoid of the perfection of wisdom.

original: tathā ca kartavyaṃ yathāyaṃ prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktairmanasikārai rātriṃdivāni kṣapayet /
analyzed: tathā ca kartavyam yathā ayam prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ rātriṃdivāni kṣapayet
translated: One should act in such a way that one may spend the days and nights with attentions connected with the perfection of wisdom.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte kenacideva puruṣeṇa maṇiratnajñāne vartamānena maṇiratnajātijñena apratilabdhapūrvaṃ mahāmaṇiratnaṃ pratilabdhaṃ bhavet
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte kenacid eva puruṣeṇa maṇi ratna jñāne vartamānena maṇi ratna jāti jñena a pratilabdha pūrvam mahā maṇi ratnam pratilabdham bhavet
translated: For example, Subhuti, suppose a certain man, skilled in the knowledge of precious jewels, having obtained a great precious jewel that he had never obtained before,

original: sa tanmahāmaṇiratnaṃ pratilabhya mahatodāreṇa prītiprāmodyena samanvāgato bhavet /
analyzed: sa tat mahā maṇi ratnam pratilabhya mahatā udāreṇa prīti prāmodyena samanvāgataḥ bhavet
translated: would be endowed with great, vast joy and delight upon obtaining that great precious jewel.

analyzed: tasya tat mahā maṇi ratnam punar eva praṇaśyet
translated: But that great precious jewel of his would be lost again.

analyzed: sa tatonidānam mahatā duḥkha daurmanasyena saṃyujyeta
translated: He would be joined with great suffering and dejection on that account.

original: tasya satatasamitaṃ tanmahāmaṇiratnaṃ prati saṃyuktā eva manasikārāḥ pravarteran aho batāhaṃ tena Vaidya
analyzed: tasya satata samitam tat mahā maṇi ratnam prati saṃyuktāḥ eva manasikārāḥ pravarteran aho bata aham tena vaidya
translated: His thoughts would constantly and always turn to that great precious jewel, thinking, 'Alas, I am separated from that great precious jewel,

original: mahāmaṇiratnena viprayukta iti hi sa puruṣastasya mahāmaṇiratnasya na vismaret yāvat tadvā anyadvā tadguṇaṃ tajjātikaṃ tena mahāmaṇiratnaṃ
analyzed: mahā maṇi ratnena viprayuktaḥ iti hi sa puruṣaḥ tasya mahā maṇi ratnasya na vismaret yāvat tat vā anyat vā tad guṇam tad jātikam tena mahā maṇi ratnam
translated: the physician.' For that man would not forget that great precious jewel, or its qualities, or its kind, until he obtained that great precious jewel

analyzed: pratilabdham bhavet
translated: or another of the same quality and kind.

analyzed: evam eva subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā mahā maṇi ratna paribhraṣṭena
translated: In just the same way, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, who has fallen away from the great precious jewel of the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: mahā maṇi ratna paribhraṣṭena iva mahā maṇi ratnena ratna saṃjñinā prajñāpāramitā manasikāra a viprayuktena
translated: Like a great jewel that has fallen from a great jewel, with the notion of a jewel, not separated from the attention on the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā manasikāra avirahita sarvajña tā cittena tāvat anveṣṭavyā
translated: Like a great jewel that has fallen from the crest of a banner, the great jewel of the perfection of wisdom should be sought with the thought of the perfection of wisdom, not separated from the thought of the perfection of wisdom,

original: yāvatsā vā anyā vā pratilabdhā bhavati /🔽tāvattena prajñāpāramitāmahāmaṇiratnapratilambhapratisaṃyuktairmanasikāraiḥ sarvajñatāmahāmaṇiratnapratilambhapratisaṃyuktairmanasikārairavirahitena
analyzed: yāvat sā vai anyā vā pratilabdhā bhavati  tāvat tena prajñāpāramitā mahā maṇi ratna pratilambha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ sarvajña tā mahā maṇi ratna pratilambha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ avirahitena
translated: not separated from the thought of omniscience, until that or another is obtained.

analyzed: bhavitavyam
translated: In the meantime, he should be not separated from the thoughts connected with the acquisition of the great jewel of the perfection of wisdom, from the thoughts connected with the acquisition of the great jewel of omniscience.

original: subhūtirāha yatpunarbhagavan sarvadharmāḥ sarvamanasikārāḥ svabhāvena virahitāḥ śūnyā uktā bhagavatā /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha yat punar bhagavan sarva dharmāḥ sarva manasikārāḥ svabhāvena virahitāḥ śūnyāḥ uktāḥ bhagavatā
translated: Subhūti said: Moreover, Blessed One, all dharmas and all mental activities are said by the Blessed One to be empty, devoid of own-being.

original: tatkathaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktairmanasikāraiḥ sarvajñatāpratisaṃyuktairmanasikārairavirahito bhavati /
analyzed: tat katham bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ sarvajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ avirahitaḥ bhavati
translated: Blessed One, how is a bodhisattva mahāsattva not separated from the thoughts connected with the perfection of wisdom, from the thoughts connected with omniscience?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocat sacetsubhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ manasi karoti sarvadharmāḥ svabhāvena viviktāḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat saced subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam manasi karoti sarva dharmāḥ svabhāvena viviktāḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Subhuti, Subhuti, if a bodhisattva mahasattva thinks in this way: 'All dharmas are intrinsically isolated,'

analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ svabhāvena śūnyāḥ iti
translated: 'All dharmas are intrinsically empty,'

analyzed: evam etat manasi kurvan prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ sarvajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ avirahitaḥ bhavati
translated: thinking like this, he is not separated from thoughts connected with the perfection of wisdom, thoughts connected with omniscience.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: prajñāpāramitā hi subhūte śūnyā /🔽sā naiva vivardhate /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā hi subhūte śūnyā  sā na eva vivardhate
translated: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is empty.🔽It does not increase.

analyzed: na ca parihīyate
translated: And it does not decrease.

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha saced bhagavan prajñāpāramitā śūnyā
translated: Subhuti said, Blessed One, if the perfection of wisdom is empty,

original: sā naiva vivardhate na ca parihīyate /🔽kathaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'vivardhamānayā prajñāpāramitayā bodhaye samudāgacchati /
analyzed: sā na eva vivardhate na ca parihīyate  katham bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vivardhamānayā prajñāpāramitayā bodhaye samudāgacchati
translated: it does not increase and it does not decrease.🔽Blessed One, how does a bodhisattva mahasattva, with the perfection of wisdom that does not increase, come to full realization for the sake of awakening?

analyzed: katham ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: And how does he fully awaken to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocat na khalu punaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran vivardhate vā parihīyate 🔽vā /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat na khalu punar subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran vivardhate vā parihīyate  / vā
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhuti: Subhuti, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom does not increase or decrease.

analyzed: yathā eva subhūte prajñāpāramitā śūnyā
translated: Just as the perfection of wisdom is empty,

original: sā naiva vivardhate na ca parihīyate /
analyzed: sā na eva vivardhate na ca parihīyate
translated: it does not increase or decrease.

analyzed: evam eva subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śūnyaḥ
translated: In the same way, Subhuti, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is empty.

analyzed: sa na eva vivardhate
translated: He does not increase

analyzed: na ca parihīyate
translated: and does not decrease.

analyzed: yatas subhūte yathā eva prajñāpāramitā śūnyā
translated: Subhuti, just as the perfection of wisdom is empty,

original: sā naiva vivardhate na ca parihīyate /
analyzed: sā na eva vivardhate na ca parihīyate
translated: it does not increase or decrease.

analyzed: evam eva subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śūnyaḥ
translated: In the same way, Subhuti, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is empty.

analyzed: sa na eva vivardhate
translated: He does not increase

analyzed: na ca parihīyate
translated: and does not decrease.

analyzed: tatas bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bodhaye samudāgacchati
translated: Therefore, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva comes to enlightenment for the sake of enlightenment.

analyzed: evam ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: And thus he fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: sacetsubhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ evaṃ bhāṣyamāṇe notrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsamāpadyate na saṃsīdati /
analyzed: saced subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam bhāṣyamāṇe na utrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate na saṃsīdati
translated: Subhuti, if a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, when this is being taught, is not frightened, does not tremble, does not become terrified, does not become cowed,

analyzed: veditavyam etat subhūte carati ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām iti
translated: Subhūti, it should be known that this bodhisattva mahāsattva is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: subhūtirāha kiṃ punarbhagavan prajñāpāramitā carati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha kim punar bhagavan prajñāpāramitā carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Subhūti said, Again, Blessed One, does the perfection of wisdom practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: bhagavānāhano hīdaṃ subhūte /🔽āha kiṃ punarbhagavan yā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ śūnyatā /
analyzed: bhagavān āha no hi idam subhūte  āha kim punar bhagavan yā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ śūnyatā
translated: The Blessed One said, No, Subhūti.

analyzed: sā carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: He said, Again, Blessed One, is that emptiness of the perfection of wisdom the one who practices the perfection of wisdom?

original: bhagavānāha no hīdaṃ subhūte /🔽āha kiṃ punarbhagavan anyatra prajñāpāramitāśūnyatāyāḥ sa kaściddharma upalabhyate /
analyzed: bhagavān āha no hi idam subhūte  āha kim punar bhagavan anyatra prajñāpāramitā śūnyatāyāḥ sa kaścid dharmaḥ upalabhyate
translated: The Blessed One said, No, Subhūti.

analyzed: yaḥ carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: He said, Again, Blessed One, is there any dharma whatsoever that is found apart from the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom, which one practices the perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: bhagavān āha no hi idam subhūte
translated: The Blessed One said, No, Subhūti.

original: āha kiṃ punarbhagavan śūnyatā carati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: āha kim punar bhagavan śūnyatā carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: He said, Again, Blessed One, does emptiness practice the perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: bhagavān āha no hi idam subhūte
translated: The Blessed One said, No, Subhūti.

original: āha kiṃ punarbhagavan śūnyatāyāṃ sa kaściddharma upalabhyate yaścarati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: āha kim punar bhagavan śūnyatāyām sa kaścid dharmaḥ upalabhyate yaḥ carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: He said, Again, Blessed One, is any dharma whatsoever that is found in emptiness, which one practices the perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: bhagavān āha no hi idam subhūte
translated: The Blessed One said, No, Subhūti.

original: āha kiṃ punarbhagavan śūnyatā carati śūnyatāyām /
analyzed: āha kim punar bhagavan śūnyatā carati śūnyatāyām
translated: He said, Again, Blessed One, does emptiness practice emptiness?

analyzed: bhagavān āha no hi idam subhūte
translated: The Blessed One said, No, Subhuti.

original: āha kiṃ punarbhagavan rūpaṃ carati prajñāpāramitāyām / Vaidya
analyzed: āha kim punar bhagavan rūpam carati prajñāpāramitāyām vaidya

analyzed: bhagavān āha no hi idam subhūte
translated: The Blessed One said, No, Subhuti.

original: āha kiṃ punarbhagavan vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: āha kim punar bhagavan vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ

analyzed: kim punar bhagavan vijñānam carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Then, Blessed One, does consciousness practice the perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: bhagavān āha no hi idam subhūte
translated: The Blessed One said, No, Subhuti.

original: āha kiṃ punarbhagavan anyatra rūpātsa dharmaḥ kaścidupalabhyate /
analyzed: āha kim punar bhagavan anyatra rūpāt sa dharmaḥ kaścid upalabhyate
translated: Subhuti said, Then, Blessed One, is any dharma whatsoever perceived apart from form,

analyzed: yaḥ carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: which practices the perfection of wisdom?

original: bhagavānāha no hīdaṃ subhūte /🔽āha kiṃ punarbhagavan anyatra vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārebhyaḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha no hi idam subhūte  āha kim punar bhagavan anyatra vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārebhyaḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, No, Subhuti.

translated: Subhuti said, Then, Blessed One, is any dharma whatsoever perceived apart from feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness,

analyzed: yaḥ carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: which practices the perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: bhagavān āha no hi idam subhūte
translated: The Blessed One said, No, Subhuti.

original: subhūtirāha kathaṃ punarbhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaścarati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha katham punar bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Subhuti said, Then, Blessed One, how does a bodhisattva mahāsattva practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocat kiṃ punaḥ subhūte samanupaśyasi tvaṃ taṃ dharmaṃ yaścarati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat kim punar subhūte samanupaśyasi tvam tam dharmam yaḥ carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti, Subhūti, do you see that dharma in which the bodhisattva practices the perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: Subhūti said, No, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāha samanupaśyasi tvaṃ subhūte tāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ yatra prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvaścarati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha samanupaśyasi tvam subhūte tām prajñāpāramitām yatra prajñāpāramitāyām bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ carati
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, do you see that perfection of wisdom in which the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices?

original: āha no hīdaṃ bhagavan /🔽bhagavānāha tatkiṃ manyase subhūte yo dharmo 'nupalambhaḥ /
analyzed: āha no hi idam bhagavan  bhagavān āha tat kim manyase subhūte yaḥ dharmaḥ n upalambhaḥ
translated: He said, No, Blessed One.

original: taṃ dharmaṃ samanupaśyasi /🔽api nu sa eva dharma utpanno vā utpatsyate vā utpadyate vā /
analyzed: tam dharmam samanupaśyasi  api nu saḥ eva dharmaḥ utpannaḥ vā utpatsyate vā utpadyate vā
translated: The Blessed One said, What do you think, Subhūti, do you see that dharma which is not apprehended?

original: niruddho vā nirotsyate vā nirudhyate vā /
analyzed: niruddhaḥ vā nirotsyate vā nirudhyate vā

original: ye 'pi te bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ kṣāntisaṃpannā upaśamasaṃpannā apratihatacittā antato dagdhasthūṇāyāmapyāghātacittaṃ notpādayanti prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyavirahitāḥ /
analyzed: ye pi te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ kṣānti saṃpannāḥ upaśama saṃpannāḥ a pratihata cittāḥ antatas dagdha sthūṇāyām api āghāta cittam na utpādayanti prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya virahitāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are endowed with patience, endowed with tranquility, whose minds are unobstructed, who do not give rise to a mind of anger even towards a burnt log, who are devoid of the perfection of wisdom and skillful means,

original: tān api te sarvānabhibhavanto gamiṣyanti bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: tān api te sarvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas will surpass them all.

analyzed: na kevalam kṣānti saṃpanna an upaśama saṃpanna an apratihata cittān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti
translated: They will not only surpass those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are endowed with patience, endowed with tranquility, whose minds are unobstructed.

original: ye 'pi te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ārabdhavīryā anikṣiptadhurā akusīdā anavalīnakāyavāṅmanaḥkarmāntāḥ prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyavirahitāḥ /
analyzed: ye pi te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ārabdha vīryāḥ a nikṣipta dhurāḥ akusīdāḥ an avalīna kāya vāc manaḥ karmāntāḥ prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya virahitāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are energetic, who do not drop their burden, who are not lazy, who are not discouraged in their physical, verbal, and mental actions, who are devoid of the perfection of wisdom and skillful means,

original: tān api te sarvānabhibhavanto gamiṣyanti bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: tān api te sarvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas will surpass them all.

analyzed: na kevalam ārabdha vīryān a nikṣipta dhurān a kusīdān an avalīna kāya vāc manaḥ karmāntān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti
translated: They will not only surpass the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are energetic, who have not laid aside their great armor, who are not lazy, who are not fainthearted, and whose physical, verbal, and mental actions are not remiss.

original: ye 'pi te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā dhyānārāmā dhyānaratā dhyānabalino dhyānabalavanto dhyānapratiṣṭhitā dhyānavaśinaḥ prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyavirahitāḥ /
analyzed: ye pi te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ dhyāna ārāmāḥ dhyāna ratāḥ dhyāna balinaḥ dhyāna balavantaḥ dhyāna pratiṣṭhitāḥ dhyāna vaśinaḥ prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya virahitāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who delight in meditation, who are devoted to meditation, who are strong in meditation, who are powerful in meditation, who are established in meditation, who have mastery in meditation, but who are devoid of the perfection of wisdom and skillful means,

original: tān api te sarvānabhibhavanto gamiṣyanti bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /🔽yathānirdiṣṭāyāṃ hi prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sadevamānuṣāsuralokaṃ sarvān śrāvakapratyekabuddhayānikānanupāyakuśalāṃś
analyzed: tān api te sarvān abhibhavantaḥ gamiṣyanti bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ  yathā nirdiṣṭāyām hi prajñāpāramitāyām caran bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sa deva mānuṣa asura lokam sarvān śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yānikān an upāya kuśalān
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas will surpass them all.

analyzed: ca bodhisattvān mahāsattvān abhibhavati
translated: For a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom as it has been explained, who is established in the perfection of wisdom as it has been explained, surpasses the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, all those in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas, and the bodhisattvas who are not skilled in means.

analyzed: teṣām ca an abhibhūtaḥ bhavati
translated: And he is not surpassed by them.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /🔽yo hi bodhisattvo mahāsattvo yathānirdiṣṭāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carati /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  yaḥ hi bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yathānirdiṣṭāyām prajñāpāramitāyām carati
translated: Why is that?🔽Because the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom as it has been explained,

analyzed: prajñāpāramitām anuvartate
translated: who follows the perfection of wisdom,

original: ayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvajñavaṃśasyānupacchedāya sthito bhavati /
analyzed: ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarvajña vaṃśasya an upacchedāya sthitaḥ bhavati
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva abides for the sake of not cutting off the lineage of the Omniscient One.

analyzed: ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tathāgatān na dūrīkariṣyati
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva will not turn away from the Tathāgatas.

original: ayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ pratipadyamāno nacirādgamiṣyati bodhimaṇḍam /
analyzed: ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam pratipadyamānaḥ nacirāt gamiṣyati bodhimaṇḍam
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing like this, will soon go to the seat of awakening.

original: ayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ sattvān kleśapaṅke saṃsīdamānānuddhariṣyati /
analyzed: ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam śikṣamāṇaḥ sattvān kleśa paṅke saṃsīdamānān uddhariṣyati
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing like this, will deliver beings who are sinking in the mud of afflictions.

original: ayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ śikṣamāṇo bodhisattvaśikṣāyāṃ śikṣate /
analyzed: ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam śikṣamāṇaḥ bodhisattva śikṣāyām śikṣate
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva, training like this, trains in the training of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: na śrāvaka śikṣāyām śikṣate
translated: He does not train in the training of a śrāvaka.

original: na pratyekabuddhaśikṣāyāṃ śikṣate /🔽evaṃ śikṣamāṇaṃ ca prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ Vaidya
analyzed: na pratyekabuddha śikṣāyām śikṣate  evam śikṣamāṇam ca prajñāpāramitāyām bodhisattvam mahāsattvam vaidya
translated: He does not train in the training of a pratyekabuddha.

original: catvāro lokapālā mahārājāna upasaṃkramyaivaṃ vakṣyanti kṣipraṃ tvaṃ kulaputra asyāṃ bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ śikṣasva /
analyzed: catvāraḥ lokapālāḥ mahā rājānaḥ upasaṃkramya evam vakṣyanti kṣipram tvam kula putra asyām bodhisattva caryāyām śikṣasva
translated: The four great kings, the world guardians, will approach the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is training like this in the perfection of wisdom, and will say to him: 'You will soon train in this bodhisattva conduct, noble one.

analyzed: laghu śikṣasva
translated: Train quickly.

original: imāni te catvāri pātrāṇi yāni tvayā bodhimaṇḍe niṣadya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhena pratigrahītavyānīti /
analyzed: imāni te catvāri pātrāṇi yāni tvayā bodhimaṇḍe niṣadya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhena pratigrahītavyāni iti
translated: These are your four bowls that you should receive after sitting at the seat of enlightenment and attaining supreme perfect enlightenment.'

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ yathānirdiṣṭāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ na kevalaṃ catvāro lokapālā mahārājāna upasaṃkramitavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam yathā nirdiṣṭāyām prajñāpāramitāyām na kevalam catvāraḥ lokapālāḥ mahā rājānaḥ upasaṃkramitavyam maṃsyante
translated: If a bodhisattva mahāsattva trains like this in the perfection of wisdom as described, not only will the four great kings, the great kings of the world, think to approach him,

analyzed: aham api bhagavan tam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam upasaṃkramiṣyāmi
translated: I too, Blessed One, will approach that bodhisattva mahāsattva.

analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ tad anye deva putrāḥ
translated: What need is there to mention the other gods?

original: tathāgatair api so 'rhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairnityameva samanvāhṛto bhaviṣyati bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /
analyzed: tathāgataiḥ api saḥ rhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ nityam eva samanvāhṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: That bodhisattva mahāsattva will always be remembered by the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones.

original: evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carato bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya yāni kānicillaukikāni duḥkhāni paropakramikāṇi vā anyāni vā utpadyeran /
analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya yāni kānicid laukikāni duḥkhāni paropakramikāṇi vā anyāni vā utpadyeran
translated: For a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like this in the perfection of wisdom, whatever worldly sufferings or harms by others or any other [sufferings] that might arise,

original: tānyasya sarveṇa sarvaṃ sarvathā sarvaṃ notpatsyante /
analyzed: tāni asya sarveṇa sarvam sarvathā sarvam na utpatsyante
translated: all of those will not arise for him in any way at all.
