translated: does not see.

analyzed: saced evam carati bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: If the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices in this way,

analyzed: carati prajñāpāramitāyām iti
translated: he practices the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣāparivartaḥ nāma pañcaviṃśatitamaḥ
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the chapter named The Training, is the twenty-fifth.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: māyopamaparivartaḥ ṣaḍviṃśatitamaḥ
translated: The chapter on the illusion-like, the twenty-sixth.

original: atha khalu śakrasya devānāmindrasyaitadabhūt caranneva tāvadayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvasattvānabhibhavati /
analyzed: atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasya etat abhūt caran eva tāvat ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva sattvān abhibhavati
translated: Then this occurred to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: While practicing, this bodhisattva mahāsattva surpasses all beings.

original: kaḥ punarvādo yadā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ yadā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: How much more so when he will have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: lābhāḥ teṣām sattvānām su labdhāḥ
translated: Those beings have gained a great gain.

analyzed: su jīvitam ca te sattvāḥ jīvanti
translated: Those beings live a good life.

analyzed: yeṣām sarvajña tāyām cittam krāmati
translated: Those whose minds are set on omniscience.

analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ yaiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: How much more so for those who have given rise to the mind set on unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: spṛhaṇīyāste sattvā ye sattvasārā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyante //
analyzed: spṛhaṇīyāḥ te sattvāḥ ye sattva sārāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: Those beings who are the essence of beings and will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment are to be envied.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro māndāravāṇi puṣpāṇyabhinirmāya puṣpāṇāmañjaliṃ kṛtvā tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhamabhyavākirat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ māndāravāṇi puṣpāṇi abhinirmāya puṣpāṇām añjalim kṛtvā tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham abhyavākirat
translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, having created coral tree flowers, made a handful of flowers and scattered them over the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: evaṃ ca vācamabhāṣata yairbodhisattvayānikaiḥ pudgalairanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditam anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyāmahe /
analyzed: evam ca vācam abhāṣata yaiḥ bodhisattva yānikaiḥ pudgalaiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyāmahe
translated: And he spoke these words: Those individuals who belong to the Bodhisattva Vehicle and have given rise to the mind set on unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, thinking 'We will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,'

original: abhisaṃbudhya sarvasattvān mahatā saṃsārārṇavenohyamānān same pārime tīre pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyāma iti /
analyzed: abhisaṃbudhya sarva sattvān mahatā saṃsāra arṇavena uhyamānān same pārime tīre pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: and having fully awakened, will establish all beings who are being carried away by the great river of saṃsāra on the farther shore, on the level ground.'

analyzed: samṛdhyantām teṣām abhīpsitāḥ paricintitāḥ
translated: May their wishes and thoughts be fulfilled.

analyzed: parigṛhītāḥ citta utpādāḥ eteṣām eva buddha dharmāṇām paripūraṇāya bhavantu
translated: May these generated thoughts be embraced for the fulfillment of just these Buddha qualities.

analyzed: eteṣām eva sarvajña tā pratisaṃyuktānām dharmāṇām paripūraṇāya bhavantu
translated: May they be for the fulfillment of just these qualities connected with omniscience.

analyzed: eteṣām eva svayaṃbhū dharmāṇām paripūraṇāya bhavantu
translated: May they be for the fulfillment of just these self-arisen qualities.

analyzed: eteṣām eva asaṃhārya dharmāṇām paripūraṇāya bhavantu
translated: May they be for the fulfillment of just these unassailable qualities.

analyzed: na me bhagavan eka citta utpādaḥ pi utpadyate
translated: Blessed One, I do not even generate a single thought

original: yatte bodhisattvā mahāsattvā mahākaruṇayā samanvāgatā vivarteran anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheriti /
analyzed: yat te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ mahā karuṇayā samanvāgatāḥ vivarteran anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ iti
translated: that those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas endowed with great compassion would turn away from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: na me bhagavan ekacittotpādo 'pyutpadyate yatte bodhisattvayānikāḥ pudgalā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhuṃ saṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: na me bhagavan eka citta utpādaḥ api utpadyate yat te bodhisattva yānikāḥ pudgalāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: Blessed One, I do not even generate a single thought that those individuals who have set out in the Bodhisattva vehicle for perfect enlightenment

analyzed: tatas vivarteran
translated: would turn away from that.

original: iti yadbhūyasyā mātrayā praṇidhiṃ janayiṣyantyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau imāni saṃsārāvacarāṇi duḥkhāni sattvānāṃ saṃpaśyantaḥ /
analyzed: iti yat bhūyasyā mātrayā praṇidhim janayiṣyanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau imāni saṃsāra avacarāṇi duḥkhāni sattvānām saṃpaśyantaḥ
translated: Thus, seeing these sufferings experienced in cyclic existence by beings, they will generate aspirations to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment to an even greater extent.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tayā mahākaruṇayā arthakāmā hitakāmā hi te sadevamānuṣāsurasya lokasyānukampakāḥ /
analyzed: tayā mahā karuṇayā artha kāmāḥ hita kāmāḥ hi te sa deva mānuṣa asurasya lokasya anukampakāḥ
translated: With that great compassion, they are desirous of benefit and desirous of happiness for the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, and they have compassion for them.

original: ye imairevaṃrūpaiścittotpādaiḥ samanvāgatāḥ kimiti vayaṃ tīrṇāḥ sattvāṃstārayema /🔽muktā mocayema /🔽āśvastā āśvāsayema /
analyzed: ye imaiḥ evaṃrūpaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ samanvāgatāḥ kim iti vayam tīrṇāḥ sattvān tārayema  muktāḥ mocayema  āśvastāḥ āśvāsayema
translated: Those who are endowed with these kinds of thoughts, how can we, having crossed, help beings to cross?🔽Having been liberated, we should liberate those who have not been liberated.

analyzed: parinirvṛtāḥ parinirvāpayema
translated: Having been comforted, we should comfort those who have not been comforted.🔽Having attained complete nirvana, we should lead those who have not attained complete nirvana to complete nirvana.

analyzed: iti etaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ viharanti
translated: They abide with these thoughts.

original: yasteṣāṃ bhagavan prathamayānasaṃprasthitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ cittotpādānanumodate /
analyzed: yaḥ teṣām bhagavan prathama yāna saṃprasthitānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām citta utpādān anumodate
translated: Blessed One, he who rejoices in the thoughts of those bodhisattva great beings who have set out in the Great Vehicle for the first time,

analyzed: a vinivartanīyānām api a vinivartanīya dharma tām anumodate
translated: he rejoices in the irreversible nature of the irreversible ones,

analyzed: eka jāti pratibaddhānām api bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām eka jāti pratibaddha dharmatām anumodate
translated: and he rejoices in the Dharma nature of the bodhisattva great beings who are bound to one birth.

original: kiyatsa bhagavan kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: kiyat sa bhagavan kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: Blessed One, how much more merit does that son of a good family or daughter of a good family produce?

original: evamukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat syātkhalu punaḥ kauśika śakyeta sumeroḥ parvatarājasya palāgreṇa tulyamānasya pramāṇaṃ grahītum /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat syāt khalu punar kauśika śakyeta sumeroḥ parvata rājasya pala agreṇa tulya mānasya pramāṇam grahītum
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods, It would be possible, Kauśika, to measure the Sumeru, the king of mountains, with a grain, but,

original: na tveva kauśika tasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyānumodanāsahagatasya cittotpādasya puṇyapramāṇaṃ grahītum /
analyzed: na tu eva kauśika tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anumodanā sahagatasya citta utpādasya puṇya pramāṇam grahītum
translated: Kauśika, it is not possible to measure the merit of that son of a good family or daughter of a good family, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, who has the thought associated with rejoicing.

original: syātkhalu punaḥ kauśika śakyeta cāturmahādvīpake lokadhātau palāgreṇa tulyamāne pramāṇaṃ grahītum /
analyzed: syāt khalu punar kauśika śakyeta cāturmahādvīpake lokadhātau pala agreṇa tulya māne pramāṇam grahītum
translated: It would be possible, Kauśika, to measure with a grain the four-continent world system,

original: na tveva kauśika tasyānumodanāsahagasya cittotpādasya puṇyapramāṇaṃ grahītum /
analyzed: na tu eva kauśika tasya anumodanā sahagasya citta utpādasya puṇya pramāṇam grahītum
translated: but, Kauśika, it is not possible to measure the merit of that thought associated with rejoicing.

original: syātkhalu punaḥ kauśika śakyeta sāhasre cūlike lokadhātau tulyamāne palāgreṇa pramāṇaṃ grahītum /
analyzed: syāt khalu punar kauśika śakyeta sāhasre cūlike lokadhātau tulya māne pala agreṇa pramāṇam grahītum
translated: It would be possible, Kauśika, to measure with a grain the trichiliocosm,

translated: Gods, in this way the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who undertake the difficult practice,

analyzed: ye saṃvidyamānānām an upalabhyamānānām sattvānām kṛtaśas saṃnāham saṃnahyante
translated: who don the armor for the sake of beings who do not exist and are not apprehended,

original: ākāśena na sa devaputrāḥ sārdhaṃ veditavyaṃ manyeta /🔽yaḥ sattvānāṃ kṛtaśaḥ saṃnāhaṃ saṃnaddhavyaṃ manyeta /
analyzed: ākāśena na sa deva putrāḥ sārdham veditavyam manyeta  yaḥ sattvānām kṛtaśas saṃnāham saṃnaddhavyam manyeta
translated: are like gods who think of not knowing space.🔽Those who think of donning armor for the sake of beings

original: ayaṃ ca saṃnāho bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sattvānāṃ kṛtaśaḥ saṃnaddhaḥ /
analyzed: ayam ca saṃnāhaḥ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sattvānām kṛtaśas saṃnaddhaḥ
translated: are like bodhisattva mahāsattvas who don this armor for the sake of beings.

analyzed: sarva atyanta tayā sattva anupalabdhiḥ uktā tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One has said that all sentient beings are absolutely non-apprehensible.

analyzed: sā ca sattva vivikta tayā eva veditavyā
translated: And that should be known as being due to the emptiness of sentient beings.

analyzed: vainayika vivakta tayā ca sattva vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: And the emptiness of sentient beings should be known as being due to the emptiness of the individual.

original: sacedatraivaṃ bhāṣyamāṇe bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na saṃsīdati /
analyzed: saced atrā evam bhāṣyamāṇe bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na saṃsīdati
translated: If, when this is being taught, the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not become disheartened,

analyzed: veditavyam etat deva putrāḥ carati ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: the gods should know, 'This bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom.'

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sattva vivikta tayā hi rūpa vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of form should be known as being due to the emptiness of sentient beings.

analyzed: evam sattva vivikta tayā vedanā saṃjñā saṃskāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: Thus, the emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness should be known as being due to the emptiness of sentient beings.

analyzed: sattva vivikta tayā vijñāna vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of consciousness should be known as being due to the emptiness of sentient beings.

analyzed: evam yāvat sattva vivikta tayā sarva dharma vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: Thus, up to the emptiness of all dharmas should be known as being due to the emptiness of sentient beings.

analyzed: evam deva putrāḥ sarva dharma vivikta tā draṣṭavyā
translated: Thus, gods, the emptiness of all dharmas should be seen.

original: evaṃ devaputrāḥ sarvadharmaviviktatāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na saṃsīdati /
analyzed: evam deva putrāḥ sarva dharma vivikta tāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na saṃsīdati
translated: Thus, gods, when the emptiness of all dharmas is being taught, the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not become disheartened.

analyzed: yatas na saṃsīdati
translated: Because he does not become disheartened,

analyzed: tatas carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: And then he practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: atha khalu bhagavān jānanneva āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocat kiṃ kāraṇaṃ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ sarvadharmaviviktatāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ 🔽na saṃsīdati /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān jānan eva āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat kim kāraṇam subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam sarva dharma vivikta tāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām  na saṃsīdati
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing full well, said this to the venerable Subhūti: For what reason, Subhūti, does a bodhisattva mahāsattva not become disheartened when all dharmas are being taught as void?

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha vaidya  vivikta tvāt bhagavat na saṃsīdati
translated: Subhūti said: Blessed One, he does not become disheartened because of the voidness of dharmas.

original: anena bhagavan kāranena bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvadharmaviviktatāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ na saṃsīdati /
analyzed: anena bhagavan kāranena bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva dharma vivikta tāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām na saṃsīdati
translated: Blessed One, for this reason a bodhisattva mahāsattva does not become disheartened when all dharmas are being taught as void.

analyzed: na api bhagavan kaścid dharmaḥ saṃsīdati
translated: Blessed One, moreover, no dharma at all becomes disheartened.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Blessed One, why is that?

original: na hi bhagavan kaściddharma upalabhyate /🔽yaḥ saṃsīdet /🔽so 'pi bhagavan dharmo nopalabhyeta /
analyzed: na hi bhagavan kaścid dharmaḥ upalabhyate  yaḥ saṃsīdet  saḥ pi bhagavan dharmaḥ na upalabhyeta
translated: Because, Blessed One, no dharma whatsoever is apprehended that could become disheartened.

analyzed: yena dharmeṇa yaḥ dharmaḥ saṃsīdet
translated: Blessed One, that dharma also is not apprehended by which a dharma could become disheartened.

analyzed: bhagavān āha evam etad subhūte evam etat
translated: The Blessed One said: So it is, Subhūti, so it is.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ subhūte sacedevaṃ bhāṣyamāṇe deśyamāne nirdiśyamāne evamupadiśyamāne bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na saṃsīdati na viṣīdati na
analyzed: api tu khalu punar subhūte saced evam bhāṣyamāṇe deśyamāne nirdiśyamāne evam upadiśyamāne bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na saṃsīdati na viṣīdati na
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, if, when this is being taught, demonstrated, indicated, and shown, the Bodhisattva, the great being, does not become disheartened, does not become dejected, does not become cowed, does not become stolid, does not have regrets,

original: nāvalīyate na saṃlīyate /🔽na vipṛṣṭhīkaroti mānasam /🔽na bhagnapṛṣṭhīkaroti /
analyzed: na avalīyate na saṃlīyate  na vipṛṣṭhīkaroti mānasam  na bhagna pṛṣṭhīkaroti
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, if, when this is being taught, demonstrated, explained, and instructed, the Bodhisattva, the great being, does not become discouraged, does not become cowed, does not become humiliated, does not turn away, does not turn back,

analyzed: na utrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate
translated: does not become frightened, does not become terrified, does not become overwhelmed with terror,

analyzed: carati prajñāpāramitāyām  subhutiḥ āha evam etat bhagavan
translated: he practices the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: evam etat sugata
translated: Subhuti said: So it is, Blessed One! So it is, Well-Gone!

analyzed: saced bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam carati
translated: If, Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, the great being, practices like this,

original: carati prajñāpāramitāyām /🔽evaṃ carantaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ sendrakā devāḥ sabrahmakāḥ saprajāpatikāḥ seśānāḥ sarṣinaranārīgaṇā ārātprāñjalībhūtā namasyanti /
analyzed: carati prajñāpāramitāyām  evam carantam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam sa indrakāḥ devāḥ sa brahmakāḥ sa prajāpatikāḥ sa īśānāḥ sa ṛṣi nara nārī gaṇāḥ ārāt prāñjalībhūtāḥ namasyanti
translated: he practices the perfection of wisdom.🔽When the Bodhisattva, the great being, practices like this, the gods with Indra, with Brahma, with Prajapati, with Ishana, with the hosts of sages, men, women, and the rest, pay homage from afar with folded hands.

original: bhagavānāha na kevalaṃ subhūte evaṃ carantaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ sendrakā devāḥ sabrahmakāḥ saprajāpatikāḥ seśānāḥ sarṣinaranārīgaṇā
analyzed: bhagavān āha na kevalam subhūte evam carantam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam sa indrakāḥ devāḥ sa brahmakāḥ sa prajāpatikāḥ sa īśānāḥ sa ṛṣi nara nārī gaṇāḥ
translated: The Blessed One said: Subhuti, not only the gods with Indra, with Brahma, with Prajapati, with Ishana, with the hosts of sages, men, women, and the rest, but also the Four Great Kings, the Thirty-Three gods, the Yamas, the Tusitas, the Nirmāṇaratis, the Paranirmitavaśavartins, the Brahmakāyikas, the Brahmapurohitas, the Brahmapārṣadyas, the Mahābrahmās, the Ābhāsvaras, the Parīttābhas, the Apramāṇābhas, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Śubhakṛtsnas, the Parīttaśubhas, the Apramāṇaśubhas, the Śubhakṛtsnas, the Bṛhatphalas, the Avṛhas, the Atapa gods, the Sudarśanas, the Sudṛśas, the Akaniṣṭhas, the gods of the sphere of infinite space, the gods of the sphere of infinite consciousness, the gods of the sphere of nothingness, the gods of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, the gods of the form realm, the formless realm, and the desire realm, all of them pay homage from afar with folded hands to the Bodhisattva, the great being, who practices like this.

analyzed: ārāt prāñjalībhūtāḥ namasyanti
translated: They stand at a distance with palms joined in reverence and pay homage.

original: ye 'pi te subhūte brahmakāyikā devā brahmapurohitā brahmapārṣadyā mahābrahmāṇaḥ parīttābhā
analyzed: ye pi te subhūte brahmakāyikāḥ devāḥ brahma purohitāḥ brahma pārṣadyāḥ mahābrahmāṇaḥ parītta ābhā
translated: Those gods of the Brahmakayika realm, the Brahmapurohita, Brahmaparisadya, Mahabrahma, Parittasabha,

original: apramāṇābhā ābhāsvarāḥ parīttaśubhā apramāṇaśubhāḥ śubhakṛtsnā anabhrakāḥ puṇyaprasavā
analyzed: apramāṇābhāḥ ābhāsvarāḥ parīttaśubhāḥ apramāṇaśubhāḥ śubhakṛtsnāḥ anabhrakāḥ puṇyaprasavāḥ
translated: Apramanasabha, Abhasvara, Parittasubha, Apramanasubha, Subhakṛtsna, Anabhraka, Punyaprasava,

original: bṛhatphalā asaṃjñisattvā abṛhā atapāḥ sudṛśāḥ sudarśanā akaniṣṭhāś ca devāḥ /
analyzed: bṛhatphalāḥ asaṃjñisattvāḥ abṛhāḥ atapāḥ sudṛśāḥ sudarśanāḥ akaniṣṭhāḥ ca devāḥ
translated: Bṛhatphala, Asamjñisattva, Avirbhadra, Atapas, Sudarśana, and Akaniṣṭha gods,

original: te 'pi subhūte taṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ evaṃ carantaṃ namasyanti /
analyzed: te pi subhūte tam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam prajñāpāramitāyām evam carantam namasyanti
translated: they too, Subhūti, pay homage to that bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom in that way.

original: ye 'pi te subhūte aprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā etarhi tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti /
analyzed: ye pi te subhūte aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ etarhi tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti
translated: Those tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas in the immeasurable, incalculable world systems right now, who are present, remaining, enduring,

original: te 'pi buddhā bhagavantaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāmevaṃ carantaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ buddhacakṣuṣā paśyanti /
analyzed: te pi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām evam carantam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam buddha cakṣuṣā paśyanti
translated: those buddhas, bhagavats, see with their buddha-eye the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom in that way.

original: te ca subhūte bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carantamanugṛhṇanti /
analyzed: te ca subhūte bodhisattvam mahāsattvām prajñāpāramitāyām carantam anugṛhṇanti
translated: And those, Subhūti, favor the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: samanvāharanti
translated: They are favored.

original: ye ca khalu punaḥ subhūte bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carantastathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairanugṛhyante samanvāhriyante /
analyzed: ye ca khalu punar subhūte bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ anugṛhyante samanvāhriyante
translated: And, Subhūti, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom and are favored and remembered by the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones,

original: te te subhūte bodhisattvā mahāsattvā avinivartanīyā anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodherdhārayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: te te subhūte bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ a vinivartanīyāḥ anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ dhārayitavyāḥ
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, Subhūti, should be known as irreversible from supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca teṣāmantarāyā utpatsyante mārato vā anyato vā /
analyzed: na ca teṣām antarāyāḥ utpatsyante mārataḥ vā anyatas vā
translated: And obstacles will not arise for them, either from Māra or from others.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: ye subhūte tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau sattvāḥ
translated: Subhūti, all the beings in the great trichiliocosm,

analyzed: te sarve mārāḥ pāpīyāṃsaḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: they would all become Māra, the evil one.

original: ekaikaś ca māraḥ pāpīyāṃstāvatīreva mārasenā abhinirmimīte /🔽te 'pi subhūte mārāḥ pāpīyāṃsastasya buddhasamanvāhṛtasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carato na pratibalā antarāyaṃ kartumanuttarāyāḥ
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca māraḥ pāpīyān tāvatīḥ eva māra senāḥ abhinirmimīte  te pi subhūte mārāḥ pāpīyāṃsaḥ tasya buddha samanvāhṛtasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ na pratibalāḥ antarāyam kartum anuttarāyāḥ  /
translated: And each Māra, the evil one, would conjure up an army of Māras equal to that number.

analyzed: samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: But, Subhūti, those Māra, the evil ones, are not able to create an obstacle for that bodhisattva mahāsattva who is favored by the Buddha and practices the perfection of wisdom, in supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: tiṣṭhantu khalu punaḥ subhūte trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau sarvasattvā mārāḥ pāpīyāṃsaḥ /
analyzed: tiṣṭhantu khalu punar subhūte tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau sarva sattvāḥ mārāḥ pāpīyāṃsaḥ
translated: Let alone, Subhūti, all the wicked Māras in a great trichiliocosm,

original: yāvanta subhūte gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu trisāhasramahāsāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ subhūte gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasreṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ
translated: however many beings there are, Subhūti, in the world systems in the ten directions equal to the sands of the Ganges river,

analyzed: te pi sarve mārāḥ pāpīyāṃsaḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: all of them would become wicked Māras.

original: ekaikaś ca māraḥ pāpīyāṃstāvatīreva mārasenā abhinirmimīte /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca māraḥ pāpīyān tāvatīḥ eva māra senāḥ abhinirmimīte
translated: And each wicked Māra would conjure up an army of Māras equal to that.

original: te 'pi subhūte mārāḥ pāpīyāṃsastasya buddhasamanvāhṛtasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carato na pratibalā antarāyaṃ kartumanuttarāyāḥ
analyzed: te pi subhūte mārāḥ pāpīyāṃsaḥ tasya buddha samanvāhṛtasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ na pratibalāḥ antarāyam kartum anuttarāyāḥ  /
translated: Even those wicked Māras, Subhūti, are not able to create an obstacle for that bodhisattva mahāsattva who is attended to by the Buddha, who practices the perfection of wisdom, in unsurpassed,

analyzed: samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: perfect enlightenment.

original: dvābhyāṃ subhūte dharmābhyāṃ samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvastasmin samaye durdharṣo bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyobhirmārakāyikābhirvā devatābhiḥ
analyzed: dvābhyām subhūte dharmābhyām samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tasmin samaye durdharṣaḥ bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyobhiḥ māra kāyikābhiḥ vā devatābhiḥ
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who possesses two dharmas at that time is difficult to assail by the wicked Māras, or by the gods in Māra's retinue.

analyzed: katamābhyām dvābhyām
translated: By which two?

analyzed: yat uta sarva sattvāḥ ca asya a parityaktāḥ bhavanti
translated: Namely, all beings are not abandoned by him.

original: sarvadharmāś ca anena śūnyatāto vyavalokitā bhavanti /🔽Vaidya ābhyāṃ subhūte dvābhyāṃ dharmābhyāṃ samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo durgharṣo bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyobhirmārakāyikābhirvā devatābhiḥ
analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ ca anena śūnyatātaḥ vyavalokitāḥ bhavanti  vaidyaḥ ābhyām subhūte dvābhyām dharmābhyām samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ durgharṣaḥ bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyobhiḥ māra kāyikābhiḥ vā devatābhiḥ
translated: And by this, all dharmas are seen as empty.🔽Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has these two dharmas is difficult to vanquish by Māra, the evil ones, or the devas in Māra's retinue.

original: aparābhyāṃ subhūte dvābhyāṃ dharmābhyāṃ samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo durgharṣo bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyobhirmārakāyikābhirvā devatābhiḥ /
analyzed: aparābhyām subhūte dvābhyām dharmābhyām samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ durgharṣaḥ bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyobhiḥ māra kāyikābhiḥ vā devatābhiḥ
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has two other dharmas is difficult to vanquish by Māra, the evil ones, or the devas in Māra's retinue.

analyzed: katamābhyām dvābhyām
translated: What are the two?

analyzed: yat uta yathāvādī tathākārī ca bhavati
translated: Namely, he is one who practices as he teaches.

analyzed: buddhaiḥ ca bhagavadbhiḥ samanvāhriyate
translated: And he is one who is assisted by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: ābhyāṃ subhūte dvābhyāṃ samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo durgharṣo bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyobhirmārakāyikābhirvā devatābhiḥ /
analyzed: ābhyām subhūte dvābhyām samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ durgharṣaḥ bhavati māraiḥ pāpīyobhiḥ māra kāyikābhiḥ vā devatābhiḥ
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has these two is difficult to vanquish by Māra, the evil ones, or the devas in Māra's retinue.

original: evaṃ carataḥ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya devā apyupasaṃkramitavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: evam carataḥ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya devāḥ api upasaṃkramitavyam maṃsyante
translated: Subhūti, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva practices like this, even the devas will think, 'We should approach him.'

analyzed: upasaṃkramya ca paripraṣṭavyam maṃsyante
translated: Having approached, they will think, 'We should ask him questions.'

analyzed: paripraśnīkartavyam maṃsyante
translated: They will think that they should ask questions.

analyzed: paryupāsitavyam maṃsyante
translated: They will think that they should attend on you.

original: utsāhaṃ cāsya vardhayiṣyanti kṣipraṃ tvaṃ kulaputra anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyase /
analyzed: utsāham ca asya vardhayiṣyanti kṣipram tvam kula putra anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: And they will increase your enthusiasm, saying: ‘You will soon, son of good family, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.’

original: tasmāttarhi kulaputra anenaiva vihāreṇa vihara yaduta prajñāpāramitāvihāreṇa /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kula putra anena eva vihāreṇa vihara yat uta prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa
translated: Therefore, son of good family, dwell in this very dwelling, namely, the dwelling of the perfection of wisdom.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /🔽etenaiva hi tvaṃ kulaputra vihāreṇa viharan anāthānāṃ sattvānāṃ nātho bhaviṣyasi /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  etena eva hi tvam kula putra vihāreṇa viharan anāthānām sattvānām nāthaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: Why is that?

original: atrāṇānāṃ sattvānāṃ trātā bhaviṣyasi /🔽aśaraṇānāṃ sattvānāṃ śaraṇaṃ bhaviṣyasi /🔽alayanānāṃ sattvānāṃ layanaṃ bhaviṣyasi /
analyzed: atrāṇānām sattvānām trātā bhaviṣyasi  aśaraṇānām sattvānām śaraṇam bhaviṣyasi  a layanānām sattvānām layanam bhaviṣyasi

translated: It is the nature of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, that when they manifest a smile,

original: atha tadā nānāvarṇā anekavarṇā raśmayo bhagavato mukhadvārānniścaranti tadyathā nīlapītalohitāvadātamāñjiṣṭhasphaṭikarajatasuvarṇavarṇāḥ
analyzed: atha tadā nānā varṇāḥ aneka varṇāḥ raśmayaḥ bhagavataḥ mukha dvārāt niścaranti tat yathā nīla pīta lohita avadāta māñjiṣṭha sphaṭika rajata suvarṇa varṇāḥ
translated: then at that time rays of light of various colors, of many colors, issue forth from the mouth of the Blessed One, namely blue, yellow, red, white, crimson, crystal, silver, and golden colors.

original: te niścarya anantāparyantān lokadhātūnābhayā avabhāsya yāvadbrahmalokamabhyudgamya punareva pratyudāvṛtya bhagavantaṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya
analyzed: te niścarya ananta aparyantān lokadhātūn ābhayā avabhāsya yāvat brahma lokam abhyudgamya punar eva pratyudāvṛtya bhagavantam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya
translated: Having issued forth, they illuminate the infinite and boundless world systems with their light, up to the Brahma world, and having risen up, they return and circle around the Blessed One three times, and then disappear into the top of his head.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ mūrdhani antardhīyante
translated: They disappear into the crown of the Blessed One's head.🔽Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder,

original: atha khalvāyuṣmānānanda utthāyāsanādekāṃsamuttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam
translated: placed his right knee on the ground,

original: pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamayya bhagavantametadavocat
analyzed: pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamayya bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: bowed to the Blessed One with joined palms, and said to the Blessed One:

original: nāhetukaṃ nāpratyayaṃ tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ smitaṃ prāduṣkurvanti /
analyzed: na ahetukam na apratyayam tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ smitam prāduṣkurvanti
translated: Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones do not smile without a cause or condition.

analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ
translated: What is the cause, Blessed One,

analyzed: kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya prāduṣkaraṇāya
translated: what is the condition for smiling?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantamānandametadavocat idamānanda bhikṣūṇāṃ ṣaṣṭhaṃ śatamanāgate 'dhvani tārakopame kalpe anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat idam ānanda bhikṣūṇām ṣaṣṭham śatam anāgate dhvani tāraka upame kalpe anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda: Ānanda, this is the sixth hundred of monks who, in the future, in the eon named Tāraka, will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: abhisaṃbudhya ca sattvebhyaḥ dharmam deśayiṣyati
translated: And having fully awakened, they will teach the Dharma to beings.

analyzed: sarve ca eka nāmānaḥ bhaviṣyanti yat uta avakīrṇa kusuma nāmānaḥ
translated: And all of them will have the same name, namely Avakīrṇakusuma.

original: tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ śāstāro loke bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ śāstāraḥ loke bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, Teachers, in the world.

original: teṣāṃ khalu punarānanda avakīrṇakusumanāmnāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ sarveṣāṃ samaḥ śrāvakasaṃgho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām khalu punar ānanda avakīrṇakusuma nāmnām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām sarveṣām samaḥ śrāvaka saṃghaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Ānanda, all those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones named Avakīrṇa-kusuma will have the same assembly of hearers.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca teṣāmavakīrṇakusumanāmnāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ samamevāyuḥpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati viṃśatikalpasahasrāṇi /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca teṣām avakīrṇakusuma nāmnām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām samam eva āyuḥ pramāṇam bhaviṣyati viṃśati kalpa sahasrāṇi
translated: And all those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones named Avakīrṇa-kusuma will have the same lifespan of twenty thousand eons.

original: sarveṣāmeva caikaikasya vaistārikaṃ pravacanaṃ bhaviṣyati pṛthuvaipulyaprāptaṃ devamanuṣyeṣu /
analyzed: sarveṣām eva ca ekaikasya vaistārikam pravacanam bhaviṣyati pṛthu vaipulya prāptam deva manuṣyeṣu
translated: And the teachings of each and every one of them will be extensive, reaching far and wide among gods and humans.

analyzed: sarveṣām eva ca saddharmaḥ samam sthāsyati
translated: And the True Dharma of each and every one of them will remain the same.

analyzed: viṃśatim eva kalpa sahasrāṇi ekaikasya
translated: For twenty thousand eons each.

original: sarve ca te yato yata eva grāmanagaranigamajanapadarāṣṭrarājadhānīto 'bhiniṣkramiṣyanti /
analyzed: sarve ca te yatas yatas eva grāma nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra rājadhānītaḥ bhiniṣkramiṣyanti
translated: And each and every one of them will go forth from a village, town, city, country, kingdom, or capital.

original: abhiniṣkramya yatra yatra dharmacakraṃ pravartayiṣyanti /🔽pravartya ca yatra yatra ca vihariṣyanti /
analyzed: abhiniṣkramya yatra yatra dharmacakram pravartayiṣyanti  pravartya ca yatra yatra ca vihariṣyanti
translated: Having gone forth, wherever they will turn the wheel of the Dharma,🔽having turned it, wherever they will dwell,

original: yato yataś ca yatra yatraiva ca pravekṣanti /
analyzed: yatas yatas ca yatra yatra eva ca pravekṣanti
translated: and from wherever they will enter wherever,

original: yena yena ca yato yata eva cābhiniṣkramiṣyanti /
analyzed: yena yena ca yatas yatas eva ca abhiniṣkramiṣyanti
translated: And wherever and from wherever they will go forth,

original: tatastatastatra tatra teṣāṃ praviśatāmabhiniṣkrāmatāṃ viharatāṃ ca pañcavarṇikānāṃ puṣpāṇāṃ puṣpavarṣāḥ pravartiṣyante /
analyzed: tatas tatas tatra tatra teṣām praviśatām abhiniṣkrāmatām viharatām ca pañca varṇikānām puṣpāṇām puṣpa varṣāḥ pravartiṣyante
translated: there and there, there and there, as they enter, go forth, and dwell, showers of five-colored flowers will fall.

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda bodhisattvairmahāsattvairuttamena vihāreṇa vihartukāmaiḥ prajñāpāramitāvihāreṇa Vaidya
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ uttamena vihāreṇa vihartu kāmaiḥ prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa vaidya
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to dwell in the supreme dwelling, in the dwelling of the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: vihartavyam
translated: should dwell like a physician.

analyzed: tathāgata vihāreṇa ānanda vihartu kāmaiḥ prajñāpāramitā vihāreṇa vihartavyam
translated: Ānanda, those who wish to dwell in the Tathāgata's dwelling should dwell in the dwelling of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye hi kecidānanda bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ cariṣyanti /🔽niṣṭhā tatra gantavyā manuṣyebhya evaite cyutā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ye hi kecid ānanda bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām cariṣyanti  niṣṭhā tatra gantavyā manuṣyebhyaḥ eva ete cyutāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Ānanda, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who will practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽should be known as having come from among humans.

original: te ihopapannāstuṣitebhya eva vā devanikāyebhyaścyutā bhaviṣyanti manuṣyeṣvevopapannāḥ /
analyzed: te iha upapannāḥ tuṣitebhyaḥ eva vā devanikāyebhyaḥ cyutāḥ bhaviṣyanti manuṣyeṣu eva upapannāḥ
translated: They will be reborn here, having fallen from the Tuṣita gods or other classes of gods, and will be reborn among humans.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi manuṣyeṣu tuṣiteṣu ca deveṣu iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā vistareṇa pracariṣyatīti /
analyzed: tathā hi manuṣyeṣu tuṣiteṣu ca deveṣu iyam prajñāpāramitā vistareṇa pracariṣyati iti
translated: Because in humans and in the Tuṣita gods this perfection of wisdom will be practiced extensively.

original: tathāgatāvalokitāḥ khalu punarānanda te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: tathāgata avalokitāḥ khalu punar ānanda te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Ānanda, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas should be known to be looked upon by the Tathāgata.

analyzed: ye iha prajñāpāramitāyām cariṣyanti
translated: Ānanda, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who will practice this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: ye imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti
translated: who will take up this perfection of wisdom,

original: dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti /
analyzed: dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti
translated: who will bear it in mind, recite it, master it, teach it, explain it, expound it, chant it, meditate on it with wisdom,

original: antaśo likhiṣyanti /🔽udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya pravartya deśayitvopadiśyoddiśya svādhyāyya🔽antaśo likhitvā bodhisattvān mahāsattvānavavadiṣyanti anuśāsiṣyanti saṃdarśayiṣyanti
analyzed: antaśas likhiṣyanti  udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya pravartya deśayitvā upadiśya uddiśya su ādhyāyya  antaśas likhitvā bodhisattvān mahāsattvān avavadiṣyanti anuśāsiṣyanti saṃdarśayiṣyanti
translated: and even write it,🔽having taken it up, borne it in mind, recited it, mastered it, taught it, explained it, expounded it, chanted it, meditated on it with wisdom,

analyzed: samādāpayiṣyanti samuttejayiṣyanti saṃpraharṣayiṣyanti
translated: and even written it, will instruct, teach, demonstrate, encourage, uplift, and bring joy to the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: avaropitakuśalamūlāste ānanda bodhisattvā mahāsattvā veditavyāstathāgateṣvarhatsu samyaksaṃbuddheṣu /
analyzed: avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ te ānanda bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ veditavyāḥ tathāgateṣu arhatsu samyaksaṃbuddheṣu
translated: Ānanda, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have planted the roots of virtue under the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas should be known.

original: na kevalaṃ śrāvakapratyekabuddhānāmantike taiḥ kuśalamūlānyavaropitāni iha prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitum /🔽niḥsaṃśayaṃ khalu punarānanda tathāgateṣvarhatsu samyaksaṃbuddheṣu taiḥ kuśalamūlānyavaropitāni bodhisattvairmahāsattvaiḥ /
analyzed: na kevalam śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām antike taiḥ kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni iha prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitum  niḥsaṃśayam khalu punar ānanda tathāgateṣu arhatsu samyaksaṃbuddheṣu taiḥ kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ
translated: Not only did they plant wholesome roots in the presence of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas in order to train in this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: ye iha prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣante
translated: But, Ānanda, without a doubt, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who train in this perfection of wisdom have planted wholesome roots in the presence of the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.

analyzed: na ca utrāsam āpadyante
translated: And those who do not become frightened🔽when they train in this perfection of wisdom,

original: ye ca ānanda enāṃ prajñāpāramitāmudgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyantyupadekṣyantyuddekṣyanti
analyzed: ye ca ānanda enām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti
translated: and those, Ānanda, who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, understand it, teach it, explain it, chant it,

analyzed: su ādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti ca
translated: recite it after the teacher,

analyzed: arthataḥ ca dharmataḥ ca nayataḥ ca anugamiṣyanti
translated: and follow it in terms of the meaning and the teaching,

original: niṣṭhā ānanda tatra gantavyā saṃmukhībhūtāste abhūvan bodhisattvā mahāsattvāstathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmiti /
analyzed: niṣṭhā ānanda tatra gantavyā saṃmukhībhūtāḥ te abhūvan bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām iti
translated: Ānanda, one should conclude that they have been face-to-face with the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.

analyzed: ye ca enām prajñāpāramitām na pratikrośanti
translated: And those who do not revile this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: na prativahanti
translated: who do not oppose it,

analyzed: na pratikopayanti  na pratisaṃharanti  na pratiṣedhayanti
translated: They will not cause them to be angry.🔽They will not cause them to be withdrawn.

analyzed: na pratikṣipanti
translated: They will not cause them to be rejected.🔽They will not cause them to be thrown away.

analyzed: na pratibādhitavyām maṃsyante
translated: They will not consider them to be to be opposed.

analyzed: te pi ānanda bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ pūrva jina kṛta adhikārāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, Ānanda, should be known as those who have attended to the past Victorious Ones.

original: kiṃcāpyānanda bodhisattvena mahāsattvena tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmantike kuśalamūlamavaropitam /
analyzed: kiṃca api ānanda bodhisattvena mahāsattvena tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām antike kuśala mūlam avaropitam
translated: Moreover, Ānanda, the bodhisattva mahāsattva has planted the roots of virtue in the presence of the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones.

original: evaṃ hi tanna śrāvakapratyekabuddhatvāya dāsyati vipākam /
analyzed: evam hi tat na śrāvaka pratyekabuddha tvāya dāsyati vipākam
translated: In that way, it will not give a ripening for the state of a śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha.

original: sacedbodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau na visaṃvādayiṣyati praṇidhānam /
analyzed: saced bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau na visaṃvādayiṣyati praṇidhānam
translated: If the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not go back on his vow to highest genuine full Awakening,

original: api tu khalu punarānanda prāyeṇa tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kṛtajñena bhavitavyaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caritavatā /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar ānanda prāyeṇa tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kṛtajñena bhavitavyam prajñāpāramitāyām caritavatā
translated: and moreover, Ānanda, the bodhisattva mahāsattva has generally become grateful, having practiced the perfection of wisdom.

original: tasmāttarhi te ānanda parīndāmi anuparīndāmi imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhūyasyā mātrayā
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi te ānanda parīndāmi anuparīndāmi imām prajñāpāramitām bhūyasyā mātrayā
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, I entrust, I fully entrust to you this perfection of wisdom, even more so

original: akṣarasaṃnipātādudgrahaṇāya dhāraṇāya vācanāya paryavāptaye pravartanāya cirasthitaye
analyzed: akṣara saṃnipātāt udgrahaṇāya dhāraṇāya vācanāya paryavāptaye pravartanāya cira sthitaye
translated: for the purpose of memorizing, retaining, reciting, mastering, propagating, and preserving it for a long time.

original: yatheyaṃ nāntardhīyeta /🔽sacettvamānanda yo mayā te dharmo deśitaḥ sākṣāt sthāpayitvā prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: yathā iyam na antardhīyeta  saced tvam ānanda yaḥ mayā te dharmaḥ deśitaḥ sākṣāt sthāpayitvā prajñāpāramitām
translated: So that it may not disappear.🔽If you, Ānanda, having memorized all that Dharma which I have taught to you, except for the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: tām sarvām dharma deśanām udgṛhya punar eva vipraṇāśayeḥ
translated: and then were to destroy it again,

analyzed: punar eva utsṛjeḥ vismārayeḥ
translated: to let it go again, to forget it,

original: na me tvamānanda etāvatā aparāddhaḥ syāḥ /
analyzed: na me tvam ānanda etāvatā aparāddhaḥ syāḥ
translated: then, Ānanda, by that you would not have offended me that much.

original: yatkhalu punastvamānanda prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktaṃ padaṃ vā padasāmantakaṃ vā nāśayeḥ /🔽utsṛjeḥ /
analyzed: yat khalu punar tvam ānanda prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktam padam vā pada sāmantakam vā nāśayeḥ  utsṛjeḥ
translated: But if, Ānanda, you were to destroy even a single word or half a word connected with the perfection of wisdom,🔽to let it go,

analyzed: vismārayeḥ
translated: to forget it,

analyzed: tāvatā tvam ānanda mama aparāddhaḥ syāḥ
translated: by that you would have offended me that much, Ānanda.

analyzed: na ca me tvam cittam ārādhayeḥ
translated: And you would not have pleased me with your mind.

analyzed: saced punar tvam ānanda prajñāpāramitām udgṛhya punar eva nāśayeḥ
translated: If, Ānanda, having memorized the perfection of wisdom, you were to destroy it again,

analyzed: punar eva utsṛjeḥ
translated: to let it go again,

analyzed: vismārayeḥ  na tvayā aham satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ syām
translated: to forget it,

original: na mānito na pūjito nārcito nāpacāyitaḥ syām /
analyzed: na mānitaḥ na pūjitaḥ na arcitaḥ na apacāyitaḥ syām
translated: you would not have honored me well, you would not have revered me, you would not have shown me respect, you would not have made offerings to me, you would not have shown me homage.

original: ye 'pi Vaidya te ānanda atītānāgatapratyutpannā buddhā bhagavantaḥ /
analyzed: ye pi vaidya te ānanda atīta anāgata pratyutpannāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ
translated: Ānanda, those who are the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in the past, future, and present,

original: te 'pi tvayā ānanda na satkṛtā na gurukṛtā na mānitā na pūjitā nārcitā nāpacāyitā bhavanti /🔽sacetpunastvamānanda prajñāpāramitāmudgṛhya punareva nāśayeḥ /🔽punarevotsṛjeḥ /🔽vismārayeḥ /
analyzed: te pi tvayā ānanda na satkṛtāḥ na gurukṛtāḥ na mānitāḥ na pūjitāḥ na arcitāḥ na apacāyitāḥ bhavanti  saced punar tvam ānanda prajñāpāramitām udgṛhya punar eva nāśayeḥ  punar eva utsṛjeḥ  vismārayeḥ
translated: And those who are the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in the past, future, and present, they too, Ananda, have not been honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by you.

analyzed: tāvatā tvam ānanda mama aparāddhaḥ syāḥ
translated: If, Ananda, you were to take up the perfection of wisdom, and then destroy it, give it away, forget it, and be distracted, then, Ananda, you would have offended against me.

analyzed: na ca me tvam cittam ārādhayeḥ
translated: And you would not have satisfied my mind.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: uktametadānanda tathāgatena prajñāpāramitā atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ mātā jananī janayitrī sarvajñatāyā 🔽āhāriketi /
analyzed: uktam etat ānanda tathāgatena prajñāpāramitā atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām mātā jananī janayitrī sarvajña tāyāḥ  āhārikā iti
translated: Ananda, the perfection of wisdom has been declared by the Tathagata to be the mother and origin and producer of the past, future, and present Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, and the giver of the knowledge of all modes.

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda parīndāmi anuparīndāmi te imāṃ prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda parīndāmi anuparīndāmi te imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: Therefore, Ananda, I entrust and place in your hands this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: yathā iyam na antardhīyeta  udgrahītavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā  dhārayitavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: So that it may not disappear.🔽Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be taken up.🔽Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be borne in mind.

analyzed: vācayitavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be recited.

analyzed: paryavāptavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be studied.

analyzed: pravartayitavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā  deśayitavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā  upadeṣṭavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be practiced.🔽Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be taught.🔽Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be expounded.

analyzed: uddeṣṭavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā  su ādhyātavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be recited.🔽Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be mastered.

analyzed: likhitavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā  bhāvayitavyā iyam ānanda prajñāpāramitā
translated: Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be written.🔽Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be contemplated.

original: sumanasikṛtā ca sudhṛtā ca suparyavāptā ca supravartitā ca tvayā ānanda iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā kartavyā /
analyzed: su manasi kṛtā ca su dhṛtā ca su paryavāptā ca su pravartitā ca tvayā ānanda iyam prajñāpāramitā kartavyā
translated: Ananda, this perfection of wisdom should be well-contemplated, well-remembered, well-mastered, and well-practiced by you.

analyzed: su parivyaktena akṣara pada vyañjanena su niruktā ca udgrahītavyā
translated: It should be well-recited with well-defined letters, words, and syllables, and well-memorized.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ hi ānanda tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ dharmakāyateti tāṃ dharmatāṃ pramāṇīkṛtya /
analyzed: atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām hi ānanda tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām dharmakāya tā iti tām dharmatām pramāṇīkṛtya
translated: Because, Ananda, the Dharma-body of the past, future, and present Tathagatas, Arhats, and Perfectly Awakened Ones is that very reality, and that reality should be taken as authoritative.

original: yathā tattvamānanda etarhi me tathāgatasya tiṣṭhato dhriyamāṇasya yāpayato hitaiṣitayā
analyzed: yathā tattvam ānanda etarhi me tathāgatasya tiṣṭhataḥ dhriyamāṇasya yāpayataḥ hita eṣitayā
translated: Ananda, just as it is now, when I, the Tathagata, am standing, remaining, and continuing, out of a desire for benefit

original: premato vā gauravato vā kalyāṇato vā sparśavihārato vā kartavyaṃ vā dātavyaṃ vā samanvāhartavyaṃ vā manyase /
analyzed: premataḥ vā gauravataḥ vā kalyāṇataḥ vā sparśavihārataḥ vā kartavyam vā dātavyam vā samanvāhartavyam vā manyase
translated: Do you think that it should be done, given, or reflected upon out of love, respect, virtue, or pleasant dwelling?

original: tathaiva tvayā ānanda iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā🔽pravartayitavyā deśayitavyā upadeṣṭavyā uddeṣṭavyā svādhyātavyā likhitavyā bhāvayitavyā
analyzed: tathā eva tvayā ānanda iyam prajñāpāramitā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā  pravartayitavyā deśayitavyā upadeṣṭavyā uddeṣṭavyā su ādhyātavyā likhitavyā bhāvayitavyā
translated: In the same way, Ānanda, this perfection of wisdom should be taken up, borne in mind, recited,🔽mastered, taught, explained, recited, written, contemplated,

original: satkartavyā gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā arcayitavyā apacāyitavyā /
analyzed: satkartavyā gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā arcayitavyā apacāyitavyā
translated: honored, revered, respected, worshipped, and venerated.

original: tayā hitaiṣitayā tena premṇā tena gauraveṇa tayā guṇavattayā /
analyzed: tayā hita eṣitayā tena premṇā tena gauraveṇa tayā guṇavat tayā
translated: By that desire for benefit, by that love, by that respect, by that virtuous nature,

original: evaṃ tvayā ānanda ahaṃ pūjito bhavāmi /
analyzed: evam tvayā ānanda aham pūjitaḥ bhavāmi
translated: in that way you honor me.

analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: And those bodhisattva mahāsattvas,

original: atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ ca buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmantike prema ca prasādaś ca gauravaṃ cotpāditaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām ca buddhānām bhagavatām antike prema ca prasādaḥ ca gauravam ca utpāditam bhavati
translated: and the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones of the past, future, and present, generate love, faith, and respect.

original: yadi te ānanda ahaṃ priyo manaāpo 'parityaktastathāgataḥ /
analyzed: yadi te ānanda aham priyaḥ parityaktaḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: If, Ānanda, you love and delight in the Tathāgata who is not to be abandoned,

original: tataste ānanda iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā priyā manaāpā aparityajanīyā bhavatu /
analyzed: tatas te ānanda iyam prajñāpāramitā priyā manaāpā a parityajanīyā bhavatu
translated: Then, Ānanda, this perfection of wisdom should be dear to you, pleasing, delightful, and not to be abandoned,

original: yathā te ekapadam api na praṇaśyet /
analyzed: yathā te eka padam api na praṇaśyet
translated: so that not even a single word of it may be lost,

analyzed: yathā na antardhīyeta
translated: so that it may not disappear.

original: bahv api te ānanda ahaṃ bhāṣeyaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ parīndanāmāramya kalpaṃ vā kalpāvaśeṣaṃ
analyzed: bahu api te ānanda aham bhāṣeyam prajñāpāramitāyāḥ parīndanām āramya kalpam vā kalpa avaśeṣam
translated: Ānanda, even if I were to speak about the entrusting of the perfection of wisdom for an eon or the remainder of an eon,

original: vā kalpaśataṃ vā kalpasahasraṃ vā kalpaśatasahasraṃ vā kalpakoṭīṃ vā kalpakoṭīśataṃ
analyzed: vā kalpa śatam vā kalpa sahasram vā kalpa śata sahasram vā kalpa koṭīm vā kalpa koṭī śatam
translated: or for a hundred eons, a thousand eons, a hundred thousand eons, a koṭi of eons, a hundred koṭis of eons,

original: vā kalpakoṭīsahasraṃ vā kalpakoṭīśatasahasraṃ vā tato vā upari /
analyzed: vā kalpa koṭī sahasram vā kalpa koṭī śata sahasram vā tatas vā upari
translated: a thousand koṭis of eons, a hundred thousand koṭis of eons, or more than that,

analyzed: saṃkṣepeṇa ānanda yādṛśaḥ tava aham śāstā
translated: in brief, Ānanda, just as I am your teacher,

analyzed: tādṛśī te prajñāpāramitā śāstā
translated: just so is the perfection of wisdom your teacher.

original: yādṛśāste atītānāgatapratyutpannā buddhā bhagavantaḥ sadevamānuṣāsurasya lokasya śāstāraḥ /
analyzed: yādṛśāḥ te atīta anāgata pratyutpannāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ sa deva mānuṣa asurasya lokasya śāstāraḥ
translated: Just as the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present, together with the assembly of disciples, are the teachers of the world with its gods, humans, and titans,

analyzed: tādṛśī prajñāpāramitā sa deva mānuṣa asurasya lokasya śāstā
translated: just so is the perfection of wisdom the teacher of the world with its gods, humans, and titans.

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda aparimāṇā prajñāpāramitā
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.

original: aparimāṇayā parīndanayā prajñāpāramitāṃ te parīndāmyanuparīndāmi sadevamānuṣāsurasya lokasya hitāya sukhāya /
analyzed: aparimāṇayā parīndanayā prajñāpāramitām te parīndāmi anuparīndāmi sa deva mānuṣa asurasya lokasya hitāya sukhāya
translated: I entrust, I fully entrust the perfection of wisdom to you, Ananda, with an immeasurable entrusting, for the benefit and happiness of the world with its gods, men, and Asuras.

analyzed: yasya ānanda tathāgataḥ na parityaktaḥ
translated: Ananda, he who has not abandoned the Tathagata,

analyzed: dharmaḥ na parityaktaḥ
translated: who has not abandoned the Dharma,

analyzed: saṃghaḥ na parityaktaḥ
translated: who has not abandoned the Sangha,

analyzed: atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām bodhiḥ na parityaktā
translated: who has not abandoned the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Lords, of the past, future, and present,

analyzed: tasya prajñāpāramitā a parityaktā bhavatu
translated: for him the perfection of wisdom will not be abandoned.

analyzed: iyam asmākam anuśāsanī
translated: This is our instruction.

analyzed: vaidya yaḥ pi kaścid ānandaḥ enām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇīyāt dhārayet paryat vācayet āpnuyāt pravartayet deśayet upadiśet uddiśet su ādhyāyet likhet bhāvayet
translated: Ananda, whoever would take up, bear in mind, read aloud, master, expound, teach, recite, explain, write out, and contemplate this perfection of wisdom,

original: atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ tena bodhiranuparigṛhītā bhavet /
analyzed: atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām tena bodhiḥ anuparigṛhītā bhavet
translated: he would take possession of the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Lords, of the past, future, and present.

original: yo hi kaścidānanda enāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ pralujyamānāmanuparigṛhṇīte /
analyzed: yaḥ hi kaścid ānandaḥ enām prajñāpāramitām pralujyamānām anuparigṛhṇīte
translated: Ananda, whoever would take possession of this perfection of wisdom when it is being destroyed,

original: atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ tena bodhiranuparigṛhītā bhavati /
analyzed: atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām tena bodhiḥ anuparigṛhītā bhavati
translated: By that, the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present is taken up.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: prajñāpāramitānirjātā hi ānanda buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ bodhiḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā nirjātā hi ānanda buddhānām bhagavatām bodhiḥ
translated: Because, Ānanda, the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, is born from the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye 'pi te ānanda abhūvannatīte 'dhvani tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: ye pi te ānanda abhūvan atīte dhvani tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Ānanda, those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones who were in the past,

original: teṣāmapyānanda buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ prajñāpāramitānirjātaiva anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhirabhūt /
analyzed: teṣām api ānanda buddhānām bhagavatām prajñāpāramitā nirjātā eva anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhūt
translated: Ānanda, for those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment was born from the perfection of wisdom.

original: te 'pi te ānanda anāgate 'dhvani bhaviṣyanti tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: te pi te ānanda anāgate dhvani bhaviṣyanti tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Ānanda, those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones who will be in the future,

original: teṣāmapyānanda buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ prajñāpāramitānirjātaiva anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhirbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām api ānanda buddhānām bhagavatām prajñāpāramitā nirjātā eva anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Ānanda, for those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment will be born from the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye 'pi te ānanda aprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā etarhi tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti /
analyzed: ye pi te ānanda aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ etarhi tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti
translated: Ānanda, those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones who are at present in countless, immeasurable world systems,

original: teṣāmapyānanda buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ prajñāpāramitānirjātaiva anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ /
analyzed: teṣām api ānanda buddhānām bhagavatām prajñāpāramitā nirjātā eva anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ
translated: Ānanda, the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, also arises from the perfection of wisdom.

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmena
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitukāmena iyameva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā
analyzed: ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitu kāmena iyam eva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā
translated: and who wishes to train in the six perfections, should listen to just this perfection of wisdom, should take it up, should bear it in mind,

original: vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyopadeṣṭavyoddeṣṭavyā svādhyātavyā likhitavyā /
analyzed: vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyā upadeṣṭavyā uddeṣṭavyā su ādhyātavyā likhitavyā
translated: should recite it, should master it, should teach it, should explain it, should recite it, should expound it, should write it,

analyzed: iha eva prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam yogam āpattavyam
translated: and should train in and apply oneself to just this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: eṣā hi ānanda prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ mātā jananī janayitrī /
analyzed: eṣā hi ānanda prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām mātā jananī janayitrī
translated: Ānanda, this perfection of wisdom is the mother, the progenitor, of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: ye 'pi kecidānanda bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitvā niryātāḥ /
analyzed: ye pi kecid ānanda bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitvā niryātāḥ
translated: Ānanda, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have trained in the six perfections and have gone forth,

analyzed: niryāsyanti niryānti ca anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: will go forth, and are going forth to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: sarve te ānanda prajñāpāramitāmāgamya ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitāḥ /
analyzed: sarve te ānanda prajñāpāramitām āgamya ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitāḥ
translated: All of them, Ānanda, have trained in the six perfections by relying on the perfection of wisdom.

original: te 'pi sarve enāmeva prajñāpāramitāmāgamya ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu nirjātāḥ /
analyzed: te pi sarve enām eva prajñāpāramitām āgamya ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu nirjātāḥ
translated: All of them have also arisen from just this perfection of wisdom and the six perfections.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: prajñāpāramitānirjātā hi ānanda sarvāḥ pāramitāḥ āhārikā bhavantyanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā nirjātāḥ hi ānanda sarvāḥ pāramitāḥ āhārikāḥ bhavanti anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: For, Ānanda, all the perfections are produced from the perfection of wisdom and are the supporters of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda bhūyasyā mātrayā enāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ dvitīyakam api tṛtīyakam api parīndāmyanuparīndāmi te /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda bhūyasyā mātrayā enām prajñāpāramitām dvitīyakam api tṛtīyakam api parīndāmi anuparīndāmi te
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, I entrust and place this perfection of wisdom in your hands to an even greater extent a second and a third time,

analyzed: yathā iyam na antardhīyeta
translated: so that it will not disappear.

original: eṣā hi ānanda tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmakṣayo dharmakoṣaḥ /
analyzed: eṣā hi ānanda tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām akṣayaḥ dharma koṣaḥ
translated: For this, Ānanda, is the imperishable Dharma treasure of the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones,

analyzed: yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: namely, the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yo hi ānanda atīte 'dhvani anavarāgre saṃsāre sattvānāṃ buddhairbhagavadbhirdharmo deśitaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ hi ānanda atīte dhvani an avara agre saṃsāre sattvānām buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ dharmaḥ deśitaḥ
translated: Ānanda, the Dharma that has been taught by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, for the sake of beings in the past,

analyzed: sarvaḥ saḥ itas eva dharma koṣāt
translated: all of that has come from just this Dharma treasure,

analyzed: yat uta prajñāpāramitātaḥ
translated: namely, from the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye 'pi te ānanda anāgate 'dhvani buddhā bhagavanto 'parimite saṃsāre 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhya sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye pi te ānanda anāgate buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ parimite saṃsāre nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya sattvānām dharmam deśayiṣyanti
translated: Ānanda, those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who in the future will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment in the limitless world, and will teach the Dharma to beings,

original: te 'pi buddhā bhagavanta ita eva dharmakoṣāt /
analyzed: te pi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ itas eva dharmakoṣāt
translated: those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, will also teach from this very treasury of the Dharma,

analyzed: yat uta prajñāpāramitātaḥ
translated: namely, from the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye 'pi te ānanda etarhi aprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavantastiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti /
analyzed: ye pi te ānanda etarhi aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti
translated: Ānanda, those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who at present abide, maintain themselves, and live in immeasurable and incalculable world systems,

analyzed: dharmam ca deśayanti
translated: and who teach the Dharma,

original: teṣāmapyānanda buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmita eva dharmakoṣātprabhāvanā bhavati /
analyzed: teṣām api ānanda buddhānām bhagavatām itas eva dharma koṣāt prabhāvanā bhavati
translated: those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, also teach from this very treasury of the Dharma,

analyzed: yat uta prajñāpāramitātaḥ
translated: namely, from the perfection of wisdom.

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda akṣaya eṣa dharmakoṣo yaduta prajñāpāramitākoṣaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda akṣayaḥ eṣa dharma koṣaḥ yat uta prajñāpāramitā koṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, this treasury of the Dharma, namely the treasury of the perfection of wisdom, is inexhaustible.

original: sacettvamānanda śrāvakayāni śrāvakayānikānāṃ pudgalānāṃ śrāvakabhūmau dharmaṃ deśayes
analyzed: saced tvam ānanda śrāvaka yāni śrāvaka yānikānām pudgalānām śrāvaka bhūmau dharmam deśayeḥ
translated: If you, Ānanda, were to teach the Dharma to the persons in the Śrāvaka Vehicle on the Śrāvaka level,

original: tasyāṃ ca dharmadeśanāyāṃ ye trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau satvās te sarve arhatvaṃ
analyzed: tasyām ca dharma deśanāyām ye tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau satvāḥ te sarve arha tvam
translated: and if all the beings in the great trichiliocosm were to attain arhatship through that teaching of the Dharma,🔽and if their relics were to be distributed like the mustard seeds in a mustard oil mill,

original: sākṣāt kuryus tathāpi tvayā me śrāvakeṇa dharmacakrapravartanānupravartanato dharmadeśayatā🔽śrāvakakṛtyaṃ na kṛtaṃ syāt sacet punas tvam ānanda bodhisatvasya mahāsatvasya ekam
analyzed: sākṣāt kuryuḥ tathā api tvayā me śrāvakeṇa dharma cakra pravartana anupravartanataḥ dharma deśaya tā  śrāvaka kṛtyam na kṛtam syāt saced punar tvam ānanda bodhisatvasya mahāsatvasya ekam
translated: Even if they were to do so, you, my disciple, would not have done the work of a disciple by teaching the Dharma by following the setting in motion of the wheel of the Dharma.🔽If, Ananda, you were to teach even one single Dharma associated with the perfection of wisdom to a bodhisattva great being,

original: api prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktaṃ dharmaṃ deśayeḥ saṃprakāśayeḥ evam ahaṃ tvayā śrāvakeṇa🔽dharmacakrapravartanānuvartanato dharmaṃ deśayanato ārādhitaḥ syān / na tu tayā paurvikayā
analyzed: api prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktam dharmam deśayeḥ saṃprakāśayeḥ evam aham tvayā śrāvakeṇa  dharma cakra pravartana anuvartanataḥ dharmam deśayanataḥ ārādhitaḥ syāt na tu tayā paurvikayā
translated: then I would have been served by you, my disciple,

original: dharmadeśanayā yayā te trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau sarvasatvā arhatvaṃ prāpitās /
analyzed: dharma deśanayā yayā te tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau sarva satvāḥ arha tvam prāpitāḥ
translated: by teaching the Dharma by following the setting in motion of the wheel of the Dharma, but not by that previous teaching of the Dharma by which you established all beings in the great trichiliocosm in arhatship.

original: teṣāṃ cārhatāṃ yad dānamayaṃ puṇyakriyāvastu śīlamayaṃ puṇyakriyāvastu bhāvanāmayaṃ
analyzed: teṣām ca arhatām yat dāna mayam puṇya kriyā vastu śīla mayam puṇya kriyā vastu bhāvanā mayam
translated: And the wholesome action of giving, the wholesome action of morality, and the wholesome action of meditation

original: puṇyakriyāvastu tat kiṃ manyase ānandāpi nu sa bahu puṇyaskandhaḥ / /
analyzed: puṇya kriyā vastu tat kim manyase ānanda api nu sa bahu puṇya skandhaḥ
translated: of those arhats, what do you think, Ananda, is that a great heap of merit?

analyzed: ānandaḥ āha
translated: Ananda said:

analyzed: bahu bhagavan
translated: Much, Blessed One.

analyzed: bahu sugata
translated: Much, Sugata.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: tata saḥ ānanda
translated: But that, Ananda,

original: śrāvakayānikaḥ pudgalo bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati yo bodhisatvānāṃ mahāsatvānāṃ prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktaṃ dharmaṃ deśayati / ato 'pi sa ānanda/
analyzed: śrāvaka yānikaḥ pudgalaḥ bahutaram puṇyam prasavati yaḥ bodhisatvānām mahāsatvānām prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktam dharmam deśayati saḥ ānanda
translated: The person belonging to the Śrāvakayāna generates much more merit than that if he teaches the Dharma connected with the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings. For this reason, Ānanda,

original: bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati yo bodhisatvo mahāsatvo 'parasya bodhisatvasya mahāsatvasya prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktaṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: bahutaram puṇyam prasavati yaḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ parasya bodhisatvasya mahāsatvasya prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktam dharmam deśayati
translated: the bodhisattva great being generates much more merit than that if he teaches the Dharma connected with the perfection of wisdom to another bodhisattva great being.

original: antaśa ekadivasam api tiṣṭhatv ānandaikadivasam antaśaḥ purobhaktam api / tiṣṭhatv ānanda/
analyzed: antaśas eka divasam api tiṣṭhatu ānanda eka divasam antaśas purobhaktam api tiṣṭhatu ānanda
translated: Let alone one day, Ānanda. Let alone one day, let alone half a day, Ānanda.

original: purobhaktam api / tiṣṭhatv ānanda/🔽purobhaktaṃ deśitaḥ /🔽antaśa ekanālikām api ekanālikāntaram api vā tiṣṭhatv ānanda/
analyzed: purobhaktam api tiṣṭhatu ānanda  purobhaktam deśitaḥ  antaśas eka nālikām api eka nālikā antaram api vā tiṣṭhatu ānanda
translated: Let alone half a day, Ānanda.🔽Let alone half a day, let alone one moment, Ānanda.🔽Let alone one moment, let alone one instant, Ānanda.

original: ekanālikāntaram antaśo muhūrtam api tiṣṭhatv ānanda/
analyzed: eka nālikā antaram antaśas muhūrtam api tiṣṭhatu ānanda
translated: Let alone one instant, let alone one brief instant, Ānanda.

original: muhūrtam antaśa ekalavam api tiṣṭhatv ānanda/🔽ekalavam antaśa ekakṣaṇasaṃnipātam api yo hy ānanda/
analyzed: muhūrtam antaśas eka lavam api tiṣṭhatu ānanda 🔽eka lavam antaśas eka kṣaṇa saṃnipātam api yaḥ hi ānanda
translated: Let alone one brief instant, Ānanda.

original: bodhisatvo mahāsatvaḥ aparasya bodhisatvasya mahāsatvasya ekakṣaṇalavam api prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktaṃ dharmaṃ deśayanty ayaṃ tato 'tibahutaraṃ
analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ aparasya bodhisatvasya mahāsatvasya eka kṣaṇa lavam api prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktam dharmam deśayanti ayam ti bahutaram
translated: A bodhisattva, a great being, who teaches for just one moment the Dharma that is connected with the perfection of wisdom to another bodhisattva, a great being, this one produces very much more🔽

analyzed: puṇyam prasavati
translated: A bodhisattva mahāsattva who teaches the Dharma connected with the perfection of wisdom for just one moment to another bodhisattva mahāsattva generates merit that is much greater than that.

analyzed: idam hi ānanda
translated: This is because, Ānanda,

original: tasya bodhisatvasya mahāsatvasya dharmadānaṃ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhayānikānāṃ pudgalānāṃ kuśalamūlāny abhibhavati //
analyzed: tasya bodhisatvasya mahāsatvasya dharma dānam sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yānikānām pudgalānām kuśala mūlāni abhibhavati
translated: the Dharma gift of that bodhisattva mahāsattva surpasses the wholesome roots of all the individuals in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

analyzed: evam ānanda
translated: Thus, Ānanda,

original: kuśalamūlasamanvāgato bodhisatvo mahāsatva evam etat kuśalamūlaṃ samanvāharann asthānam
analyzed: kuśala mūla samanvāgataḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ evam etat kuśala mūlam samanvāharan asthānam
translated: a bodhisattva mahāsattva endowed with wholesome roots, recollecting those wholesome roots in this way, it is not possible

original: etad ānandānavakāśo yat sa bodhisatvo mahāsatvo vivartetānuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodher
analyzed: etat ānanda anavakāśaḥ yat sa bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ vivarteta anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: for that bodhisattva mahāsattva to turn away from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: na etat sthānam vidyate
translated: There is no such possibility.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃs tasyāṃ velāyāṃ tathārūpam ṛddhyabhisaṃskāram abhisaṃskṛtavān
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām tathārūpam ṛddhi abhisaṃskāram abhisaṃskṛtavān
translated: Then the Blessed One, at that time, performed a transformation such that

analyzed: yathārūpeṇa ṛddhi abhisaṃskṛtena tāḥ catasraḥ parṣadaḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikā deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoragāḥ
translated: By what kind of miraculous transformation, those four assemblies of monks, nuns, male and female lay followers, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas,

original: manuṣyāmanuṣyā vā sarve te buddhānubhāvenākṣobhyaṃ tathāgatam arhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ🔽paśyanti sma bhikṣusaṃghaparivṛtaṃ bodhisattvagaṇapuraskṛtaṃ Vaidya
analyzed: manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ vā sarve te buddha anubhāvena akṣobhyam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham  paśyanti sma bhikṣu saṃgha parivṛtam bodhisattva gaṇa puraskṛtam vaidya
translated: humans and non-humans, all of them, by the Buddha's power, saw the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Akṣobhya,

analyzed: dharmam deśayantam sāgara upamāyām gambhīrāyām akṣobhyāyām parṣadi bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ acintya guṇa samanvāgataiḥ
translated: surrounded by an assembly of monks, with a multitude of bodhisattvas in front, teaching the Dharma in a sea-like, profound and unshakable assembly, with bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas endowed with inconceivable qualities,

analyzed: parivṛtam puraskṛtam sarvaiḥ ca arhadbhiḥ kṣīṇa āsravaiḥ niḥkleśaiḥ vaśībhūtaiḥ su vimukta cittaiḥ
translated: surrounded and revered by all the arhats, those whose defilements are exhausted, those without afflictions, those who have attained mastery, those with well-liberated minds,

analyzed: su vimukta prajñaiḥ ājāneyaiḥ mahā nāgaiḥ kṛtakṛtyaiḥ kṛta karaṇīyaiḥ apahṛta bhāraiḥ anuprāpta svaka arthaiḥ
translated: those with well-liberated wisdom, those who are noble, those who are great elephants, those who have done what had to be done, those who have accomplished what had to be done, those who have cast off the burden, those who have reached their own goal,

analyzed: parikṣīṇa bhava saṃyojanaiḥ samyak ājñā su vimukta citaiḥ sarva cetaḥ vaśi parama pārami prāptaiḥ
translated: those who have exhausted the fetters of existence, those whose minds are well-liberated through right knowledge, those who have attained the highest perfection of mastery over all mental states.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstamṛddhyabhisaṃskāraṃ punareva pratisaṃharati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tam ṛddhi abhisaṃskāram punar eva pratisaṃharati sma
translated: Then the Blessed One withdrew that miraculous transformation.

original: pratisaṃhṛte ca bhagavatā tasmin ṛddhyabhisaṃskāre na bhūyaḥ sa bhagavānakṣobhyastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ saṃdṛśyate sma /
analyzed: pratisaṃhṛte ca bhagavatā tasmin ṛddhi abhisaṃskāre na bhūyas sa bhagavān akṣobhyaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ saṃdṛśyate sma
translated: And when the Blessed One withdrew that miraculous transformation, the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Akshobhya was no longer seen,

analyzed: te ca sarve bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: nor were all those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas,

analyzed: te ca mahāśrāvakāḥ
translated: nor were those great Shravakas,

original: tacca buddhakṣetraṃ tāsāṃ catasṛṇāṃ gandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragāṇāṃ manuṣyāmanuṣyāṇāṃ ca na cakṣuṣa ābhāsaṃ bhūya āgacchanti sma /
analyzed: tat ca buddhakṣetram tāsām catasṛṇām gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoragāṇām manuṣya amanuṣyāṇām ca na cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam bhūyas āgacchanti sma
translated: nor was that Buddha-field visible to the eyes of those four groups of Gandharvas, Asuras, Garudas, Kinnaras, Mahoragas, humans, and non-humans.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: pratisaṃhṛto hi tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena sa ṛddhyabhisaṃskāraḥ /
analyzed: pratisaṃhṛtaḥ hi tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena saḥ ṛddhi abhisaṃskāraḥ
translated: Because the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha withdrew that miraculous transformation.

original: tena te sarve sarveṣāṃ teṣāṃ na bhūyaścakṣuṣa ābhāsamāgacchanti sma //
analyzed: tena te sarve sarveṣām teṣām na bhūyaḥ cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgacchanti sma
translated: Therefore, all of them were no longer visible to the eyes of all of them.

original: atha khalu bhagavānāyuṣmantamānandamāmantrayate sma evamānanda sarvadharmā na cakṣuṣo 'pyābhāsamāgacchanti /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma evam ānanda sarva dharmāḥ na cakṣuṣaḥ pi ābhāsam āgacchanti
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the Venerable Ananda: Ananda, in this way all dharmas do not come within the range of vision.

analyzed: na dharma adharmāṇām ābhāsam āgacchanti  na dharma adharmān paśyanti
translated: They do not perceive Dharma and non-Dharma.🔽They do not see Dharma and non-Dharma.

analyzed: na dharma adharmān jānanti
translated: They do not know Dharma and non-Dharma.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ hi ānanda a jānakāḥ a paśyakāḥ
translated: Ānanda, all dharmas are non-perceivers, non-seers.

analyzed: na kārya samarthāḥ
translated: They are not capable of action.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: nirīhakā hi ānanda sarvadharmā agrāhyā ākāśanirīhakatayā /
analyzed: nirīhakāḥ hi ānanda sarva dharmāḥ a grāhyāḥ ākāśa nirīhaka tayā
translated: Ānanda, all dharmas are without exertion, ungraspable, like the sky, which is without exertion.

analyzed: acintyāḥ hi ānanda sarva dharmāḥ māyā puruṣa upamāḥ
translated: Ānanda, all dharmas are inconceivable, like a magical man.

analyzed: a vedakāḥ hi ānanda sarva dharmāḥ asadbhāva tām upādāya
translated: Ānanda, all dharmas are non-cognizant, because of their non-existence.

original: evaṃ caranta ānanda bodhisattvā mahāsattvāścaranti prajñāpāramitāyam /
analyzed: evam carantaḥ ānanda bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ caranti prajñāpāramitā ayam
translated: Ānanda, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practicing like this practice the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: na kaṃcid dharmam abhiniviśante
translated: They do not settle down on any dharma.

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇā ānanda bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ śikṣante prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇāḥ ānanda bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ śikṣante prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Ānanda, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas training like this train in the perfection of wisdom.
