analyzed: utpādam vā nirodham vā  te dharma tayā tathāgatam prajānanti
translated: Nor do they conceive of the arising or cessation of any dharma.🔽Those who know the Tathāgata through the true nature of dharmas,

analyzed: ye ca tathāgatam dharma tayā prajānanti
translated: those who know the Tathāgata through the true nature of dharmas,

original: na te tathāgatānāmāgamanaṃ vā gamanaṃ vā kalpayanti /
analyzed: na te tathāgatānām āgamanam vā gamanam vā kalpayanti
translated: they do not conceive of the coming or going of the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: ye ca tathāgatasya īdṛśīm dharmatām prajānanti
translated: Those who know the Tathāgata's suchness in this way,

analyzed: te āsannāḥ anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ caranti
translated: they are close to the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and they practice.

analyzed: te ca prajñāpāramitāyām caranti
translated: And they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: te ca bhagavataḥ śrāvakāḥ amoghaṃ rāṣṭrapiṇḍaṃ paribhuñjate /
analyzed: te ca bhagavataḥ śrāvakāḥ amogham rāṣṭra piṇḍam paribhuñjate
translated: And those disciples of the Blessed One enjoy the country's alms without waste.

analyzed: te ca lokasya dakṣiṇīyāḥ
translated: And they are worthy of offerings in the world.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra mahāsamudre ratnāni na pūrvasyā diśa āgacchanti /🔽na dakṣiṇasyāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra mahā samudre ratnāni na pūrvasyāḥ diśaḥ āgacchanti  na dakṣiṇasyāḥ
translated: Just as, son of good family, the jewels in the great ocean do not come from the east,🔽nor from the south,

analyzed: na paścimāyāḥ
translated: nor from the west,

analyzed: na uttarasyāḥ
translated: nor from the north,

original: na vidigbhyo nādhastānnopariṣṭānna kutaściddeśebhyo digbhya āgacchanti /
analyzed: na vidigbhyaḥ na adhastāt na upariṣṭāt na kutaścid deśebhyaḥ digbhyaḥ āgacchanti
translated: nor from the intermediate directions, nor from below, nor from above, nor from any direction,

original: api tu khalu punaḥ sattvānāṃ kuśalamūlānyupādāya mahāsamudre ratnānyutpadyante /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar sattvānām kuśala mūlāni upādāya mahā samudre ratnāni utpadyante
translated: Moreover, jewels arise in the great ocean on the basis of the roots of goodness of sentient beings.

analyzed: na tāni ahetukāni utpadyante
translated: They do not arise without a cause.

analyzed: hetu pratyaya kāraṇa adhīnāni pratītyasamutpannāni
translated: They are dependent originations, dependent on causes, conditions, and circumstances.

original: nirudhyamānāni ca tāni ratnāni ca kvaciddaśadiśi loke saṃkrāmanti /
analyzed: nirudhyamānāni ca tāni ratnāni ca kvacid daśa diśi loke saṃkrāmanti
translated: And when those jewels cease, they do not go anywhere in the world of the ten directions.

original: api tu khalu punaryeṣāṃ pratyayānāṃ satāṃ tāni ratnāni prabhāvyante /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar yeṣām pratyayānām satām tāni ratnāni prabhāvyante
translated: Moreover, when those conditions exist, those jewels manifest.

original: teṣāṃ pratyayānāmasatāṃ na teṣāṃ ratnānāṃ prabhāvanā bhavati /
analyzed: teṣām pratyayānām asatām na teṣām ratnānām prabhāvanā bhavati
translated: When those conditions do not exist, those jewels do not manifest.

original: evameva kulaputra teṣāṃ tathāgatānāṃ kāyapariniṣpattirna kutaściddaśadiśi lokādāgatā /
analyzed: evam eva kula putra teṣām tathāgatānām kāya pariniṣpattiḥ na kutaścid daśa diśi lokāt āgatā
translated: In the same way, noble sir, the manifestation of the bodies of those Tathāgatas does not come from anywhere in the world of the ten directions,

analyzed: na api kvacid daśa diśi loke gacchati
translated: nor does it go anywhere in the world of the ten directions.

original: na ca ahetuko buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ kāyaḥ /
analyzed: na ca ahetukaḥ buddhānām bhagavatām kāyaḥ
translated: The bodies of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are not without a cause.

analyzed: pūrva caryā pariniṣpannaḥ hetu pratyaya adhīnaḥ kāraṇa samutpannaḥ pūrva karma vipākāt utpannaḥ
translated: They are the result of causes and conditions, dependent on the causes and conditions of previous practice, arisen from the maturation of previous karma.

analyzed: sa na kvacid daśa diśi loke sti
translated: They do not exist anywhere in the world of the ten directions.

original: api tu khalu punaryeṣāṃ pratyayānāṃ satāṃ kāyābhiniṣpattirbhavati /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar yeṣām pratyayānām satām kāya abhiniṣpattiḥ bhavati
translated: But rather, when the conditions for the manifestation of the body are present,

analyzed: teṣām pratyayānām asatām kāya abhiniṣpattiḥ na prajñāyate
translated: the manifestation of the body is perceived. When those conditions are absent, the manifestation of the body is not perceived.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra vīṇāyāḥ śabda utpadyamāno na kutaścidāgacchati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra vīṇāyāḥ śabdaḥ utpadyamānaḥ na kutaścid āgacchati
translated: For example, noble sir, the sound that arises from a vīṇā does not come from anywhere when it arises.

analyzed: nirudhyamānaḥ na kvacid gacchati
translated: And when it ceases, it does not go anywhere.

analyzed: na kvacid saṃkrāmati
translated: It does not go anywhere at all.

analyzed: pratītya ca hetu pratyaya sāmagrīm utpadyate hetu adhīnaḥ pratyaya adhīnaḥ
translated: And yet, depending on a combination of causes and conditions, it arises, dependent on causes and dependent on conditions.

original: tadyathāpi nāma droṇīṃ ca pratītya carma ca pratītya tantrīś ca pratītya daṇḍaṃ ca
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma droṇīm ca pratītya carma ca pratītya tantrīḥ ca pratītya daṇḍam ca
translated: For example, depending on a sounding box, depending on a skin, depending on strings, depending on a stick,

original: pratītya upadhānīś ca pratītya koṇaṃ ca pratītya puruṣasya ca tajjavyāyāmaṃ pratītya
analyzed: pratītya upadhānīḥ ca pratītya koṇam ca pratītya puruṣasya ca tajja vyāyāmam pratītya
translated: depending on a man’s effort, depending on a man’s exertion,

original: evamayaṃ vīṇāyāḥ śabdo niścarati hetvadhīnaḥ pratyayādhīnaḥ /
analyzed: evam ayam vīṇāyāḥ śabdaḥ niścarati hetu adhīnaḥ pratyaya adhīnaḥ
translated: in the same way, this sound from a vīṇā arises, dependent on causes and dependent on conditions.

original: sa ca śabdo na droṇyā niścarati /
analyzed: sa ca śabdaḥ na droṇyāḥ niścarati
translated: And yet, that sound does not come from the sounding box,

original: na carmaṇo na tantrībhyo na daṇḍānnopadhānībhyo na koṇānna puruṣasya tajjavyāyāmataḥ śabdo niścarati /
analyzed: na carmaṇaḥ na tantrībhyaḥ na daṇḍāt na upadhānībhyaḥ na koṇāt na puruṣasya tajja vyāyāmataḥ śabdaḥ niścarati
translated: nor from the skin, nor from the strings, nor from the stick, nor from the bridge, nor from the pegs, nor from the man’s effort, nor from the man’s exertion.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ sarveṣāṃ samāyogācchabdaḥ prajñapyate /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar sarveṣām samāyogāt śabdaḥ prajñapyate
translated: Moreover, the sound is designated by the combination of all of them.

analyzed: nirudhyamānaḥ pi śabdaḥ na kvacid gacchati
translated: Even when the sound is ceasing, it does not go anywhere.

original: evameva kulaputra buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ kāyaniṣpattirhetvadhīnā pratyayādhīnā anekakuśalamūlaprayogapariniṣpannā ca /
analyzed: evam eva kula putra buddhānām bhagavatām kāya niṣpattiḥ hetu adhīnā pratyaya adhīnā aneka kuśala mūla prayoga pariniṣpannā ca
translated: In the same way, noble son, the manifestation of the body of the Blessed Buddhas depends on causes and conditions, and is perfected through the application of many roots of virtue.

original: na caikato hetuto na caikataḥ pratyayato na caikataḥ kuśalamūlato buddhakāyaprabhāvanā /
analyzed: na ca ekatas hetutaḥ na ca ekatas pratyayataḥ na ca ekatas kuśala mūlataḥ buddhakāya prabhāvanā
translated: But it is not manifested by the Buddha's body from a single cause, nor from a single condition, nor from a single root of virtue.

original: na ca nairhetukī /🔽Vaidya bahuhetupratyayasāmagryāṃ samutpannā sā na kutaścidāgacchati /
analyzed: na ca nairhetukī  vaidya bahu hetu pratyaya sāmagryām samutpannā sā na kutaścid āgacchati
translated: And it is not without a cause.🔽When the collection of many causes and conditions arises, it does not come from anywhere.

analyzed: hetu pratyaya sāmagryām asatyām na kvacid gacchati
translated: When the collection of causes and conditions is absent, it does not go anywhere.

original: evaṃ tvayā kulaputra teṣāṃ tathāgatānāmāgamanaṃ ca gamanaṃ ca draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: evam tvayā kula putra teṣām tathāgatānām āgamanam ca gamanam ca draṣṭavyam
translated: In the same way, noble son, you should see the coming and going of those Tathāgatas.

analyzed: sarva dharmāṇām api kula putra
translated: And, noble son,

analyzed: tvayā iyam eva dharmatā anugantavyā
translated: you should understand this very nature of all phenomena.

original: yataḥ kulaputra tvamevaṃ tathāgatāṃś ca sarvadharmāṃś ca anutpannānaniruddhāṃś ca saṃprajñāsyasi /
analyzed: yatas kula putra tvam evam tathāgatān ca sarva dharmān ca anutpannān aniruddhān ca saṃprajñāsyasi
translated: From which, noble son, you will understand the Tathāgatas and all phenomena to be unborn and unceasing.

analyzed: tatas tvam niyataḥ bhaviṣyasi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Then you will be restrained in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām upāya kauśalye ca niyatam cariṣyasi
translated: You will certainly practice the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: asmin khalu punastathāgatānāmanāgatyagamananirdeśe bhāṣyamāṇe mahān bhūmicālo 'bhūt /
analyzed: asmin khalu punar tathāgatānām anāgatya gamana nirdeśe bhāṣyamāṇe mahān bhūmicālaḥ bhūt
translated: Moreover, when this teaching on the Tathāgatas' coming and going was being spoken, there was a great earthquake.

original: sarvaś ca trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātuḥ ṣaḍvikāramahādaśamahānimittaṃ kampate prakampate saṃprakampate /
analyzed: sarvaḥ ca tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ ṣaṣ vikāra mahā daśa mahā nimittam kampate prakampate saṃprakampate
translated: And this entire great trichiliocosm shook in six ways, with great signs and great tremors.

original: calati pracalati saṃpracalati /🔽vedhate pravedhate saṃpravedhate /🔽raṇati praraṇati saṃpraraṇati /
analyzed: calati pracalati saṃpracalati  vedhate pravedhate saṃpravedhate  raṇati praraṇati saṃpraraṇati
translated: It moved, moved strongly, and moved intensely.🔽It quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered intensely.🔽It trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely.🔽It quaked, quaked strongly, and quaked intensely.

original: kṣubhyati prakṣubhyati saṃprakṣubhyati /🔽garjati pragarjati saṃpragarjati sma /
analyzed: kṣubhyati prakṣubhyati saṃprakṣubhyati  garjati pragarjati saṃpragarjati sma
translated: It roared, roared strongly, and roared intensely.

original: sarvāṇi ca mārabhavanāni saṃkṣobhitāni jihmībhūtāni cābhūvan /
analyzed: sarvāṇi ca māra bhavanāni saṃkṣobhitāni jihmībhūtāni ca abhūvan
translated: And all the abodes of Māra were agitated and became dim.

analyzed: ye kecana tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatayaḥ
translated: Whatever grasses, bushes, herbs, and forests there were in the great trichiliocosm,

original: te sarve yena dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvastena praṇatā abhūvan /
analyzed: te sarve yena dharmodgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tena praṇatāḥ abhūvan
translated: all of them inclined towards the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata.

analyzed: akāla puṣpāṇi ca utsṛjanti sma
translated: and out-of-season flowers were scattered.

analyzed: upariṣṭāt ca antarīkṣāt mahā puṣpa varṣaḥ prāvarṣat
translated: And a great rain of flowers fell from the sky above.

original: śakraś ca devānāmindraścatvāraś ca mahārājāno dharmodgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ divyaiścandanacūrṇairdivyaiś ca puṣpairavākiran abhyavākiran
analyzed: śakraḥ ca devānām indraḥ catvāraḥ ca mahā rājānaḥ dharmodgatam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam divyaiḥ candana cūrṇaiḥ divyaiḥ ca puṣpaiḥ avākiran abhyavākiran  /
translated: Śakra, lord of the gods, and the four great kings scattered and rained down on the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata divine sandalwood powder and divine flowers,

analyzed: abhiprākiran
translated: and they scattered them.

original: evaṃ ca vācamabhāṣanta sādhu sādhu kulaputra /
analyzed: evam ca vācam abhāṣanta sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: And they spoke these words: Excellent, excellent, O son of noble family!

original: tava kulaputra anubhāvena adyāsmābhiḥ paramārthanirjātā kathā deśyamānā śrutā sarvalokavipratyanīkā /
analyzed: tava kula putra anubhāvena adya asmābhiḥ parama artha nirjātā kathā deśyamānā śrutā sarva loka vipratyanīkā
translated: By your power, O son of noble family, we have today heard a discourse spoken that is born of the highest truth, which is contrary to the whole world,

analyzed: sarva satkāya dṛṣṭi pratiṣṭhitānām sarva asat dṛṣṭi abhiviniviṣṭānām sattvānām
translated: whereon all beings who are established in the view of the reality of the body and who are fixed in all false views have no footing.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dharmodgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat kaḥ punaḥ kulaputra atra hetuḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dharmodgatam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat kaḥ punar kula putra atra hetuḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita said this to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata: What, O son of noble family, is the cause here?

original: kaḥ pratyayo 'sya mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya loke prādurbhāvāya /
analyzed: kaḥ pratyayaḥ sya mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya loke prādurbhāvāya
translated: What is the reason for the appearance in the world of this great earthquake?

original: dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattva āha imaṃ kulaputra tathāgatānāmanāgatyagamananirdeśaṃ
analyzed: dharmodgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āha imam kula putra tathāgatānām anāgatyagamana nirdeśam
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata said, Son of noble family, this teaching of the Tathāgatas on not coming and not going,

original: tava ca pṛcchato mama ca nirdiśato 'ṣṭānāṃ prāṇisahasrāṇāmanutpattikadharmakṣāntipratilambho 'bhūt /
analyzed: tava ca pṛcchataḥ mama ca nirdiśataḥ ṣṭānām prāṇi sahasrāṇām anutpattikadharmakṣānti pratilambhaḥ bhūt
translated: through your asking and my explaining, has resulted in eight thousand beings attaining receptivity to the non-arising of dharmas.

analyzed: aśīteḥ ca prāṇi niyutānām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpannāni
translated: And the minds of eight quintillion beings have been generated toward unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: catuḥṣaṣṭeś ca prāṇisahasrāṇāṃ virajāṃsi vigatamalāni dharmeṣu dharmacakṣūṃṣi viśuddhāni //
analyzed: catuḥṣaṣṭeḥ ca prāṇi sahasrāṇām virajāṃsi vigata malāni dharmeṣu dharma cakṣūṃṣi viśuddhāni
translated: And the Dharma-eye, stainless and free from defilements, has been purified for sixty-four thousand beings in regard to dharmas.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ paramodāreṇa prītiprāmodyena samanvāgato 'bhūt lābhā me paramasulabdhāḥ /🔽yasya me prajñāpāramitāmimaṃ ca tathāgatānāmanāgatyagamananirdeśaṃ paripṛcchataḥ iyatāṃ sattvānāmarthaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ parama udāreṇa prīti prāmodyena samanvāgataḥ bhūt lābhāḥ me parama su labdhāḥ  yasya me prajñāpāramitām imam ca tathāgatānām anāgatya gamana nirdeśam paripṛcchataḥ iyatām sattvānām arthaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita became endowed with the highest and most expansive joy and delight, thinking, I have gained the highest gain.🔽Through my asking about the perfection of wisdom and this teaching of the Tathāgatas on not coming and not going, this benefit has been accomplished for so many beings.

original: etadevāsmākaṃ paryāptaṃ kuśalaṃ bhavedanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ pariniṣpattaye /
analyzed: etat eva asmākam paryāptam kuśalam bhavet anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ pariniṣpattaye
translated: This alone will be sufficient for me to perfect unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca me bhūyo vicikitsā pravartate 'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: na ca me bhūyas vicikitsā pravartate nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: And I no longer have any doubt about unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

analyzed: niḥsaṃśayam aham tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyāmi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: I am without doubt that I will become a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly enlightened buddha.

original: sa tenaiva prītiprāmodyena samanvāgataḥ saptatālaṃ vihāyasamabhyudgamya saptatāle
analyzed: sa tena eva prīti prāmodyena samanvāgataḥ sapta tālam vihāyasam abhyudgamya sapta tāle
translated: He, endowed with that very joy and gladness, rose up into the sky to the height of seven palm trees and,

original: sthitvā evaṃ cintayati sma kenāhametarhi antarīkṣe sthitaḥ dharmodgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ
analyzed: sthitvā evam cintayati sma kena aham etarhi antarīkṣe sthitaḥ dharma udgatam bodhisattvam
translated: standing there, thought, “By what means can I, standing in the sky, honor the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata

analyzed: mahāsattvam satkuryām iti
translated: with a parasol?”

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindra sadāpraruditaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamabhyudgataṃ dṛṣṭvā cetasaiva cāsya cittamājñāya divyāni cāsmai māndāravāṇi 🔽puṣpāṇyupanāmayati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indra sadāpraruditam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam abhyudgatam dṛṣṭvā cetasā eva ca asya cittam ājñāya divyāni ca asmai māndāravāṇi  puṣpāṇi upanāmayati sma
translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, seeing the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita risen up, and knowing his thought with his own mind, presented him with divine coral tree flowers

original: evaṃ cāvocat ebhistvaṃ kulaputra divyaiḥ puṣpairdharmodgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ Vaidya
analyzed: evam ca avocat ebhiḥ tvam kula putra divyaiḥ puṣpaiḥ dharma udgatam bodhisattvam vaidya
translated: and said, “Noble one, with these divine flowers honor the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata,

analyzed: mahāsattvam satkuru
translated: the great physician.”

analyzed: satkartavyaḥ hi kula putra asmābhiḥ tava parigrāhakaḥ
translated: “Noble one, we must honor him who has accepted you.

original: tava hi kulaputra anubhāvena adya bahūnāṃ prāṇisahasrāṇāmarthaḥ kṛtaḥ /🔽durlabhāḥ kulaputra evaṃrūpāḥ sattvāḥ /
analyzed: tava hi kula putra anubhāvena adya bahūnām prāṇi sahasrāṇām arthaḥ kṛtaḥ  durlabhāḥ kula putra evaṃrūpāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: For, noble sir, by your power, the welfare of many thousands of living beings has been accomplished today.

original: ye sarvasattvānāṃ kṛtaśo 'prameyānasaṃkhyeyān kalpānutsahante mahāntaṃ bhāramudvoḍhuṃ yathā tvayā utsoḍham //
analyzed: ye sarva sattvānām prameyān asaṃkhyeyān kalpān utsahante mahāntam bhāram udvoḍhum yathā tvayā utsoḍham
translated: Noble sir, beings like you are rare who, for the sake of all living beings, are willing to take on a great burden for immeasurable, incalculable eons, as you have done.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śakrasya devānāmindrasyāntikānmāndāravāṇi puṣpāṇi gṛhītvā dharmodgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamavākirat /🔽abhyavākirat /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śakrasya devānām indrasya antikāt māndāravāṇi puṣpāṇi gṛhītvā dharmodgatam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam avākirat  abhyavākirat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, having taken divine coral tree flowers from Śakra, lord of the gods, scattered them over the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata,🔽sprinkled them,

analyzed: abhiprākirat
translated: and scattered them again.

original: svakena ca kāyena dharmodgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamabhicchādayati sma /
analyzed: svakena ca kāyena dharmodgatam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam abhicchādayati sma
translated: And with his own body, he covered the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata.

original: evaṃ ca vācamabhāṣata eṣo 'haṃ kulaputra adyāgreṇa tavātmānaṃ niryātayāmi upasthānaparicaryāyai /
analyzed: evam ca vācam abhāṣata eṣaḥ ham kula putra adya agreṇa tava ātmānam niryātayāmi upasthāna paricaryāyai
translated: And he spoke these words: 'Noble sir, from this day forth, I offer myself to you for service and attendance.

original: sa ātmānaṃ niryātya dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya purataḥ prāñjaliṃ kṛtvāsthāt //
analyzed: saḥ ātmānam niryātya dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya puratas prāñjalim kṛtvā asthāt
translated: Having offered himself, he stood in front of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata with palms joined.'

original: atha khalu sā śreṣṭhidārikā tāni ca pañca dārikāśatāni sadāpraruditaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat etā vayam api kulaputra tavātmānaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu sā śreṣṭhi dārikā tāni ca pañca dārikā śatāni sadāpraruditam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat etāḥ vayam api kula putra tava ātmānam
translated: Then the merchant’s daughter and the five hundred girls said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, “Noble sir, we too will give our bodies

original: vayamapyanena kuśalamūlena eteṣāmeva dharmāṇāṃ lābhinyo bhavema /
analyzed: vayam api anena kuśala mūlena eteṣām eva dharmāṇām lābhinyaḥ bhavema
translated: and with this wholesome root, may we also obtain these dharmas.

original: tvayaiva ca sārdhaṃ punaḥ punarbuddhāṃś ca bhagavato bodhisattvāṃś ca satkuryāma gurukuryāma /
analyzed: tvayā eva ca sārdham punar punar buddhān ca bhagavataḥ bodhisattvān ca satkuryāma gurukuryāma
translated: Together with you, we will again and again honor the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: āsannībhūtāḥ ca tava eva bhavema
translated: May we be close to you.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śreṣṭhidārikāṃ tāni ca pañca dārikāśatānyetadavocat yadi me yūyaṃ dārikā adhyāśayamanuvartadhvam /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śreṣṭhi dārikām tāni ca pañca dārikā śatāni etat avocat yadi me yūyam dārikāḥ adhyāśayam anuvartadhvam
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita said to the merchant’s daughter and the five hundred girls, “If you girls follow my superior intention,

original: adhyāśayena ca mahyamātmānaṃ niryātayata /🔽evamahaṃ yuṣmān pratīccheyam /🔽dārikā āhuḥ anuvartiṣyāmahe tava vayamāśayenādhyāśayena ca /
analyzed: adhyāśayena ca mahyam ātmānam niryātayata  evam aham yuṣmān pratīccheyam  dārikāḥ āhuḥ anuvartiṣyāmahe tava vayam āśayena adhyāśayena ca
translated: and with a superior intention give yourselves to me,🔽then I will accept you.🔽The girls said, “We will follow your intention with a superior intention.

analyzed: vayam tava ātmānam niryātayāmaḥ yathā icchā karaṇīya tāyai
translated: We give ourselves to you to do as you wish.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvastāni śreṣṭhidārikāpramukhāni pañca🔽dārikāśatāni sarvālaṃkārabhūṣitāni kṛtvā tāni ca pañca rathaśatānyalaṃkṛtya sarvāṇi
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tāni śreṣṭhi dārikā pramukhāni pañca  dārikā śatāni sarva alaṃkāra bhūṣitāni kṛtvā tāni ca pañca ratha śatāni alaṃkṛtya sarvāṇi
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, having adorned those five hundred daughters headed by the merchant's daughter with all ornaments, and having adorned those five hundred chariots,

original: ca tāni dharmodgatāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya niryātayati sma upasthānaparicaryāyaiḥ
analyzed: ca tāni dharmodgatāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya niryātayati smaḥ upasthāna paricaryāyaiḥ
translated: offered them all to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata for the sake of service and attendance.

analyzed: imāḥ kula putra aham tava upasthāyikāḥ niryātayāmi
translated: Son of good family, I offer you these as my attendants.

original: imāni ca pañca rathaśatāni niryātayāmi paribhogāyeti //
analyzed: imāni ca pañca ratha śatāni niryātayāmi paribhogāya iti
translated: And I offer these five hundred chariots for your enjoyment.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindrastasmai kulaputrāya sādhukāramadāt sādhu sādhu kulaputra /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ tasmai kula putrāya sādhukāram adāt sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, applauded that son of good family, saying, Excellent, excellent, son of good family!

analyzed: bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ sarva sva parityāgibhiḥ bhavitavyam
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas should give up everything.

original: evaṃrūpeṇa ca tyāgacittena bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kṣipramanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyate /
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa ca tyāga cittena bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: With such a mind of generosity, a bodhisattva mahāsattva quickly awakens to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: evaṃ ca dharmabhāṇakāṇāṃ pūjāṃ kṛtvā śakyaṃ prajñāpāramitāmupāyakauśalyaṃ ca śrotum /
analyzed: evam ca dharma bhāṇakāṇām pūjām kṛtvā śakyam prajñāpāramitām upāya kauśalyam ca śrotum
translated: And having made offerings to the Dharma teachers, one is able to hear the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: tair api kulaputra paurvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ pūrvaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ
analyzed: taiḥ api kula putra paurvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ pūrvam bodhisattva caryām
translated: Those previous Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, while practicing the conduct of Bodhisattvas in the past,🔽

original: caradbhirevaṃrūpa eva tyāge sthitvā anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ samudānītā prajñāpāramitāmupāyakauśalyaṃ🔽ca paripraśnayadbhiriti //🔽atha khalu dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvastāni śreṣṭhidārikāpramukhāni pañca
analyzed: caradbhiḥ evaṃrūpe eva tyāge sthitvā anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ samudānītā prajñāpāramitām upāya kauśalyam  ca paripraśnayadbhiḥ iti  atha khalu dharmodgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tāni śreṣṭhi dārikā pramukhāni pañca
translated: Those previous Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, while practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva in the past, attained unsurpassed perfect enlightenment by abiding in such a form of generosity, by inquiring about the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: dārikāśatāni pañca rathaśatāni sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kuśalaparipūrimupādāya pratigṛhṇīte sma /
analyzed: dārikā śatāni pañca ratha śatāni sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kuśala paripūrim upādāya pratigṛhṇīte sma
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata accepted those five hundred maidens headed by the merchant's daughter and the five hundred chariots for the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, in order to complete his wholesome actions.

analyzed: pratigṛhya ca sadāpraruditāya eva kula putrāya pratiniryātayāmāsa
translated: Having accepted them, he returned them to the noble son Sadāprarudita.

original: atha khalu dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattva utthāyāsanāt svakaṃ gṛhaṃ prāvikṣat sūryasya cāstaṃgamanakālo 'bhūt //
analyzed: atha khalu dharmodgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ utthāya āsanāt svakam gṛham prāvikṣat sūryasya ca astaṃgamana kālaḥ bhūt
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata rose from his seat and entered his own house, and it was the time of sunset.

original: atha khalu sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyaitadabhūt naitanmama sādhu pratirūpaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya etat abhūt na etat mama sādhu pratirūpam bhavet
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita thought, This would not be right for me.

analyzed: yat aham dharma kāma tayā āgatya niṣīdeyam
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita thought this: It would not be right for me to come here with a desire for the Dharma and then sit down,🔽or to make a bed,

analyzed: śayyām ca parikalpayeyam  yat nu aham dvābhyām eva vaidya
translated: or to lie down.

original: īryāpathābhyāṃ sthitvā sthānena caṃkrameṇa ca kālamatināmayeyam /
analyzed: īryāpathābhyām sthitvā sthānena caṃkrameṇa ca kālam atināmayeyam
translated: I should spend my time standing and walking, using only two postures,

original: yāvaddharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ svakādgṛhānnirgato bhaviṣyati yaduta dharmasaṃprakāśanāyeti //
analyzed: yāvat dharma udgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ svakāt gṛhāt nirgataḥ bhaviṣyati yat uta dharma saṃprakāśanāya iti
translated: until the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata comes out of his house in order to teach the Dharma.

original: atha khalu dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sapta varṣāṇyekasamādhisamāpanna evābhūt /
analyzed: atha khalu dharmodgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sapta varṣāṇi eka samādhi samāpannaḥ eva abhūt
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata remained absorbed in a single samādhi for seven years,

analyzed: aprameyaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ bodhisattva samādhi sahasraiḥ prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya nirjātaiḥ vyāhārṣīt
translated: practicing with immeasurable and countless thousands of bodhisattva samādhis born from the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: sadāprarudito 'pi bodhisattvo mahāsattva sapta varṣāṇi dvābhyāmeva īryāpathābhyāṃ kālamatināmayan na styānamiddhamavakrāmayāmāsa /
analyzed: sadāpraruditaḥ pi bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva sapta varṣāṇi dvābhyām eva īryāpathābhyām kālam atināmayan na styānam iddham avakrāmayāmāsa
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita also spent seven years passing the time using only two postures, not giving rise to laziness or drowsiness.

original: sapta varṣāṇi ca kāmavitarkamutpādayāmāsa /🔽na vyāpādavitarkaṃ na vihiṃsāvitarkamutpādayāmāsa /
analyzed: sapta varṣāṇi ca kāma vitarkam utpādayāmāsa  na vyāpāda vitarkam na vihiṃsā vitarkam utpādayāmāsa
translated: For seven years he did not give rise to thoughts of desire,🔽did not give rise to thoughts of malice or harm,

analyzed: na rasa gṛddhim na citta audbilyam utpādayāmāsa
translated: did not give rise to attachment to taste, and did not give rise to mental elation.

original: api tu kadā nāma dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'smātsamādhervyutthāsyati /
analyzed: api tu kadā nāma dharma udgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ smāt samādheḥ vyutthāsyati
translated: But he thought, When will the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata emerge from this samādhi?

original: yannu vayaṃ dharmodgatasya bodhisattva mahāsattvasya dharmāsanaṃ prajñapayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yat nu vayam dharmodgatasya bodhisattva mahāsattvasya dharma āsanam prajñapayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Let us prepare a Dharma seat for the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata,

analyzed: yatra asau kula putraḥ niṣadya dharmam deśayiṣyati iti
translated: where that noble son will sit and teach the Dharma.

original: taṃ ca pṛthivīpradeśaṃ susiktaṃ sumṛṣṭaṃ ca kariṣyāmo nānāpuṣpābhikīrṇam /
analyzed: tam ca pṛthivī pradeśam su siktam su mṛṣṭam ca kariṣyāmaḥ nānā puṣpa abhikīrṇam
translated: And let us make that place of earth well-watered, well-swept, and strewn with various flowers,

original: yatra pṛthivīpradeśe dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāmupāyakauśalyaṃ ca saṃprakāśayiṣyatīti cintayāmāsa /
analyzed: yatra pṛthivī pradeśe dharma udgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitām upāya kauśalyam ca saṃprakāśayiṣyati iti cintayāmāsa
translated: where the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata will teach the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: tāny api śreṣṭhidārikāpramukhāni pañca dārikāśatāni sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya
analyzed: tāni api śreṣṭhi dārikā pramukhāni pañca dārikā śatāni sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya
translated: Those five hundred maidens headed by the merchant's daughter, and the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita,

analyzed: mahāsattvasya anuśikṣamāṇāni dvābhyām eva īryāpathābhyām kālam atināmayāmāsuḥ sarvāḥ
translated: They spent their time in only two postures,🔽training in the practice of the great being.

analyzed: kriyāḥ tasya anuvartamānāḥ
translated: They spent their time in two postures only, and all their activities were in accord with his.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvo divyaṃ nirghoṣamaśrauṣīt itaḥ saptame divase dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'smātsamādhervyutthāsyati /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ divyam nirghoṣam aśrauṣīt itas saptame divase dharma udgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ smāt samādheḥ vyutthāsyati
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita heard a divine voice: From here, in seven days, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata will arise from that samādhi.

original: vyutthāya ca madhyenagarasya niṣadya dharmaṃ deśayiṣyatīti /
analyzed: vyutthāya ca madhyenagarasya niṣadya dharmam deśayiṣyati iti
translated: Having arisen, he will sit in the middle of the city and teach the Dharma.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvastaṃ divyaṃ nirghoṣaṃ śrutvā tuṣṭa🔽udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajātastaṃ pṛthivīpradeśaṃ śodhayāmāsa sārdhaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tam divyam nirghoṣam śrutvā tuṣṭa  udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ tam pṛthivī pradeśam śodhayāmāsa sārdham
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, having heard that divine voice, was satisfied,

analyzed: śreṣṭhi dārikā pramukhaiḥ pañca dārikā śataiḥ
translated: elated, delighted, joyful, and blissful. He cleaned that place, together with five hundred girls headed by the merchant's daughter.

analyzed: dharma āsanam ca prajñapayāmāsa sapta ratna mayam
translated: And he prepared a Dharma seat made of the seven precious substances.

original: svakaṃ cottarāsaṅgaṃ kāyādavatārya tasyāsanasyopari prajñapayati sma /
analyzed: svakam ca uttarāsaṅgam kāyāt avatārya tasya āsanasya upari prajñapayati sma
translated: And he took off his upper robe from his body and spread it over that seat.

original: atha khalu tā dārikāḥ svakasvakānuttarāsaṅgān kāyādavatārya pañcottarāsaṅgaśatāni
analyzed: atha khalu tāḥ dārikāḥ svaka svakān uttarāsaṅgān kāyāt avatārya pañca uttarāsaṅga śatāni
translated: Then those girls, taking off their own upper robes,

original: tatrāsane prajñapayāmāsuḥ atrāsane dharmodgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo niṣadya dharmaṃ deśayiṣyatīti /
analyzed: tatra āsane prajñapayāmāsuḥ atra āsane dharma udgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ niṣadya dharmam deśayiṣyati iti
translated: spread out five hundred upper robes on that seat, thinking, 'On this seat the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata will sit and teach the Dharma.'

original: evaṃ tāś ca sarvā dārikā dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dharmāsanamāstīrya tuṣṭā udagrā āttamanasaḥ pramuditāḥ prītisaumanasya
analyzed: evam tāḥ ca sarvāḥ dārikāḥ dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dharma āsanam āstīrya tuṣṭāḥ udagrāḥ ātta manasaḥ pramuditāḥ prīti saumanasya
translated: In the same way, all those girls, having spread out the Dharma seat for the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata, were satisfied, elated, delighted, joyful,

analyzed: jātāḥ abhūvan
translated: and had feelings of happiness and gladness.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattvastaṃ pṛthivīpradeśaṃ sektukāmaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tam pṛthivī pradeśam sektu kāmaḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, desiring to sprinkle that place on the ground,

analyzed: na ca udakam samantāt paryeṣamāṇaḥ pi labhate
translated: but not finding water anywhere,

analyzed: yena tam pṛthivī pradeśam siñcet
translated: with which to sprinkle that place on the ground,

analyzed: yathā api nāma māreṇa pāpīyasā tat sarvam udakam antardhāpitam abhūt
translated: it was as if all that water had been made to disappear by the evil Māra,

original: apyeva nāma asya sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyodakamalabhamānasya cittaṃ khidyeta /
analyzed: api eva nāma asya sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya udakam alabhamānasya cittam khidyeta
translated: thinking, 'Perhaps the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, not finding water, will have a troubled mind,

analyzed: duḥkha daurmanasyam ca bhavet
translated: and will feel sorrow and distress.'

analyzed: cittasya vā anyathātvam bhavet
translated: Or there would be a change in the mind,

analyzed: yena asya kuśala mūlasya antardhānam bhavet
translated: by which the root of the wholesome would disappear.

analyzed: na vā pūjāḥ bhrājeran
translated: Or the worship would not shine.

original: atha khalu sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyaitadabhūt yannvahamātmanaḥ kāyaṃ viddhvā imaṃ pṛthivīpradeśaṃ rudhireṇa siñceyam
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya etat abhūt yat nu aham ātmanaḥ kāyam viddhvā imam pṛthivī pradeśam rudhireṇa siñceyam
translated: Then this occurred to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita: Let me pierce my own body and sprinkle this place with blood.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: ayam hi pṛthivī pradeśaḥ uddhata rajaskaḥ
translated: This place is dusty.

original: mā rajodhāturito bhūpradeśāddharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kāye nipatet /
analyzed: mā rajaḥ dhātuḥ itas bhū pradeśāt dharma udgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kāye nipatet
translated: Let not the dust fall on the body of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata from this place.

analyzed: kim vā anena ātma bhāvena avaśyam bhedana dharmiṇā kuryām
translated: Or what should I do with this body, which is bound to be destroyed?

analyzed: varam khalu punar mama ayam kāya vaidya
translated: Better that this body of mine,

analyzed: evaṃrūpayā kriyayā vinaśyatu
translated: be destroyed by such an act.

analyzed: na tu niḥsāmarthya kriyayā
translated: Not by an act of impotence.

original: api ca kāmahetoḥ kāmanidānaṃ bahūni me ātmabhāvasahasrāṇi punaḥ punaḥ saṃsāre saṃsarato bhinnāni /
analyzed: api ca kāma hetoḥ kāma nidānam bahūni me ātma bhāva sahasrāṇi punar punar saṃsāre saṃsarataḥ bhinnāni
translated: Moreover, for the sake of desire, for the sake of pleasure, many thousands of my bodies have been destroyed again and again, transmigrating in saṃsāra.

analyzed: na punar evaṃrūpeṣu sthāneṣu saddharma parigrahasya kṛtaśas
translated: But not for the sake of upholding the true Dharma in such places.

analyzed: yadi punar bhidyante
translated: If, on the other hand, they are distinguished,

analyzed: kāmam evaṃrūpeṣu bhidyantām iti
translated: let them be distinguished in this way.

original: atha khalu sadāprarudito bodhisattvo mahāsattva iti pratisaṃkhyāya tīkṣṇaṃ śastraṃ gṛhītvā svakāyaṃ samantato viddhvā taṃ pṛthivīpradeśaṃ svarudhireṇa
analyzed: atha khalu sadāpraruditaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ iti pratisaṃkhyāya tīkṣṇam śastram gṛhītvā sva kāyam samantataḥ viddhvā tam pṛthivī pradeśam sva rudhireṇa
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita, having reflected thus, took a sharp weapon, pierced his own body all over, and sprinkled that place on the ground with his own blood,🔽and he said to those five hundred girls headed by the merchant's daughter:🔽Take these sharp weapons and pierce your own bodies, and sprinkle this place on the ground with your own blood,

analyzed: sarvam asiñcat
translated: and then dig here.

analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhiḥ samudānītā

original: atha khalu sadāpraruditasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyaitadabhūt prajñaptaṃ mayā dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dharmāsanam

translated: Just as I am now teaching the Dharma in this very great trichiliocosm, surrounded by a community of monks, with a host of bodhisattvas placed in front,

analyzed: ebhiḥ eva nayaiḥ ebhiḥ eva nāmabhiḥ ebhiḥ eva akṣaraiḥ imām eva prajñāpāramitām bhāṣe
translated: with these very methods, these very names, these very syllables, precisely this perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: saḥ cintyena bāhuśrutyena śruta sāgara tayā ca samanvāgataḥ bhūt
translated: He was endowed with inconceivable erudition and an ocean of learning.

original: sarvāsu ca jātiṣu na jātu buddhavirahito 'bhūt /
analyzed: sarvāsu ca jātiṣu na jātu buddha virahitaḥ bhūt
translated: And in all his births he was never separated from the Buddha.

original: yatra yatra buddhā bhagavantaḥ saṃmukhībhūtā bhavanti /
analyzed: yatra yatra buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ saṃmukhībhūtāḥ bhavanti
translated: Wherever the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, appeared in person,

analyzed: tatra tatra upapadyate sma
translated: there he was reborn.

analyzed: avirahitaḥ ca bhavati sma buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ
translated: And he was never separated from the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

analyzed: antatas svapna antara gataḥ pi
translated: even while dreaming.

analyzed: sarve ca anena akṣaṇāḥ vivarjitāḥ
translated: And all unfavorable conditions are avoided by him.

analyzed: kṣaṇa saṃpad ca a rāgi tā
translated: And the favorable conditions are obtained.

original: tatra khalu punarbhagavānāyuṣmantamānandamāmantrayate sma tadanenāpi te ānanda
analyzed: tatra khalu punar bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma tat anena api te ānanda
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the venerable Ānanda: By this method also, Ānanda,

original: paryāyeṇa evaṃ veditavyam ityapīyaṃ prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ
analyzed: paryāyeṇa evam veditavyam iti api iyam prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām
translated: you should know that this perfection of wisdom of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings,

analyzed: sarvajña jñānasya āhārikā iti
translated: is the producer of the knowledge of all modes.

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda bodhisattvairmahāsattvaiḥ sarvajñajñānaṃ pratilabdhukāmairasyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caritavyam /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ sarvajña jñānam pratilabdhu kāmaiḥ asyām prajñāpāramitāyām caritavyam
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, who wish to win the knowledge of all modes, should course in this perfection of wisdom.

original: iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyopadeṣṭavyoddeṣṭavyā svādhyātavyā
analyzed: iyam prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā pravartayitavyā deśayitavyā upadeṣṭavyā uddeṣṭavyā su ādhyātavyā
translated: This perfection of wisdom should be listened to, learned, borne in mind, recited, mastered, propagated, taught, explained, elucidated, repeated, written,

analyzed: likhitavyā
translated: and should be made into a book, and should be worshipped with flowers, etc.

original: tathāgatādhiṣṭhānena mahāpustake pravyaktapravyaktairakṣaraiḥ sulikhitāṃ kṛtvā satkartavyā
analyzed: tathāgata adhiṣṭhānena mahā pustake pravyakta pravyaktaiḥ akṣaraiḥ su likhitām kṛtvā satkartavyā
translated: Through the consecration of the Tathagata, it should be well written in a great book with clear and well-formed letters, and should be worshipped🔽with flowers, etc.

analyzed: gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā arcayitavyā apacāyitavyā puṣpaiḥ dhūpaiḥ gandhaiḥ mālyaiḥ vilepanaiḥ cūrṇaiḥ cīvaraiḥ vādyaiḥ vastraiḥ chatraiḥ dhvajaiḥ ghaṇṭābhiḥ
translated: should be revered, honored, worshipped, venerated, and esteemed with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags,

analyzed: samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: and with rows of lamps all around,

analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ
translated: and with various kinds of offerings.

analyzed: iyam asmākam antikāt ānanda anuśāsanī
translated: This, Ānanda, is our instruction to you.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: atra hi prajñāpāramitāyām sarvajña jñāna pariniṣpattiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Because in this perfection of wisdom the full attainment of the knowledge of all modes will come about.

original: tatkiṃ manyase ānanda śāstā te tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: tat kim manyase ānanda śāstā te tathāgataḥ
translated: What do you think, Ānanda, is the Tathāgata your teacher?

analyzed: ānandaḥ āha śāstā me bhagavan
translated: Ānanda said, Blessed One, the Tathāgata is my teacher.

analyzed: śāstā me sugata
translated: Sugata, the Tathāgata is my teacher.

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantamānandametadavocat śāstā te ānanda tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat śāstā te ānanda tathāgataḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda, Ānanda, the Tathāgata is your teacher.

original: paricarito 'smyānanda tvayā maitreṇa kāyakarmaṇā manaāpena /🔽maitreṇa vākkarmaṇā manaāpena /
analyzed: paricaritaḥ smi ānanda tvayā maitreṇa kāya karmaṇā manaāpena  maitreṇa vāc karmaṇā manaāpena
translated: Ānanda, you have served me with a dear and agreeable bodily action,🔽with a dear and agreeable verbal action,

analyzed: maitreṇa manaḥ karmaṇā manaāpena
translated: and with a dear and agreeable mental action.

original: tasmāttarhi ānanda yathaiva tvayā mamaitarhi tiṣṭhato dhriyamāṇasya yāpayato 'smin samucchraye prema ca prasādaś ca gauravaṃ ca kṛtam /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda yathā eva tvayā mama etarhi tiṣṭhataḥ dhriyamāṇasya yāpayataḥ smin samucchraye prema ca prasādaḥ ca gauravam ca kṛtam
translated: Therefore, Ananda, just as you have now, while I am present, existing, and living, shown love, faith, and respect,

original: tathaiva tvayā ānanda mamātyayādasyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ kartavyam /
analyzed: tathā eva tvayā ānanda mama atyayāt asyām prajñāpāramitāyām kartavyam
translated: in the same way, Ananda, you should act towards this perfection of wisdom after my passing away.

original: dvir api trir api te ānanda parīndāmi anuparīndāmi enāṃ prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: dvis api tris api te ānanda parīndāmi anuparīndāmi enām prajñāpāramitām
translated: For a second time, Ananda, I entrust, I fully entrust this perfection of wisdom to you.

analyzed: yathā iyam na antardhīyeta
translated: So that it may not disappear.

analyzed: yathā na asyām tvam anyaḥ puruṣaḥ syāḥ
translated: So that you may not be another man in this.

analyzed: yāvat ānanda iyam prajñāpāramitā loke pracariṣyati
translated: As long as, Ananda, this perfection of wisdom circulates in the world,

analyzed: tāvat tathāgataḥ tiṣṭhati iti veditavyam
translated: for that long the Tathagata should be known as present.

analyzed: tāvat tathāgataḥ dharmam deśayati iti veditavyam
translated: For that long the Tathagata should be known as teaching the Dharma.

original: avirahitāste ānanda sattvā buddhadarśanena dharmaśravaṇena saṃghopasthānena ca veditavyam /
analyzed: avirahitāḥ te ānanda sattvāḥ buddha darśanena dharma śravaṇena saṃgha upasthānena ca veditavyam
translated: Those beings, Ananda, should be known as not separated from seeing the Buddha, from hearing the Dharma, and from attending to the Sangha.

analyzed: tathāgata antika avacarāḥ te ānanda sattvāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Those beings, Ananda, should be known as dwelling near the Tathagata.

analyzed: yaḥ enām prajñāpāramita vaidya
translated: Those beings, Ananda, who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite and study it,

analyzed: śroṣyanti udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti
translated: they will listen, take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, master it,

analyzed: deśayiṣyanti upadekṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti likhiṣyanti satkariṣyanti gurukariṣyanti
translated: they will teach it, explain it, expound it, chant it, recite it, and expound it in detail;

analyzed: mānayiṣyanti pūjayiṣyanti arcayiṣyanti apacāyiṣyanti puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja ghaṇṭā patākābhiḥ
translated: they will honor it, revere it, respect it, make offerings to it, and venerate it with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, bells, banners,

analyzed: samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ
translated: and with garlands of lamps all around.

analyzed: bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ iti
translated: with many kinds of offerings.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān ātta manāḥ
translated: The Blessed One said this, and was satisfied.

original: te ca maitreyapramukhā bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ āyuṣmāṃś ca subhūtirāyuṣmāṃś ca śāriputraḥ
analyzed: te ca maitreya pramukhāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ āyuṣmān ca subhūtiḥ āyuṣmān ca śāriputraḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas headed by Maitreya, the Venerable Subhūti, the Venerable Śāriputra,

original: āyuṣmāṃścānandaḥ śakraś ca devānāmindraḥ sadevamānuṣāsuragaruḍagandharvaś ca loko
analyzed: āyuṣmān ca ānandaḥ śakraḥ ca devānām indraḥ sa deva mānuṣa asura garuḍa gandharvaḥ ca
translated: the Venerable Ānanda, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, garuḍas, and gandharvas,

analyzed: bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan iti
translated: rejoiced in the Blessed One's teaching.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyām prajñāpāramitāyām parīndanāparivartaḥ nāma dvātriṃśattamaḥ
translated: In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the chapter named The Bestowal is the thirty-second.

original: samāptā ceyaṃ bhagavatyā āryāṣṭasāhasrikāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā sarvatathāgatajananī bodhisattvapratyekajinaśrāvakāṇāṃ mātā /
analyzed: samāptā ca iyam bhagavatyāḥ ārya aṣṭasāhasrikāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā sarva tathāgata jananī bodhisattva pratyeka jina śrāvakāṇām mātā
translated: And this is the end of the Blessed One's Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the mother of all Tathagatas, the mother of Bodhisattvas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Sravakas.

original: dharmamudrā dharmolkā dharmanābhirdharmabherī dharmanetrī dharmaratnanidhānam akṣayo
analyzed: dharma mudrā dharma ulkā dharma nābhiḥ dharma bherī dharma netrī dharma ratna nidhānam akṣayaḥ
translated: The Dharma Seal, the Dharma Torch, the Dharma Navel, the Dharma Drum, the Dharma Guide, the Dharma Jewel Treasury, the Inexhaustible

analyzed: dharmaḥ acintya adbhuta darśana nakṣatra mālā sa deva mānuṣa asura gandharva loka vanditā sarva sukha hetuḥ iti
translated: Dharma, the Unthinkable and Wonderful Appearance Constellation Garland, Revered by the World of Gods, Humans, Asuras, and Gandharvas, the Cause of All Happiness.

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ samyagudgṛhya paryavāpya ca dhārayitvā pravartya enāṃ viharantu sadārthina iti //
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām samyak udgṛhya paryavāpya ca dhārayitvā pravartya enām viharantu sadā arthinaḥ iti
translated: Having well received and mastered the Perfection of Wisdom, having upheld and spread it, may those who seek it always dwell in it.

original: ye dharmā hetuprabhāvā hetusteṣāṃ tathāgato hyavadat /
analyzed: ye dharmāḥ hetu prabhāvāḥ hetuḥ teṣām tathāgataḥ hi avadat
translated: Those dharmas that arise from causes, the Tathagata has declared their cause;

original: teṣāṃ ca yo nirodha evaṃvādī mahāśramaṇaḥ //
analyzed: teṣām ca yaḥ nirodhaḥ evaṃvādī mahā śramaṇaḥ
translated: And that which is the cessation of them, the great ascetic has also taught.

analyzed: deya dharmaḥ yam pravara mahāyāna yāyinyāḥ parama upāsika saurājra suta lakṣmīdharasya
translated: This is a gift of the Dharma, of the supreme upasika, the daughter of the king, the bearer of the prosperity of the supreme vehicle of the great vehicle.

analyzed: yat atra puṇyam tat bhavatu ācārya upādhyāya mātā pitṛ pūrvaṃgamam kṛtvā sakala sattva rāśeḥ anuttara jñāna avāptaye iti
translated: Whatever merit there is in this, may it go to the teacher, the preceptor, the mother, and the father, and may it lead to the attainment of unsurpassed knowledge by the entire multitude of beings.
